1130 "sudo zfs allow -u $DST_NON_ROOT_USER_NAME mount,create,receive,rollback,destroy,canmount,mountpoint," 

1131 "readonly,compression,encryption,keylocation,recordsize $DST_DATASET_OR_POOL.\n\n" 

1132 "For extra security $SRC_NON_ROOT_USER_NAME should be different than $DST_NON_ROOT_USER_NAME, i.e. the " 

1133 "sending Unix user on the source and the receiving Unix user at the destination should be separate Unix " 

1134 "user accounts with separate private keys even if both accounts reside on the same machine, per the " 

1135 "principle of least privilege. Further, if you do not plan to use the --force* flags and " 

1136 "--delete-* CLI options then ZFS permissions 'rollback,destroy' can " 

1137 "be omitted. If you do not plan to customize the respective ZFS dataset property then ZFS permissions " 

1138 "'canmount,mountpoint,readonly,compression,encryption,keylocation,recordsize' can be omitted, arriving " 

1139 "at the absolutely minimal set of required destination permissions: " 

1140 "`mount,create,receive`.\n\n" 

1141 "Also see https://openzfs.github.io/openzfs-docs/man/master/8/zfs-allow.8.html#EXAMPLES and " 

1142 "https://tinyurl.com/9h97kh8n and " 

1143 "https://youtu.be/o_jr13Z9f1k?si=7shzmIQJpzNJV6cq\n\n") 

1144 parser.add_argument( 

1145 "--no-stream", action="store_true", 

1146 help="During replication, only replicate the most recent selected source snapshot of a dataset (using -i " 

1147 "incrementals instead of -I incrementals), hence skip all intermediate source snapshots that may exist " 

1148 "between that and the most recent common snapshot. If there is no common snapshot also skip all other " 

1149 "source snapshots for the dataset, except for the most recent selected source snapshot. This option helps " 

1150 "the destination to 'catch up' with the source ASAP, consuming a minimum of disk space, at the expense " 

1151 "of reducing reliable options for rolling back to intermediate snapshots in the future.\n\n") 

1152 parser.add_argument( 

1153 "--no-resume-recv", action="store_true", 

1154 help="Replication of snapshots via 'zfs send/receive' can be interrupted by intermittent network hiccups, " 

1155 "reboots, hardware issues, etc. Interrupted 'zfs send/receive' operations are retried if the --retries " 

1156 f"and --retry-* options enable it (see above). In normal operation {prog_name} automatically retries " 

1157 "such that only the portion of the snapshot is transmitted that has not yet been fully received on the " 

1158 "destination. For example, this helps to progressively transfer a large individual snapshot over a " 

1159 "wireless network in a timely manner despite frequent intermittent network hiccups. This optimization is " 

1160 "called 'resume receive' and uses the 'zfs receive -s' and 'zfs send -t' feature.\n\n" 

1161 "The --no-resume-recv option disables this optimization such that a retry now retransmits the entire " 

1162 "snapshot from scratch, which could slow down or even prohibit progress in case of frequent network " 

1163 f"hiccups. {prog_name} automatically falls back to using the --no-resume-recv option if it is " 

1164 "auto-detected that the ZFS pool does not reliably support the 'resume receive' optimization.\n\n" 

1165 "*Note:* Snapshots that have already been fully transferred as part of the current 'zfs send/receive' " 

1166 "operation need not be retransmitted regardless of the --no-resume-recv flag. For example, assume " 

1167 "a single 'zfs send/receive' operation is transferring incremental snapshots 1 through 10 via " 

1168 "'zfs send -I', but the operation fails while transferring snapshot 10, then snapshots 1 through 9 " 

1169 "need not be retransmitted regardless of the --no-resume-recv flag, as these snapshots have already " 

1170 "been successfully received at the destination either way.\n\n") 

1171 parser.add_argument( 

1172 "--create-bookmarks", choices=["all", "many", "none"], default="many", 

1173 help=f"For increased safety, {prog_name} replication behaves as follows wrt. ZFS bookmark creation, if it is " 

1174 "autodetected that the source ZFS pool support bookmarks:\n\n" 

1175 "* `many` (default): Whenever it has successfully completed replication of the most recent source snapshot, " 

1176 f"{prog_name} creates a ZFS bookmark of that snapshot, and attaches it to the source dataset. In addition, " 

1177 f"whenever it has successfully completed a 'zfs send' operation, {prog_name} creates a ZFS bookmark of each " 

1178 f"hourly, daily, weekly, monthly and yearly source snapshot that was sent during that 'zfs send' operation, " 

1179 "and attaches it to the source dataset.\n\n" 

1180 "* `all`: Whenever it has successfully completed a 'zfs send' operation, " 

1181 f"{prog_name} creates a ZFS bookmark of each source snapshot that was sent during that 'zfs send' operation, " 

1182 "and attaches it to the source dataset. This increases safety at the expense of some performance.\n\n" 

1183 "* `none`: No bookmark is created.\n\n" 

1184 "Bookmarks exist so an incremental stream can continue to be sent from the source dataset without having " 

1185 "to keep the already replicated snapshot around on the source dataset until the next upcoming snapshot " 

1186 "has been successfully replicated. This way you can send the snapshot from the source dataset to another " 

1187 "host, then bookmark the snapshot on the source dataset, then delete the snapshot from the source " 

1188 "dataset to save disk space, and then still incrementally send the next upcoming snapshot from the " 

1189 "source dataset to the other host by referring to the bookmark.\n\n" 

1190 "The --create-bookmarks=none option disables this safety feature but is discouraged, because bookmarks " 

1191 "are tiny and relatively cheap and help to ensure that ZFS replication can continue even if source and " 

1192 "destination dataset somehow have no common snapshot anymore. " 

1193 "For example, if a pruning script has accidentally deleted too many (or even all) snapshots on the " 

1194 "source dataset in an effort to reclaim disk space, replication can still proceed because it can use " 

1195 "the info in the bookmark (the bookmark must still exist in the source dataset) instead of the info in " 

1196 "the metadata of the (now missing) source snapshot.\n\n" 

1197 "A ZFS bookmark is a tiny bit of metadata extracted from a ZFS snapshot by the 'zfs bookmark' CLI, and " 

1198 "attached to a dataset, much like a ZFS snapshot. Note that a ZFS bookmark does not contain user data; " 

1199 "instead a ZFS bookmark is essentially a tiny pointer in the form of the GUID of the snapshot and 64-bit " 

1200 "transaction group number of the snapshot and creation time of the snapshot, which is sufficient to tell " 

1201 "the destination ZFS pool how to find the destination snapshot corresponding to the source bookmark " 

1202 "and (potentially already deleted) source snapshot. A bookmark can be fed into 'zfs send' as the " 

1203 "source of an incremental send. Note that while a bookmark allows for its snapshot " 

1204 "to be deleted on the source after successful replication, it still requires that its snapshot is not " 

1205 "somehow deleted prematurely on the destination dataset, so be mindful of that. " 

1206 f"By convention, a bookmark created by {prog_name} has the same name as its corresponding " 

1207 "snapshot, the only difference being the leading '#' separator instead of the leading '@' separator. " 

1208 "Also see https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LaNgoAZeTww&t=316s.\n\n" 

1209 "You can list bookmarks, like so: " 

1210 "`zfs list -t bookmark -o name,guid,createtxg,creation -d 1 $SRC_DATASET`, and you can (and should) " 

1211 "periodically prune obsolete bookmarks just like snapshots, like so: " 

1212 "`zfs destroy $SRC_DATASET#$BOOKMARK`. Typically, bookmarks should be pruned less aggressively " 

1213 "than snapshots, and destination snapshots should be pruned less aggressively than source snapshots. " 

1214 "As an example starting point, here is a command that deletes all bookmarks older than " 

1215 "90 days, but retains the latest 200 bookmarks (per dataset) regardless of creation time: " 

1216 f"`{prog_name} {dummy_dataset} tank2/boo/bar --dryrun --recursive --skip-replication " 

1217 "--delete-dst-snapshots=bookmarks --include-snapshot-times-and-ranks notime 'all except latest 200' " 

1218 "--include-snapshot-times-and-ranks 'anytime..90 days ago'`\n\n") 

1219 parser.add_argument( 

1220 "--no-create-bookmark", action="store_true", 

1221 help=argparse.SUPPRESS) # deprecated; was replaced by --create-bookmarks=none 

1222 parser.add_argument( 

1223 "--no-use-bookmark", action="store_true", 

1224 help=f"For increased safety, in normal replication operation {prog_name} replication also looks for bookmarks " 

1225 "(in addition to snapshots) on the source dataset in order to find the most recent common snapshot wrt. the " 

1226 "destination dataset, if it is auto-detected that the source ZFS pool support bookmarks. " 

1227 "The --no-use-bookmark option disables this safety feature but is discouraged, because bookmarks help " 

1228 "to ensure that ZFS replication can continue even if source and destination dataset somehow have no " 

1229 "common snapshot anymore.\n\n" 

1230 f"Note that it does not matter whether a bookmark was created by {prog_name} or a third party script, " 

1231 "as only the GUID of the bookmark and the GUID of the snapshot is considered for comparison, and ZFS " 

1232 "guarantees that any bookmark of a given snapshot automatically has the same GUID, transaction group " 

1233 "number and creation time as the snapshot. Also note that you can create, delete and prune bookmarks " 

1234 f"any way you like, as {prog_name} (without --no-use-bookmark) will happily work with whatever " 

1235 "bookmarks currently exist, if any.\n\n") 

1236 

1237 # ^aes256-gcm@openssh.com cipher: for speed with confidentiality and integrity 

1238 # measure cipher perf like so: count=5000; for i in $(seq 1 3); do echo "iteration $i:"; for cipher in $(ssh -Q cipher); do dd if=/dev/zero bs=1M count=$count 2> /dev/null | ssh -c $cipher -p 40999 127.0.0.1 "(time -p cat) > /dev/null" 2>&1 | grep real | awk -v count=$count -v cipher=$cipher '{print cipher ": " count / $2 " MB/s"}'; done; done # noqa: E501 

1239 # see https://gbe0.com/posts/linux/server/benchmark-ssh-ciphers/ 

1240 # and https://crypto.stackexchange.com/questions/43287/what-are-the-differences-between-these-aes-ciphers 

1241 

1242 locations = ["src", "dst"] 

1243 for loc in locations: 

1244 parser.add_argument( 

1245 f"--ssh-{loc}-user", type=str, metavar="STRING", 

1246 help=f"Remote SSH username on {loc} host to connect to (optional). Overrides username given in " 

1247 f"{loc.upper()}_DATASET.\n\n") 

1248 for loc in locations: 

1249 parser.add_argument( 

1250 f"--ssh-{loc}-host", type=str, metavar="STRING", 

1251 help=f"Remote SSH hostname of {loc} host to connect to (optional). Can also be an IPv4 or IPv6 address. " 

1252 f"Overrides hostname given in {loc.upper()}_DATASET.\n\n") 

1253 for loc in locations: 

1254 parser.add_argument( 

1255 f"--ssh-{loc}-port", type=int, metavar="INT", 

1256 help=f"Remote SSH port on {loc} host to connect to (optional).\n\n") 

1257 for loc in locations: 

1258 parser.add_argument( 

1259 f"--ssh-{loc}-config-file", type=str, action=SSHConfigFileNameAction, metavar="FILE", 

1260 help=f"Path to SSH ssh_config(5) file to connect to {loc} (optional); will be passed into ssh -F CLI. " 

1261 "The basename must contain the substring 'bzfs_ssh_config'.\n\n") 

1262 parser.add_argument( 

1263 "--timeout", default=None, metavar="DURATION", 

1264 # help="Exit the program (or current task with non-zero --daemon-lifetime) with an error after this much time has " 

1265 # "elapsed. Default is to never timeout. Examples: '600 seconds', '90 minutes', '10years'\n\n") 

1266 help=argparse.SUPPRESS) 

1267 threads_default = 100 # percent 

1268 parser.add_argument( 

1269 "--threads", min=1, default=(threads_default, True), action=CheckPercentRange, metavar="INT[%]", 

1270 help="The maximum number of threads to use for parallel operations; can be given as a positive integer, " 

1271 f"optionally followed by the %% percent character (min: %(min)s, default: {threads_default}%%). Percentages " 

1272 "are relative to the number of CPU cores on the machine. Example: 200%% uses twice as many threads as " 

1273 "there are cores on the machine; 75%% uses num_threads = num_cores * 0.75. Currently this option only " 

1274 "applies to dataset and snapshot replication, --create-src-snapshots, --delete-dst-snapshots, " 

1275 "--delete-empty-dst-datasets, --monitor-snapshots and --compare-snapshot-lists. The ideal value for this " 

1276 "parameter depends on the use case and its performance requirements, as well as the number of available CPU " 

1277 "cores and the parallelism offered by SSDs vs. HDDs, ZFS topology and configuration, as well as the network " 

1278 "bandwidth and other workloads simultaneously running on the system. The current default is geared towards a " 

1279 "high degreee of parallelism, and as such may perform poorly on HDDs. Examples: 1, 4, 75%%, 150%%\n\n") 

1280 parser.add_argument( 

1281 "--max-concurrent-ssh-sessions-per-tcp-connection", type=int, min=1, default=8, action=CheckRange, metavar="INT", 

1282 help=f"For best throughput, {prog_name} uses multiple SSH TCP connections in parallel, as indicated by " 

1283 "--threads (see above). For best startup latency, each such parallel TCP connection can carry a " 

1284 "maximum of S concurrent SSH sessions, where " 

1285 "S=--max-concurrent-ssh-sessions-per-tcp-connection (default: %(default)s, min: %(min)s). " 

1286 "Concurrent SSH sessions are mostly used for metadata operations such as listing ZFS datasets and their " 

1287 "snapshots. This client-side max sessions parameter must not be higher than the server-side " 

1288 "sshd_config(5) MaxSessions parameter (which defaults to 10, see " 

1289 "https://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/man5/sshd_config.5.html).\n\n" 

1290 f"*Note:* For better throughput, {prog_name} uses one dedicated TCP connection per ZFS " 

1291 "send/receive operation such that the dedicated connection is never used by any other " 

1292 "concurrent SSH session, effectively ignoring the value of the " 

1293 "--max-concurrent-ssh-sessions-per-tcp-connection parameter in the ZFS send/receive case.\n\n") 

1294 parser.add_argument( 

1295 "--bwlimit", default=None, action=NonEmptyStringAction, metavar="STRING", 

1296 help="Sets 'pv' bandwidth rate limit for zfs send/receive data transfer (optional). Example: `100m` to cap " 

1297 "throughput at 100 MB/sec. Default is unlimited. Also see " 

1298 "https://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/man1/pv.1.html\n\n") 

1299 parser.add_argument( 

1300 "--daemon-lifetime", default="0 seconds", metavar="DURATION", 

1301 # help="Exit the daemon after this much time has elapsed. Default is '0 seconds', i.e. no daemon mode. " 

1302 # "Examples: '600 seconds', '86400 seconds', '1000years'\n\n") 

1303 help=argparse.SUPPRESS) 

1304 parser.add_argument( 

1305 "--daemon-frequency", default="minutely", metavar="STRING", 

1306 # help="Run a daemon iteration every N time units. Default is '%(default)s'. " 

1307 # "Examples: '100 millisecondly', '10secondly, 'minutely' to request the daemon to run every 100 milliseconds, " 

1308 # "or every 10 seconds, or every minute, respectively. Only has an effect if --daemon-lifetime is nonzero.\n\n") 

1309 help=argparse.SUPPRESS) 

1310 parser.add_argument( 

1311 "--daemon-remote-conf-cache-ttl", default="300 seconds", metavar="DURATION", 

1312 # help="The Time-To-Live for the remote host configuration cache, which stores available programs and " 

1313 # f"ZFS features. After this duration, {prog_name} will re-detect the remote environment. Set to '0 seconds' " 

1314 # "to re-detect on every daemon iteration. Default: %(default)s.\n\n") 

1315 help=argparse.SUPPRESS) 

1316 parser.add_argument( 

1317 "--no-estimate-send-size", action="store_true", 

1318 # help="Skip 'zfs send -n -v'. This may improve performance if replicating small snapshots at high frequency.\n\n") 

1319 help=argparse.SUPPRESS) 

1320 

1321 def hlp(program: str) -> str: 

1322 return f"The name of the '{program}' executable (optional). Default is '{program}'. " 

1323 

1324 msg = f"Use '{disable_prg}' to disable the use of this program.\n\n" 

1325 parser.add_argument( 

1326 "--compression-program", default="zstd", choices=["zstd", "lz4", "pzstd", "pigz", "gzip", "bzip2", disable_prg], 

1327 help=hlp("zstd") + msg.rstrip() + " The use is auto-disabled if data is transferred locally instead of via the " 

1328 "network. This option is about transparent compression-on-the-wire, not about " 

1329 "compression-at-rest.\n\n") 

1330 parser.add_argument( 

1331 "--compression-program-opts", default="-1", metavar="STRING", 

1332 help="The options to be passed to the compression program on the compression step (optional). " 

1333 "Default is '%(default)s' (fastest).\n\n") 

1334 parser.add_argument( 

1335 "--mbuffer-program", default="mbuffer", choices=["mbuffer", disable_prg], 

1336 help=hlp("mbuffer") + msg.rstrip() + " The use is auto-disabled if data is transferred locally " 

1337 "instead of via the network. This tool is used to smooth out the rate " 

1338 "of data flow and prevent bottlenecks caused by network latency or " 

1339 "speed fluctuation.\n\n") 

1340 parser.add_argument( 

1341 "--mbuffer-program-opts", default="-q -m 128M", metavar="STRING", 

1342 help="Options to be passed to 'mbuffer' program (optional). Default: '%(default)s'.\n\n") 

1343 parser.add_argument( 

1344 "--ps-program", default="ps", choices=["ps", disable_prg], 

1345 help=hlp("ps") + msg) 

1346 parser.add_argument( 

1347 "--pv-program", default="pv", choices=["pv", disable_prg], 

1348 help=hlp("pv") + msg.rstrip() + " This is used for bandwidth rate-limiting and progress monitoring.\n\n") 

1349 parser.add_argument( 

1350 "--pv-program-opts", metavar="STRING", 

1351 default="--progress --timer --eta --fineta --rate --average-rate --bytes --interval=1 --width=120 --buffer-size=2M", 

1352 help="The options to be passed to the 'pv' program (optional). Default: '%(default)s'.\n\n") 

1353 parser.add_argument( 

1354 "--shell-program", default="sh", choices=["sh", disable_prg], 

1355 help=hlp("sh") + msg) 

1356 parser.add_argument( 

1357 "--ssh-program", default="ssh", choices=["ssh", "hpnssh", disable_prg], 

1358 help=hlp("ssh") + msg) 

1359 parser.add_argument( 

1360 "--sudo-program", default="sudo", choices=["sudo", disable_prg], 

1361 help=hlp("sudo") + msg) 

1362 parser.add_argument( 

1363 "--zpool-program", default="zpool", choices=["zpool", disable_prg], 

1364 help=hlp("zpool") + msg) 

1365 parser.add_argument( 

1366 "--log-dir", type=str, action=SafeDirectoryNameAction, metavar="DIR", 

1367 help=f"Path to the log output directory on local host (optional). Default: $HOME/{prog_name}-logs. The logger " 

1368 "that is used by default writes log files there, in addition to the console. The basename of --log-dir must " 

1369 f"start with the prefix '{prog_name}-logs' as this helps prevent accidents. The current.dir symlink " 

1370 "always points to the subdirectory containing the most recent log file. The current.log symlink " 

1371 "always points to the most recent log file. The current.pv symlink always points to the most recent " 

1372 "data transfer monitoring log. Run `tail --follow=name --max-unchanged-stats=1` on both symlinks to " 

1373 "follow what's currently going on. Parallel replication generates a separate .pv file per thread. To " 

1374 "monitor these, run something like " 

1375 "`while true; do clear; for f in $(realpath $HOME/bzfs-logs/current/current.pv)*; " 

1376 "do tac -s $(printf '\\r') $f | tr '\\r' '\\n' | grep -m1 -v '^$'; done; sleep 1; done`\n\n") 

1377 h_fix = ("The path name of the log file on local host is " 

1378 "`${--log-dir}/${--log-file-prefix}<timestamp>${--log-file-infix}${--log-file-suffix}-<random>.log`. " 

1379 "Example: `--log-file-prefix=zrun_us-west-1_ --log-file-suffix=_daily` will generate log " 

1380 "file names such as `zrun_us-west-1_2024-09-03_12:26:15_daily-bl4i1fth.log`\n\n") 

1381 parser.add_argument( 

1382 "--log-file-prefix", default="zrun_", action=SafeFileNameAction, metavar="STRING", 

1383 help="Default is %(default)s. " + h_fix) 

1384 parser.add_argument( 

1385 "--log-file-infix", default="", action=SafeFileNameAction, metavar="STRING", 

1386 help="Default is the empty string. " + h_fix) 

1387 parser.add_argument( 

1388 "--log-file-suffix", default="", action=SafeFileNameAction, metavar="STRING", 

1389 help="Default is the empty string. " + h_fix) 

1390 parser.add_argument( 

1391 "--log-subdir", choices=["daily", "hourly", "minutely"], default="daily", 

1392 help="Make a new subdirectory in --log-dir every day, hour or minute; write log files there. " 

1393 "Default is '%(default)s'.") 

1394 parser.add_argument( 

1395 "--log-syslog-address", default=None, action=NonEmptyStringAction, metavar="STRING", 

1396 help="Host:port of the syslog machine to send messages to (e.g. 'foo.example.com:514' or '127.0.0.1:514'), or " 

1397 "the file system path to the syslog socket file on localhost (e.g. '/dev/log'). The default is no " 

1398 "address, i.e. do not log anything to syslog by default. See " 

1399 "https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.handlers.html#sysloghandler\n\n") 

1400 parser.add_argument( 

1401 "--log-syslog-socktype", choices=["UDP", "TCP"], default="UDP", 

1402 help="The socket type to use to connect if no local socket file system path is used. Default is '%(default)s'.\n\n") 

1403 parser.add_argument( 

1404 "--log-syslog-facility", type=int, min=0, max=7, default=1, action=CheckRange, metavar="INT", 

1405 help="The local facility aka category that identifies msg sources in syslog " 

1406 "(default: %(default)s, min=%(min)s, max=%(max)s).\n\n") 

1407 parser.add_argument( 

1408 "--log-syslog-prefix", default=prog_name, action=NonEmptyStringAction, metavar="STRING", 

1409 help=f"The name to prepend to each message that is sent to syslog; identifies {prog_name} messages as opposed " 

1410 "to messages from other sources. Default is '%(default)s'.\n\n") 

1411 parser.add_argument( 

1412 "--log-syslog-level", choices=["CRITICAL", "ERROR", "WARN", "INFO", "DEBUG", "TRACE"], 

1413 default="ERROR", 

1414 help="Only send messages with equal or higher priority than this log level to syslog. Default is '%(default)s'.\n\n") 

1415 parser.add_argument( 

1416 "--log-config-file", default=None, action=NonEmptyStringAction, metavar="STRING", 

1417 help="The contents of a JSON file that defines a custom python logging configuration to be used (optional). " 

1418 "If the option starts with a `+` prefix then the contents are read from the UTF-8 JSON file given " 

1419 "after the `+` prefix. Examples: +log_config.json, +/path/to/log_config.json. " 

1420 "Here is an example config file that demonstrates usage: " 

1421 "https://github.com/whoschek/bzfs/blob/main/bzfs_tests/log_config.json\n\n" 

1422 "For more examples see " 

1423 "https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7507825/where-is-a-complete-example-of-logging-config-dictconfig " 

1424 "and for details see " 

1425 "https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.config.html#configuration-dictionary-schema\n\n" 

1426 "*Note:* Lines starting with a # character are ignored as comments within the JSON. Also, if a line ends " 

1427 "with a # character the portion between that # character and the preceding # character on the same line " 

1428 "is ignored as a comment.\n\n") 

1429 parser.add_argument( 

1430 "--log-config-var", action=LogConfigVariablesAction, nargs="+", default=[], metavar="NAME:VALUE", 

1431 help="User defined variables in the form of zero or more NAME:VALUE pairs (optional). " 

1432 "These variables can be used within the JSON passed with --log-config-file (see above) via " 

1433 "`${name[:default]}` references, which are substituted (aka interpolated) as follows:\n\n" 

1434 "If the variable contains a non-empty CLI value then that value is used. Else if a default value for the " 

1435 "variable exists in the JSON file that default value is used. Else the program aborts with an error. " 

1436 "Example: In the JSON variable `${syslog_address:/dev/log}`, the variable name is 'syslog_address' " 

1437 "and the default value is '/dev/log'. The default value is the portion after the optional : colon " 

1438 "within the variable declaration. The default value is used if the CLI user does not specify a non-empty " 

1439 "value via --log-config-var, for example via " 

1440 "--log-config-var syslog_address:/path/to/socket_file or via " 

1441 "--log-config-var syslog_address:[host,port].\n\n" 

1442 f"{prog_name} automatically supplies the following convenience variables: " 

1443 "`${bzfs.log_level}`, `${bzfs.log_dir}`, `${bzfs.log_file}`, `${bzfs.sub.logger}`, " 

1444 "`${bzfs.get_default_log_formatter}`, `${bzfs.timestamp}`. " 

1445 "For a complete list see the source code of get_dict_config_logger().\n\n") 

1446 parser.add_argument( 

1447 "--include-envvar-regex", action=FileOrLiteralAction, nargs="+", default=[], metavar="REGEX", 

1448 help="On program startup, unset all Unix environment variables for which the full environment variable " 

1449 "name matches at least one of the excludes but none of the includes. If an environment variable is " 

1450 "included this decision is never reconsidered because include takes precedence over exclude. " 

1451 "The purpose is to tighten security and help guard against accidental inheritance or malicious " 

1452 "injection of environment variable values that may have unintended effects.\n\n" 

1453 "This option can be specified multiple times. " 

1454 "A leading `!` character indicates logical negation, i.e. the regex matches if the regex with the " 

1455 "leading `!` character removed does not match. " 

1456 "The default is to include no environment variables, i.e. to make no exceptions to --exclude-envvar-regex. " 

1457 "Example that retains at least these two env vars: " 

1458 "`--include-envvar-regex PATH " 

1459 f"--include-envvar-regex {env_var_prefix}min_pipe_transfer_size`. " 

1460 "Example that retains all environment variables without tightened security: `'.*'`\n\n") 

1461 parser.add_argument( 

1462 "--exclude-envvar-regex", action=FileOrLiteralAction, nargs="+", default=[], metavar="REGEX", 

1463 help="Same syntax as --include-envvar-regex (see above) except that the default is to exclude no " 

1464 f"environment variables. Example: `{env_var_prefix}.*`\n\n") 

1465 

1466 for period, label in {"yearly": "years", "monthly": "months", "weekly": "weeks", "daily": "days", "hourly": "hours", 

1467 "minutely": "minutes", "secondly": "seconds", "millisecondly": "milliseconds"}.items(): 

1468 anchor_group = parser.add_argument_group( 

1469 f"{period.title()} period anchors", "Use these options to customize when snapshots that happen " 

1470 f"every N {label} are scheduled to be created on the source by the --create-src-snapshots option.") 

1471 for f in [f for f in dataclasses.fields(PeriodAnchors) if f.name.startswith(period + "_")]: 

1472 _min = f.metadata.get("min") 

1473 _max = f.metadata.get("max") 

1474 anchor_group.add_argument( 

1475 "--" + f.name, type=int, min=_min, max=_max, default=f.default, action=CheckRange, metavar="INT", 

1476 help=f"{f.metadata.get('help')} ({_min} ≤ x ≤ {_max}, default: %(default)s).\n\n") 

1477 

1478 for option_name, flag in zfs_recv_groups.items(): 

1479 grup = option_name.replace("_", "-") # one of zfs_recv_o, zfs_recv_x 

1480 flag = "'" + flag + "'" # one of -o or -x 

1481 

1482 def h(text: str) -> str: 

1483 return argparse.SUPPRESS if option_name == "zfs_set" else text # noqa: B023 

1484 

1485 argument_group = parser.add_argument_group( 

1486 grup + " (Experimental)", 

1487 description=h(f"The following group of parameters specifies additional zfs receive {flag} options that " 

1488 "can be used to configure the copying of ZFS dataset properties from the source dataset to " 

1489 "its corresponding destination dataset. The 'zfs-recv-o' group of parameters is applied " 

1490 "before the 'zfs-recv-x' group.")) 

1491 target_choices_items = ["full", "incremental"] 

1492 target_choices_default = "+".join(target_choices_items) 

1493 target_choices = target_choices_items + [target_choices_default] 

1494 qq = "'" 

1495 argument_group.add_argument( 

1496 f"--{grup}-targets", choices=target_choices, default=target_choices_default, 

1497 help=h(f"The zfs send phase or phases during which the extra {flag} options are passed to 'zfs receive'. " 

1498 "This can be one of the following choices: " 

1499 f"{', '.join([f'{qq}{x}{qq}' for x in target_choices])}. " 

1500 "Default is '%(default)s'. " 

1501 "A 'full' send is sometimes also known as an 'initial' send.\n\n")) 

1502 msg = "Thus, -x opts do not benefit from source != 'local' (which is the default already)." \ 

1503 if flag == "'-x'" else "" 

1504 argument_group.add_argument( 

1505 f"--{grup}-sources", action=NonEmptyStringAction, default="local", metavar="STRING", 

1506 help=h("The ZFS sources to provide to the 'zfs get -s' CLI in order to fetch the ZFS dataset properties " 

1507 f"that will be fed into the --{grup}-include/exclude-regex filter (see below). The sources are in " 

1508 "the form of a comma-separated list (no spaces) containing one or more of the following choices: " 

1509 "'local', 'default', 'inherited', 'temporary', 'received', 'none', with the default being '%(default)s'. " 

1510 f"Uses 'zfs get -p -s ${grup}-sources all $SRC_DATASET' to fetch the " 

1511 "properties to copy - https://openzfs.github.io/openzfs-docs/man/master/8/zfs-get.8.html. P.S: Note " 

1512 "that the existing 'zfs send --props' option does not filter and that --props only reads properties " 

1513 f"from the 'local' ZFS property source (https://github.com/openzfs/zfs/issues/13024). {msg}\n\n")) 

1514 argument_group.add_argument( 

1515 f"--{grup}-include-regex", action=FileOrLiteralAction, nargs="+", default=[], metavar="REGEX", 

1516 help=h(f"Take the output properties of --{grup}-sources (see above) and filter them such that we only " 

1517 "retain the properties whose name matches at least one of the --include regexes but none of the " 

1518 "--exclude regexes. If a property is excluded this decision is never reconsidered because exclude " 

1519 f"takes precedence over include. Append each retained property to the list of {flag} options in " 

1520 "--zfs-recv-program-opt(s), unless another '-o' or '-x' option with the same name already exists " 

1521 "therein. In other words, --zfs-recv-program-opt(s) takes precedence.\n\n" 

1522 f"The --{grup}-include-regex option can be specified multiple times. " 

1523 "A leading `!` character indicates logical negation, i.e. the regex matches if the regex with the " 

1524 "leading `!` character removed does not match. " 

1525 "If the option starts with a `+` prefix then regexes are read from the newline-separated " 

1526 "UTF-8 text file given after the `+` prefix, one regex per line inside of the text file.\n\n" 

1527 f"The default is to include no properties, thus by default no extra {flag} option is appended. " 

1528 f"Example: `--{grup}-include-regex recordsize volblocksize`. " 

1529 "More examples: `.*` (include all properties), `foo bar myapp:.*` (include three regexes) " 

1530 f"`+{grup}_regexes.txt`, `+/path/to/{grup}_regexes.txt`\n\n")) 

1531 argument_group.add_argument( 

1532 f"--{grup}-exclude-regex", action=FileOrLiteralAction, nargs="+", default=[], metavar="REGEX", 

1533 help=h(f"Same syntax as --{grup}-include-regex (see above), and the default is to exclude no properties. " 

1534 f"Example: --{grup}-exclude-regex encryptionroot keystatus origin volblocksize volsize\n\n")) 

1535 parser.add_argument( 

1536 "--version", action="version", version=f"{prog_name}-{__version__}, by {prog_author}", 

1537 help="Display version information and exit.\n\n") 

1538 parser.add_argument( 

1539 "--help, -h", action="help", 

1540 help="Show this help message and exit.\n\n") 

1541 return parser 

1542 # fmt: on 

1543 

1544 

1545############################################################################# 

1546class LogParams: 

1547 def __init__(self, args: argparse.Namespace) -> None: 

1548 """Option values for logging; reads from ArgumentParser via args.""" 

1549 # immutable variables: 

1550 if args.quiet: 

1551 self.log_level = "ERROR" 

1552 elif args.verbose >= 2: 

1553 self.log_level = "TRACE" 

1554 elif args.verbose >= 1: 

1555 self.log_level = "DEBUG" 

1556 else: 

1557 self.log_level = "INFO" 

1558 self.log_config_file = args.log_config_file 

1559 if self.log_config_file: 

1560 validate_no_argument_file(self.log_config_file, args, err_prefix="--log-config-file: ") 

1561 self.log_config_vars = dict(var.split(":", 1) for var in args.log_config_var) 

1562 timestamp = datetime.now().isoformat(sep="_", timespec="seconds") # 2024-09-03_12:26:15 

1563 self.timestamp: str = timestamp 

1564 self.home_dir: str = get_home_directory() 

1565 default_dir_name = prog_name + "-logs" 

1566 log_parent_dir: str = args.log_dir if args.log_dir else os.path.join(self.home_dir, default_dir_name) 

1567 if not os.path.basename(log_parent_dir).startswith(default_dir_name): 

1568 die(f"Basename of --log-dir must start with prefix '{default_dir_name}', but got: {log_parent_dir}") 

1569 if os.path.islink(log_parent_dir): 

1570 die(f"--log-dir must not be a symlink: {log_parent_dir}") 

1571 sep = "_" if args.log_subdir == "daily" else ":" 

1572 subdir = timestamp[0 : timestamp.rindex(sep) if args.log_subdir == "minutely" else timestamp.index(sep)] 

1573 self.log_dir: str = os.path.join(log_parent_dir, subdir) # 2024-09-03 (d), 2024-09-03_12 (h), 2024-09-03_12:26 (m) 

1574 os.makedirs(log_parent_dir, mode=DIR_PERMISSIONS, exist_ok=True) 

1575 os.makedirs(self.log_dir, mode=DIR_PERMISSIONS, exist_ok=True) 

1576 self.log_file_prefix = args.log_file_prefix 

1577 self.log_file_infix = args.log_file_infix 

1578 self.log_file_suffix = args.log_file_suffix 

1579 fd, self.log_file = tempfile.mkstemp( 

1580 suffix=".log", 

1581 prefix=f"{self.log_file_prefix}{self.timestamp}{self.log_file_infix}{self.log_file_suffix}-", 

1582 dir=self.log_dir, 

1583 ) 

1584 os.close(fd) 

1585 self.pv_log_file = self.log_file[0 : -len(".log")] + ".pv" 

1586 self.last_modified_cache_dir = os.path.join(log_parent_dir, ".cache", "last_modified") 

1587 os.makedirs(os.path.dirname(self.last_modified_cache_dir), mode=DIR_PERMISSIONS, exist_ok=True) 

1588 

1589 # Create/update "current" symlink to current_dir, which is a subdir containing further symlinks to log files. 

1590 # For parallel usage, ensures there is no time window when the symlinks are inconsistent or do not exist. 

1591 current = "current" 

1592 dot_current_dir = os.path.join(log_parent_dir, f".{current}") 

1593 current_dir = os.path.join(dot_current_dir, os.path.basename(self.log_file)[0 : -len(".log")]) 

1594 os.makedirs(dot_current_dir, mode=DIR_PERMISSIONS, exist_ok=True) 

1595 os.makedirs(current_dir, mode=DIR_PERMISSIONS, exist_ok=True) 

1596 create_symlink(self.log_file, current_dir, f"{current}.log") 

1597 create_symlink(self.pv_log_file, current_dir, f"{current}.pv") 

1598 create_symlink(self.log_dir, current_dir, f"{current}.dir") 

1599 dst_file = os.path.join(current_dir, current) 

1600 os.symlink(os.path.relpath(current_dir, start=log_parent_dir), dst_file) 

1601 os.replace(dst_file, os.path.join(log_parent_dir, current)) # atomic rename 

1602 delete_stale_files(dot_current_dir, prefix="", millis=10, dirs=True, exclude=os.path.basename(current_dir)) 

1603 self.params: Optional[Params] = None 

1604 

1605 def __repr__(self) -> str: 

1606 return str(self.__dict__) 

1607 

1608 

1609############################################################################# 

1610RegexList = List[Tuple[re.Pattern, bool]] # Type alias 

1611UnixTimeRange = Optional[Tuple[Union[timedelta, int], Union[timedelta, int]]] # Type alias 

1612RankRange = Tuple[Tuple[str, int, bool], Tuple[str, int, bool]] # Type alias 

1613Tree = Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]] # Type alias 

1614 

1615 

1616############################################################################# 

1617class Params: 

1618 def __init__( 

1619 self, 

1620 args: argparse.Namespace, 

1621 sys_argv: Optional[List[str]] = None, 

1622 log_params: Optional[LogParams] = None, 

1623 log: Optional[Logger] = None, 

1624 inject_params: Optional[Dict[str, bool]] = None, 

1625 ) -> None: 

1626 """Option values for all aspects; reads from ArgumentParser via args.""" 

1627 # immutable variables: 

1628 assert args is not None 

1629 self.args: argparse.Namespace = args 

1630 self.sys_argv: List[str] = sys_argv if sys_argv is not None else [] 

1631 assert isinstance(self.sys_argv, list) 

1632 self.log_params: LogParams = cast(LogParams, log_params) 

1633 self.log: Logger = cast(Logger, log) 

1634 self.inject_params: Dict[str, bool] = inject_params if inject_params is not None else {} # for testing only 

1635 self.one_or_more_whitespace_regex: re.Pattern = re.compile(r"\s+") 

1636 self.two_or_more_spaces_regex: re.Pattern = re.compile(r" +") 

1637 self.unset_matching_env_vars(args) 

1638 self.xperiods = SnapshotPeriods() 

1639 

1640 assert len(args.root_dataset_pairs) > 0 

1641 self.root_dataset_pairs: List[Tuple[str, str]] = args.root_dataset_pairs 

1642 self.recursive: bool = args.recursive 

1643 self.recursive_flag: str = "-r" if args.recursive else "" 

1644 

1645 self.dry_run: bool = args.dryrun is not None 

1646 self.dry_run_recv: str = "-n" if self.dry_run else "" 

1647 self.dry_run_destroy: str = self.dry_run_recv 

1648 self.dry_run_no_send: bool = args.dryrun == "send" 

1649 self.verbose_zfs: bool = args.verbose >= 2 

1650 self.verbose_destroy: str = "" if args.quiet else "-v" 

1651 self.quiet: bool = args.quiet 

1652 

1653 self.zfs_send_program_opts: List[str] = self.fix_send_opts(self.split_args(args.zfs_send_program_opts)) 

1654 zfs_recv_program_opts: List[str] = self.split_args(args.zfs_recv_program_opts) 

1655 for extra_opt in args.zfs_recv_program_opt: 1655 ↛ 1656line 1655 didn't jump to line 1656 because the loop on line 1655 never started

1656 zfs_recv_program_opts.append(self.validate_arg_str(extra_opt, allow_all=True)) 

1657 self.zfs_recv_program_opts: List[str] = self.fix_recv_opts(zfs_recv_program_opts) 

1658 if self.verbose_zfs: 

1659 append_if_absent(self.zfs_send_program_opts, "-v") 

1660 append_if_absent(self.zfs_recv_program_opts, "-v") 

1661 self.zfs_full_recv_opts: List[str] = self.zfs_recv_program_opts.copy() 

1662 cpconfigs = [CopyPropertiesConfig(group, flag, args, self) for group, flag in zfs_recv_groups.items()] 

1663 self.zfs_recv_o_config, self.zfs_recv_x_config, self.zfs_set_config = cpconfigs 

1664 

1665 self.force_rollback_to_latest_snapshot: bool = args.force_rollback_to_latest_snapshot 

1666 self.force_rollback_to_latest_common_snapshot = SynchronizedBool(args.force_rollback_to_latest_common_snapshot) 

1667 self.force: SynchronizedBool = SynchronizedBool(args.force) 

1668 self.force_once: bool = args.force_once 

1669 self.force_unmount: str = "-f" if args.force_unmount else "" 

1670 force_hard: str = "-R" if args.force_destroy_dependents else "" 

1671 self.force_hard: str = "-R" if args.force_hard else force_hard # --force-hard is deprecated 

1672 

1673 self.skip_parent: bool = args.skip_parent 

1674 self.skip_missing_snapshots: str = args.skip_missing_snapshots 

1675 self.skip_on_error: str = args.skip_on_error 

1676 self.retry_policy: RetryPolicy = RetryPolicy(args, self) 

1677 self.skip_replication: bool = args.skip_replication 

1678 self.delete_dst_snapshots: bool = args.delete_dst_snapshots is not None 

1679 self.delete_dst_bookmarks: bool = args.delete_dst_snapshots == "bookmarks" 

1680 self.delete_dst_snapshots_no_crosscheck: bool = args.delete_dst_snapshots_no_crosscheck 

1681 self.delete_dst_snapshots_except: bool = args.delete_dst_snapshots_except 

1682 self.delete_dst_datasets: bool = args.delete_dst_datasets 

1683 self.delete_empty_dst_datasets: bool = args.delete_empty_dst_datasets is not None 

1684 self.delete_empty_dst_datasets_if_no_bookmarks_and_no_snapshots: bool = ( 

1685 args.delete_empty_dst_datasets == "snapshots+bookmarks" 

1686 ) 

1687 self.compare_snapshot_lists: str = args.compare_snapshot_lists 

1688 self.daemon_lifetime_nanos: int = 1_000_000 * parse_duration_to_milliseconds(args.daemon_lifetime) 

1689 self.daemon_frequency: str = args.daemon_frequency 

1690 self.enable_privilege_elevation: bool = not args.no_privilege_elevation 

1691 self.no_stream: bool = args.no_stream 

1692 self.resume_recv: bool = not args.no_resume_recv 

1693 self.create_bookmarks: str = "none" if args.no_create_bookmark else args.create_bookmarks # no_create_bookmark depr 

1694 self.use_bookmark: bool = not args.no_use_bookmark 

1695 

1696 self.src: Remote = Remote("src", args, self) # src dataset, host and ssh options 

1697 self.dst: Remote = Remote("dst", args, self) # dst dataset, host and ssh options 

1698 self.create_src_snapshots_config: CreateSrcSnapshotConfig = CreateSrcSnapshotConfig(args, self) 

1699 self.monitor_snapshots_config: MonitorSnapshotsConfig = MonitorSnapshotsConfig(args, self) 

1700 self.is_caching_snapshots: bool = args.cache_snapshots == "true" 

1701 

1702 self.compression_program: str = self.program_name(args.compression_program) 

1703 self.compression_program_opts: List[str] = self.split_args(args.compression_program_opts) 

1704 self.getconf_program: str = self.program_name("getconf") # print number of CPUs on POSIX except Solaris 

1705 self.psrinfo_program: str = self.program_name("psrinfo") # print number of CPUs on Solaris 

1706 self.mbuffer_program: str = self.program_name(args.mbuffer_program) 

1707 self.mbuffer_program_opts: List[str] = self.split_args(args.mbuffer_program_opts) 

1708 self.ps_program: str = self.program_name(args.ps_program) 

1709 self.pv_program: str = self.program_name(args.pv_program) 

1710 self.pv_program_opts: List[str] = self.split_args(args.pv_program_opts) 

1711 self.isatty: bool = getenv_bool("isatty", True) 

1712 if args.bwlimit: 1712 ↛ 1713line 1712 didn't jump to line 1713 because the condition on line 1712 was never true

1713 self.pv_program_opts += [f"--rate-limit={self.validate_arg_str(args.bwlimit)}"] 

1714 self.shell_program_local: str = "sh" 

1715 self.shell_program: str = self.program_name(args.shell_program) 

1716 self.ssh_program: str = self.program_name(args.ssh_program) 

1717 self.sudo_program: str = self.program_name(args.sudo_program) 

1718 self.uname_program: str = self.program_name("uname") 

1719 self.zfs_program: str = self.program_name("zfs") 

1720 self.zpool_program: str = self.program_name(args.zpool_program) 

1721 

1722 # no point creating complex shell pipeline commands for tiny data transfers: 

1723 self.min_pipe_transfer_size: int = getenv_int("min_pipe_transfer_size", 1024 * 1024) 

1724 self.max_datasets_per_batch_on_list_snaps: int = getenv_int("max_datasets_per_batch_on_list_snaps", 1024) 

1725 self.max_datasets_per_minibatch_on_list_snaps: int = getenv_int("max_datasets_per_minibatch_on_list_snaps", -1) 

1726 self.max_snapshots_per_minibatch_on_delete_snaps = getenv_int("max_snapshots_per_minibatch_on_delete_snaps", 2**29) 

1727 self.dedicated_tcp_connection_per_zfs_send: bool = getenv_bool("dedicated_tcp_connection_per_zfs_send", True) 

1728 self.threads: Tuple[int, bool] = (1, False) if self.force_once else args.threads 

1729 timeout_nanos = None if args.timeout is None else 1_000_000 * parse_duration_to_milliseconds(args.timeout) 

1730 self.timeout_nanos: Optional[int] = timeout_nanos 

1731 self.no_estimate_send_size: bool = args.no_estimate_send_size 

1732 self.remote_conf_cache_ttl_nanos: int = 1_000_000 * parse_duration_to_milliseconds(args.daemon_remote_conf_cache_ttl) 

1733 self.terminal_columns: int = ( 

1734 getenv_int("terminal_columns", shutil.get_terminal_size(fallback=(120, 24)).columns) 

1735 if self.isatty and self.pv_program != disable_prg and not self.quiet 

1736 else 0 

1737 ) 

1738 

1739 self.os_cpu_count: Optional[int] = os.cpu_count() 

1740 self.os_geteuid: int = os.geteuid() 

1741 self.prog_version: str = __version__ 

1742 self.python_version: str = sys.version 

1743 self.platform_version: str = platform.version() 

1744 self.platform_platform: str = platform.platform() 

1745 

1746 # mutable variables: 

1747 snapshot_filters = args.snapshot_filters_var if hasattr(args, snapshot_filters_var) else [[]] 

1748 self.snapshot_filters: List[List[SnapshotFilter]] = [optimize_snapshot_filters(f) for f in snapshot_filters] 

1749 self.exclude_dataset_property: Optional[str] = args.exclude_dataset_property 

1750 self.exclude_dataset_regexes: RegexList = [] # deferred to validate_task() phase 

1751 self.include_dataset_regexes: RegexList = [] # deferred to validate_task() phase 

1752 self.tmp_exclude_dataset_regexes: RegexList = [] # deferred to validate_task() phase 

1753 self.tmp_include_dataset_regexes: RegexList = [] # deferred to validate_task() phase 

1754 self.abs_exclude_datasets: List[str] = [] # deferred to validate_task() phase 

1755 self.abs_include_datasets: List[str] = [] # deferred to validate_task() phase 

1756 

1757 self.curr_zfs_send_program_opts: List[str] = [] 

1758 self.zfs_recv_ox_names: Set[str] = set() 

1759 self.available_programs: Dict[str, Dict[str, str]] = {} 

1760 self.zpool_features: Dict[str, Dict[str, str]] = {} 

1761 self.connection_pools: Dict[str, "ConnectionPools"] = {} 

1762 

1763 def split_args(self, text: str, *items: Union[str, Iterable[str]], allow_all: bool = False) -> List[str]: 

1764 """Splits option string on runs of one or more whitespace into an option list.""" 

1765 text = text.strip() 

1766 opts = self.one_or_more_whitespace_regex.split(text) if text else [] 

1767 xappend(opts, items) 

1768 if not allow_all: 

1769 self.validate_quoting(opts) 

1770 return opts 

1771 

1772 def validate_arg(self, opt: str, allow_spaces: bool = False, allow_all: bool = False) -> Optional[str]: 

1773 """allow_all permits all characters, including whitespace and quotes. See squote() and dquote().""" 

1774 if allow_all or opt is None: 

1775 return opt 

1776 if any(char.isspace() and (char != " " or not allow_spaces) for char in opt): 

1777 die(f"Option must not contain a whitespace character{' other than space' if allow_spaces else ''}: {opt}") 

1778 self.validate_quoting([opt]) 

1779 return opt 

1780 

1781 def validate_arg_str(self, opt: str, allow_spaces: bool = False, allow_all: bool = False) -> str: 

1782 if opt is None: 

1783 die("Option must not be missing") 

1784 self.validate_arg(opt, allow_spaces=allow_spaces, allow_all=allow_all) 

1785 return opt 

1786 

1787 @staticmethod 

1788 def validate_quoting(opts: List[str]) -> None: 

1789 for opt in opts: 

1790 if "'" in opt or '"' in opt or "$" in opt or "`" in opt: 

1791 die(f"Option must not contain a single quote or double quote or dollar or backtick character: {opt}") 

1792 

1793 @staticmethod 

1794 def fix_recv_opts(opts: List[str]) -> List[str]: 

1795 return fix_send_recv_opts( 

1796 opts, exclude_long_opts={"--dryrun"}, exclude_short_opts="n", include_arg_opts={"-o", "-x"} 

1797 ) 

1798 

1799 @staticmethod 

1800 def fix_send_opts(opts: List[str]) -> List[str]: 

1801 return fix_send_recv_opts( 

1802 opts, 

1803 exclude_long_opts={"--dryrun"}, 

1804 exclude_short_opts="den", 

1805 include_arg_opts={"-X", "--exclude", "--redact"}, 

1806 exclude_arg_opts=frozenset({"-i", "-I"}), 

1807 ) 

1808 

1809 def program_name(self, program: str) -> str: 

1810 """For testing: helps simulate errors caused by external programs.""" 

1811 self.validate_arg_str(program) 

1812 if not program: 

1813 die(f"Program name must not be missing: {program}") 

1814 for char in SHELL_CHARS + ":": 

1815 if char in program: 

1816 die(f"Program name must not contain a '{char}' character: {program}") 

1817 if self.inject_params.get("inject_unavailable_" + program, False): 1817 ↛ 1818line 1817 didn't jump to line 1818 because the condition on line 1817 was never true

1818 return program + "-xxx" # substitute a program that cannot be found on the PATH 

1819 if self.inject_params.get("inject_failing_" + program, False): 1819 ↛ 1820line 1819 didn't jump to line 1820 because the condition on line 1819 was never true

1820 return "false" # substitute a program that will error out with non-zero return code 

1821 return program 

1822 

1823 def unset_matching_env_vars(self, args: argparse.Namespace) -> None: 

1824 exclude_envvar_regexes = compile_regexes(args.exclude_envvar_regex) 

1825 include_envvar_regexes = compile_regexes(args.include_envvar_regex) 

1826 for envvar_name in list(os.environ.keys()): 

1827 if is_included(envvar_name, exclude_envvar_regexes, include_envvar_regexes): 1827 ↛ 1828line 1827 didn't jump to line 1828 because the condition on line 1827 was never true

1828 os.environ.pop(envvar_name, None) 

1829 self.log.debug("Unsetting b/c envvar regex: %s", envvar_name) 

1830 

1831 def lock_file_name(self) -> str: 

1832 """Makes it such that a job that runs periodically declines to start if the same previous periodic 

1833 job is still running without completion yet.""" 

1834 # fmt: off 

1835 key = (tuple(self.root_dataset_pairs), self.args.recursive, self.args.exclude_dataset_property, 

1836 tuple(self.args.include_dataset), tuple(self.args.exclude_dataset), 

1837 tuple(self.args.include_dataset_regex), tuple(self.args.exclude_dataset_regex), 

1838 tuple(tuple(f) for f in self.snapshot_filters), self.args.skip_replication, self.args.create_src_snapshots, 

1839 self.args.create_src_snapshots_plan, self.args.create_src_snapshots_timeformat, 

1840 self.create_src_snapshots_config.anchors, 

1841 self.args.delete_dst_datasets, self.args.delete_dst_snapshots, self.args.delete_dst_snapshots_except, 

1842 self.args.delete_empty_dst_datasets, 

1843 self.args.compare_snapshot_lists, self.args.monitor_snapshots, 

1844 self.args.log_file_infix, 

1845 self.src.basis_ssh_host, self.dst.basis_ssh_host, 

1846 self.src.basis_ssh_user, self.dst.basis_ssh_user) 

1847 # fmt: on 

1848 hash_code = hashlib.sha256(str(key).encode("utf-8")).hexdigest() 

1849 return os.path.join(tempfile.gettempdir(), f"{prog_name}-lockfile-{hash_code}.lock") 

1850 

1851 def dry(self, msg: str) -> str: 

1852 return "Dry " + msg if self.dry_run else msg 

1853 

1854 

1855############################################################################# 

1856class Remote: 

1857 def __init__(self, loc: str, args: argparse.Namespace, p: Params) -> None: 

1858 """Option values for either location=='src' or location=='dst'; reads from ArgumentParser via args.""" 

1859 # immutable variables: 

1860 assert loc == "src" or loc == "dst" 

1861 self.location: str = loc 

1862 self.params = p 

1863 self.basis_ssh_user: str = getattr(args, f"ssh_{loc}_user") 

1864 self.basis_ssh_host: str = getattr(args, f"ssh_{loc}_host") 

1865 self.ssh_port: int = getattr(args, f"ssh_{loc}_port") 

1866 self.ssh_config_file: Optional[str] = p.validate_arg(getattr(args, f"ssh_{loc}_config_file")) 

1867 if self.ssh_config_file: 

1868 if "bzfs_ssh_config" not in os.path.basename(self.ssh_config_file): 1868 ↛ 1871line 1868 didn't jump to line 1871 because the condition on line 1868 was always true

1869 die(f"Basename of --ssh-{loc}-config-file must contain substring 'bzfs_ssh_config': {self.ssh_config_file}") 

1870 # disable interactive password prompts and X11 forwarding and pseudo-terminal allocation: 

1871 self.ssh_extra_opts: List[str] = ["-oBatchMode=yes", "-oServerAliveInterval=0", "-x", "-T"] + ( 

1872 ["-v"] if args.verbose >= 3 else [] 

1873 ) 

1874 self.max_concurrent_ssh_sessions_per_tcp_connection: int = args.max_concurrent_ssh_sessions_per_tcp_connection 

1875 self.reuse_ssh_connection: bool = getenv_bool("reuse_ssh_connection", True) 

1876 if self.reuse_ssh_connection: 1876 ↛ 1882line 1876 didn't jump to line 1882 because the condition on line 1876 was always true

1877 self.ssh_socket_dir: str = os.path.join(get_home_directory(), ".ssh", "bzfs") 

1878 os.makedirs(os.path.dirname(self.ssh_socket_dir), exist_ok=True) 

1879 os.makedirs(self.ssh_socket_dir, mode=DIR_PERMISSIONS, exist_ok=True) 

1880 self.socket_prefix = "s" 

1881 delete_stale_files(self.ssh_socket_dir, self.socket_prefix, ssh=True) 

1882 self.sanitize1_regex = re.compile(r"[\s\\/@$]") # replace whitespace, /, $, \, @ with a ~ tilde char 

1883 self.sanitize2_regex = re.compile(rf"[^a-zA-Z0-9{re.escape('~.:_-')}]") # Remove chars not in the allowed set 

1884 

1885 # mutable variables: 

1886 self.root_dataset: str = "" # deferred until run_main() 

1887 self.basis_root_dataset: str = "" # deferred until run_main() 

1888 self.pool: str = "" 

1889 self.sudo: str = "" 

1890 self.use_zfs_delegation: bool = False 

1891 self.ssh_user: str = "" 

1892 self.ssh_host: str = "" 

1893 self.ssh_user_host: str = "" 

1894 self.is_nonlocal: bool = False 

1895 

1896 def local_ssh_command(self) -> List[str]: 

1897 """Returns the ssh CLI command to run locally in order to talk to the remote host. This excludes the (trailing) 

1898 command to run on the remote host, which will be appended later.""" 

1899 if self.ssh_user_host == "": 

1900 return [] # dataset is on local host - don't use ssh 

1901 

1902 # dataset is on remote host 

1903 p = self.params 

1904 if p.ssh_program == disable_prg: 1904 ↛ 1905line 1904 didn't jump to line 1905 because the condition on line 1904 was never true

1905 die("Cannot talk to remote host because ssh CLI is disabled.") 

1906 ssh_cmd = [p.ssh_program] + self.ssh_extra_opts 

1907 if self.ssh_config_file: 1907 ↛ 1908line 1907 didn't jump to line 1908 because the condition on line 1907 was never true

1908 ssh_cmd += ["-F", self.ssh_config_file] 

1909 if self.ssh_port: 1909 ↛ 1910line 1909 didn't jump to line 1910 because the condition on line 1909 was never true

1910 ssh_cmd += ["-p", str(self.ssh_port)] 

1911 if self.reuse_ssh_connection: 1911 ↛ 1924line 1911 didn't jump to line 1924 because the condition on line 1911 was always true

1912 # Performance: reuse ssh connection for low latency startup of frequent ssh invocations via the 'ssh -S' and 

1913 # 'ssh -S -M -oControlPersist=60s' options. See https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/OpenSSH/Cookbook/Multiplexing 

1914 # Generate unique private Unix domain socket file name in user's home dir and pass it to 'ssh -S /path/to/socket' 

1915 def sanitize(name: str) -> str: 

1916 name = self.sanitize1_regex.sub("~", name) # replace whitespace, /, $, \, @ with a ~ tilde char 

1917 name = self.sanitize2_regex.sub("", name) # Remove chars not in the allowed set 

1918 return name 

1919 

1920 unique = f"{os.getpid()}@{time.time_ns()}@{random.SystemRandom().randint(0, 999_999_999_999)}" 

1921 socket_name = f"{self.socket_prefix}{unique}@{sanitize(self.ssh_host)[:45]}@{sanitize(self.ssh_user)}" 

1922 socket_file = os.path.join(self.ssh_socket_dir, socket_name)[: max(100, len(self.ssh_socket_dir) + 10)] 

1923 ssh_cmd += ["-S", socket_file] 

1924 ssh_cmd += [self.ssh_user_host] 

1925 return ssh_cmd 

1926 

1927 def cache_key(self) -> Tuple: 

1928 return self.location, self.pool, self.ssh_user_host, self.ssh_port, self.ssh_config_file 

1929 

1930 def __repr__(self) -> str: 

1931 return str(self.__dict__) 

1932 

1933 

1934############################################################################# 

1935class CopyPropertiesConfig: 

1936 def __init__(self, group: str, flag: str, args: argparse.Namespace, p: Params) -> None: 

1937 """Option values for --zfs-recv-o* and --zfs-recv-x* option groups; reads from ArgumentParser via args.""" 

1938 # immutable variables: 

1939 grup = group 

1940 self.group: str = group 

1941 self.flag: str = flag # one of -o or -x 

1942 sources: str = p.validate_arg_str(getattr(args, f"{grup}_sources")) 

1943 self.sources: str = ",".join(sorted([s.strip() for s in sources.strip().split(",")])) # canonicalize 

1944 self.targets: str = p.validate_arg_str(getattr(args, f"{grup}_targets")) 

1945 self.include_regexes: RegexList = compile_regexes(getattr(args, f"{grup}_include_regex")) 

1946 self.exclude_regexes: RegexList = compile_regexes(getattr(args, f"{grup}_exclude_regex")) 

1947 

1948 def __repr__(self) -> str: 

1949 return str(self.__dict__)

1952############################################################################# 

1953class RetryPolicy: 

1954 def __init__(self, args: argparse.Namespace, p: Params) -> None: 

1955 """Option values for retries; reads from ArgumentParser via args.""" 

1956 # immutable variables: 

1957 self.retries: int = args.retries 

1958 self.min_sleep_secs: float = args.retry_min_sleep_secs 

1959 self.max_sleep_secs: float = args.retry_max_sleep_secs 

1960 self.max_elapsed_secs: float = args.retry_max_elapsed_secs 

1961 self.min_sleep_nanos: int = int(self.min_sleep_secs * 1_000_000_000) 

1962 self.max_sleep_nanos: int = int(self.max_sleep_secs * 1_000_000_000) 

1963 self.max_elapsed_nanos: int = int(self.max_elapsed_secs * 1_000_000_000) 

1964 self.min_sleep_nanos = max(1, self.min_sleep_nanos) 

1965 self.max_sleep_nanos = max(self.min_sleep_nanos, self.max_sleep_nanos) 

1966 

1967 def __repr__(self) -> str: 

1968 return ( 

1969 f"retries: {self.retries}, min_sleep_secs: {self.min_sleep_secs}, " 

1970 f"max_sleep_secs: {self.max_sleep_secs}, max_elapsed_secs: {self.max_elapsed_secs}" 

1971 ) 

1972 

1973 

1974############################################################################# 

1975@dataclass(frozen=True) 

1976class Retry: 

1977 count: int 

1978 

1979 

1980############################################################################# 

1981class SnapshotLabel(NamedTuple): 

1982 """Contains the individual parts that are concatenated into a ZFS snapshot name.""" 

1983 

1984 prefix: str # bzfs_ 

1985 infix: str # us-west-1_ 

1986 timestamp: str # 2024-11-06_08:30:05 

1987 suffix: str # _hourly 

1988 

1989 def __str__(self) -> str: # bzfs_us-west-1_2024-11-06_08:30:05_hourly 

1990 return f"{self.prefix}{self.infix}{self.timestamp}{self.suffix}" 

1991 

1992 def validate_label(self, input_text: str) -> None: 

1993 name = str(self) 

1994 validate_dataset_name(name, input_text) 

1995 if "/" in name: 

1996 die(f"Invalid ZFS snapshot name: '{name}' for: '{input_text}*'") 

1997 for key, value in {"prefix": self.prefix, "infix": self.infix, "suffix": self.suffix}.items(): 

1998 if key == "prefix": 

1999 if not value.endswith("_"): 

2000 die(f"Invalid {input_text}{key}: Must end with an underscore character: '{value}'") 

2001 if value.count("_") > 1: 

2002 die(f"Invalid {input_text}{key}: Must not contain multiple underscore characters: '{value}'") 

2003 elif key == "infix": 

2004 if value: 

2005 if not value.endswith("_"): 

2006 die(f"Invalid {input_text}{key}: Must end with an underscore character: '{value}'") 

2007 if value.count("_") > 1: 

2008 die(f"Invalid {input_text}{key}: Must not contain multiple underscore characters: '{value}'") 

2009 elif value: 

2010 if not value.startswith("_"): 

2011 die(f"Invalid {input_text}{key}: Must start with an underscore character: '{value}'") 

2012 if value.count("_") > 1: 

2013 die(f"Invalid {input_text}{key}: Must not contain multiple underscore characters: '{value}'") 

2014 

2015 

2016############################################################################# 

2017class SnapshotPeriods: # thread-safe 

2018 def __init__(self) -> None: 

2019 # immutable variables: 

2020 self.suffix_milliseconds: Final = { 

2021 "yearly": 365 * 86400 * 1000, 

2022 "monthly": round(30.5 * 86400 * 1000), 

2023 "weekly": 7 * 86400 * 1000, 

2024 "daily": 86400 * 1000, 

2025 "hourly": 60 * 60 * 1000, 

2026 "minutely": 60 * 1000, 

2027 "secondly": 1000, 

2028 "millisecondly": 1, 

2029 } 

2030 self.period_labels: Final = { 

2031 "yearly": "years", 

2032 "monthly": "months", 

2033 "weekly": "weeks", 

2034 "daily": "days", 

2035 "hourly": "hours", 

2036 "minutely": "minutes", 

2037 "secondly": "seconds", 

2038 "millisecondly": "milliseconds", 

2039 } 

2040 self._suffix_regex0: Final = re.compile(rf"([1-9][0-9]*)?({'|'.join(self.suffix_milliseconds.keys())})") 

2041 self._suffix_regex1: Final = re.compile("_" + self._suffix_regex0.pattern) 

2042 

2043 def suffix_to_duration0(self, suffix: str) -> Tuple[int, str]: 

2044 return self._suffix_to_duration(suffix, self._suffix_regex0) 

2045 

2046 def suffix_to_duration1(self, suffix: str) -> Tuple[int, str]: 

2047 return self._suffix_to_duration(suffix, self._suffix_regex1) 

2048 

2049 @staticmethod 

2050 def _suffix_to_duration(suffix: str, regex: re.Pattern) -> Tuple[int, str]: 

2051 """Ex: Converts "2 hourly" to (2, "hourly") and "hourly" to (1, "hourly"), i.e. perform some action every N hours.""" 

2052 if match := regex.fullmatch(suffix): 

2053 duration_amount = int(match.group(1)) if match.group(1) else 1 

2054 assert duration_amount > 0 

2055 duration_unit = match.group(2) 

2056 return duration_amount, duration_unit 

2057 else: 

2058 return 0, "" 

2059 

2060 def label_milliseconds(self, snapshot: str) -> int: 

2061 i = snapshot.rfind("_") 

2062 snapshot = "" if i < 0 else snapshot[i + 1 :] 

2063 duration_amount, duration_unit = self._suffix_to_duration(snapshot, self._suffix_regex0) 

2064 return duration_amount * self.suffix_milliseconds.get(duration_unit, 0) 

2065 

2066 

2067############################################################################# 

2068class CreateSrcSnapshotConfig: 

2069 def __init__(self, args: argparse.Namespace, p: Params) -> None: 

2070 """Option values for --create-src-snapshots*; reads from ArgumentParser via args.""" 

2071 # immutable variables: 

2072 self.skip_create_src_snapshots: bool = not args.create_src_snapshots 

2073 self.create_src_snapshots_even_if_not_due: bool = args.create_src_snapshots_even_if_not_due 

2074 tz_spec: Optional[str] = args.create_src_snapshots_timezone if args.create_src_snapshots_timezone else None 

2075 self.tz: Optional[tzinfo] = get_timezone(tz_spec) 

2076 self.current_datetime: datetime = current_datetime(tz_spec) 

2077 self.timeformat: str = args.create_src_snapshots_timeformat 

2078 self.anchors: PeriodAnchors = PeriodAnchors.parse(args) 

2079 

2080 # Compute the schedule for upcoming periodic time events (suffix_durations). This event schedule is also used in 

2081 # daemon mode via sleep_until_next_daemon_iteration() 

2082 suffixes: List[str] = [] 

2083 labels = [] 

2084 create_src_snapshots_plan = args.create_src_snapshots_plan or str({"bzfs": {"onsite": {"adhoc": 1}}}) 

2085 for org, target_periods in ast.literal_eval(create_src_snapshots_plan).items(): 

2086 for target, periods in target_periods.items(): 

2087 for period_unit, period_amount in periods.items(): # e.g. period_unit can be "10minutely" or "minutely" 

2088 if not isinstance(period_amount, int) or period_amount < 0: 

2089 die(f"--create-src-snapshots-plan: Period amount must be a non-negative integer: {period_amount}") 

2090 if period_amount > 0: 

2091 suffix = nsuffix(period_unit) 

2092 suffixes.append(suffix) 

2093 labels.append(SnapshotLabel(prefix=nprefix(org), infix=ninfix(target), timestamp="", suffix=suffix)) 

2094 xperiods: SnapshotPeriods = p.xperiods 

2095 if self.skip_create_src_snapshots: 

2096 duration_amount, duration_unit = p.xperiods.suffix_to_duration0(p.daemon_frequency) 

2097 if duration_amount <= 0 or not duration_unit: 

2098 die(f"Invalid --daemon-frequency: {p.daemon_frequency}") 

2099 suffixes = [nsuffix(p.daemon_frequency)] 

2100 labels = [] 

2101 suffix_durations = {suffix: xperiods.suffix_to_duration1(suffix) for suffix in suffixes} 

2102 

2103 def suffix_key(suffix: str) -> Tuple[int, str]: 

2104 duration_amount, duration_unit = suffix_durations[suffix] 

2105 duration_milliseconds = duration_amount * xperiods.suffix_milliseconds.get(duration_unit, 0) 

2106 if suffix.endswith("hourly") or suffix.endswith("minutely") or suffix.endswith("secondly"): 

2107 if duration_milliseconds != 0 and 86400 * 1000 % duration_milliseconds != 0: 

2108 die( 

2109 "Invalid --create-src-snapshots-plan: Period duration should be a divisor of 86400 seconds " 

2110 f"without remainder so that snapshots will be created at the same time of day every day: {suffix}" 

2111 ) 

2112 if suffix.endswith("monthly"): 

2113 if duration_amount != 0 and 12 % duration_amount != 0: 

2114 die( 

2115 "Invalid --create-src-snapshots-plan: Period duration should be a divisor of 12 months " 

2116 f"without remainder so that snapshots will be created at the same time every year: {suffix}" 

2117 ) 

2118 return duration_milliseconds, suffix 

2119 

2120 suffixes = sorted(suffixes, key=suffix_key, reverse=True) # take snapshots for dailies before hourlies, and so on 

2121 self.suffix_durations: Dict[str, Tuple[int, str]] = {suffix: suffix_durations[suffix] for suffix in suffixes} # sort 

2122 suffix_indexes = {suffix: k for k, suffix in enumerate(suffixes)} 

2123 labels.sort(key=lambda label: (suffix_indexes[label.suffix], label)) # take snapshots for dailies before hourlies 

2124 self._snapshot_labels: List[SnapshotLabel] = labels 

2125 for label in self.snapshot_labels(): 

2126 label.validate_label("--create-src-snapshots-plan ") 

2127 

2128 def snapshot_labels(self) -> List[SnapshotLabel]: 

2129 """Returns the snapshot name patterns for which snapshots shall be created.""" 

2130 timeformat = self.timeformat 

2131 is_millis = timeformat.endswith("%F") # non-standard hack to append milliseconds 

2132 if is_millis: 

2133 timeformat = timeformat[0:-1] + "f" # replace %F with %f (append microseconds) 

2134 timestamp: str = self.current_datetime.strftime(timeformat) 

2135 if is_millis: 

2136 timestamp = timestamp[0 : -len("000")] # replace microseconds with milliseconds 

2137 timestamp = timestamp.replace("+", "z") # zfs CLI does not accept the '+' character in snapshot names 

2138 return [SnapshotLabel(label.prefix, label.infix, timestamp, label.suffix) for label in self._snapshot_labels] 

2139 

2140 def __repr__(self) -> str: 

2141 return str(self.__dict__) 

2142 

2143 

2144############################################################################# 

2145@dataclass(frozen=True) 

2146class AlertConfig: 

2147 kind: Literal["Latest", "Oldest"] 

2148 warning_millis: int 

2149 critical_millis: int 

2150 

2151 

2152############################################################################# 

2153@dataclass(frozen=True) 

2154class MonitorSnapshotAlert: 

2155 label: SnapshotLabel 

2156 latest: Optional[AlertConfig] 

2157 oldest: Optional[AlertConfig] 

2158 

2159 

2160############################################################################# 

2161class MonitorSnapshotsConfig: 

2162 def __init__(self, args: argparse.Namespace, p: Params) -> None: 

2163 """Option values for --monitor-snapshots*; reads from ArgumentParser via args.""" 

2164 # immutable variables: 

2165 self.monitor_snapshots: Dict = ast.literal_eval(args.monitor_snapshots) 

2166 self.dont_warn: bool = args.monitor_snapshots_dont_warn 

2167 self.dont_crit: bool = args.monitor_snapshots_dont_crit 

2168 self.no_latest_check: bool = args.monitor_snapshots_no_latest_check 

2169 self.no_oldest_check: bool = args.monitor_snapshots_no_oldest_check 

2170 alerts = [] 

2171 xperiods: SnapshotPeriods = p.xperiods 

2172 for org, target_periods in self.monitor_snapshots.items(): 

2173 prefix = nprefix(org) 

2174 for target, periods in target_periods.items(): 

2175 for period_unit, alert_dicts in periods.items(): # e.g. period_unit can be "10minutely" or "minutely" 

2176 label = SnapshotLabel(prefix=prefix, infix=ninfix(target), timestamp="", suffix=nsuffix(period_unit)) 

2177 alert_latest, alert_oldest = None, None 

2178 for alert_type, alert_dict in alert_dicts.items(): 

2179 m = "--monitor-snapshots: " 

2180 if alert_type not in ["latest", "oldest"]: 

2181 die(f"{m}'{alert_type}' must be 'latest' or 'oldest' within {args.monitor_snapshots}") 

2182 warning_millis: int = 0 

2183 critical_millis: int = 0 

2184 cycles: int = 1 

2185 for kind, value in alert_dict.items(): 

2186 context = args.monitor_snapshots 

2187 if kind == "warning": 

2188 warning_millis = max(0, parse_duration_to_milliseconds(str(value), context=context)) 

2189 elif kind == "critical": 

2190 critical_millis = max(0, parse_duration_to_milliseconds(str(value), context=context)) 

2191 elif kind == "cycles": 

2192 cycles = max(0, int(value)) 

2193 else: 

2194 die(f"{m}'{kind}' must be 'warning', 'critical' or 'cycles' within {context}") 

2195 if warning_millis > 0 or critical_millis > 0: 

2196 duration_amount, duration_unit = xperiods.suffix_to_duration1(label.suffix) 

2197 duration_milliseconds = duration_amount * xperiods.suffix_milliseconds.get(duration_unit, 0) 

2198 warning_millis += 0 if warning_millis <= 0 else cycles * duration_milliseconds 

2199 critical_millis += 0 if critical_millis <= 0 else cycles * duration_milliseconds 

2200 warning_millis = unixtime_infinity_secs if warning_millis <= 0 else warning_millis 

2201 critical_millis = unixtime_infinity_secs if critical_millis <= 0 else critical_millis 

2202 capitalized_alert_type = cast(Literal["Latest", "Oldest"], sys.intern(alert_type.capitalize())) 

2203 alert_config = AlertConfig(capitalized_alert_type, warning_millis, critical_millis) 

2204 if alert_type == "latest": 

2205 if not self.no_latest_check: 

2206 alert_latest = alert_config 

2207 else: 

2208 assert alert_type == "oldest" 

2209 if not self.no_oldest_check: 

2210 alert_oldest = alert_config 

2211 if alert_latest is not None or alert_oldest is not None: 

2212 alerts.append(MonitorSnapshotAlert(label, alert_latest, alert_oldest)) 

2213 

2214 def alert_sort_key(alert: MonitorSnapshotAlert) -> Tuple[int, SnapshotLabel]: 

2215 duration_amount, duration_unit = xperiods.suffix_to_duration1(alert.label.suffix) 

2216 duration_milliseconds = duration_amount * xperiods.suffix_milliseconds.get(duration_unit, 0) 

2217 return duration_milliseconds, alert.label 

2218 

2219 alerts.sort(key=alert_sort_key, reverse=True) # check snapshots for dailies before hourlies, and so on 

2220 self.alerts: List[MonitorSnapshotAlert] = alerts 

2221 self.enable_monitor_snapshots: bool = len(alerts) > 0 

2222 

2223 def __repr__(self) -> str: 

2224 return str(self.__dict__) 

2225 

2226 

2227############################################################################# 

2228@dataclass(frozen=True) 

2229class RemoteConfCacheItem: 

2230 connection_pools: "ConnectionPools" 

2231 available_programs: Dict[str, str] 

2232 zpool_features: Dict[str, str] 

2233 timestamp_nanos: int = field(default_factory=time.monotonic_ns) 

2234 

2235 

2236############################################################################# 

2237def main() -> None: 

2238 """API for command line clients.""" 

2239 try: 

2240 run_main(argument_parser().parse_args(), sys.argv) 

2241 except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e: 

2242 sys.exit(e.returncode) 

2243 

2244 

2245def run_main(args: argparse.Namespace, sys_argv: Optional[List[str]] = None, log: Optional[Logger] = None) -> None: 

2246 """API for Python clients; visible for testing; may become a public API eventually.""" 

2247 Job().run_main(args, sys_argv, log) 

2248 

2249 

2250############################################################################# 

2251class Job: 

2252 def __init__(self) -> None: 

2253 self.params: Params 

2254 self.all_dst_dataset_exists: Dict[str, Dict[str, bool]] = defaultdict(lambda: defaultdict(bool)) 

2255 self.dst_dataset_exists: SynchronizedDict[str, bool] = SynchronizedDict({}) 

2256 self.src_properties: Dict[str, Dict[str, Union[str, int]]] = {} 

2257 self.dst_properties: Dict[str, Dict[str, Union[str, int]]] = {} 

2258 self.all_exceptions: List[str] = [] 

2259 self.all_exceptions_count = 0 

2260 self.max_exceptions_to_summarize = 10000 

2261 self.first_exception: Optional[BaseException] = None 

2262 self.remote_conf_cache: Dict[Tuple, RemoteConfCacheItem] = {} 

2263 self.dedicated_tcp_connection_per_zfs_send: bool = True 

2264 self.max_datasets_per_minibatch_on_list_snaps: Dict[str, int] = {} 

2265 self.max_workers: Dict[str, int] = {} 

2266 self.re_suffix = r"(?:/.*)?" # also match descendants of a matching dataset 

2267 self.stats_lock = threading.Lock() 

2268 self.num_cache_hits: int = 0 

2269 self.num_cache_misses: int = 0 

2270 self.num_snapshots_found: int = 0 

2271 self.num_snapshots_replicated: int = 0 

2272 self.control_persist_secs: int = 90 

2273 self.control_persist_margin_secs: int = 2 

2274 self.progress_reporter: ProgressReporter = cast(ProgressReporter, None) 

2275 self.is_first_replication_task: SynchronizedBool = SynchronizedBool(True) 

2276 self.replication_start_time_nanos: int = time.monotonic_ns() 

2277 self.timeout_nanos: Optional[int] = None 

2278 

2279 self.is_test_mode: bool = False # for testing only 

2280 self.creation_prefix = "" # for testing only 

2281 self.isatty: Optional[bool] = None # for testing only 

2282 self.use_select: bool = False # for testing only 

2283 self.progress_update_intervals: Optional[Tuple[float, float]] = None # for testing only 

2284 self.error_injection_triggers: Dict[str, Counter] = {} # for testing only 

2285 self.delete_injection_triggers: Dict[str, Counter] = {} # for testing only 

2286 self.param_injection_triggers: Dict[str, Dict[str, bool]] = {} # for testing only 

2287 self.inject_params: Dict[str, bool] = {} # for testing only 

2288 self.injection_lock = threading.Lock() # for testing only 

2289 self.max_command_line_bytes: Optional[int] = None # for testing only 

2290 

2291 def shutdown(self) -> None: 

2292 """Exit any multiplexed ssh sessions that may be leftover.""" 

2293 cache_items = self.remote_conf_cache.values() 

2294 for i, cache_item in enumerate(cache_items): 2294 ↛ 2295line 2294 didn't jump to line 2295 because the loop on line 2294 never started

2295 cache_item.connection_pools.shutdown(f"{i + 1}/{len(cache_items)}") 

2296 

2297 def terminate(self, old_term_handler: Any, except_current_process: bool = False) -> None: 

2298 def post_shutdown() -> None: 

2299 signal.signal(signal.SIGTERM, old_term_handler) # restore original signal handler 

2300 terminate_process_subtree(except_current_process=except_current_process) 

2301 

2302 with xfinally(post_shutdown): 

2303 self.shutdown() 

2304 

2305 def run_main(self, args: argparse.Namespace, sys_argv: Optional[List[str]] = None, log: Optional[Logger] = None) -> None: 

2306 assert isinstance(self.error_injection_triggers, dict) 

2307 assert isinstance(self.delete_injection_triggers, dict) 

2308 assert isinstance(self.inject_params, dict) 

2309 with xfinally(reset_logger): # runs reset_logger() on exit, without masking exception raised in body of `with` block 

2310 try: 

2311 log_params = LogParams(args) 

2312 log = get_logger(log_params, args, log) 

2313 log.info("%s", f"Log file is: {log_params.log_file}") 

2314 except BaseException as e: 

2315 get_simple_logger(__name__).error("Log init: %s", e, exc_info=False if isinstance(e, SystemExit) else True) 

2316 raise e 

2317 

2318 aux_args: List[str] = [] 

2319 if getattr(args, "include_snapshot_plan", None): 2319 ↛ 2320line 2319 didn't jump to line 2320 because the condition on line 2319 was never true

2320 aux_args += args.include_snapshot_plan 

2321 if getattr(args, "delete_dst_snapshots_except_plan", None): 2321 ↛ 2322line 2321 didn't jump to line 2322 because the condition on line 2321 was never true

2322 aux_args += args.delete_dst_snapshots_except_plan 

2323 if len(aux_args) > 0: 2323 ↛ 2324line 2323 didn't jump to line 2324 because the condition on line 2323 was never true

2324 log.info("Auxiliary CLI arguments: %s", " ".join(aux_args)) 

2325 args = argument_parser().parse_args(xappend(aux_args, "--", args.root_dataset_pairs), namespace=args) 

2326 

2327 def log_error_on_exit(error: Any, status_code: Any, exc_info: bool = False) -> None: 

2328 log.error("%s%s", f"Exiting {prog_name} with status code {status_code}. Cause: ", error, exc_info=exc_info) 

2329 

2330 try: 

2331 log.info("CLI arguments: %s %s", " ".join(sys_argv or []), f"[euid: {os.geteuid()}]") 

2332 if self.is_test_mode: 2332 ↛ 2333line 2332 didn't jump to line 2333 because the condition on line 2332 was never true

2333 log.log(log_trace, "Parsed CLI arguments: %s", args) 

2334 self.params = p = Params(args, sys_argv, log_params, log, self.inject_params) 

2335 log_params.params = p 

2336 with open_nofollow(log_params.log_file, "a", encoding="utf-8", perm=FILE_PERMISSIONS) as log_file_fd: 

2337 with contextlib.redirect_stderr(cast(IO, Tee(log_file_fd, sys.stderr))): # stderr to logfile+stderr 

2338 lock_file = p.lock_file_name() 

2339 lock_fd = os.open(lock_file, os.O_WRONLY | os.O_TRUNC | os.O_CREAT | os.O_NOFOLLOW, FILE_PERMISSIONS) 

2340 with xfinally(lambda: os.close(lock_fd)): 

2341 try: 

2342 # Acquire an exclusive lock; will raise an error if lock is already held by another process. 

2343 # The (advisory) lock is auto-released when the process terminates or the fd is closed. 

2344 fcntl.flock(lock_fd, fcntl.LOCK_EX | fcntl.LOCK_NB) # LOCK_NB ... non-blocking 

2345 except BlockingIOError: 

2346 msg = "Exiting as same previous periodic job is still running without completion yet per " 

2347 die(msg + lock_file, still_running_status) 

2348 with xfinally(lambda: Path(lock_file).unlink(missing_ok=True)): # don't accumulate stale files 

2349 # On CTRL-C and SIGTERM, send signal to descendant processes to also terminate descendants 

2350 old_term_handler = signal.getsignal(signal.SIGTERM) 

2351 signal.signal(signal.SIGTERM, lambda sig, f: self.terminate(old_term_handler)) 

2352 old_int_handler = signal.signal(signal.SIGINT, lambda s, f: self.terminate(old_term_handler)) 

2353 try: 

2354 self.run_tasks() 

2355 except BaseException as e: 

2356 self.terminate(old_term_handler, except_current_process=True) 

2357 raise e 

2358 finally: 

2359 signal.signal(signal.SIGTERM, old_term_handler) # restore original signal handler 

2360 signal.signal(signal.SIGINT, old_int_handler) # restore original signal handler 

2361 for _ in range(2 if self.max_command_line_bytes else 1): 

2362 self.shutdown() 

2363 print("", end="", file=sys.stderr) 

2364 sys.stderr.flush() 

2365 except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e: 

2366 log_error_on_exit(e, e.returncode) 

2367 raise e 

2368 except SystemExit as e: 

2369 log_error_on_exit(e, e.code) 

2370 raise e 

2371 except (subprocess.TimeoutExpired, UnicodeDecodeError) as e: 

2372 log_error_on_exit(e, die_status) 

2373 raise SystemExit(die_status) from e 

2374 except re.error as e: 

2375 log_error_on_exit(f"{e} within regex {e.pattern!r}", die_status) 

2376 raise SystemExit(die_status) from e 

2377 except BaseException as e: 

2378 log_error_on_exit(e, die_status, exc_info=True)
