2379 raise SystemExit(die_status) from e 

2380 finally: 

2381 log.info("%s", f"Log file was: {log_params.log_file}") 

2382 log.info("Success. Goodbye!") 

2383 sys.stderr.flush() 

2384 

2385 def run_tasks(self) -> None: 

2386 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

2387 self.all_exceptions = [] 

2388 self.all_exceptions_count = 0 

2389 self.first_exception = None 

2390 self.remote_conf_cache = {} 

2391 self.isatty = self.isatty if self.isatty is not None else p.isatty 

2392 self.validate_once() 

2393 self.replication_start_time_nanos = time.monotonic_ns() 

2394 self.progress_reporter = ProgressReporter(p, self.use_select, self.progress_update_intervals) 

2395 with xfinally(lambda: self.progress_reporter.stop()): 

2396 daemon_stoptime_nanos = time.monotonic_ns() + p.daemon_lifetime_nanos 

2397 while True: # loop for daemon mode 

2398 self.timeout_nanos = None if p.timeout_nanos is None else time.monotonic_ns() + p.timeout_nanos 

2399 self.all_dst_dataset_exists.clear() 

2400 self.progress_reporter.reset() 

2401 src, dst = p.src, p.dst 

2402 for src_root_dataset, dst_root_dataset in p.root_dataset_pairs: 

2403 src.root_dataset = src.basis_root_dataset = src_root_dataset 

2404 dst.root_dataset = dst.basis_root_dataset = dst_root_dataset 

2405 p.curr_zfs_send_program_opts = p.zfs_send_program_opts.copy() 

2406 if p.daemon_lifetime_nanos > 0: 

2407 self.timeout_nanos = None if p.timeout_nanos is None else time.monotonic_ns() + p.timeout_nanos 

2408 recurs_sep = " " if p.recursive_flag else "" 

2409 task_description = f"{src.basis_root_dataset} {p.recursive_flag}{recurs_sep}--> {dst.basis_root_dataset}" 

2410 if len(p.root_dataset_pairs) > 1: 

2411 log.info("Starting task: %s", task_description + " ...") 

2412 try: 

2413 try: 

2414 self.maybe_inject_error(cmd=[], error_trigger="retryable_run_tasks") 

2415 self.timeout() 

2416 self.validate_task() 

2417 self.run_task() 

2418 except RetryableError as retryable_error: 

2419 assert retryable_error.__cause__ is not None 

2420 raise retryable_error.__cause__ from None 

2421 except (CalledProcessError, subprocess.TimeoutExpired, SystemExit, UnicodeDecodeError) as e: 

2422 if p.skip_on_error == "fail" or ( 

2423 isinstance(e, subprocess.TimeoutExpired) and p.daemon_lifetime_nanos == 0 

2424 ): 

2425 raise e 

2426 log.error("%s", e) 

2427 self.append_exception(e, "task", task_description) 

2428 if not self.sleep_until_next_daemon_iteration(daemon_stoptime_nanos): 

2429 break 

2430 if not p.skip_replication: 

2431 self.print_replication_stats(self.replication_start_time_nanos) 

2432 error_count = self.all_exceptions_count 

2433 if error_count > 0 and p.daemon_lifetime_nanos == 0: 

2434 msgs = "\n".join([f"{i + 1}/{error_count}: {e}" for i, e in enumerate(self.all_exceptions)]) 

2435 log.error("%s", f"Tolerated {error_count} errors. Error Summary: \n{msgs}") 

2436 assert self.first_exception is not None 

2437 raise self.first_exception 

2438 

2439 def append_exception(self, e: BaseException, task_name: str, task_description: str) -> None: 

2440 self.first_exception = self.first_exception or e 

2441 if len(self.all_exceptions) < self.max_exceptions_to_summarize: # cap max memory consumption 2441 ↛ 2443line 2441 didn't jump to line 2443 because the condition on line 2441 was always true

2442 self.all_exceptions.append(str(e)) 

2443 self.all_exceptions_count += 1 

2444 self.params.log.error(f"#{self.all_exceptions_count}: Done with %s: %s", task_name, task_description) 

2445 

2446 def sleep_until_next_daemon_iteration(self, daemon_stoptime_nanos: int) -> bool: 

2447 sleep_nanos = daemon_stoptime_nanos - time.monotonic_ns() 

2448 if sleep_nanos <= 0: 

2449 return False 

2450 self.progress_reporter.pause() 

2451 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

2452 config = p.create_src_snapshots_config 

2453 curr_datetime = config.current_datetime + timedelta(microseconds=1) 

2454 next_snapshotting_event_dt = min( 

2455 ( 

2456 round_datetime_up_to_duration_multiple(curr_datetime, duration_amount, duration_unit, config.anchors) 

2457 for duration_amount, duration_unit in config.suffix_durations.values() 

2458 ), 

2459 default=curr_datetime + timedelta(days=10 * 365), # infinity 

2460 ) 

2461 offset: timedelta = next_snapshotting_event_dt - datetime.now(config.tz) 

2462 offset_nanos = (offset.days * 86400 + offset.seconds) * 1_000_000_000 + offset.microseconds * 1_000 

2463 sleep_nanos = min(sleep_nanos, max(0, offset_nanos)) 

2464 log.info("Daemon sleeping for: %s%s", human_readable_duration(sleep_nanos), f" ... [Log {p.log_params.log_file}]") 

2465 time.sleep(sleep_nanos / 1_000_000_000) 

2466 config.current_datetime = datetime.now(config.tz) 

2467 return daemon_stoptime_nanos - time.monotonic_ns() > 0 

2468 

2469 def print_replication_stats(self, start_time_nanos: int) -> None: 

2470 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

2471 elapsed_nanos = time.monotonic_ns() - start_time_nanos 

2472 msg = p.dry(f"Replicated {self.num_snapshots_replicated} snapshots in {human_readable_duration(elapsed_nanos)}.") 

2473 if self.is_program_available("pv", "local"): 

2474 sent_bytes = count_num_bytes_transferred_by_zfs_send(p.log_params.pv_log_file) 

2475 sent_bytes_per_sec = round(1_000_000_000 * sent_bytes / elapsed_nanos) 

2476 msg += f" zfs sent {human_readable_bytes(sent_bytes)} [{human_readable_bytes(sent_bytes_per_sec)}/s]." 

2477 log.info("%s", msg.ljust(p.terminal_columns - len("2024-01-01 23:58:45 [I] "))) 

2478 

2479 def validate_once(self) -> None: 

2480 p = self.params 

2481 p.zfs_recv_ox_names = self.recv_option_property_names(p.zfs_recv_program_opts) 

2482 for snapshot_filter in p.snapshot_filters: 

2483 for _filter in snapshot_filter: 2483 ↛ 2484line 2483 didn't jump to line 2484 because the loop on line 2483 never started

2484 if _filter.name == snapshot_regex_filter_name: 

2485 exclude_snapshot_regexes = compile_regexes(_filter.options[0]) 

2486 include_snapshot_regexes = compile_regexes(_filter.options[1] or [".*"]) 

2487 _filter.options = (exclude_snapshot_regexes, include_snapshot_regexes) 

2488 

2489 exclude_regexes = [exclude_dataset_regexes_default] 

2490 if len(p.args.exclude_dataset_regex) > 0: # some patterns don't exclude anything 2490 ↛ 2491line 2490 didn't jump to line 2491 because the condition on line 2490 was never true

2491 exclude_regexes = [regex for regex in p.args.exclude_dataset_regex if regex != "" and regex != "!.*"] 

2492 include_regexes = p.args.include_dataset_regex 

2493 

2494 # relative datasets need not be compiled more than once as they don't change between tasks 

2495 def separate_abs_vs_rel_datasets(datasets: List[str]) -> Tuple[List[str], List[str]]: 

2496 abs_datasets: List[str] = [] 

2497 rel_datasets: List[str] = [] 

2498 for dataset in datasets: 2498 ↛ 2499line 2498 didn't jump to line 2499 because the loop on line 2498 never started

2499 (abs_datasets if dataset.startswith("/") else rel_datasets).append(dataset) 

2500 return abs_datasets, rel_datasets 

2501 

2502 p.abs_exclude_datasets, rel_exclude_datasets = separate_abs_vs_rel_datasets(p.args.exclude_dataset) 

2503 p.abs_include_datasets, rel_include_datasets = separate_abs_vs_rel_datasets(p.args.include_dataset) 

2504 p.tmp_exclude_dataset_regexes, p.tmp_include_dataset_regexes = ( 

2505 compile_regexes(exclude_regexes + self.dataset_regexes(rel_exclude_datasets), suffix=self.re_suffix), 

2506 compile_regexes(include_regexes + self.dataset_regexes(rel_include_datasets), suffix=self.re_suffix), 

2507 ) 

2508 

2509 if p.pv_program != disable_prg: 2509 ↛ 2518line 2509 didn't jump to line 2518 because the condition on line 2509 was always true

2510 pv_program_opts_set = set(p.pv_program_opts) 

2511 if pv_program_opts_set.isdisjoint({"--bytes", "-b", "--bits", "-8"}): 2511 ↛ 2512line 2511 didn't jump to line 2512 because the condition on line 2511 was never true

2512 die("--pv-program-opts must contain one of --bytes or --bits for progress metrics to function.") 

2513 if self.isatty and not p.quiet: 2513 ↛ 2518line 2513 didn't jump to line 2518 because the condition on line 2513 was always true

2514 for opts in [["--eta", "-e"], ["--fineta", "-I"], ["--average-rate", "-a"]]: 

2515 if pv_program_opts_set.isdisjoint(opts): 2515 ↛ 2516line 2515 didn't jump to line 2516 because the condition on line 2515 was never true

2516 die(f"--pv-program-opts must contain one of {', '.join(opts)} for progress report line to function.") 

2517 

2518 src, dst = p.src, p.dst 

2519 for remote in [src, dst]: 

2520 r, loc = remote, remote.location 

2521 validate_user_name(r.basis_ssh_user, f"--ssh-{loc}-user") 

2522 validate_host_name(r.basis_ssh_host, f"--ssh-{loc}-host") 

2523 validate_port(r.ssh_port, f"--ssh-{loc}-port ") 

2524 

2525 def validate_task(self) -> None: 

2526 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

2527 src, dst = p.src, p.dst 

2528 for remote in [src, dst]: 

2529 r = remote 

2530 r.ssh_user, r.ssh_host, r.ssh_user_host, r.pool, r.root_dataset = parse_dataset_locator( 

2531 r.basis_root_dataset, user=r.basis_ssh_user, host=r.basis_ssh_host, port=r.ssh_port 

2532 ) 

2533 r.sudo, r.use_zfs_delegation = self.sudo_cmd(r.ssh_user_host, r.ssh_user) 

2534 local_addrs = ("",) if self.is_test_mode else ("", "127.0.0.1", "::1") # ::1 is IPv6 version of loopback address 

2535 remote.is_nonlocal = r.ssh_host not in local_addrs 

2536 self.dst_dataset_exists = SynchronizedDict(self.all_dst_dataset_exists[dst.ssh_user_host]) 

2537 

2538 if src.ssh_host == dst.ssh_host: 

2539 msg = f"src: {src.basis_root_dataset}, dst: {dst.basis_root_dataset}" 

2540 if src.root_dataset == dst.root_dataset: 

2541 die(f"Source and destination dataset must not be the same! {msg}") 

2542 if p.recursive and ( 

2543 is_descendant(src.root_dataset, of_root_dataset=dst.root_dataset) 

2544 or is_descendant(dst.root_dataset, of_root_dataset=src.root_dataset) 

2545 ): 

2546 die(f"Source and destination dataset trees must not overlap! {msg}") 

2547 

2548 suffix = self.re_suffix # also match descendants of a matching dataset 

2549 p.exclude_dataset_regexes, p.include_dataset_regexes = ( 

2550 p.tmp_exclude_dataset_regexes + compile_regexes(self.dataset_regexes(p.abs_exclude_datasets), suffix=suffix), 

2551 p.tmp_include_dataset_regexes + compile_regexes(self.dataset_regexes(p.abs_include_datasets), suffix=suffix), 

2552 ) 

2553 if len(p.include_dataset_regexes) == 0: 

2554 p.include_dataset_regexes = [(re.compile(".*"), False)] 

2555 

2556 self.detect_available_programs() 

2557 

2558 zfs_send_program_opts = p.curr_zfs_send_program_opts 

2559 if self.is_zpool_feature_enabled_or_active(dst, "feature@large_blocks"): 

2560 append_if_absent(zfs_send_program_opts, "--large-block") # solaris-11.4 does not have this feature 

2561 if self.is_solaris_zfs(dst): 

2562 p.dry_run_destroy = "" # solaris-11.4 knows no 'zfs destroy -n' flag 

2563 p.verbose_destroy = "" # solaris-11.4 knows no 'zfs destroy -v' flag 

2564 if self.is_solaris_zfs(src): # solaris-11.4 only knows -w compress 

2565 zfs_send_program_opts = ["-p" if opt == "--props" else opt for opt in zfs_send_program_opts] 

2566 zfs_send_program_opts = fix_solaris_raw_mode(zfs_send_program_opts) 

2567 p.curr_zfs_send_program_opts = zfs_send_program_opts 

2568 

2569 self.max_workers = {} 

2570 self.max_datasets_per_minibatch_on_list_snaps = {} 

2571 for r in [src, dst]: 

2572 cpus = int(p.available_programs[r.location].get("getconf_cpu_count", 8)) 

2573 threads, is_percent = p.threads 

2574 cpus = max(1, round(cpus * threads / 100.0) if is_percent else round(threads)) 

2575 self.max_workers[r.location] = cpus 

2576 bs = max(1, p.max_datasets_per_batch_on_list_snaps) # 1024 by default 

2577 max_datasets_per_minibatch = p.max_datasets_per_minibatch_on_list_snaps 

2578 if max_datasets_per_minibatch <= 0: 

2579 max_datasets_per_minibatch = max(1, bs // cpus) 

2580 max_datasets_per_minibatch = min(bs, max_datasets_per_minibatch) 

2581 self.max_datasets_per_minibatch_on_list_snaps[r.location] = max_datasets_per_minibatch 

2582 log.log( 

2583 log_trace, 

2584 "%s", 

2585 f"max_datasets_per_batch_on_list_snaps: {p.max_datasets_per_batch_on_list_snaps}, " 

2586 f"max_datasets_per_minibatch_on_list_snaps: {max_datasets_per_minibatch}, " 

2587 f"max_workers: {self.max_workers[r.location]}, " 

2588 f"location: {r.location}", 

2589 ) 

2590 if self.is_test_mode: 

2591 log.log(log_trace, "Validated Param values: %s", pretty_print_formatter(self.params)) 

2592 

2593 def sudo_cmd(self, ssh_user_host: str, ssh_user: str) -> Tuple[str, bool]: 

2594 p = self.params 

2595 assert isinstance(ssh_user_host, str) 

2596 assert isinstance(ssh_user, str) 

2597 assert isinstance(p.sudo_program, str) 

2598 assert isinstance(p.enable_privilege_elevation, bool) 

2599 

2600 is_root = True 

2601 if ssh_user_host != "": 

2602 if ssh_user == "": 

2603 if os.geteuid() != 0: 

2604 is_root = False 

2605 elif ssh_user != "root": 

2606 is_root = False 

2607 elif os.geteuid() != 0: 

2608 is_root = False 

2609 

2610 if is_root: 

2611 sudo = "" # using sudo in an attempt to make ZFS operations work even if we are not root user? 

2612 use_zfs_delegation = False # or instead using 'zfs allow' delegation? 

2613 return sudo, use_zfs_delegation 

2614 elif p.enable_privilege_elevation: 

2615 if p.sudo_program == disable_prg: 

2616 die(f"sudo CLI is not available on host: {ssh_user_host or 'localhost'}") 

2617 # The '-n' option makes 'sudo' safer and more fail-fast. It avoids having sudo prompt the user for input of any 

2618 # kind. If a password is required for the sudo command to run, sudo will display an error message and exit. 

2619 return p.sudo_program + " -n", False 

2620 else: 

2621 return "", True 

2622 

2623 def run_task(self) -> None: 

2624 def filter_src_datasets() -> List[str]: # apply --{include|exclude}-dataset policy 

2625 return self.filter_datasets(src, basis_src_datasets) if src_datasets is None else src_datasets 

2626 

2627 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

2628 src, dst = p.src, p.dst 

2629 max_workers = min(self.max_workers[src.location], self.max_workers[dst.location]) 

2630 recursive_sep = " " if p.recursive_flag else "" 

2631 task_description = f"{src.basis_root_dataset} {p.recursive_flag}{recursive_sep}--> {dst.basis_root_dataset} ..." 

2632 failed = False 

2633 src_datasets = None 

2634 basis_src_datasets = [] 

2635 self.src_properties = {} 

2636 self.dst_properties = {} 

2637 if not self.is_dummy(src): # find src dataset or all datasets in src dataset tree (with --recursive) 

2638 is_caching = self.is_caching_snapshots(src) 

2639 props = "volblocksize,recordsize,name" 

2640 props = "snapshots_changed," + props if is_caching else props 

2641 cmd = p.split_args( 

2642 f"{p.zfs_program} list -t filesystem,volume -s name -Hp -o {props} {p.recursive_flag}", src.root_dataset 

2643 ) 

2644 for line in (self.try_ssh_command(src, log_debug, cmd=cmd) or "").splitlines(): 

2645 cols = line.split("\t") 

2646 snapshots_changed, volblocksize, recordsize, src_dataset = cols if is_caching else ["-"] + cols 

2647 self.src_properties[src_dataset] = { 

2648 "recordsize": int(recordsize) if recordsize != "-" else -int(volblocksize), 

2649 SNAPSHOTS_CHANGED: int(snapshots_changed) if snapshots_changed and snapshots_changed != "-" else 0, 

2650 } 

2651 basis_src_datasets.append(src_dataset) 

2652 assert not self.is_test_mode or basis_src_datasets == sorted(basis_src_datasets), "List is not sorted" 

2653 

2654 # Optionally, atomically create a new snapshot of the src datasets selected by --{include|exclude}-dataset* policy. 

2655 # The implementation attempts to fit as many datasets as possible into a single (atomic) 'zfs snapshot' command line, 

2656 # using lexicographical sort order, and using 'zfs snapshot -r' to the extent that this is compatible with the 

2657 # --{include|exclude}-dataset* pruning policy. The snapshots of all datasets that fit within the same single 

2658 # 'zfs snapshot' CLI invocation will be taken within the same ZFS transaction group, and correspondingly have 

2659 # identical 'createtxg' ZFS property (but not necessarily identical 'creation' ZFS time property as ZFS actually 

2660 # provides no such guarantee), and thus be consistent. Dataset names that can't fit into a single command line are 

2661 # spread over multiple command line invocations, respecting the limits that the operating system places on the 

2662 # maximum length of a single command line, per `getconf ARG_MAX`. 

2663 if not p.create_src_snapshots_config.skip_create_src_snapshots: 

2664 log.info(p.dry("--create-src-snapshots: %s"), f"{src.basis_root_dataset} {p.recursive_flag}{recursive_sep}...") 

2665 if len(basis_src_datasets) == 0: 

2666 die(f"Source dataset does not exist: {src.basis_root_dataset}") 

2667 src_datasets = filter_src_datasets() # apply include/exclude policy 

2668 datasets_to_snapshot: Dict[SnapshotLabel, List[str]] = self.find_datasets_to_snapshot(src_datasets) 

2669 datasets_to_snapshot = {label: datasets for label, datasets in datasets_to_snapshot.items() if len(datasets) > 0} 

2670 basis_datasets_to_snapshot = datasets_to_snapshot.copy() # shallow copy 

2671 commands = {} 

2672 for label, datasets in datasets_to_snapshot.items(): 

2673 cmd = p.split_args(f"{src.sudo} {p.zfs_program} snapshot") 

2674 if p.recursive: 

2675 # Run 'zfs snapshot -r' on the roots of subtrees if possible, else fallback to non-recursive CLI flavor 

2676 root_datasets = self.root_datasets_if_recursive_zfs_snapshot_is_possible(datasets, basis_src_datasets) 

2677 if root_datasets is not None: 

2678 cmd.append("-r") # recursive; takes a snapshot of all datasets in the subtree(s) 

2679 datasets_to_snapshot[label] = root_datasets 

2680 commands[label] = cmd 

2681 creation_msg = f"Creating {sum(len(datasets) for datasets in basis_datasets_to_snapshot.values())} snapshots" 

2682 log.info(p.dry("--create-src-snapshots: %s"), f"{creation_msg} within {len(src_datasets)} datasets ...") 

2683 # create snapshots in large (parallel) batches, without using a command line that's too big for the OS to handle 

2684 self.run_ssh_cmd_parallel( 

2685 src, 

2686 [(commands[lbl], [f"{ds}@{lbl}" for ds in datasets]) for lbl, datasets in datasets_to_snapshot.items()], 

2687 fn=lambda cmd, batch: self.run_ssh_command(src, is_dry=p.dry_run, print_stdout=True, cmd=cmd + batch), 

2688 max_batch_items=1 if self.is_solaris_zfs(src) else 2**29, # solaris CLI doesn't accept multiple datasets 

2689 ) 

2690 # perf: copy lastmodified time of source dataset into local cache to reduce future 'zfs list -t snapshot' calls 

2691 self.update_last_modified_cache(basis_datasets_to_snapshot) 

2692 

2693 # Optionally, replicate src.root_dataset (optionally including its descendants) to dst.root_dataset 

2694 if not p.skip_replication: 

2695 if len(basis_src_datasets) == 0: 

2696 die(f"Replication: Source dataset does not exist: {src.basis_root_dataset}") 

2697 if self.is_dummy(dst): 

2698 die("Replication: Destination may be a dummy dataset only if exclusively creating snapshots on the source!") 

2699 src_datasets = filter_src_datasets() # apply include/exclude policy 

2700 failed = self.replicate_datasets(src_datasets, task_description, max_workers) 

2701 

2702 if failed or not ( 

2703 p.delete_dst_datasets 

2704 or p.delete_dst_snapshots 

2705 or p.delete_empty_dst_datasets 

2706 or p.compare_snapshot_lists 

2707 or p.monitor_snapshots_config.enable_monitor_snapshots 

2708 ): 

2709 return 

2710 log.info("Listing dst datasets: %s", task_description) 

2711 if self.is_dummy(dst): 

2712 die("Destination may be a dummy dataset only if exclusively creating snapshots on the source!") 

2713 is_caching = self.is_caching_snapshots(dst) and p.monitor_snapshots_config.enable_monitor_snapshots 

2714 props = "name" 

2715 props = "snapshots_changed," + props if is_caching else props 

2716 cmd = p.split_args( 

2717 f"{p.zfs_program} list -t filesystem,volume -s name -Hp -o {props}", p.recursive_flag, dst.root_dataset 

2718 ) 

2719 basis_dst_datasets = [] 

2720 basis_dst_datasets_str = self.try_ssh_command(dst, log_trace, cmd=cmd) 

2721 if basis_dst_datasets_str is None: 

2722 log.warning("Destination dataset does not exist: %s", dst.root_dataset) 

2723 else: 

2724 for line in basis_dst_datasets_str.splitlines(): 

2725 cols = line.split("\t") 

2726 snapshots_changed, dst_dataset = cols if is_caching else ["-"] + cols 

2727 self.dst_properties[dst_dataset] = { 

2728 SNAPSHOTS_CHANGED: int(snapshots_changed) if snapshots_changed and snapshots_changed != "-" else 0, 

2729 } 

2730 basis_dst_datasets.append(dst_dataset) 

2731 

2732 assert not self.is_test_mode or basis_dst_datasets == sorted(basis_dst_datasets), "List is not sorted" 

2733 dst_datasets = self.filter_datasets(dst, basis_dst_datasets) # apply include/exclude policy 

2734 

2735 # Optionally, delete existing destination datasets that do not exist within the source dataset if they are 

2736 # included via --{include|exclude}-dataset* policy. Do not recurse without --recursive. With --recursive, 

2737 # never delete non-selected dataset subtrees or their ancestors. 

2738 if p.delete_dst_datasets and not failed: 

2739 log.info(p.dry("--delete-dst-datasets: %s"), task_description) 

2740 children = defaultdict(set) 

2741 for dst_dataset in basis_dst_datasets: # Compute the direct children of each NON-FILTERED dataset 

2742 parent = os.path.dirname(dst_dataset) 

2743 children[parent].add(dst_dataset) 

2744 to_delete: Set[str] = set() 

2745 for dst_dataset in reversed(dst_datasets): 

2746 if children[dst_dataset].issubset(to_delete): 

2747 to_delete.add(dst_dataset) # all children are deletable, thus the dataset itself is deletable too 

2748 to_delete = to_delete.difference( 

2749 {replace_prefix(src_dataset, src.root_dataset, dst.root_dataset) for src_dataset in basis_src_datasets} 

2750 ) 

2751 self.delete_datasets(dst, to_delete) 

2752 dst_datasets = sorted(set(dst_datasets).difference(to_delete)) 

2753 basis_dst_datasets = sorted(set(basis_dst_datasets).difference(to_delete)) 

2754 

2755 # Optionally, delete existing destination snapshots that do not exist within the source dataset if they 

2756 # are included by the --{include|exclude}-snapshot-* policy, and the destination dataset is included 

2757 # via --{include|exclude}-dataset* policy. 

2758 if p.delete_dst_snapshots and not failed: 

2759 log.info(p.dry("--delete-dst-snapshots: %s"), task_description + f" [{len(dst_datasets)} datasets]") 

2760 kind = "bookmark" if p.delete_dst_bookmarks else "snapshot" 

2761 filter_needs_creation_time = has_timerange_filter(p.snapshot_filters) 

2762 props = self.creation_prefix + "creation,guid,name" if filter_needs_creation_time else "guid,name" 

2763 basis_src_datasets_set = set(basis_src_datasets) 

2764 num_snapshots_found, num_snapshots_deleted = 0, 0 

2765 

2766 def delete_destination_snapshots(dst_dataset: str, tid: str, retry: Retry) -> bool: # thread-safe 

2767 src_dataset = replace_prefix(dst_dataset, old_prefix=dst.root_dataset, new_prefix=src.root_dataset) 

2768 if src_dataset in basis_src_datasets_set and (self.are_bookmarks_enabled(src) or not p.delete_dst_bookmarks): 

2769 src_kind = kind 

2770 if not p.delete_dst_snapshots_no_crosscheck: 

2771 src_kind = "snapshot,bookmark" if self.are_bookmarks_enabled(src) else "snapshot" 

2772 src_cmd = p.split_args(f"{p.zfs_program} list -t {src_kind} -d 1 -s name -Hp -o guid", src_dataset) 

2773 else: 

2774 src_cmd = None 

2775 dst_cmd = p.split_args(f"{p.zfs_program} list -t {kind} -d 1 -s createtxg -Hp -o {props}", dst_dataset) 

2776 self.maybe_inject_delete(dst, dataset=dst_dataset, delete_trigger="zfs_list_delete_dst_snapshots") 

2777 src_snaps_with_guids, dst_snaps_with_guids = self.run_in_parallel( # list src+dst snapshots in parallel 

2778 lambda: set(self.run_ssh_command(src, log_trace, cmd=src_cmd).splitlines() if src_cmd else []), 

2779 lambda: self.try_ssh_command(dst, log_trace, cmd=dst_cmd), 

2780 ) 

2781 if dst_snaps_with_guids is None: 

2782 log.warning("Third party deleted destination: %s", dst_dataset) 

2783 return False 

2784 dst_snaps_with_guids = dst_snaps_with_guids.splitlines() 

2785 num_dst_snaps_with_guids = len(dst_snaps_with_guids) 

2786 basis_dst_snaps_with_guids = dst_snaps_with_guids.copy() 

2787 if p.delete_dst_bookmarks: 

2788 replace_in_lines(dst_snaps_with_guids, old="#", new="@", count=1) # treat bookmarks as snapshots 

2789 # The check against the source dataset happens *after* filtering the dst snapshots with filter_snapshots(). 

2790 # `p.delete_dst_snapshots_except` means the user wants to specify snapshots to *retain* aka *keep* 

2791 all_except = p.delete_dst_snapshots_except 

2792 if p.delete_dst_snapshots_except and not self.is_dummy(src): 

2793 # However, as here we are in "except" mode AND the source is NOT a dummy, we first filter to get what 

2794 # the policy says to *keep* (so all_except=False for the filter_snapshots() call), then from that "keep" 

2795 # list, we later further refine by checking what's on the source dataset. 

2796 all_except = False 

2797 dst_snaps_with_guids = self.filter_snapshots(dst_snaps_with_guids, all_except=all_except) 

2798 if p.delete_dst_bookmarks: 

2799 replace_in_lines(dst_snaps_with_guids, old="@", new="#", count=1) # restore pre-filtering bookmark state 

2800 if filter_needs_creation_time: 

2801 dst_snaps_with_guids = cut(field=2, lines=dst_snaps_with_guids) 

2802 basis_dst_snaps_with_guids = cut(field=2, lines=basis_dst_snaps_with_guids) 

2803 if p.delete_dst_snapshots_except and not self.is_dummy(src): # Non-dummy Source + "Except" (Keep) Mode 

2804 # Retain dst snapshots that match snapshot filter policy AND are on src dataset, aka 

2805 # Delete dst snapshots except snapshots that match snapshot filter policy AND are on src dataset. 

2806 # Concretely, `dst_snaps_with_guids` contains GUIDs of DST snapshots that the filter policy says to KEEP. 

2807 # We only actually keep them if they are ALSO on the SRC. 

2808 # So, snapshots to DELETE (`dst_tags_to_delete`) are ALL snapshots on DST (`basis_dst_snaps_with_guids`) 

2809 # EXCEPT those whose GUIDs are in `dst_snaps_with_guids` AND ALSO in `src_snaps_with_guids`. 

2810 except_dst_guids = set(cut(field=1, lines=dst_snaps_with_guids)).intersection(src_snaps_with_guids) 

2811 dst_tags_to_delete = filter_lines_except(basis_dst_snaps_with_guids, except_dst_guids) 

2812 else: # Standard Delete Mode OR Dummy Source + "Except" (Keep) Mode 

2813 # In standard delete mode: 

2814 # `dst_snaps_with_guids` contains GUIDs of policy-selected snapshots on DST. 

2815 # We delete those that are NOT on SRC. 

2816 # `dst_tags_to_delete` = `dst_snaps_with_guids` - `src_snaps_with_guids`. 

2817 # In dummy source + "except" (keep) mode: 

2818 # `all_except` was True. 

2819 # `dst_snaps_with_guids` contains snaps NOT matching the "keep" policy -- these are the ones to delete. 

2820 # `src_snaps_with_guids` is empty. 

2821 # `dst_tags_to_delete` = `dst_snaps_with_guids` - {} = `dst_snaps_with_guids`. 

2822 dst_guids_to_delete = set(cut(field=1, lines=dst_snaps_with_guids)).difference(src_snaps_with_guids) 

2823 dst_tags_to_delete = filter_lines(dst_snaps_with_guids, dst_guids_to_delete) 

2824 separator = "#" if p.delete_dst_bookmarks else "@" 

2825 dst_tags_to_delete = cut(field=2, separator=separator, lines=dst_tags_to_delete) 

2826 if p.delete_dst_bookmarks: 

2827 self.delete_bookmarks(dst, dst_dataset, snapshot_tags=dst_tags_to_delete) 

2828 else: 

2829 self.delete_snapshots(dst, dst_dataset, snapshot_tags=dst_tags_to_delete) 

2830 with self.stats_lock: 

2831 nonlocal num_snapshots_found 

2832 num_snapshots_found += num_dst_snaps_with_guids 

2833 nonlocal num_snapshots_deleted 

2834 num_snapshots_deleted += len(dst_tags_to_delete) 

2835 if len(dst_tags_to_delete) > 0 and not p.delete_dst_bookmarks: 

2836 self.dst_properties[dst_dataset][SNAPSHOTS_CHANGED] = 0 # invalidate cache 

2837 return True 

2838 

2839 # Run delete_destination_snapshots(dataset) for each dataset, while handling errors, retries + parallel exec 

2840 if self.are_bookmarks_enabled(dst) or not p.delete_dst_bookmarks: 

2841 start_time_nanos = time.monotonic_ns() 

2842 failed = self.process_datasets_in_parallel_and_fault_tolerant( 

2843 dst_datasets, 

2844 process_dataset=delete_destination_snapshots, # lambda 

2845 skip_tree_on_error=lambda dataset: False, 

2846 max_workers=max_workers, 

2847 enable_barriers=False, 

2848 task_name="--delete-dst-snapshots", 

2849 ) 

2850 elapsed_nanos = time.monotonic_ns() - start_time_nanos 

2851 log.info( 

2852 p.dry("--delete-dst-snapshots: %s"), 

2853 task_description + f" [Deleted {num_snapshots_deleted} out of {num_snapshots_found} {kind}s " 

2854 f"within {len(dst_datasets)} datasets; took {human_readable_duration(elapsed_nanos)}]", 

2855 ) 

2856 

2857 # Optionally, delete any existing destination dataset that has no snapshot and no bookmark if all descendants 

2858 # of that dataset do not have a snapshot or bookmark either. To do so, we walk the dataset list (conceptually, 

2859 # a tree) depth-first (i.e. sorted descending). If a dst dataset has zero snapshots and zero bookmarks and all 

2860 # its children are already marked as orphans, then it is itself an orphan, and we mark it as such. Walking in 

2861 # a reverse sorted way means that we efficiently check for zero snapshots/bookmarks not just over the direct 

2862 # children but the entire tree. Finally, delete all orphan datasets in an efficient batched way. 

2863 if p.delete_empty_dst_datasets and p.recursive and not failed: 

2864 log.info(p.dry("--delete-empty-dst-datasets: %s"), task_description) 

2865 delete_empty_dst_datasets_if_no_bookmarks_and_no_snapshots = ( 

2866 p.delete_empty_dst_datasets_if_no_bookmarks_and_no_snapshots and self.are_bookmarks_enabled(dst) 

2867 ) 

2868 

2869 # Compute the direct children of each NON-FILTERED dataset. Thus, no non-selected dataset and no ancestor of a 

2870 # non-selected dataset will ever be added to the "orphan" set. In other words, this treats non-selected dataset 

2871 # subtrees as if they all had snapshots, so non-selected dataset subtrees and their ancestors are guaranteed 

2872 # to not get deleted. 

2873 children = defaultdict(set) 

2874 for dst_dataset in basis_dst_datasets: 

2875 parent = os.path.dirname(dst_dataset) 

2876 children[parent].add(dst_dataset) 

2877 

2878 # Find and mark orphan datasets, finally delete them in an efficient way. Using two filter runs instead of one 

2879 # filter run is an optimization. The first run only computes candidate orphans, without incurring I/O, to reduce 

2880 # the list of datasets for which we list snapshots via 'zfs list -t snapshot ...' from dst_datasets to a subset 

2881 # of dst_datasets, which in turn reduces I/O and improves perf. Essentially, this eliminates the I/O to list 

2882 # snapshots for ancestors of excluded datasets. The second run computes the real orphans. 

2883 btype = "bookmark,snapshot" if delete_empty_dst_datasets_if_no_bookmarks_and_no_snapshots else "snapshot" 

2884 dst_datasets_having_snapshots: Set[str] = set() 

2885 for run in range(0, 2): 

2886 orphans: Set[str] = set() 

2887 for dst_dataset in reversed(dst_datasets): 

2888 if children[dst_dataset].issubset(orphans): 

2889 # all children turned out to be orphans, thus the dataset itself could be an orphan 

2890 if dst_dataset not in dst_datasets_having_snapshots: # always True during first filter run 

2891 orphans.add(dst_dataset) 

2892 if run == 0: 

2893 # find datasets with >= 1 snapshot; update dst_datasets_having_snapshots for real use in the 2nd run 

2894 cmd = p.split_args(f"{p.zfs_program} list -t {btype} -d 1 -S name -Hp -o name") 

2895 for datasets_having_snapshots in self.zfs_list_snapshots_in_parallel( 

2896 dst, cmd, sorted(orphans), ordered=False 

2897 ): 

2898 if delete_empty_dst_datasets_if_no_bookmarks_and_no_snapshots: 

2899 replace_in_lines(datasets_having_snapshots, old="#", new="@", count=1) # treat bookmarks as snap 

2900 datasets_having_snapshots = set(cut(field=1, separator="@", lines=datasets_having_snapshots)) 

2901 dst_datasets_having_snapshots.update(datasets_having_snapshots) # union 

2902 else: 

2903 self.delete_datasets(dst, orphans) 

2904 dst_datasets = sorted(set(dst_datasets).difference(orphans)) 

2905 

2906 # Optionally, compare source and destination dataset trees recursively wrt. snapshots, for example to check if all 

2907 # recently taken snapshots have been successfully replicated by a periodic job. 

2908 if p.compare_snapshot_lists and not failed: 

2909 log.info("--compare-snapshot-lists: %s", task_description) 

2910 if len(basis_src_datasets) == 0 and not self.is_dummy(src): 

2911 die(f"Source dataset does not exist: {src.basis_root_dataset}") 

2912 src_datasets = filter_src_datasets() # apply include/exclude policy 

2913 self.run_compare_snapshot_lists(src_datasets, dst_datasets) 

2914 

2915 # Optionally, alert the user if the ZFS 'creation' time property of the latest or oldest snapshot for any specified 

2916 # snapshot name pattern within the selected datasets is too old wrt. the specified age limit. The purpose is to 

2917 # check if snapshots are successfully taken on schedule, successfully replicated on schedule, and successfully 

2918 # pruned on schedule. Process exit code is 0, 1, 2 on OK, WARNING, CRITICAL, respectively. 

2919 if p.monitor_snapshots_config.enable_monitor_snapshots and not failed: 

2920 log.info("--monitor-snapshots: %s", task_description) 

2921 src_datasets = filter_src_datasets() # apply include/exclude policy 

2922 num_cache_hits = self.num_cache_hits 

2923 num_cache_misses = self.num_cache_misses 

2924 start_time_nanos = time.monotonic_ns() 

2925 self.run_in_parallel( 

2926 lambda: self.monitor_snapshots(dst, dst_datasets), lambda: self.monitor_snapshots(src, src_datasets) 

2927 ) 

2928 elapsed = human_readable_duration(time.monotonic_ns() - start_time_nanos) 

2929 if num_cache_hits != self.num_cache_hits or num_cache_misses != self.num_cache_misses: 

2930 total = self.num_cache_hits + self.num_cache_misses 

2931 msg = f", cache hits: {percent(self.num_cache_hits, total)}, misses: {percent(self.num_cache_misses, total)}" 

2932 else: 

2933 msg = "" 

2934 log.info( 

2935 "--monitor-snapshots done: %s", 

2936 f"{task_description} [{len(src_datasets) + len(dst_datasets)} datasets; took {elapsed}{msg}]", 

2937 ) 

2938 

2939 def monitor_snapshots(self, remote: Remote, sorted_datasets: List[str]) -> None: 

2940 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

2941 alerts: List[MonitorSnapshotAlert] = p.monitor_snapshots_config.alerts 

2942 labels: List[SnapshotLabel] = [alert.label for alert in alerts] 

2943 current_unixtime_millis: float = p.create_src_snapshots_config.current_datetime.timestamp() * 1000 

2944 is_debug: bool = log.isEnabledFor(log_debug) 

2945 if self.is_caching_snapshots(remote): 

2946 props = self.dst_properties if remote is p.dst else self.src_properties 

2947 snapshots_changed_dict: Dict[str, int] = { 

2948 dataset: int(vals[SNAPSHOTS_CHANGED]) for dataset, vals in props.items() 

2949 } 

2950 hash_code: str = hashlib.sha256(str(tuple(alerts)).encode("utf-8")).hexdigest() 

2951 is_caching = False 

2952 

2953 def monitor_last_modified_cache_file(r: Remote, dataset: str, label: SnapshotLabel, alert_cfg: AlertConfig) -> str: 

2954 cache_label = SnapshotLabel(os_path_join("===", alert_cfg.kind, str(label), hash_code), "", "", "") 

2955 return self.last_modified_cache_file(r, dataset, cache_label) 

2956 

2957 def alert_msg( 

2958 kind: str, dataset: str, snapshot: str, label: SnapshotLabel, snapshot_age_millis: float, delta_millis: int 

2959 ) -> str: 

2960 assert kind == "Latest" or kind == "Oldest" 

2961 lbl = f"{label.prefix}{label.infix}<timestamp>{label.suffix}" 

2962 if snapshot_age_millis >= current_unixtime_millis: 

2963 return f"No snapshot exists for {dataset}@{lbl}" 

2964 msg = f"{kind} snapshot for {dataset}@{lbl} is {human_readable_duration(snapshot_age_millis, unit='ms')} old" 

2965 s = f" ({snapshot})" if snapshot else "" 

2966 if delta_millis == -1: 

2967 return f"{msg}{s}" 

2968 return f"{msg} but should be at most {human_readable_duration(delta_millis, unit='ms')} old{s}" 

2969 

2970 def check_alert( 

2971 label: SnapshotLabel, 

2972 alert_cfg: Optional[AlertConfig], 

2973 creation_unixtime_secs: int, 

2974 dataset: str, 

2975 snapshot: str, 

2976 ) -> None: 

2977 if alert_cfg is None: 

2978 return 

2979 if is_caching and not p.dry_run: # update cache with latest state from 'zfs list -t snapshot' 

2980 snapshots_changed = snapshots_changed_dict.get(dataset, 0) 

2981 cache_file = monitor_last_modified_cache_file(remote, dataset, label, alert_cfg) 

2982 set_last_modification_time_safe(cache_file, unixtime_in_secs=(creation_unixtime_secs, snapshots_changed)) 

2983 warning_millis = alert_cfg.warning_millis 

2984 critical_millis = alert_cfg.critical_millis 

2985 alert_kind = alert_cfg.kind 

2986 snapshot_age_millis = current_unixtime_millis - creation_unixtime_secs * 1000 

2987 m = "--monitor_snapshots: " 

2988 if snapshot_age_millis > critical_millis: 

2989 msg = m + alert_msg(alert_kind, dataset, snapshot, label, snapshot_age_millis, critical_millis) 

2990 log.critical("%s", msg) 

2991 if not p.monitor_snapshots_config.dont_crit: 

2992 die(msg, exit_code=critical_status) 

2993 elif snapshot_age_millis > warning_millis: 

2994 msg = m + alert_msg(alert_kind, dataset, snapshot, label, snapshot_age_millis, warning_millis) 

2995 log.warning("%s", msg) 

2996 if not p.monitor_snapshots_config.dont_warn: 

2997 die(msg, exit_code=warning_status) 

2998 elif is_debug: 

2999 msg = m + "OK. " + alert_msg(alert_kind, dataset, snapshot, label, snapshot_age_millis, delta_millis=-1) 

3000 log.debug("%s", msg) 

3001 

3002 def alert_latest_snapshot(i: int, creation_unixtime_secs: int, dataset: str, snapshot: str) -> None: 

3003 alert: MonitorSnapshotAlert = alerts[i] 

3004 check_alert(alert.label, alert.latest, creation_unixtime_secs, dataset, snapshot) 

3005 

3006 def alert_oldest_snapshot(i: int, creation_unixtime_secs: int, dataset: str, snapshot: str) -> None: 

3007 alert: MonitorSnapshotAlert = alerts[i] 

3008 check_alert(alert.label, alert.oldest, creation_unixtime_secs, dataset, snapshot) 

3009 

3010 def find_stale_datasets_and_check_alerts() -> List[str]: 

3011 """If the cache is enabled, check which datasets have changed to determine which datasets can be skipped cheaply, 

3012 i.e. without incurring 'zfs list -t snapshots'. This is done by comparing the "snapshots_changed" ZFS dataset 

3013 property with the local cache - https://openzfs.github.io/openzfs-docs/man/7/zfsprops.7.html#snapshots_changed""" 

3014 stale_datasets = [] 

3015 time_threshold = time.time() - time_threshold_secs 

3016 for dataset in sorted_datasets: 

3017 is_stale_dataset = False 

3018 snapshots_changed: int = snapshots_changed_dict.get(dataset, 0) 

3019 for alert in alerts: 

3020 for cfg in (alert.latest, alert.oldest): 

3021 if cfg is None: 

3022 continue 

3023 if ( 

3024 snapshots_changed != 0 

3025 and snapshots_changed < time_threshold 

3026 and ( 

3027 cached_unix_times := self.cache_get_snapshots_changed2( 

3028 monitor_last_modified_cache_file(remote, dataset, alert.label, cfg) 

3029 ) 

3030 ) 

3031 and snapshots_changed == cached_unix_times[1] # cached snapshots_changed aka last modified time 

3032 and snapshots_changed >= cached_unix_times[0] # creation time of minmax snapshot aka access time 

3033 ): # cached state is still valid; emit an alert if the latest/oldest snapshot is too old 

3034 lbl = alert.label 

3035 check_alert(lbl, cfg, creation_unixtime_secs=cached_unix_times[0], dataset=dataset, snapshot="") 

3036 else: # cached state is nomore valid; fallback to 'zfs list -t snapshot' 

3037 is_stale_dataset = True 

3038 if is_stale_dataset: 

3039 stale_datasets.append(dataset) 

3040 return stale_datasets 

3041 

3042 # satisfy request from local cache as much as possible 

3043 if self.is_caching_snapshots(remote): 

3044 stale_datasets = find_stale_datasets_and_check_alerts() 

3045 with self.stats_lock: 

3046 self.num_cache_misses += len(stale_datasets) 

3047 self.num_cache_hits += len(sorted_datasets) - len(stale_datasets) 

3048 else: 

3049 stale_datasets = sorted_datasets 

3050 

3051 # fallback to 'zfs list -t snapshot' for any remaining datasets, as these couldn't be satisfied from local cache 

3052 is_caching = self.is_caching_snapshots(remote) 

3053 datasets_without_snapshots = self.handle_minmax_snapshots( 

3054 remote, stale_datasets, labels, fn_latest=alert_latest_snapshot, fn_oldest=alert_oldest_snapshot 

3055 ) 

3056 for dataset in datasets_without_snapshots: 

3057 for i in range(len(alerts)): 

3058 alert_latest_snapshot(i, creation_unixtime_secs=0, dataset=dataset, snapshot="") 

3059 alert_oldest_snapshot(i, creation_unixtime_secs=0, dataset=dataset, snapshot="") 

3060 

3061 def replicate_datasets(self, src_datasets: List[str], task_description: str, max_workers: int) -> bool: 

3062 assert not self.is_test_mode or src_datasets == sorted(src_datasets), "List is not sorted" 

3063 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

3064 src, dst = p.src, p.dst 

3065 self.num_snapshots_found = 0 

3066 self.num_snapshots_replicated = 0 

3067 # perf/latency: no need to set up a dedicated TCP connection if no parallel replication is possible 

3068 self.dedicated_tcp_connection_per_zfs_send = ( 

3069 p.dedicated_tcp_connection_per_zfs_send 

3070 and max_workers > 1 

3071 and has_siblings(src_datasets) # siblings can be replicated in parallel 

3072 ) 

3073 log.info("Starting replication task: %s", task_description + f" [{len(src_datasets)} datasets]") 

3074 start_time_nanos = time.monotonic_ns() 

3075 

3076 def src2dst(src_dataset: str) -> str: 

3077 return replace_prefix(src_dataset, old_prefix=src.root_dataset, new_prefix=dst.root_dataset) 

3078 

3079 def dst2src(dst_dataset: str) -> str: 

3080 return replace_prefix(dst_dataset, old_prefix=dst.root_dataset, new_prefix=src.root_dataset) 

3081 

3082 def find_stale_datasets() -> Tuple[List[str], Dict[str, str]]: 

3083 """If the cache is enabled on replication, check which src datasets or dst datasets have changed to determine 

3084 which datasets can be skipped cheaply, i.e. without incurring 'zfs list -t snapshots'. This is done by comparing 

3085 the "snapshots_changed" ZFS dataset property with the local cache. 

3086 See https://openzfs.github.io/openzfs-docs/man/7/zfsprops.7.html#snapshots_changed""" 

3087 # First, check which src datasets have changed since the last replication to that destination 

3088 cache_files = {} 

3089 stale_src_datasets1 = [] 

3090 maybe_stale_dst_datasets = [] 

3091 userhost_dir = p.dst.ssh_user_host # cache is only valid for identical destination username+host 

3092 userhost_dir = userhost_dir if userhost_dir else "-" 

3093 hash_key = tuple(tuple(f) for f in p.snapshot_filters) # cache is only valid for same --include/excl-snapshot* 

3094 hash_code = hashlib.sha256(str(hash_key).encode("utf-8")).hexdigest() 

3095 for src_dataset in src_datasets: 

3096 dst_dataset = src2dst(src_dataset) # cache is only valid for identical destination dataset 

3097 cache_label = SnapshotLabel(os.path.join("==", userhost_dir, dst_dataset, hash_code), "", "", "") 

3098 cache_file = self.last_modified_cache_file(src, src_dataset, cache_label) 

3099 cache_files[src_dataset] = cache_file 

3100 snapshots_changed: int = int(self.src_properties[src_dataset][SNAPSHOTS_CHANGED]) # get prop "for free" 

3101 if ( 

3102 snapshots_changed != 0 

3103 and time.time() > snapshots_changed + time_threshold_secs 

3104 and snapshots_changed == self.cache_get_snapshots_changed(cache_file) 

3105 ): 

3106 maybe_stale_dst_datasets.append(dst_dataset) 

3107 else: 

3108 stale_src_datasets1.append(src_dataset) 

3109 

3110 # For each src dataset that hasn't changed, check if the corresponding dst dataset has changed 

3111 stale_src_datasets2 = [] 

3112 dst_snapshots_changed_dict = self.zfs_get_snapshots_changed(dst, maybe_stale_dst_datasets) 

3113 for dst_dataset in maybe_stale_dst_datasets: 

3114 snapshots_changed = dst_snapshots_changed_dict.get(dst_dataset, 0) 

3115 cache_file = self.last_modified_cache_file(dst, dst_dataset) 

3116 if ( 

3117 snapshots_changed != 0 

3118 and time.time() > snapshots_changed + time_threshold_secs 

3119 and snapshots_changed == self.cache_get_snapshots_changed(cache_file) 

3120 ): 

3121 log.info("Already up-to-date [cached]: %s", dst_dataset) 

3122 else: 

3123 stale_src_datasets2.append(dst2src(dst_dataset)) 

3124 assert not self.is_test_mode or stale_src_datasets1 == sorted(stale_src_datasets1), "List is not sorted" 

3125 assert not self.is_test_mode or stale_src_datasets2 == sorted(stale_src_datasets2), "List is not sorted" 

3126 stale_src_datasets = list(heapq.merge(stale_src_datasets1, stale_src_datasets2)) # merge two sorted lists 

3127 assert not self.is_test_mode or not has_duplicates(stale_src_datasets), "List contains duplicates" 

3128 return stale_src_datasets, cache_files 

3129 

3130 if self.is_caching_snapshots(src): 

3131 stale_src_datasets, cache_files = find_stale_datasets() 

3132 num_cache_misses = len(stale_src_datasets) 

3133 num_cache_hits = len(src_datasets) - len(stale_src_datasets) 

3134 self.num_cache_misses += num_cache_misses 

3135 self.num_cache_hits += num_cache_hits 

3136 total = self.num_cache_hits + self.num_cache_misses 

3137 cmsg = f", cache hits: {percent(self.num_cache_hits, total)}, misses: {percent(self.num_cache_misses, total)}" 

3138 else: 

3139 stale_src_datasets = src_datasets 

3140 cache_files = {} 

3141 cmsg = "" 

3142 

3143 # Run replicate_dataset(dataset) for each dataset, while taking care of errors, retries + parallel execution 

3144 failed = self.process_datasets_in_parallel_and_fault_tolerant( 

3145 stale_src_datasets, 

3146 process_dataset=self.replicate_dataset, # lambda 

3147 skip_tree_on_error=lambda dataset: not self.dst_dataset_exists[src2dst(dataset)], 

3148 max_workers=max_workers, 

3149 enable_barriers=False, 

3150 task_name="Replication", 

3151 ) 

3152 

3153 if self.is_caching_snapshots(src) and not failed: 

3154 # refresh "snapshots_changed" ZFS dataset property from dst 

3155 stale_dst_datasets = [src2dst(src_dataset) for src_dataset in stale_src_datasets] 

3156 dst_snapshots_changed_dict = self.zfs_get_snapshots_changed(dst, stale_dst_datasets) 

3157 for dst_dataset in stale_dst_datasets: # update local cache 

3158 dst_snapshots_changed = dst_snapshots_changed_dict.get(dst_dataset, 0) 

3159 dst_cache_file = self.last_modified_cache_file(dst, dst_dataset) 

3160 src_dataset = dst2src(dst_dataset) 

3161 src_snapshots_changed: int = int(self.src_properties[src_dataset][SNAPSHOTS_CHANGED]) 

3162 if not p.dry_run: 

3163 set_last_modification_time_safe(cache_files[src_dataset], unixtime_in_secs=src_snapshots_changed) 

3164 set_last_modification_time_safe(dst_cache_file, unixtime_in_secs=dst_snapshots_changed) 

3165 

3166 elapsed_nanos = time.monotonic_ns() - start_time_nanos 

3167 log.info( 

3168 p.dry("Replication done: %s"), 

3169 f"{task_description} [Replicated {self.num_snapshots_replicated} out of {self.num_snapshots_found} snapshots" 

3170 f" within {len(src_datasets)} datasets; took {human_readable_duration(elapsed_nanos)}{cmsg}]", 

3171 ) 

3172 return failed 

3173 

3174 def replicate_dataset(self, src_dataset: str, tid: str, retry: Retry) -> bool: 

3175 """Replicates src_dataset (without handling descendants) to dst_dataset (thread-safe).""" 

3176 

3177 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

3178 src, dst = p.src, p.dst 

3179 retry_count = retry.count 

3180 dst_dataset = replace_prefix(src_dataset, old_prefix=src.root_dataset, new_prefix=dst.root_dataset) 

3181 log.debug(p.dry(f"{tid} Replicating: %s"), f"{src_dataset} --> {dst_dataset} ...") 

3182 

3183 # list GUID and name for dst snapshots, sorted ascending by createtxg (more precise than creation time) 

3184 dst_cmd = p.split_args(f"{p.zfs_program} list -t snapshot -d 1 -s createtxg -Hp -o guid,name", dst_dataset) 

3185 

3186 # list GUID and name for src snapshots + bookmarks, primarily sort ascending by transaction group (which is more 

3187 # precise than creation time), secondarily sort such that snapshots appear after bookmarks for the same GUID. 

3188 # Note: A snapshot and its ZFS bookmarks always have the same GUID, creation time and transaction group. A snapshot 

3189 # changes its transaction group but retains its creation time and GUID on 'zfs receive' on another pool, i.e. 

3190 # comparing createtxg is only meaningful within a single pool, not across pools from src to dst. Comparing creation 

3191 # time remains meaningful across pools from src to dst. Creation time is a UTC Unix time in integer seconds. 

3192 # Note that 'zfs create', 'zfs snapshot' and 'zfs bookmark' CLIs enforce that snapshot names must not contain a '#' 

3193 # char, bookmark names must not contain a '@' char, and dataset names must not contain a '#' or '@' char. 

3194 # GUID and creation time also do not contain a '#' or '@' char. 

3195 filter_needs_creation_time = has_timerange_filter(p.snapshot_filters) 

3196 types = "snapshot,bookmark" if p.use_bookmark and self.are_bookmarks_enabled(src) else "snapshot" 

3197 props = self.creation_prefix + "creation,guid,name" if filter_needs_creation_time else "guid,name" 

3198 src_cmd = p.split_args(f"{p.zfs_program} list -t {types} -s createtxg -s type -d 1 -Hp -o {props}", src_dataset) 

3199 self.maybe_inject_delete(src, dataset=src_dataset, delete_trigger="zfs_list_snapshot_src") 

3200 src_snapshots_and_bookmarks, dst_snapshots_with_guids = self.run_in_parallel( # list src+dst snapshots in parallel 

3201 lambda: self.try_ssh_command(src, log_trace, cmd=src_cmd), 

3202 lambda: self.try_ssh_command(dst, log_trace, cmd=dst_cmd, error_trigger="zfs_list_snapshot_dst"), 

3203 ) 

3204 self.dst_dataset_exists[dst_dataset] = dst_snapshots_with_guids is not None 

3205 dst_snapshots_with_guids = dst_snapshots_with_guids.splitlines() if dst_snapshots_with_guids is not None else [] 

3206 if src_snapshots_and_bookmarks is None: 

3207 log.warning("Third party deleted source: %s", src_dataset) 

3208 return False # src dataset has been deleted by some third party while we're running - nothing to do anymore 

3209 src_snapshots_with_guids: List[str] = src_snapshots_and_bookmarks.splitlines() 

3210 src_snapshots_and_bookmarks = None 

3211 if len(dst_snapshots_with_guids) == 0 and "bookmark" in types: 

3212 # src bookmarks serve no purpose if the destination dataset has no snapshot; ignore them 

3213 src_snapshots_with_guids = [snapshot for snapshot in src_snapshots_with_guids if "@" in snapshot] 

3214 num_src_snapshots_found = sum(1 for snapshot in src_snapshots_with_guids if "@" in snapshot) 

3215 with self.stats_lock: 

3216 self.num_snapshots_found += num_src_snapshots_found 

3217 # apply include/exclude regexes to ignore irrelevant src snapshots 

3218 basis_src_snapshots_with_guids = src_snapshots_with_guids 

3219 src_snapshots_with_guids = self.filter_snapshots(src_snapshots_with_guids) 

3220 if filter_needs_creation_time: 

3221 src_snapshots_with_guids = cut(field=2, lines=src_snapshots_with_guids) 

3222 basis_src_snapshots_with_guids = cut(field=2, lines=basis_src_snapshots_with_guids) 

3223 

3224 # find oldest and latest "true" snapshot, as well as GUIDs of all snapshots and bookmarks. 

3225 # a snapshot is "true" if it is not a bookmark. 

3226 oldest_src_snapshot = "" 

3227 latest_src_snapshot = "" 

3228 included_src_guids: Set[str] = set() 

3229 for line in src_snapshots_with_guids: 

3230 guid, snapshot = line.split("\t", 1) 

3231 included_src_guids.add(guid) 

3232 if "@" in snapshot: 

3233 latest_src_snapshot = snapshot 

3234 if not oldest_src_snapshot: 

3235 oldest_src_snapshot = snapshot 

3236 if len(src_snapshots_with_guids) == 0: 

3237 if p.skip_missing_snapshots == "fail": 

3238 die(f"Source dataset includes no snapshot: {src_dataset}. Consider using --skip-missing-snapshots=dataset") 

3239 elif p.skip_missing_snapshots == "dataset": 

3240 log.warning("Skipping source dataset because it includes no snapshot: %s", src_dataset) 

3241 if p.recursive and not self.dst_dataset_exists[dst_dataset]: 

3242 log.warning("Also skipping descendant datasets as dst dataset does not exist for %s", src_dataset) 

3243 return self.dst_dataset_exists[dst_dataset] 

3244 

3245 log.debug("latest_src_snapshot: %s", latest_src_snapshot) 

3246 latest_dst_snapshot = "" 

3247 latest_dst_guid = "" 

3248 latest_common_src_snapshot = "" 

3249 props_cache: Dict[Tuple[str, str, str], Dict[str, Optional[str]]] = {} 

3250 done_checking = False 

3251 

3252 if self.dst_dataset_exists[dst_dataset]: 

3253 if len(dst_snapshots_with_guids) > 0: 

3254 latest_dst_guid, latest_dst_snapshot = dst_snapshots_with_guids[-1].split("\t", 1) 

3255 if p.force_rollback_to_latest_snapshot: 

3256 log.info(p.dry(f"{tid} Rolling back destination to most recent snapshot: %s"), latest_dst_snapshot) 

3257 # rollback just in case the dst dataset was modified since its most recent snapshot 

3258 done_checking = done_checking or self.check_zfs_dataset_busy(dst, dst_dataset) 

3259 cmd = p.split_args(f"{dst.sudo} {p.zfs_program} rollback", latest_dst_snapshot) 

3260 self.try_ssh_command(dst, log_debug, is_dry=p.dry_run, print_stdout=True, cmd=cmd, exists=False) 

3261 elif latest_src_snapshot == "": 

3262 log.info(f"{tid} Already-up-to-date: %s", dst_dataset) 

3263 return True 

3264 

3265 # find most recent snapshot (or bookmark) that src and dst have in common - we'll start to replicate 

3266 # from there up to the most recent src snapshot. any two snapshots are "common" iff their ZFS GUIDs (i.e. 

3267 # contents) are equal. See https://github.com/openzfs/zfs/commit/305bc4b370b20de81eaf10a1cf724374258b74d1 

3268 def latest_common_snapshot( 

3269 snapshots_with_guids: List[str], intersect_guids: Set[str] 

3270 ) -> Tuple[Optional[str], str]: 

3271 """Returns a true snapshot instead of its bookmark with the same GUID, per the sort order previously 

3272 used for 'zfs list -s ...'""" 

3273 for _line in reversed(snapshots_with_guids): 

3274 _guid, _snapshot = _line.split("\t", 1) 

3275 if _guid in intersect_guids: 

3276 return _guid, _snapshot # can be a snapshot or bookmark 

3277 return None, "" 

3278 

3279 latest_common_guid, latest_common_src_snapshot = latest_common_snapshot( 

3280 src_snapshots_with_guids, set(cut(field=1, lines=dst_snapshots_with_guids)) 

3281 ) 

3282 log.debug("latest_common_src_snapshot: %s", latest_common_src_snapshot) # is a snapshot or bookmark 

3283 log.log(log_trace, "latest_dst_snapshot: %s", latest_dst_snapshot) 

3284 

3285 if latest_common_src_snapshot and latest_common_guid != latest_dst_guid: 

3286 # found latest common snapshot but dst has an even newer snapshot. rollback dst to that common snapshot. 

3287 assert latest_common_guid 

3288 _, latest_common_dst_snapshot = latest_common_snapshot(dst_snapshots_with_guids, {latest_common_guid}) 

3289 if not (p.force_rollback_to_latest_common_snapshot or p.force): 

3290 die( 

3291 f"Conflict: Most recent destination snapshot {latest_dst_snapshot} is more recent than " 

3292 f"most recent common snapshot {latest_common_dst_snapshot}. Rollback destination first, " 

3293 "for example via --force-rollback-to-latest-common-snapshot (or --force) option." 

3294 ) 

3295 if p.force_once: 

3296 p.force.value = False 

3297 p.force_rollback_to_latest_common_snapshot.value = False 

3298 log.info( 

3299 p.dry(f"{tid} Rolling back destination to most recent common snapshot: %s"), latest_common_dst_snapshot 

3300 ) 

3301 done_checking = done_checking or self.check_zfs_dataset_busy(dst, dst_dataset) 

3302 cmd = p.split_args( 

3303 f"{dst.sudo} {p.zfs_program} rollback -r {p.force_unmount} {p.force_hard}", latest_common_dst_snapshot 

3304 ) 

3305 try: 

3306 self.run_ssh_command(dst, log_debug, is_dry=p.dry_run, print_stdout=True, cmd=cmd) 

3307 except (subprocess.CalledProcessError, UnicodeDecodeError) as e: 

3308 stderr = stderr_to_str(e.stderr) if hasattr(e, "stderr") else "" 

3309 no_sleep = self.clear_resumable_recv_state_if_necessary(dst_dataset, stderr) 

3310 # op isn't idempotent so retries regather current state from the start of replicate_dataset() 

3311 raise RetryableError("Subprocess failed", no_sleep=no_sleep) from e 

3312 

3313 if latest_src_snapshot and latest_src_snapshot == latest_common_src_snapshot: 

3314 log.info(f"{tid} Already up-to-date: %s", dst_dataset) 

3315 return True 

3316 

3317 # endif self.dst_dataset_exists[dst_dataset] 

3318 log.debug("latest_common_src_snapshot: %s", latest_common_src_snapshot) # is a snapshot or bookmark 

3319 log.log(log_trace, "latest_dst_snapshot: %s", latest_dst_snapshot) 

3320 dry_run_no_send = False 

3321 right_just = 7 

3322 

3323 def format_size(num_bytes: int) -> str: 

3324 return human_readable_bytes(num_bytes, separator="").rjust(right_just) 

3325 

3326 if not latest_common_src_snapshot: 

3327 # no common snapshot was found. delete all dst snapshots, if any 

3328 if latest_dst_snapshot: 

3329 if not p.force: 

3330 die( 

3331 f"Conflict: No common snapshot found between {src_dataset} and {dst_dataset} even though " 

3332 "destination has at least one snapshot. Aborting. Consider using --force option to first " 

3333 "delete all existing destination snapshots in order to be able to proceed with replication." 

3334 ) 

3335 if p.force_once: 

3336 p.force.value = False 

3337 done_checking = done_checking or self.check_zfs_dataset_busy(dst, dst_dataset) 

3338 self.delete_snapshots(dst, dst_dataset, snapshot_tags=cut(2, separator="@", lines=dst_snapshots_with_guids)) 

3339 if p.dry_run: 

3340 # As we're in --dryrun (--force) mode this conflict resolution step (see above) wasn't really executed: 

3341 # "no common snapshot was found. delete all dst snapshots". In turn, this would cause the subsequent 

3342 # 'zfs receive -n' to fail with "cannot receive new filesystem stream: destination has snapshots; must 

3343 # destroy them to overwrite it". So we skip the zfs send/receive step and keep on trucking. 

3344 dry_run_no_send = True 

3345 

3346 # to start with, fully replicate oldest snapshot, which in turn creates a common snapshot 

3347 if p.no_stream: 

3348 oldest_src_snapshot = latest_src_snapshot 

3349 if oldest_src_snapshot: 

3350 if not self.dst_dataset_exists[dst_dataset]: 

3351 # on destination, create parent filesystem and ancestors if they do not yet exist 

3352 dst_dataset_parent = os.path.dirname(dst_dataset) 

3353 if not self.dst_dataset_exists[dst_dataset_parent]: 

3354 if p.dry_run: 

3355 dry_run_no_send = True 

3356 if dst_dataset_parent != "": 

3357 self.create_zfs_filesystem(dst_dataset_parent) 

3358 

3359 recv_resume_token, send_resume_opts, recv_resume_opts = self._recv_resume_token(dst_dataset, retry_count) 

3360 curr_size = self.estimate_send_size(src, dst_dataset, recv_resume_token, oldest_src_snapshot) 

3361 humansize = format_size(curr_size) 

3362 if recv_resume_token: 

3363 send_opts = send_resume_opts # e.g. ["-t", "1-c740b4779-..."] 

3364 else: 

3365 send_opts = p.curr_zfs_send_program_opts + [oldest_src_snapshot] 

3366 send_cmd = p.split_args(f"{src.sudo} {p.zfs_program} send", send_opts) 

3367 recv_opts = p.zfs_full_recv_opts.copy() + recv_resume_opts 

3368 recv_opts, set_opts = self.add_recv_property_options(True, recv_opts, src_dataset, props_cache) 

3369 recv_cmd = p.split_args( 

3370 f"{dst.sudo} {p.zfs_program} receive -F", p.dry_run_recv, recv_opts, dst_dataset, allow_all=True 

3371 ) 

3372 log.info(p.dry(f"{tid} Full send: %s"), f"{oldest_src_snapshot} --> {dst_dataset} ({humansize.strip()}) ...") 

3373 done_checking = done_checking or self.check_zfs_dataset_busy(dst, dst_dataset) 

3374 dry_run_no_send = dry_run_no_send or p.dry_run_no_send 

3375 self.maybe_inject_params(error_trigger="full_zfs_send_params") 

3376 humansize = humansize.rjust(right_just * 3 + 2) 

3377 self.run_zfs_send_receive( 

3378 src_dataset, dst_dataset, send_cmd, recv_cmd, curr_size, humansize, dry_run_no_send, "full_zfs_send" 

3379 ) 

3380 latest_common_src_snapshot = oldest_src_snapshot # we have now created a common snapshot 

3381 if not dry_run_no_send and not p.dry_run: 

3382 self.dst_dataset_exists[dst_dataset] = True 

3383 with self.stats_lock: 

3384 self.num_snapshots_replicated += 1 

3385 self.create_zfs_bookmarks(src, src_dataset, [oldest_src_snapshot]) 

3386 self.zfs_set(set_opts, dst, dst_dataset) 

3387 dry_run_no_send = dry_run_no_send or p.dry_run 

3388 retry_count = 0 

3389 

3390 # endif not latest_common_src_snapshot 

3391 # finally, incrementally replicate all snapshots from most recent common snapshot until most recent src snapshot 

3392 if latest_common_src_snapshot: 

3393 

3394 def replication_candidates() -> Tuple[List[str], List[str]]: 

3395 assert len(basis_src_snapshots_with_guids) > 0 

3396 result_snapshots = [] 

3397 result_guids = [] 

3398 last_appended_guid = "" 

3399 snapshot_itr = reversed(basis_src_snapshots_with_guids) 

3400 while True: 

3401 guid, snapshot = snapshot_itr.__next__().split("\t", 1) 

3402 if "@" in snapshot: 

3403 result_snapshots.append(snapshot) 

3404 result_guids.append(guid) 

3405 last_appended_guid = guid 

3406 if snapshot == latest_common_src_snapshot: # latest_common_src_snapshot is a snapshot or bookmark 

3407 if guid != last_appended_guid and "@" not in snapshot: 

3408 # only appends the src bookmark if it has no snapshot. If the bookmark has a snapshot then that 

3409 # snapshot has already been appended, per the sort order previously used for 'zfs list -s ...' 

3410 result_snapshots.append(snapshot) 

3411 result_guids.append(guid) 

3412 break 

3413 result_snapshots.reverse() 

3414 result_guids.reverse() 

3415 assert len(result_snapshots) > 0 

3416 assert len(result_snapshots) == len(result_guids) 

3417 return result_guids, result_snapshots 

3418 

3419 # collect the most recent common snapshot (which may be a bookmark) followed by all src snapshots 

3420 # (that are not a bookmark) that are more recent than that. 

3421 cand_guids, cand_snapshots = replication_candidates() 

3422 if len(cand_snapshots) == 1: 

3423 # latest_src_snapshot is a (true) snapshot that is equal to latest_common_src_snapshot or LESS recent 

3424 # than latest_common_src_snapshot. The latter case can happen if latest_common_src_snapshot is a 

3425 # bookmark whose snapshot has been deleted on src. 

3426 return True # nothing more tbd 

3427 

3428 recv_resume_token, send_resume_opts, recv_resume_opts = self._recv_resume_token(dst_dataset, retry_count) 

3429 recv_opts = p.zfs_recv_program_opts.copy() + recv_resume_opts 

3430 recv_opts, set_opts = self.add_recv_property_options(False, recv_opts, src_dataset, props_cache) 

3431 if p.no_stream: 

3432 # skip intermediate snapshots 

3433 steps_todo = [("-i", latest_common_src_snapshot, latest_src_snapshot, [latest_src_snapshot])] 

3434 else: 

3435 # include intermediate src snapshots that pass --{include,exclude}-snapshot-* policy, using 

3436 # a series of -i/-I send/receive steps that skip excluded src snapshots. 

3437 steps_todo = self.incremental_send_steps_wrapper( 

3438 cand_snapshots, cand_guids, included_src_guids, recv_resume_token is not None 

3439 ) 

3440 log.log(log_trace, "steps_todo: %s", list_formatter(steps_todo, "; ")) 

3441 estimate_send_sizes = [ 

3442 self.estimate_send_size( 

3443 src, dst_dataset, recv_resume_token if i == 0 else None, incr_flag, from_snap, to_snap 

3444 ) 

3445 for i, (incr_flag, from_snap, to_snap, to_snapshots) in enumerate(steps_todo) 

3446 ] 

3447 total_size = sum(estimate_send_sizes) 

3448 total_num = sum(len(to_snapshots) for incr_flag, from_snap, to_snap, to_snapshots in steps_todo) 

3449 done_size = 0 

3450 done_num = 0 

3451 for i, (incr_flag, from_snap, to_snap, to_snapshots) in enumerate(steps_todo): 

3452 assert len(to_snapshots) >= 1 

3453 curr_num_snapshots = len(to_snapshots) 

3454 curr_size = estimate_send_sizes[i] 

3455 humansize = format_size(total_size) + "/" + format_size(done_size) + "/" + format_size(curr_size) 

3456 human_num = f"{total_num}/{done_num}/{curr_num_snapshots} snapshots" 

3457 if recv_resume_token: 

3458 send_opts = send_resume_opts # e.g. ["-t", "1-c740b4779-..."] 

3459 else: 

3460 send_opts = p.curr_zfs_send_program_opts + [incr_flag, from_snap, to_snap] 

3461 send_cmd = p.split_args(f"{src.sudo} {p.zfs_program} send", send_opts) 

3462 recv_cmd = p.split_args( 

3463 f"{dst.sudo} {p.zfs_program} receive", p.dry_run_recv, recv_opts, dst_dataset, allow_all=True 

3464 ) 

3465 dense_size = p.two_or_more_spaces_regex.sub("", humansize.strip()) 

3466 log.info( 

3467 p.dry(f"{tid} Incremental send {incr_flag}: %s"), 

3468 f"{from_snap} .. {to_snap[to_snap.index('@'):]} --> {dst_dataset} ({dense_size}) ({human_num}) ...", 

3469 ) 

3470 done_checking = done_checking or self.check_zfs_dataset_busy(dst, dst_dataset, busy_if_send=False) 

3471 if p.dry_run and not self.dst_dataset_exists[dst_dataset]: 

3472 dry_run_no_send = True 

3473 dry_run_no_send = dry_run_no_send or p.dry_run_no_send 

3474 self.maybe_inject_params(error_trigger="incr_zfs_send_params") 

3475 self.run_zfs_send_receive( 

3476 src_dataset, dst_dataset, send_cmd, recv_cmd, curr_size, humansize, dry_run_no_send, "incr_zfs_send" 

3477 ) 

3478 done_size += curr_size 

3479 done_num += curr_num_snapshots 

3480 recv_resume_token = None 

3481 with self.stats_lock: 

3482 self.num_snapshots_replicated += curr_num_snapshots 

3483 if p.create_bookmarks == "all": 

3484 self.create_zfs_bookmarks(src, src_dataset, to_snapshots) 

3485 elif p.create_bookmarks == "many": 

3486 to_snapshots = [snap for snap in to_snapshots if p.xperiods.label_milliseconds(snap) >= 60 * 60 * 1000] 

3487 if i == len(steps_todo) - 1 and (len(to_snapshots) == 0 or to_snapshots[-1] != to_snap): 

3488 to_snapshots.append(to_snap) 

3489 self.create_zfs_bookmarks(src, src_dataset, to_snapshots) 

3490 self.zfs_set(set_opts, dst, dst_dataset) 

3491 return True 

3492 

3493 def prepare_zfs_send_receive( 

3494 self, src_dataset: str, send_cmd: List[str], recv_cmd: List[str], size_estimate_bytes: int, size_estimate_human: str 

3495 ) -> Tuple[str, str, str]: 

3496 p = self.params 

3497 send_cmd_str = shlex.join(send_cmd) 

3498 recv_cmd_str = shlex.join(recv_cmd) 

3499 

3500 if self.is_program_available("zstd", "src") and self.is_program_available("zstd", "dst"): 

3501 _compress_cmd = self.compress_cmd("src", size_estimate_bytes) 

3502 _decompress_cmd = self.decompress_cmd("dst", size_estimate_bytes) 

3503 else: # no compression is used if source and destination do not both support compression 

3504 _compress_cmd, _decompress_cmd = "cat", "cat" 

3505 

3506 recordsize = abs(int(self.src_properties[src_dataset]["recordsize"])) 

3507 src_buffer = self.mbuffer_cmd("src", size_estimate_bytes, recordsize) 

3508 dst_buffer = self.mbuffer_cmd("dst", size_estimate_bytes, recordsize) 

3509 local_buffer = self.mbuffer_cmd("local", size_estimate_bytes, recordsize) 

3510 

3511 pv_src_cmd = "" 

3512 pv_dst_cmd = "" 

3513 pv_loc_cmd = "" 

3514 if p.src.ssh_user_host == "": 

3515 pv_src_cmd = self.pv_cmd("local", size_estimate_bytes, size_estimate_human) 

3516 elif p.dst.ssh_user_host == "": 

3517 pv_dst_cmd = self.pv_cmd("local", size_estimate_bytes, size_estimate_human) 

3518 elif _compress_cmd == "cat": 

3519 pv_loc_cmd = self.pv_cmd("local", size_estimate_bytes, size_estimate_human) # compression disabled 

3520 else: 

3521 # pull-push mode with compression enabled: reporting "percent complete" isn't straightforward because 

3522 # localhost observes the compressed data instead of the uncompressed data, so we disable the progress bar. 

3523 pv_loc_cmd = self.pv_cmd("local", size_estimate_bytes, size_estimate_human, disable_progress_bar=True) 

3524 

3525 # assemble pipeline running on source leg 

3526 src_pipe = "" 

3527 if self.inject_params.get("inject_src_pipe_fail", False): 

3528 # for testing; initially forward some bytes and then fail 

3529 src_pipe = f"{src_pipe} | dd bs=64 count=1 2>/dev/null && false" 

3530 if self.inject_params.get("inject_src_pipe_garble", False): 

3531 src_pipe = f"{src_pipe} | base64" # for testing; forward garbled bytes 

3532 if pv_src_cmd != "" and pv_src_cmd != "cat": 

3533 src_pipe = f"{src_pipe} | {pv_src_cmd}" 

3534 if _compress_cmd != "cat": 

3535 src_pipe = f"{src_pipe} | {_compress_cmd}" 

3536 if src_buffer != "cat": 

3537 src_pipe = f"{src_pipe} | {src_buffer}" 

3538 if src_pipe.startswith(" |"): 

3539 src_pipe = src_pipe[2:] # strip leading ' |' part 

3540 if self.inject_params.get("inject_src_send_error", False): 

3541 send_cmd_str = f"{send_cmd_str} --injectedGarbageParameter" # for testing; induce CLI parse error 

3542 if src_pipe != "": 

3543 src_pipe = f"{send_cmd_str} | {src_pipe}" 

3544 if p.src.ssh_user_host != "": 

3545 src_pipe = p.shell_program + " -c " + self.dquote(src_pipe) 

3546 else: 

3547 src_pipe = send_cmd_str 

3548 

3549 # assemble pipeline running on middle leg between source and destination. only enabled for pull-push mode 

3550 local_pipe = "" 

3551 if local_buffer != "cat": 

3552 local_pipe = f"{local_buffer}" 

3553 if pv_loc_cmd != "" and pv_loc_cmd != "cat": 

3554 local_pipe = f"{local_pipe} | {pv_loc_cmd}" 

3555 if local_buffer != "cat": 

3556 local_pipe = f"{local_pipe} | {local_buffer}" 

3557 if local_pipe.startswith(" |"): 

3558 local_pipe = local_pipe[2:] # strip leading ' |' part 

3559 if local_pipe != "": 

3560 local_pipe = f"| {local_pipe}" 

3561 

3562 # assemble pipeline running on destination leg 

3563 dst_pipe = "" 

3564 if dst_buffer != "cat": 

3565 dst_pipe = f"{dst_buffer}" 

3566 if _decompress_cmd != "cat": 

3567 dst_pipe = f"{dst_pipe} | {_decompress_cmd}" 

3568 if pv_dst_cmd != "" and pv_dst_cmd != "cat": 

3569 dst_pipe = f"{dst_pipe} | {pv_dst_cmd}" 

3570 if self.inject_params.get("inject_dst_pipe_fail", False): 

3571 # interrupt zfs receive for testing retry/resume; initially forward some bytes and then stop forwarding 

3572 dst_pipe = f"{dst_pipe} | dd bs=1024 count={inject_dst_pipe_fail_kbytes} 2>/dev/null" 

3573 if self.inject_params.get("inject_dst_pipe_garble", False): 

3574 dst_pipe = f"{dst_pipe} | base64" # for testing; forward garbled bytes 

3575 if dst_pipe.startswith(" |"): 

3576 dst_pipe = dst_pipe[2:] # strip leading ' |' part 

3577 if self.inject_params.get("inject_dst_receive_error", False): 

3578 recv_cmd_str = f"{recv_cmd_str} --injectedGarbageParameter" # for testing; induce CLI parse error 

3579 if dst_pipe != "": 

3580 dst_pipe = f"{dst_pipe} | {recv_cmd_str}" 

3581 if p.dst.ssh_user_host != "": 

3582 dst_pipe = p.shell_program + " -c " + self.dquote(dst_pipe) 

3583 else: 

3584 dst_pipe = recv_cmd_str 

3585 

3586 # If there's no support for shell pipelines, we can't do compression, mbuffering, monitoring and rate-limiting, 

3587 # so we fall back to simple zfs send/receive. 

3588 if not self.is_program_available("sh", "src"): 

3589 src_pipe = send_cmd_str 

3590 if not self.is_program_available("sh", "dst"): 

3591 dst_pipe = recv_cmd_str 

3592 if not self.is_program_available("sh", "local"): 

3593 local_pipe = "" 

3594 

3595 src_pipe = self.squote(p.src, src_pipe) 

3596 dst_pipe = self.squote(p.dst, dst_pipe) 

3597 return src_pipe, local_pipe, dst_pipe 

3598 

3599 def run_zfs_send_receive( 

3600 self, 

3601 src_dataset: str, 

3602 dst_dataset: str, 

3603 send_cmd: List[str], 

3604 recv_cmd: List[str], 

3605 size_estimate_bytes: int, 

3606 size_estimate_human: str, 

3607 dry_run_no_send: bool, 

3608 error_trigger: Optional[str] = None, 

3609 ) -> None: 

3610 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

3611 src_pipe, local_pipe, dst_pipe = self.prepare_zfs_send_receive( 

3612 src_dataset, send_cmd, recv_cmd, size_estimate_bytes, size_estimate_human 

3613 ) 

3614 conn_pool_name = DEDICATED if self.dedicated_tcp_connection_per_zfs_send else SHARED 

3615 src_conn_pool: ConnectionPool = p.connection_pools["src"].pool(conn_pool_name) 

3616 src_conn: Connection = src_conn_pool.get_connection() 

3617 dst_conn_pool: ConnectionPool = p.connection_pools["dst"].pool(conn_pool_name) 

3618 dst_conn: Connection = dst_conn_pool.get_connection() 

3619 try: 

3620 self.refresh_ssh_connection_if_necessary(p.src, src_conn) 

3621 self.refresh_ssh_connection_if_necessary(p.dst, dst_conn) 

3622 src_ssh_cmd = " ".join(src_conn.ssh_cmd_quoted) 

3623 dst_ssh_cmd = " ".join(dst_conn.ssh_cmd_quoted) 

3624 cmd = [p.shell_program_local, "-c", f"{src_ssh_cmd} {src_pipe} {local_pipe} | {dst_ssh_cmd} {dst_pipe}"] 

3625 msg = "Would execute: %s" if dry_run_no_send else "Executing: %s" 

3626 log.debug(msg, cmd[2].lstrip()) 

3627 if not dry_run_no_send: 

3628 try: 

3629 self.maybe_inject_error(cmd=cmd, error_trigger=error_trigger) 

3630 process = subprocess_run( 

3631 cmd, stdin=DEVNULL, stdout=PIPE, stderr=PIPE, text=True, timeout=self.timeout(), check=True 

3632 ) 

3633 except (subprocess.CalledProcessError, UnicodeDecodeError) as e: 

3634 no_sleep = False 

3635 if not isinstance(e, UnicodeDecodeError): 

3636 xprint(log, stderr_to_str(e.stdout), file=sys.stdout) 

3637 log.warning("%s", stderr_to_str(e.stderr).rstrip()) 

3638 if isinstance(e, subprocess.CalledProcessError): 

3639 no_sleep = self.clear_resumable_recv_state_if_necessary(dst_dataset, e.stderr) 

3640 # op isn't idempotent so retries regather current state from the start of replicate_dataset() 

3641 raise RetryableError("Subprocess failed", no_sleep=no_sleep) from e 

3642 else: 

3643 xprint(log, process.stdout, file=sys.stdout) 

3644 xprint(log, process.stderr, file=sys.stderr) 

3645 finally: 

3646 dst_conn_pool.return_connection(dst_conn) 

3647 src_conn_pool.return_connection(src_conn) 

3648 

3649 def clear_resumable_recv_state_if_necessary(self, dst_dataset: str, stderr: str) -> bool: 

3650 def clear_resumable_recv_state() -> bool: 

3651 log.warning(p.dry("Aborting an interrupted zfs receive -s, deleting partially received state: %s"), dst_dataset) 

3652 cmd = p.split_args(f"{p.dst.sudo} {p.zfs_program} receive -A", dst_dataset) 

3653 self.try_ssh_command(p.dst, log_trace, is_dry=p.dry_run, print_stdout=True, cmd=cmd) 

3654 log.log(log_trace, p.dry("Done Aborting an interrupted zfs receive -s: %s"), dst_dataset) 

3655 return True 

3656 

3657 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

3658 # "cannot resume send: 'wb_src/tmp/src@s1' is no longer the same snapshot used in the initial send" 

3659 # "cannot resume send: 'wb_src/tmp/src@s1' used in the initial send no longer exists" 

3660 # "cannot resume send: incremental source 0xa000000000000000 no longer exists" 

3661 if "cannot resume send" in stderr and ( 

3662 "is no longer the same snapshot used in the initial send" in stderr 

3663 or "used in the initial send no longer exists" in stderr 

3664 or re.match(r".*incremental source [0-9a-fx]+ no longer exists", stderr) 

3665 ): 

3666 return clear_resumable_recv_state() 

3667 

3668 # "cannot receive resume stream: incompatible embedded data stream feature with encrypted receive." 

3669 # see https://github.com/openzfs/zfs/issues/12480 

3670 # 'cannot receive new filesystem stream: destination xx contains partially-complete state from "zfs receive -s"' 

3671 # this indicates that --no-resume-recv detects that dst contains a previously interrupted recv -s 

3672 elif "cannot receive" in stderr and ( 

3673 "cannot receive resume stream: incompatible embedded data stream feature with encrypted receive" in stderr 

3674 or 'contains partially-complete state from "zfs receive -s"' in stderr 

3675 ): 

3676 return clear_resumable_recv_state() 

3677 

3678 elif ( # this signals normal behavior on interrupt of 'zfs receive -s' if running without --no-resume-recv 

3679 "cannot receive new filesystem stream: checksum mismatch or incomplete stream" in stderr 

3680 and "Partially received snapshot is saved" in stderr 

3681 ): 

3682 return True 

3683 

3684 # "cannot destroy 'wb_dest/tmp/dst@s1': snapshot has dependent clones ... use '-R' to destroy the following 

3685 # datasets: wb_dest/tmp/dst/%recv" # see https://github.com/openzfs/zfs/issues/10439#issuecomment-642774560 

3686 # This msg indicates a failed 'zfs destroy' via --delete-dst-snapshots. This "clone" is caused by a previously 

3687 # interrupted 'zfs receive -s'. The fix used here is to delete the partially received state of said 

3688 # 'zfs receive -s' via 'zfs receive -A', followed by an automatic retry, which will now succeed to delete the 

3689 # snapshot without user intervention. 

3690 elif ( 

3691 "cannot destroy" in stderr 

3692 and "snapshot has dependent clone" in stderr 

3693 and "use '-R' to destroy the following dataset" in stderr 

3694 and f"\n{dst_dataset}/%recv\n" in stderr 

3695 ): 

3696 return clear_resumable_recv_state() 

3697 

3698 # Same cause as above, except that this error can occur during 'zfs rollback' 

3699 # Also see https://github.com/openzfs/zfs/blob/master/cmd/zfs/zfs_main.c 

3700 elif ( 

3701 "cannot rollback to" in stderr 

3702 and "clones of previous snapshots exist" in stderr 

3703 and "use '-R' to force deletion of the following clones and dependents" in stderr 

3704 and f"\n{dst_dataset}/%recv\n" in stderr 

3705 ): 

3706 return clear_resumable_recv_state() 

3707 

3708 return False 

3709 

3710 def _recv_resume_token(self, dst_dataset: str, retry_count: int) -> Tuple[Optional[str], List[str], List[str]]: 

3711 """Gets recv_resume_token ZFS property from dst_dataset and returns corresponding opts to use for send+recv.""" 

3712 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

3713 if not p.resume_recv: 

3714 return None, [], [] 

3715 warning = None 

3716 if not self.is_zpool_feature_enabled_or_active(p.dst, "feature@extensible_dataset"): 

3717 warning = "not available on destination dataset" 

3718 elif not self.is_program_available(zfs_version_is_at_least_2_1_0, "dst"): 

3719 warning = "unreliable as zfs version is too old" # e.g. zfs-0.8.3 "internal error: Unknown error 1040" 

3720 if warning: 

3721 log.warning(f"ZFS receive resume feature is {warning}. Falling back to --no-resume-recv: %s", dst_dataset) 

3722 return None, [], [] 

3723 recv_resume_token = None 

3724 send_resume_opts = [] 

3725 if self.dst_dataset_exists[dst_dataset]: 

3726 cmd = p.split_args(f"{p.zfs_program} get -Hp -o value -s none receive_resume_token", dst_dataset) 

3727 recv_resume_token = self.run_ssh_command(p.dst, log_trace, cmd=cmd).rstrip() 

3728 if recv_resume_token == "-" or not recv_resume_token: 

3729 recv_resume_token = None 

3730 else: 

3731 send_resume_opts += ["-n"] if p.dry_run else [] 

3732 send_resume_opts += ["-v"] if p.verbose_zfs else [] 

3733 send_resume_opts += ["-t", recv_resume_token] 

3734 recv_resume_opts = ["-s"] 

3735 return recv_resume_token, send_resume_opts, recv_resume_opts 

3736
