3737 def mbuffer_cmd(self, loc: str, size_estimate_bytes: int, recordsize: int) -> str: 

3738 """If mbuffer command is on the PATH, uses it in the ssh network pipe between 'zfs send' and 'zfs receive' to 

3739 smooth out the rate of data flow and prevent bottlenecks caused by network latency or speed fluctuation.""" 

3740 p = self.params 

3741 if ( 

3742 size_estimate_bytes >= p.min_pipe_transfer_size 

3743 and ( 

3744 (loc == "src" and (p.src.is_nonlocal or p.dst.is_nonlocal)) 

3745 or (loc == "dst" and (p.src.is_nonlocal or p.dst.is_nonlocal)) 

3746 or (loc == "local" and p.src.is_nonlocal and p.dst.is_nonlocal) 

3747 ) 

3748 and self.is_program_available("mbuffer", loc) 

3749 ): 

3750 recordsize = max(recordsize, 128 * 1024 if self.is_solaris_zfs_location(loc) else 2 * 1024 * 1024) 

3751 return shlex.join([p.mbuffer_program, "-s", str(recordsize)] + p.mbuffer_program_opts) 

3752 else: 

3753 return "cat" 

3754 

3755 def compress_cmd(self, loc: str, size_estimate_bytes: int) -> str: 

3756 """If zstd command is on the PATH, uses it in the ssh network pipe between 'zfs send' and 'zfs receive' to 

3757 reduce network bottlenecks by sending compressed data.""" 

3758 p = self.params 

3759 if ( 

3760 size_estimate_bytes >= p.min_pipe_transfer_size 

3761 and (p.src.is_nonlocal or p.dst.is_nonlocal) 

3762 and self.is_program_available("zstd", loc) 

3763 ): 

3764 return shlex.join([p.compression_program] + p.compression_program_opts) 

3765 else: 

3766 return "cat" 

3767 

3768 def decompress_cmd(self, loc: str, size_estimate_bytes: int) -> str: 

3769 p = self.params 

3770 if ( 

3771 size_estimate_bytes >= p.min_pipe_transfer_size 

3772 and (p.src.is_nonlocal or p.dst.is_nonlocal) 

3773 and self.is_program_available("zstd", loc) 

3774 ): 

3775 return shlex.join([p.compression_program, "-dc"]) 

3776 else: 

3777 return "cat" 

3778 

3779 worker_thread_number_regex: re.Pattern = re.compile(r"ThreadPoolExecutor-\d+_(\d+)") 

3780 

3781 def pv_cmd( 

3782 self, loc: str, size_estimate_bytes: int, size_estimate_human: str, disable_progress_bar: bool = False 

3783 ) -> str: 

3784 """If pv command is on the PATH, monitors the progress of data transfer from 'zfs send' to 'zfs receive'. 

3785 Progress can be viewed via "tail -f $pv_log_file" aka tail -f ~/bzfs-logs/current.pv or similar.""" 

3786 p = self.params 

3787 if self.is_program_available("pv", loc): 3787 ↛ 3809line 3787 didn't jump to line 3809 because the condition on line 3787 was always true

3788 size = f"--size={size_estimate_bytes}" 

3789 if disable_progress_bar or size_estimate_bytes == 0: 3789 ↛ 3790line 3789 didn't jump to line 3790 because the condition on line 3789 was never true

3790 size = "" 

3791 pv_log_file = p.log_params.pv_log_file 

3792 thread_name = threading.current_thread().name 

3793 if match := Job.worker_thread_number_regex.fullmatch(thread_name): 3793 ↛ 3794line 3793 didn't jump to line 3794 because the condition on line 3793 was never true

3794 worker = int(match.group(1)) 

3795 if worker > 0: 

3796 pv_log_file += pv_file_thread_separator + f"{worker:04}" 

3797 if self.is_first_replication_task.get_and_set(False): 3797 ↛ 3801line 3797 didn't jump to line 3801 because the condition on line 3797 was always true

3798 if self.isatty and not p.quiet: 3798 ↛ 3799line 3798 didn't jump to line 3799 because the condition on line 3798 was never true

3799 self.progress_reporter.start() 

3800 self.replication_start_time_nanos = time.monotonic_ns() 

3801 if self.isatty and not p.quiet: 3801 ↛ 3802line 3801 didn't jump to line 3802 because the condition on line 3801 was never true

3802 self.progress_reporter.enqueue_pv_log_file(pv_log_file) 

3803 pv_program_opts = [p.pv_program] + p.pv_program_opts 

3804 if self.progress_update_intervals is not None: # for testing 3804 ↛ 3805line 3804 didn't jump to line 3805 because the condition on line 3804 was never true

3805 pv_program_opts += [f"--interval={self.progress_update_intervals[0]}"] 

3806 pv_program_opts += ["--force", f"--name={size_estimate_human}"] + ([size] if size else []) 

3807 return f"LC_ALL=C {shlex.join(pv_program_opts)} 2>> {shlex.quote(pv_log_file)}" 

3808 else: 

3809 return "cat" 

3810 

3811 def run_ssh_command( 

3812 self, 

3813 remote: Remote, 

3814 level: int = -1, 

3815 is_dry: bool = False, 

3816 check: bool = True, 

3817 print_stdout: bool = False, 

3818 print_stderr: bool = True, 

3819 cmd: Optional[List[str]] = None, 

3820 ) -> str: 

3821 """Runs the given cmd via ssh on the given remote, and returns stdout. The full command is the concatenation 

3822 of both the command to run on the localhost in order to talk to the remote host ($remote.local_ssh_command()) 

3823 and the command to run on the given remote host ($cmd).""" 

3824 level = level if level >= 0 else logging.INFO 

3825 assert cmd is not None and isinstance(cmd, list) and len(cmd) > 0 

3826 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

3827 quoted_cmd = [shlex.quote(arg) for arg in cmd] 

3828 conn_pool: ConnectionPool = p.connection_pools[remote.location].pool(SHARED) 

3829 conn: Connection = conn_pool.get_connection() 

3830 try: 

3831 ssh_cmd: List[str] = conn.ssh_cmd 

3832 if remote.ssh_user_host != "": 

3833 self.refresh_ssh_connection_if_necessary(remote, conn) 

3834 cmd = quoted_cmd 

3835 msg = "Would execute: %s" if is_dry else "Executing: %s" 

3836 log.log(level, msg, list_formatter(conn.ssh_cmd_quoted + quoted_cmd, lstrip=True)) 

3837 if is_dry: 

3838 return "" 

3839 try: 

3840 process = subprocess_run( 

3841 ssh_cmd + cmd, stdin=DEVNULL, stdout=PIPE, stderr=PIPE, text=True, timeout=self.timeout(), check=check 

3842 ) 

3843 except (subprocess.CalledProcessError, subprocess.TimeoutExpired, UnicodeDecodeError) as e: 

3844 if not isinstance(e, UnicodeDecodeError): 

3845 xprint(log, stderr_to_str(e.stdout), run=print_stdout, end="") 

3846 xprint(log, stderr_to_str(e.stderr), run=print_stderr, end="") 

3847 raise 

3848 else: 

3849 xprint(log, process.stdout, run=print_stdout, end="") 

3850 xprint(log, process.stderr, run=print_stderr, end="") 

3851 return process.stdout # type: ignore[no-any-return] # need to ignore on python <= 3.8 

3852 finally: 

3853 conn_pool.return_connection(conn) 

3854 

3855 def try_ssh_command( 

3856 self, 

3857 remote: Remote, 

3858 level: int, 

3859 is_dry: bool = False, 

3860 print_stdout: bool = False, 

3861 cmd: Optional[List[str]] = None, 

3862 exists: bool = True, 

3863 error_trigger: Optional[str] = None, 

3864 ) -> Optional[str]: 

3865 """Convenience method that helps retry/react to a dataset or pool that potentially doesn't exist anymore.""" 

3866 assert cmd is not None and isinstance(cmd, list) and len(cmd) > 0 

3867 log = self.params.log 

3868 try: 

3869 self.maybe_inject_error(cmd=cmd, error_trigger=error_trigger) 

3870 return self.run_ssh_command(remote, level=level, is_dry=is_dry, print_stdout=print_stdout, cmd=cmd) 

3871 except (subprocess.CalledProcessError, UnicodeDecodeError) as e: 

3872 if not isinstance(e, UnicodeDecodeError): 

3873 stderr = stderr_to_str(e.stderr) 

3874 if exists and ( 

3875 ": dataset does not exist" in stderr 

3876 or ": filesystem does not exist" in stderr # solaris 11.4.0 

3877 or ": does not exist" in stderr # solaris 11.4.0 'zfs send' with missing snapshot 

3878 or ": no such pool" in stderr 

3879 ): 

3880 return None 

3881 log.warning("%s", stderr.rstrip()) 

3882 raise RetryableError("Subprocess failed") from e 

3883 

3884 def refresh_ssh_connection_if_necessary(self, remote: Remote, conn: "Connection") -> None: 

3885 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

3886 if remote.ssh_user_host == "": 3886 ↛ 3887line 3886 didn't jump to line 3887 because the condition on line 3886 was never true

3887 return # we're in local mode; no ssh required 

3888 if not self.is_program_available("ssh", "local"): 3888 ↛ 3889line 3888 didn't jump to line 3889 because the condition on line 3888 was never true

3889 die(f"{p.ssh_program} CLI is not available to talk to remote host. Install {p.ssh_program} first!") 

3890 if not remote.reuse_ssh_connection: 3890 ↛ 3891line 3890 didn't jump to line 3891 because the condition on line 3890 was never true

3891 return 

3892 # Performance: reuse ssh connection for low latency startup of frequent ssh invocations via the 'ssh -S' and 

3893 # 'ssh -S -M -oControlPersist=60s' options. See https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/OpenSSH/Cookbook/Multiplexing 

3894 control_persist_limit_nanos = (self.control_persist_secs - self.control_persist_margin_secs) * 1_000_000_000 

3895 with conn.lock: 

3896 if time.monotonic_ns() - conn.last_refresh_time < control_persist_limit_nanos: 3896 ↛ 3897line 3896 didn't jump to line 3897 because the condition on line 3896 was never true

3897 return # ssh master is alive, reuse its TCP connection (this is the common case & the ultra-fast path) 

3898 ssh_cmd = conn.ssh_cmd 

3899 ssh_socket_cmd = ssh_cmd[0:-1] # omit trailing ssh_user_host 

3900 ssh_socket_cmd += ["-O", "check", remote.ssh_user_host] 

3901 # extend lifetime of ssh master by $control_persist_secs via 'ssh -O check' if master is still running. 

3902 # 'ssh -S /path/to/socket -O check' doesn't talk over the network, hence is still a low latency fast path. 

3903 t = self.timeout() 

3904 if subprocess_run(ssh_socket_cmd, stdin=DEVNULL, stdout=PIPE, stderr=PIPE, text=True, timeout=t).returncode == 0: 3904 ↛ 3905line 3904 didn't jump to line 3905 because the condition on line 3904 was never true

3905 log.log(log_trace, "ssh connection is alive: %s", list_formatter(ssh_socket_cmd)) 

3906 else: # ssh master is not alive; start a new master: 

3907 log.log(log_trace, "ssh connection is not yet alive: %s", list_formatter(ssh_socket_cmd)) 

3908 control_persist_secs = self.control_persist_secs 

3909 if "-v" in remote.ssh_extra_opts: 3909 ↛ 3913line 3909 didn't jump to line 3913 because the condition on line 3909 was always true

3910 # Unfortunately, with `ssh -v` (debug mode), the ssh master won’t background; instead it stays in the 

3911 # foreground and blocks until the ControlPersist timer expires (90 secs). To make progress earlier we ... 

3912 control_persist_secs = min(control_persist_secs, 1) # tell ssh to block as briefly as possible (1 sec) 

3913 ssh_socket_cmd = ssh_cmd[0:-1] # omit trailing ssh_user_host 

3914 ssh_socket_cmd += ["-M", f"-oControlPersist={control_persist_secs}s", remote.ssh_user_host, "exit"] 

3915 log.log(log_trace, "Executing: %s", list_formatter(ssh_socket_cmd)) 

3916 process = subprocess_run(ssh_socket_cmd, stdin=DEVNULL, stderr=PIPE, text=True, timeout=self.timeout()) 

3917 if process.returncode != 0: 3917 ↛ 3918line 3917 didn't jump to line 3918 because the condition on line 3917 was never true

3918 log.error("%s", process.stderr.rstrip()) 

3919 die( 

3920 f"Cannot ssh into remote host via '{' '.join(ssh_socket_cmd)}'. Fix ssh configuration " 

3921 f"first, considering diagnostic log file output from running {prog_name} with: -v -v -v" 

3922 ) 

3923 conn.last_refresh_time = time.monotonic_ns() 

3924 

3925 def timeout(self) -> Optional[float]: 

3926 """Raises TimeoutExpired if necessary, else returns the number of seconds left until timeout is to occur.""" 

3927 timeout_nanos = self.timeout_nanos 

3928 if timeout_nanos is None: 3928 ↛ 3930line 3928 didn't jump to line 3930 because the condition on line 3928 was always true

3929 return None # never raise a timeout 

3930 delta_nanos = timeout_nanos - time.monotonic_ns() 

3931 if delta_nanos <= 0: 

3932 assert self.params.timeout_nanos is not None 

3933 raise subprocess.TimeoutExpired(prog_name + "_timeout", timeout=self.params.timeout_nanos / 1_000_000_000) 

3934 return delta_nanos / 1_000_000_000 # seconds 

3935 

3936 def maybe_inject_error(self, cmd: List[str], error_trigger: Optional[str] = None) -> None: 

3937 """For testing only; for unit tests to simulate errors during replication and test correct handling of them.""" 

3938 if error_trigger: 

3939 counter = self.error_injection_triggers.get("before") 

3940 if counter and self.decrement_injection_counter(counter, error_trigger): 

3941 try: 

3942 raise CalledProcessError(returncode=1, cmd=" ".join(cmd), stderr=error_trigger + ":dataset is busy") 

3943 except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e: 

3944 if error_trigger.startswith("retryable_"): 

3945 raise RetryableError("Subprocess failed") from e 

3946 else: 

3947 raise 

3948 

3949 def maybe_inject_delete(self, remote: Remote, dataset: str, delete_trigger: str) -> None: 

3950 """For testing only; for unit tests to delete datasets during replication and test correct handling of that.""" 

3951 assert delete_trigger 

3952 counter = self.delete_injection_triggers.get("before") 

3953 if counter and self.decrement_injection_counter(counter, delete_trigger): 

3954 p = self.params 

3955 cmd = p.split_args(f"{remote.sudo} {p.zfs_program} destroy -r", p.force_unmount, p.force_hard, dataset or "") 

3956 self.run_ssh_command(remote, log_debug, print_stdout=True, cmd=cmd) 

3957 

3958 def maybe_inject_params(self, error_trigger: str) -> None: 

3959 """For testing only; for unit tests to simulate errors during replication and test correct handling of them.""" 

3960 assert error_trigger 

3961 counter = self.error_injection_triggers.get("before") 

3962 if counter and self.decrement_injection_counter(counter, error_trigger): 

3963 self.inject_params = self.param_injection_triggers[error_trigger] 

3964 elif error_trigger in self.param_injection_triggers: 

3965 self.inject_params = {} 

3966 

3967 def decrement_injection_counter(self, counter: Counter, trigger: str) -> bool: 

3968 """For testing only.""" 

3969 with self.injection_lock: 

3970 if counter[trigger] <= 0: 

3971 return False 

3972 counter[trigger] -= 1 

3973 return True 

3974 

3975 @staticmethod 

3976 def squote(remote: Remote, arg: str) -> str: 

3977 return arg if remote.ssh_user_host == "" else shlex.quote(arg) 

3978 

3979 @staticmethod 

3980 def dquote(arg: str) -> str: 

3981 """shell-escapes double quotes and dollar and backticks, then surrounds with double quotes.""" 

3982 return '"' + arg.replace('"', '\\"').replace("$", "\\$").replace("`", "\\`") + '"' 

3983 

3984 def filter_datasets(self, remote: Remote, sorted_datasets: List[str]) -> List[str]: 

3985 """Returns all datasets (and their descendants) that match at least one of the include regexes but none of the 

3986 exclude regexes. Assumes the list of input datasets is sorted. The list of output datasets will be sorted too.""" 

3987 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

3988 results = [] 

3989 for i, dataset in enumerate(sorted_datasets): 

3990 if i == 0 and p.skip_parent: 3990 ↛ 3991line 3990 didn't jump to line 3991 because the condition on line 3990 was never true

3991 continue 

3992 rel_dataset = relativize_dataset(dataset, remote.root_dataset) 

3993 if rel_dataset.startswith("/"): 3993 ↛ 3994line 3993 didn't jump to line 3994 because the condition on line 3993 was never true

3994 rel_dataset = rel_dataset[1:] # strip leading '/' char if any 

3995 if is_included(rel_dataset, p.include_dataset_regexes, p.exclude_dataset_regexes): 3995 ↛ 3996line 3995 didn't jump to line 3996 because the condition on line 3995 was never true

3996 results.append(dataset) 

3997 log.debug("Including b/c dataset regex: %s", dataset) 

3998 else: 

3999 log.debug("Excluding b/c dataset regex: %s", dataset) 

4000 if p.exclude_dataset_property: 4000 ↛ 4001line 4000 didn't jump to line 4001 because the condition on line 4000 was never true

4001 results = self.filter_datasets_by_exclude_property(remote, results) 

4002 is_debug = p.log.isEnabledFor(log_debug) 

4003 for dataset in results: 4003 ↛ 4004line 4003 didn't jump to line 4004 because the loop on line 4003 never started

4004 if is_debug: 

4005 log.debug("Finally included %s dataset: %s", remote.location, dataset) 

4006 if self.is_test_mode: 4006 ↛ 4009line 4006 didn't jump to line 4009 because the condition on line 4006 was never true

4007 # Asserts the following: If a dataset is excluded its descendants are automatically excluded too, and this 

4008 # decision is never reconsidered even for the descendants because exclude takes precedence over include. 

4009 resultset = set(results) 

4010 root_datasets = [dataset for dataset in results if os.path.dirname(dataset) not in resultset] # have no parent 

4011 for root in root_datasets: # each root is not a descendant of another dataset 

4012 assert not any(is_descendant(root, of_root_dataset=dataset) for dataset in results if dataset != root) 

4013 for dataset in results: # each dataset belongs to a subtree rooted at one of the roots 

4014 assert any(is_descendant(dataset, of_root_dataset=root) for root in root_datasets) 

4015 return results 

4016 

4017 def filter_datasets_by_exclude_property(self, remote: Remote, sorted_datasets: List[str]) -> List[str]: 

4018 """Excludes datasets that are marked with a ZFS user property value that, in effect, says 'skip me'.""" 

4019 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

4020 results = [] 

4021 localhostname = None 

4022 skip_dataset = DONT_SKIP_DATASET 

4023 for dataset in sorted_datasets: 

4024 if is_descendant(dataset, of_root_dataset=skip_dataset): 

4025 # skip_dataset shall be ignored or has been deleted by some third party while we're running 

4026 continue # nothing to do anymore for this dataset subtree (note that datasets is sorted) 

4027 skip_dataset = DONT_SKIP_DATASET 

4028 # TODO perf: on zfs >= 2.3 use json via zfs list -j to safely merge all zfs list's into one 'zfs list' call 

4029 cmd = p.split_args(f"{p.zfs_program} list -t filesystem,volume -Hp -o {p.exclude_dataset_property}", dataset) 

4030 self.maybe_inject_delete(remote, dataset=dataset, delete_trigger="zfs_list_exclude_property") 

4031 property_value = self.try_ssh_command(remote, log_trace, cmd=cmd) 

4032 if property_value is None: 

4033 log.warning(f"Third party deleted {remote.location}: %s", dataset) 

4034 skip_dataset = dataset 

4035 else: 

4036 reason = "" 

4037 property_value = property_value.strip() 

4038 if not property_value or property_value == "-" or property_value.lower() == "true": 

4039 sync = True 

4040 elif property_value.lower() == "false": 

4041 sync = False 

4042 else: 

4043 localhostname = localhostname or socket.gethostname() 

4044 sync = any(localhostname == hostname.strip() for hostname in property_value.split(",")) 

4045 reason = f", localhostname: {localhostname}, hostnames: {property_value}" 

4046 

4047 if sync: 

4048 results.append(dataset) 

4049 log.debug("Including b/c dataset prop: %s%s", dataset, reason) 

4050 else: 

4051 skip_dataset = dataset 

4052 log.debug("Excluding b/c dataset prop: %s%s", dataset, reason) 

4053 return results 

4054 

4055 def filter_snapshots(self, basis_snapshots: List[str], all_except: bool = False) -> List[str]: 

4056 """Returns all snapshots that pass all include/exclude policies. 

4057 `all_except=False` returns snapshots *matching* the filters, 

4058 for example those that should be deleted if we are in "delete selected" mode. 

4059 `all_except=True` returns snapshots *not* matching the filters, 

4060 for example those that should be deleted if we are in "retain selected" mode.""" 

4061 

4062 def resolve_timerange(timerange: UnixTimeRange) -> UnixTimeRange: 

4063 assert timerange is not None 

4064 lo, hi = timerange 

4065 if isinstance(lo, timedelta): 

4066 lo = math.ceil(current_unixtime_in_secs - lo.total_seconds()) 

4067 if isinstance(hi, timedelta): 

4068 hi = math.ceil(current_unixtime_in_secs - hi.total_seconds()) 

4069 assert isinstance(lo, int) 

4070 assert isinstance(hi, int) 

4071 return (lo, hi) if lo <= hi else (hi, lo) 

4072 

4073 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

4074 current_unixtime_in_secs: float = p.create_src_snapshots_config.current_datetime.timestamp() 

4075 resultset = set() 

4076 for snapshot_filter in p.snapshot_filters: 

4077 snapshots = basis_snapshots 

4078 for _filter in snapshot_filter: 

4079 name = _filter.name 

4080 if name == snapshot_regex_filter_name: 4080 ↛ 4081line 4080 didn't jump to line 4081 because the condition on line 4080 was never true

4081 snapshots = self.filter_snapshots_by_regex(snapshots, regexes=_filter.options) 

4082 elif name == "include_snapshot_times": 

4083 timerange = resolve_timerange(_filter.timerange) if _filter.timerange is not None else _filter.timerange 

4084 snapshots = self.filter_snapshots_by_creation_time(snapshots, include_snapshot_times=timerange) 

4085 else: 

4086 assert name == "include_snapshot_times_and_ranks" 

4087 timerange = resolve_timerange(_filter.timerange) if _filter.timerange is not None else _filter.timerange 

4088 snapshots = self.filter_snapshots_by_creation_time_and_rank( 

4089 snapshots, include_snapshot_times=timerange, include_snapshot_ranks=_filter.options 

4090 ) 

4091 resultset.update(snapshots) # union 

4092 snapshots = [line for line in basis_snapshots if "#" in line or ((line in resultset) != all_except)] 

4093 is_debug = log.isEnabledFor(log_debug) 

4094 for snapshot in snapshots: 

4095 if is_debug: 

4096 log.debug("Finally included snapshot: %s", snapshot[snapshot.rindex("\t") + 1 :]) 

4097 return snapshots 

4098 

4099 def filter_snapshots_by_regex(self, snapshots: List[str], regexes: Tuple[RegexList, RegexList]) -> List[str]: 

4100 """Returns all snapshots that match at least one of the include regexes but none of the exclude regexes.""" 

4101 exclude_snapshot_regexes, include_snapshot_regexes = regexes 

4102 log = self.params.log 

4103 is_debug = log.isEnabledFor(log_debug) 

4104 results = [] 

4105 for snapshot in snapshots: 

4106 i = snapshot.find("@") # snapshot separator 

4107 if i < 0: 

4108 continue # retain bookmarks to help find common snapshots, apply filter only to snapshots 

4109 elif is_included(snapshot[i + 1 :], include_snapshot_regexes, exclude_snapshot_regexes): 

4110 results.append(snapshot) 

4111 if is_debug: 

4112 log.debug("Including b/c snapshot regex: %s", snapshot[snapshot.rindex("\t") + 1 :]) 

4113 else: 

4114 if is_debug: 

4115 log.debug("Excluding b/c snapshot regex: %s", snapshot[snapshot.rindex("\t") + 1 :]) 

4116 return results 

4117 

4118 def filter_snapshots_by_creation_time(self, snapshots: List[str], include_snapshot_times: UnixTimeRange) -> List[str]: 

4119 log = self.params.log 

4120 is_debug = log.isEnabledFor(log_debug) 

4121 lo_snaptime, hi_snaptime = include_snapshot_times or (0, unixtime_infinity_secs) 

4122 assert isinstance(lo_snaptime, int) 

4123 assert isinstance(hi_snaptime, int) 

4124 results = [] 

4125 for snapshot in snapshots: 

4126 if "@" not in snapshot: 

4127 continue # retain bookmarks to help find common snapshots, apply filter only to snapshots 

4128 elif lo_snaptime <= int(snapshot[0 : snapshot.index("\t")]) < hi_snaptime: 

4129 results.append(snapshot) 

4130 if is_debug: 

4131 log.debug("Including b/c creation time: %s", snapshot[snapshot.rindex("\t") + 1 :]) 

4132 else: 

4133 if is_debug: 

4134 log.debug("Excluding b/c creation time: %s", snapshot[snapshot.rindex("\t") + 1 :]) 

4135 return results 

4136 

4137 def filter_snapshots_by_creation_time_and_rank( 

4138 self, snapshots: List[str], include_snapshot_times: UnixTimeRange, include_snapshot_ranks: List[RankRange] 

4139 ) -> List[str]: 

4140 

4141 def get_idx(rank: Tuple[str, int, bool], n: int) -> int: 

4142 kind, num, is_percent = rank 

4143 m = round(n * num / 100) if is_percent else min(n, num) 

4144 assert kind == "latest" or kind == "oldest" 

4145 return m if kind == "oldest" else n - m 

4146 

4147 assert isinstance(include_snapshot_ranks, list) 

4148 assert len(include_snapshot_ranks) > 0 

4149 log = self.params.log 

4150 is_debug = log.isEnabledFor(log_debug) 

4151 lo_time, hi_time = include_snapshot_times or (0, unixtime_infinity_secs) 

4152 assert isinstance(lo_time, int) 

4153 assert isinstance(hi_time, int) 

4154 n = sum(1 for snapshot in snapshots if "@" in snapshot) 

4155 for rank_range in include_snapshot_ranks: 

4156 lo_rank, hi_rank = rank_range 

4157 lo = get_idx(lo_rank, n) 

4158 hi = get_idx(hi_rank, n) 

4159 lo, hi = (lo, hi) if lo <= hi else (hi, lo) 

4160 i = 0 

4161 results = [] 

4162 for snapshot in snapshots: 

4163 if "@" not in snapshot: 

4164 continue # retain bookmarks to help find common snapshots, apply filter only to snapshots 

4165 else: 

4166 msg = None 

4167 if lo <= i < hi: 

4168 msg = "Including b/c snapshot rank: %s" 

4169 elif lo_time <= int(snapshot[0 : snapshot.index("\t")]) < hi_time: 

4170 msg = "Including b/c creation time: %s" 

4171 if msg: 

4172 results.append(snapshot) 

4173 else: 

4174 msg = "Excluding b/c snapshot rank: %s" 

4175 if is_debug: 

4176 log.debug(msg, snapshot[snapshot.rindex("\t") + 1 :]) 

4177 i += 1 

4178 snapshots = results 

4179 n = hi - lo 

4180 return snapshots 

4181 

4182 def filter_properties( 

4183 self, props: Dict[str, Optional[str]], include_regexes: RegexList, exclude_regexes: RegexList 

4184 ) -> Dict[str, Optional[str]]: 

4185 """Returns ZFS props whose name matches at least one of the include regexes but none of the exclude regexes.""" 

4186 log = self.params.log 

4187 is_debug = log.isEnabledFor(log_debug) 

4188 results: Dict[str, Optional[str]] = {} 

4189 for propname, propvalue in props.items(): 

4190 if is_included(propname, include_regexes, exclude_regexes): 

4191 results[propname] = propvalue 

4192 if is_debug: 

4193 log.debug("Including b/c property regex: %s", propname) 

4194 else: 

4195 if is_debug: 

4196 log.debug("Excluding b/c property regex: %s", propname) 

4197 return results 

4198 

4199 def delete_snapshots(self, remote: Remote, dataset: str, snapshot_tags: List[str]) -> None: 

4200 if len(snapshot_tags) == 0: 

4201 return 

4202 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

4203 log.info(p.dry(f"Deleting {len(snapshot_tags)} snapshots within %s: %s"), dataset, snapshot_tags) 

4204 # delete snapshots in batches without creating a command line that's too big for the OS to handle 

4205 self.run_ssh_cmd_batched( 

4206 remote, 

4207 self.delete_snapshot_cmd(remote, dataset + "@"), 

4208 snapshot_tags, 

4209 lambda batch: self.delete_snapshot(remote, dataset, dataset + "@" + ",".join(batch)), 

4210 max_batch_items=1 if self.is_solaris_zfs(remote) else self.params.max_snapshots_per_minibatch_on_delete_snaps, 

4211 sep=",", 

4212 ) 

4213 

4214 def delete_snapshot(self, r: Remote, dataset: str, snapshots_to_delete: str) -> None: 

4215 p = self.params 

4216 cmd = self.delete_snapshot_cmd(r, snapshots_to_delete) 

4217 is_dry = p.dry_run and self.is_solaris_zfs(r) # solaris-11.4 knows no 'zfs destroy -n' flag 

4218 try: 

4219 self.maybe_inject_error(cmd=cmd, error_trigger="zfs_delete_snapshot") 

4220 self.run_ssh_command(r, log_debug, is_dry=is_dry, print_stdout=True, cmd=cmd) 

4221 except (subprocess.CalledProcessError, UnicodeDecodeError) as e: 

4222 stderr = stderr_to_str(e.stderr) if hasattr(e, "stderr") else "" 

4223 no_sleep = self.clear_resumable_recv_state_if_necessary(dataset, stderr) 

4224 # op isn't idempotent so retries regather current state from the start 

4225 raise RetryableError("Subprocess failed", no_sleep=no_sleep) from e 

4226 

4227 def delete_snapshot_cmd(self, r: Remote, snapshots_to_delete: str) -> List[str]: 

4228 p = self.params 

4229 return p.split_args( 

4230 f"{r.sudo} {p.zfs_program} destroy", p.force_hard, p.verbose_destroy, p.dry_run_destroy, snapshots_to_delete 

4231 ) 

4232 

4233 def delete_bookmarks(self, remote: Remote, dataset: str, snapshot_tags: List[str]) -> None: 

4234 if len(snapshot_tags) == 0: 

4235 return 

4236 # Unfortunately ZFS has no syntax yet to delete multiple bookmarks in a single CLI invocation 

4237 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

4238 log.info( 

4239 p.dry(f"Deleting {len(snapshot_tags)} bookmarks within %s: %s"), dataset, dataset + "#" + ",".join(snapshot_tags) 

4240 ) 

4241 cmd = p.split_args(f"{remote.sudo} {p.zfs_program} destroy") 

4242 self.run_ssh_cmd_parallel( 

4243 remote, 

4244 [(cmd, [f"{dataset}#{snapshot_tag}" for snapshot_tag in snapshot_tags])], 

4245 lambda _cmd, batch: self.try_ssh_command( 

4246 remote, log_debug, is_dry=p.dry_run, print_stdout=True, cmd=_cmd + batch, exists=False 

4247 ), 

4248 max_batch_items=1, 

4249 ) 

4250 

4251 def delete_datasets(self, remote: Remote, datasets: Iterable[str]) -> None: 

4252 """Deletes the given datasets via zfs destroy -r on the given remote.""" 

4253 # Impl is batch optimized to minimize CLI + network roundtrips: only need to run zfs destroy if previously 

4254 # destroyed dataset (within sorted datasets) is not a prefix (aka ancestor) of current dataset 

4255 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

4256 last_deleted_dataset = DONT_SKIP_DATASET 

4257 for dataset in sorted(datasets): 

4258 if is_descendant(dataset, of_root_dataset=last_deleted_dataset): 

4259 continue 

4260 log.info(p.dry("Deleting dataset tree: %s"), f"{dataset} ...") 

4261 cmd = p.split_args( 

4262 f"{remote.sudo} {p.zfs_program} destroy -r {p.force_unmount} {p.force_hard} {p.verbose_destroy}", 

4263 p.dry_run_destroy, 

4264 dataset, 

4265 ) 

4266 is_dry = p.dry_run and self.is_solaris_zfs(remote) # solaris-11.4 knows no 'zfs destroy -n' flag 

4267 self.run_ssh_command(remote, log_debug, is_dry=is_dry, print_stdout=True, cmd=cmd) 

4268 last_deleted_dataset = dataset 

4269 

4270 def create_zfs_filesystem(self, filesystem: str) -> None: 

4271 # zfs create -p -u $filesystem 

4272 # To ensure the filesystems that we create do not get mounted, we apply a separate 'zfs create -p -u' 

4273 # invocation for each non-existing ancestor. This is because a single 'zfs create -p -u' applies the '-u' 

4274 # part only to the immediate filesystem, rather than to the not-yet existing ancestors. 

4275 p = self.params 

4276 parent = "" 

4277 no_mount = "-u" if self.is_program_available(zfs_version_is_at_least_2_1_0, "dst") else "" 

4278 for component in filesystem.split("/"): 

4279 parent += component 

4280 if not self.dst_dataset_exists[parent]: 

4281 cmd = p.split_args(f"{p.dst.sudo} {p.zfs_program} create -p", no_mount, parent) 

4282 try: 

4283 self.run_ssh_command(p.dst, log_debug, is_dry=p.dry_run, print_stdout=True, cmd=cmd) 

4284 except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e: 

4285 # ignore harmless error caused by 'zfs create' without the -u flag, or by dataset already existing 

4286 if ( 

4287 "filesystem successfully created, but it may only be mounted by root" not in e.stderr 

4288 and "filesystem successfully created, but not mounted" not in e.stderr # SolarisZFS 

4289 and "dataset already exists" not in e.stderr 

4290 and "filesystem already exists" not in e.stderr # SolarisZFS? 

4291 ): 

4292 raise 

4293 if not p.dry_run: 

4294 self.dst_dataset_exists[parent] = True 

4295 parent += "/" 

4296 

4297 def create_zfs_bookmarks(self, remote: Remote, dataset: str, snapshots: List[str]) -> None: 

4298 """Creates bookmarks for the given snapshots, using the 'zfs bookmark' CLI.""" 

4299 # Unfortunately ZFS has no syntax yet to create multiple bookmarks in a single CLI invocation 

4300 p = self.params 

4301 

4302 def create_zfs_bookmark(cmd: List[str]) -> None: 

4303 snapshot = cmd[-1] 

4304 assert "@" in snapshot 

4305 bookmark_cmd = cmd + [replace_prefix(snapshot, old_prefix=f"{dataset}@", new_prefix=f"{dataset}#")] 

4306 try: 

4307 self.run_ssh_command(remote, log_debug, is_dry=p.dry_run, print_stderr=False, cmd=bookmark_cmd) 

4308 except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e: 

4309 # ignore harmless zfs error caused by bookmark with the same name already existing 

4310 if ": bookmark exists" not in e.stderr: 

4311 print(e.stderr, file=sys.stderr, end="") 

4312 raise 

4313 

4314 if p.create_bookmarks != "none" and self.are_bookmarks_enabled(remote): 

4315 cmd = p.split_args(f"{remote.sudo} {p.zfs_program} bookmark") 

4316 self.run_ssh_cmd_parallel( 

4317 remote, [(cmd, snapshots)], lambda _cmd, batch: create_zfs_bookmark(_cmd + batch), max_batch_items=1 

4318 ) 

4319 

4320 def estimate_send_size(self, remote: Remote, dst_dataset: str, recv_resume_token: Optional[str], *items: str) -> int: 

4321 """Estimates num bytes to transfer via 'zfs send'.""" 

4322 p = self.params 

4323 if p.no_estimate_send_size or self.is_solaris_zfs(remote): 

4324 return 0 # solaris-11.4 does not have a --parsable equivalent 

4325 zfs_send_program_opts = ["--parsable" if opt == "-P" else opt for opt in p.curr_zfs_send_program_opts] 

4326 zfs_send_program_opts = append_if_absent(zfs_send_program_opts, "-v", "-n", "--parsable") 

4327 if recv_resume_token: 

4328 zfs_send_program_opts = ["-Pnv", "-t", recv_resume_token] 

4329 items = () 

4330 cmd = p.split_args(f"{remote.sudo} {p.zfs_program} send", zfs_send_program_opts, items) 

4331 try: 

4332 lines = self.try_ssh_command(remote, log_trace, cmd=cmd) 

4333 except RetryableError as retryable_error: 

4334 assert retryable_error.__cause__ is not None 

4335 if recv_resume_token: 

4336 e = retryable_error.__cause__ 

4337 stderr = stderr_to_str(e.stderr) if hasattr(e, "stderr") else "" 

4338 retryable_error.no_sleep = self.clear_resumable_recv_state_if_necessary(dst_dataset, stderr) 

4339 # op isn't idempotent so retries regather current state from the start of replicate_dataset() 

4340 raise retryable_error 

4341 if lines is None: 

4342 return 0 # src dataset or snapshot has been deleted by third party 

4343 size = lines.splitlines()[-1] 

4344 assert size.startswith("size") 

4345 return int(size[size.index("\t") + 1 :]) 

4346 

4347 def dataset_regexes(self, datasets: List[str]) -> List[str]: 

4348 src, dst = self.params.src, self.params.dst 

4349 results = [] 

4350 for dataset in datasets: 4350 ↛ 4351line 4350 didn't jump to line 4351 because the loop on line 4350 never started

4351 if dataset.startswith("/"): 

4352 # it's an absolute dataset - convert it to a relative dataset 

4353 dataset = dataset[1:] 

4354 if is_descendant(dataset, of_root_dataset=src.root_dataset): 

4355 dataset = relativize_dataset(dataset, src.root_dataset) 

4356 elif is_descendant(dataset, of_root_dataset=dst.root_dataset): 

4357 dataset = relativize_dataset(dataset, dst.root_dataset) 

4358 else: 

4359 continue # ignore datasets that make no difference 

4360 if dataset.startswith("/"): 

4361 dataset = dataset[1:] 

4362 if dataset.endswith("/"): 

4363 dataset = dataset[0:-1] 

4364 if dataset: 

4365 regex = re.escape(dataset) 

4366 else: 

4367 regex = ".*" 

4368 results.append(regex) 

4369 return results 

4370 

4371 TRetryRun = TypeVar("TRetryRun") 

4372 

4373 def run_with_retries(self, policy: RetryPolicy, fn: Callable[..., TRetryRun], *args: Any, **kwargs: Any) -> TRetryRun: 

4374 """Runs the given function with the given arguments, and retries on failure as indicated by policy.""" 

4375 log = self.params.log 

4376 max_sleep_mark = policy.min_sleep_nanos 

4377 retry_count = 0 

4378 sysrandom = None 

4379 start_time_nanos = time.monotonic_ns() 

4380 while True: 

4381 try: 

4382 return fn(*args, **kwargs, retry=Retry(retry_count)) # Call the target function with provided args 

4383 except RetryableError as retryable_error: 

4384 elapsed_nanos = time.monotonic_ns() - start_time_nanos 

4385 if retry_count < policy.retries and elapsed_nanos < policy.max_elapsed_nanos: 

4386 retry_count += 1 

4387 if retryable_error.no_sleep and retry_count <= 1: 

4388 log.info(f"Retrying [{retry_count}/{policy.retries}] immediately ...") 

4389 else: # jitter: pick a random sleep duration within the range [min_sleep_nanos, max_sleep_mark] as delay 

4390 sysrandom = random.SystemRandom() if sysrandom is None else sysrandom 

4391 sleep_nanos = sysrandom.randint(policy.min_sleep_nanos, max_sleep_mark) 

4392 log.info(f"Retrying [{retry_count}/{policy.retries}] in {human_readable_duration(sleep_nanos)} ...") 

4393 time.sleep(sleep_nanos / 1_000_000_000) 

4394 max_sleep_mark = min(policy.max_sleep_nanos, 2 * max_sleep_mark) # exponential backoff with cap 

4395 else: 

4396 if policy.retries > 0: 

4397 log.warning( 

4398 f"Giving up because the last [{retry_count}/{policy.retries}] retries across " 

4399 f"[{elapsed_nanos // 1_000_000_000}/{policy.max_elapsed_nanos // 1_000_000_000}] " 

4400 "seconds for the current request failed!" 

4401 ) 

4402 assert retryable_error.__cause__ is not None 

4403 raise retryable_error.__cause__ from None 

4404 

4405 def incremental_send_steps_wrapper( 

4406 self, src_snapshots: List[str], src_guids: List[str], included_guids: Set[str], is_resume: bool 

4407 ) -> List[Tuple[str, str, str, List[str]]]: 

4408 force_convert_I_to_i = self.params.src.use_zfs_delegation and not getenv_bool("no_force_convert_I_to_i", True) 

4409 # force_convert_I_to_i == True implies that: 

4410 # If using 'zfs allow' delegation mechanism, force convert 'zfs send -I' to a series of 

4411 # 'zfs send -i' as a workaround for zfs issue https://github.com/openzfs/zfs/issues/16394 

4412 return self.incremental_send_steps(src_snapshots, src_guids, included_guids, is_resume, force_convert_I_to_i) 

4413 

4414 @staticmethod 

4415 def incremental_send_steps( 

4416 src_snapshots: List[str], src_guids: List[str], included_guids: Set[str], is_resume: bool, force_convert_I_to_i: bool 

4417 ) -> List[Tuple[str, str, str, List[str]]]: 

4418 """Computes steps to incrementally replicate the given src snapshots with the given src_guids such that we 

4419 include intermediate src snapshots that pass the policy specified by --{include,exclude}-snapshot-* 

4420 (represented here by included_guids), using an optimal series of -i/-I send/receive steps that skip 

4421 excluded src snapshots. The steps are optimal in the sense that no solution with fewer steps exists. A step 

4422 corresponds to a single ZFS send/receive operation. Fewer steps translate to better performance, especially 

4423 when sending many small snapshots. For example, 1 step that sends 100 small snapshots in a single operation is 

4424 much faster than 100 steps that each send only 1 such snapshot per ZFS send/receive operation. 

4425 Example: skip hourly snapshots and only include daily shapshots for replication 

4426 Example: [d1, h1, d2, d3, d4] (d is daily, h is hourly) --> [d1, d2, d3, d4] via 

4427 -i d1:d2 (i.e. exclude h1; '-i' and ':' indicate 'skip intermediate snapshots') 

4428 -I d2-d4 (i.e. also include d3; '-I' and '-' indicate 'include intermediate snapshots') 

4429 * The force_convert_I_to_i param is necessary as a work-around for https://github.com/openzfs/zfs/issues/16394 

4430 * The 'zfs send' CLI with a bookmark as starting snapshot does not (yet) support including intermediate 

4431 src_snapshots via -I flag per https://github.com/openzfs/zfs/issues/12415. Thus, if the replication source 

4432 is a bookmark we convert a -I step to a -i step followed by zero or more -i/-I steps. 

4433 * The is_resume param is necessary as 'zfs send -t' does not support sending more than a single snapshot 

4434 on resuming a previously interrupted 'zfs receive -s'. Thus, here too, we convert a -I step to a -i step 

4435 followed by zero or more -i/-I steps.""" 

4436 

4437 def append_run(i: int, label: str) -> int: 

4438 # step = ("-I", src_snapshots[start], src_snapshots[i], i - start) 

4439 # print(f"{label} {self.send_step_to_str(step)}") 

4440 is_not_resume = len(steps) > 0 or not is_resume 

4441 if i - start > 1 and (not force_convert_I_to_i) and "@" in src_snapshots[start] and is_not_resume: 

4442 steps.append(("-I", src_snapshots[start], src_snapshots[i], src_snapshots[start + 1 : i + 1])) 

4443 elif "@" in src_snapshots[start] and is_not_resume: 

4444 for j in range(start, i): # convert -I step to -i steps 

4445 steps.append(("-i", src_snapshots[j], src_snapshots[j + 1], src_snapshots[j + 1 : j + 2])) 

4446 else: # it's a bookmark src or zfs send -t; convert -I step to -i step followed by zero or more -i/-I steps 

4447 steps.append(("-i", src_snapshots[start], src_snapshots[start + 1], src_snapshots[start + 1 : start + 2])) 

4448 i = start + 1 

4449 return i - 1 

4450 

4451 assert len(src_guids) == len(src_snapshots) 

4452 assert len(included_guids) >= 0 

4453 steps = [] 

4454 guids = src_guids 

4455 n = len(guids) 

4456 i = 0 

4457 while i < n and guids[i] not in included_guids: # skip hourlies 

4458 i += 1 

4459 

4460 while i < n: 

4461 assert guids[i] in included_guids # it's a daily 

4462 start = i 

4463 i += 1 

4464 while i < n and guids[i] in included_guids: # skip dailies 

4465 i += 1 

4466 if i < n: 

4467 if i - start == 1: 

4468 # it's a single daily (that was already replicated) followed by an hourly 

4469 i += 1 

4470 while i < n and guids[i] not in included_guids: # skip hourlies 

4471 i += 1 

4472 if i < n: 

4473 assert start != i 

4474 step = ("-i", src_snapshots[start], src_snapshots[i], src_snapshots[i : i + 1]) 

4475 # print(f"r1 {self.send_step_to_str(step)}") 

4476 steps.append(step) 

4477 i -= 1 

4478 else: # it's a run of more than one daily 

4479 i -= 1 

4480 assert start != i 

4481 i = append_run(i, "r2") 

4482 else: # finish up run of trailing dailies 

4483 i -= 1 

4484 if start != i: 

4485 i = append_run(i, "r3") 

4486 i += 1 

4487 return steps 

4488 

4489 @staticmethod 

4490 def send_step_to_str(step: Tuple[str, str, str]) -> str: 

4491 # return str(step[1]) + ('-' if step[0] == '-I' else ':') + str(step[2]) 

4492 return str(step) 

4493 

4494 def zfs_set(self, properties: List[str], remote: Remote, dataset: str) -> None: 

4495 """Applies the given property key=value pairs via 'zfs set' CLI to the given dataset on the given remote.""" 

4496 p = self.params 

4497 if len(properties) == 0: 

4498 return 

4499 # set properties in batches without creating a command line that's too big for the OS to handle 

4500 cmd = p.split_args(f"{remote.sudo} {p.zfs_program} set") 

4501 self.run_ssh_cmd_batched( 

4502 remote, 

4503 cmd, 

4504 properties, 

4505 lambda batch: self.run_ssh_command( 

4506 remote, log_debug, is_dry=p.dry_run, print_stdout=True, cmd=cmd + batch + [dataset] 

4507 ), 

4508 max_batch_items=1 if self.is_solaris_zfs(remote) else 2**29, # solaris-11.4 CLI doesn't accept multiple props 

4509 ) 

4510 

4511 def zfs_get( 

4512 self, 

4513 remote: Remote, 

4514 dataset: str, 

4515 sources: str, 

4516 output_columns: str, 

4517 propnames: str, 

4518 splitlines: bool, 

4519 props_cache: Dict[Tuple[str, str, str], Dict[str, Optional[str]]], 

4520 ) -> Dict[str, Optional[str]]: 

4521 """Returns the results of 'zfs get' CLI on the given dataset on the given remote.""" 

4522 if not propnames: 

4523 return {} 

4524 p = self.params 

4525 cache_key = (sources, output_columns, propnames) 

4526 props = props_cache.get(cache_key) 

4527 if props is None: 

4528 cmd = p.split_args(f"{p.zfs_program} get -Hp -o {output_columns} -s {sources} {propnames}", dataset) 

4529 lines = self.run_ssh_command(remote, log_trace, cmd=cmd) 

4530 is_name_value_pair = "," in output_columns 

4531 props = {} 

4532 # if not splitlines: omit single trailing newline that was appended by 'zfs get' CLI 

4533 for line in lines.splitlines() if splitlines else [lines[0:-1]]: 

4534 if is_name_value_pair: 

4535 propname, propvalue = line.split("\t", 1) 

4536 props[propname] = propvalue 

4537 else: 

4538 props[line] = None 

4539 props_cache[cache_key] = props 

4540 return props 

4541 

4542 def add_recv_property_options( 

4543 self, 

4544 full_send: bool, 

4545 recv_opts: List[str], 

4546 dataset: str, 

4547 cache: Dict[Tuple[str, str, str], Dict[str, Optional[str]]], 

4548 ) -> Tuple[List[str], List[str]]: 

4549 """Reads the ZFS properties of the given src dataset. Appends zfs recv -o and -x values to recv_opts according to CLI 

4550 params, and returns properties to explicitly set on the dst dataset after 'zfs receive' completes successfully.""" 

4551 p = self.params 

4552 set_opts = [] 

4553 ox_names = p.zfs_recv_ox_names.copy() 

4554 for config in [p.zfs_recv_o_config, p.zfs_recv_x_config, p.zfs_set_config]: 

4555 if len(config.include_regexes) == 0: 

4556 continue # this is the default - it's an instant noop 

4557 if (full_send and "full" in config.targets) or (not full_send and "incremental" in config.targets): 

4558 # 'zfs get' uses newline as record separator and tab as separator between output columns. A ZFS user property 

4559 # may contain newline and tab characters (indeed anything). Together, this means that there is no reliable 

4560 # way to determine where a record ends and the next record starts when listing multiple arbitrary records in 

4561 # a single 'zfs get' call. Therefore, here we use a separate 'zfs get' call for each ZFS user property. 

4562 # TODO: perf: on zfs >= 2.3 use json via zfs get -j to safely merge all zfs gets into one 'zfs get' call 

4563 try: 

4564 props_any = self.zfs_get(p.src, dataset, config.sources, "property", "all", True, cache) 

4565 props_filtered = self.filter_properties(props_any, config.include_regexes, config.exclude_regexes) 

4566 user_propnames = [name for name in props_filtered.keys() if ":" in name] 

4567 sys_propnames = ",".join([name for name in props_filtered.keys() if ":" not in name]) 

4568 props = self.zfs_get(p.src, dataset, config.sources, "property,value", sys_propnames, True, cache) 

4569 for propnames in user_propnames: 

4570 props.update(self.zfs_get(p.src, dataset, config.sources, "property,value", propnames, False, cache)) 

4571 except (subprocess.CalledProcessError, UnicodeDecodeError) as e: 

4572 raise RetryableError("Subprocess failed") from e 

4573 for propname in sorted(props.keys()): 

4574 if config is p.zfs_recv_o_config: 

4575 if propname not in ox_names: 

4576 recv_opts.append("-o") 

4577 recv_opts.append(f"{propname}={props[propname]}") 

4578 ox_names.add(propname) 

4579 elif config is p.zfs_recv_x_config: 

4580 if propname not in ox_names: 

4581 recv_opts.append("-x") 

4582 recv_opts.append(propname) 

4583 ox_names.add(propname) 

4584 else: 

4585 set_opts.append(f"{propname}={props[propname]}") 

4586 return recv_opts, set_opts 

4587 

4588 @staticmethod 

4589 def recv_option_property_names(recv_opts: List[str]) -> Set[str]: 

4590 """Extracts -o and -x property names that are already specified on the command line. This can be used to check 

4591 for dupes because 'zfs receive' does not accept multiple -o or -x options with the same property name.""" 

4592 propnames = set() 

4593 i = 0 

4594 n = len(recv_opts) 

4595 while i < n: 

4596 stripped = recv_opts[i].strip() 

4597 if stripped in ("-o", "-x"): 

4598 i += 1 

4599 if i == n or recv_opts[i].strip() in ("-o", "-x"): 

4600 die(f"Missing value for {stripped} option in --zfs-recv-program-opt(s): {' '.join(recv_opts)}") 

4601 propnames.add(recv_opts[i] if stripped == "-x" else recv_opts[i].split("=", 1)[0]) 

4602 i += 1 

4603 return propnames 

4604 

4605 def root_datasets_if_recursive_zfs_snapshot_is_possible( 

4606 self, datasets: List[str], basis_datasets: List[str] 

4607 ) -> Optional[List[str]]: 

4608 """Returns the root datasets within the (filtered) `datasets` list if no incompatible pruning is detected. A dataset 

4609 within `datasets` is considered a root dataset if it has no parent, i.e. it is not a descendant of any dataset in 

4610 `datasets`. Returns `None` if any (unfiltered) dataset in `basis_dataset` that is a descendant of at least one of 

4611 the root datasets is missing in `datasets`, indicating that --include/exclude-dataset* or the snapshot schedule 

4612 have pruned a dataset in a way that is incompatible with 'zfs snapshot -r' CLI semantics, thus requiring a switch 

4613 to the non-recursive 'zfs snapshot snapshot1 .. snapshot N' CLI flavor. 

4614 Assumes that set(datasets).issubset(set(basis_datasets)). Also assumes that datasets and basis_datasets are both 

4615 sorted (and thus the output root_datasets is sorted too), which is why this algorithm is efficient - O(N) time 

4616 complexity. The impl is akin to the merge algorithm of a merge sort, adapted to our specific use case. 

4617 See root_datasets_if_recursive_zfs_snapshot_is_possible_slow_but_correct() in the unit test suite for an alternative 

4618 impl that's easier to grok.""" 

4619 datasets_set: Set[str] = set(datasets) 

4620 root_datasets: List[str] = self.find_root_datasets(datasets) 

4621 len_root_datasets = len(root_datasets) 

4622 len_basis_datasets = len(basis_datasets) 

4623 i, j = 0, 0 

4624 while i < len_root_datasets and j < len_basis_datasets: # walk and "merge" both sorted lists, in sync 

4625 if basis_datasets[j] < root_datasets[i]: # irrelevant subtree? 

4626 j += 1 # move to the next basis_src_dataset 

4627 elif is_descendant(basis_datasets[j], of_root_dataset=root_datasets[i]): # relevant subtree? 

4628 if basis_datasets[j] not in datasets_set: # was dataset chopped off by schedule or --incl/exclude-dataset*? 

4629 return None # detected filter pruning that is incompatible with 'zfs snapshot -r' 

4630 j += 1 # move to the next basis_src_dataset 

4631 else: 

4632 i += 1 # move to next root dataset; no need to check root_datasets that are nomore (or not yet) reachable 

4633 return root_datasets 

4634 

4635 @staticmethod 

4636 def find_root_datasets(sorted_datasets: List[str]) -> List[str]: 

4637 """Returns the roots of the subtrees in the (sorted) input datasets. The output root dataset list is sorted, too. 

4638 A dataset is a root dataset if it has no parent, i.e. it is not a descendant of any dataset in the input datasets.""" 

4639 root_datasets = [] 

4640 skip_dataset = DONT_SKIP_DATASET 

4641 for dataset in sorted_datasets: 

4642 if is_descendant(dataset, of_root_dataset=skip_dataset): 

4643 continue 

4644 skip_dataset = dataset 

4645 root_datasets.append(dataset) 

4646 return root_datasets 

4647 

4648 def find_datasets_to_snapshot(self, sorted_datasets: List[str]) -> Dict[SnapshotLabel, List[str]]: 

4649 """Given a (sorted) list of source datasets, returns a dict where the key is a snapshot name (aka SnapshotLabel, e.g. 

4650 bzfs_2024-11-06_08:30:05_hourly) and the value is the (sorted) (sub)list of datasets for which a snapshot needs to 

4651 be created with that name, because these datasets are due per the schedule, either because the 'creation' time of 

4652 their most recent snapshot with that name pattern is now too old, or such a snapshot does not even exist. 

4653 The baseline implementation uses the 'zfs list -t snapshot' CLI to find the most recent snapshots, which is simple 

4654 but doesn't scale well with the number of snapshots, at least if the goal is to take snapshots every second. 

4655 An alternative, much more scalable, implementation queries the standard ZFS "snapshots_changed" dataset property 

4656 (requires zfs >= 2.2.0), in combination with a local cache that stores this property, as well as the creation time 

4657 of the most recent snapshot, for each SnapshotLabel and each dataset.""" 

4658 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

4659 src, config = p.src, p.create_src_snapshots_config 

4660 datasets_to_snapshot: Dict[SnapshotLabel, List[str]] = defaultdict(list) 

4661 is_caching = False 

4662 msgs = [] 

4663 

4664 def create_snapshot_if_latest_is_too_old( 

4665 datasets_to_snapshot: Dict[SnapshotLabel, List[str]], dataset: str, label: SnapshotLabel, creation_unixtime: int 

4666 ) -> None: 

4667 """Schedules creation of a snapshot for the given label if the label's existing latest snapshot is too old.""" 

4668 creation_dt = datetime.fromtimestamp(creation_unixtime, tz=config.tz) 

4669 log.log(log_trace, "Latest snapshot creation: %s for %s", creation_dt, label) 

4670 duration_amount, duration_unit = config.suffix_durations[label.suffix] 

4671 next_event_dt = round_datetime_up_to_duration_multiple( 

4672 creation_dt + timedelta(microseconds=1), duration_amount, duration_unit, config.anchors 

4673 ) 

4674 msg = "" 

4675 if config.current_datetime >= next_event_dt: 

4676 datasets_to_snapshot[label].append(dataset) # mark it as scheduled for snapshot creation 

4677 msg = " has passed" 

4678 msgs.append((next_event_dt, dataset, label, msg)) 

4679 if is_caching and not p.dry_run: # update cache with latest state from 'zfs list -t snapshot' 

4680 cache_file = self.last_modified_cache_file(src, dataset, label) 

4681 set_last_modification_time_safe(cache_file, unixtime_in_secs=creation_unixtime, if_more_recent=True) 

4682 

4683 labels = [] 

4684 config_labels: List[SnapshotLabel] = config.snapshot_labels() 

4685 for label in config_labels: 

4686 _duration_amount, _duration_unit = config.suffix_durations[label.suffix] 

4687 if _duration_amount == 0 or config.create_src_snapshots_even_if_not_due: 

4688 datasets_to_snapshot[label] = sorted_datasets # take snapshot regardless of creation time of existing snaps 

4689 else: 

4690 labels.append(label) 

4691 if len(labels) == 0: 

4692 return datasets_to_snapshot # nothing more TBD 

4693 

4694 # satisfy request from local cache as much as possible 

4695 cached_datasets_to_snapshot: Dict[SnapshotLabel, List[str]] = defaultdict(list) 

4696 if self.is_caching_snapshots(src): 

4697 sorted_datasets_todo = [] 

4698 for dataset in sorted_datasets: 

4699 cached_snapshots_changed: int = self.cache_get_snapshots_changed(self.last_modified_cache_file(src, dataset)) 

4700 if cached_snapshots_changed == 0: 

4701 sorted_datasets_todo.append(dataset) # request cannot be answered from cache 

4702 continue 

4703 if cached_snapshots_changed != self.src_properties[dataset][SNAPSHOTS_CHANGED]: # get that prop "for free" 

4704 self.invalidate_last_modified_cache_dataset(dataset) 

4705 sorted_datasets_todo.append(dataset) # request cannot be answered from cache 

4706 continue 

4707 creation_unixtimes = [] 

4708 for label in labels: 

4709 creation_unixtime = self.cache_get_snapshots_changed(self.last_modified_cache_file(src, dataset, label)) 

4710 if creation_unixtime == 0: 

4711 sorted_datasets_todo.append(dataset) # request cannot be answered from cache 

4712 break 

4713 creation_unixtimes.append(creation_unixtime) 

4714 if len(creation_unixtimes) == len(labels): 

4715 for j, label in enumerate(labels): 

4716 create_snapshot_if_latest_is_too_old( 

4717 cached_datasets_to_snapshot, dataset, label, creation_unixtimes[j] 

4718 ) 

4719 sorted_datasets = sorted_datasets_todo 

4720 

4721 def create_snapshot_fn(i: int, creation_unixtime_secs: int, dataset: str, snapshot: str) -> None: 

4722 create_snapshot_if_latest_is_too_old(datasets_to_snapshot, dataset, labels[i], creation_unixtime_secs) 

4723 

4724 def on_finish_dataset(dataset: str) -> None: 

4725 if is_caching and not p.dry_run: 

4726 set_last_modification_time_safe( 

4727 self.last_modified_cache_file(src, dataset), 

4728 unixtime_in_secs=int(self.src_properties[dataset][SNAPSHOTS_CHANGED]), 

4729 if_more_recent=True, 

4730 ) 

4731 

4732 # fallback to 'zfs list -t snapshot' for any remaining datasets, as these couldn't be satisfied from local cache 

4733 is_caching = self.is_caching_snapshots(src) 

4734 datasets_without_snapshots = self.handle_minmax_snapshots( 

4735 src, sorted_datasets, labels, fn_latest=create_snapshot_fn, fn_on_finish_dataset=on_finish_dataset 

4736 ) 

4737 for lbl in labels: # merge (sorted) results from local cache + 'zfs list -t snapshot' into (sorted) combined result 

4738 datasets_to_snapshot[lbl].sort() 

4739 if datasets_without_snapshots or (lbl in cached_datasets_to_snapshot): # +take snaps for snapshot-less datasets 

4740 datasets_to_snapshot[lbl] = list( # inputs to merge() are sorted, and outputs are sorted too 

4741 heapq.merge(datasets_to_snapshot[lbl], cached_datasets_to_snapshot[lbl], datasets_without_snapshots) 

4742 ) 

4743 msgs.sort() 

4744 prefx = "Next scheduled snapshot time: " 

4745 text = "\n".join(f"{prefx}{next_event_dt} for {dataset}@{label}{msg}" for next_event_dt, dataset, label, msg in msgs) 

4746 if len(text) > 0: 

4747 log.info("Next scheduled snapshot times ...\n%s", text) 

4748 # sort to ensure that we take snapshots for dailies before hourlies, and so on 

4749 label_indexes = {label: k for k, label in enumerate(config_labels)} 

4750 datasets_to_snapshot = dict(sorted(datasets_to_snapshot.items(), key=lambda kv: label_indexes[kv[0]])) 

4751 return datasets_to_snapshot 

4752 

4753 def handle_minmax_snapshots( 

4754 self, 

4755 remote: Remote, 

4756 sorted_datasets: List[str], 

4757 labels: List[SnapshotLabel], 

4758 fn_latest: Callable[[int, int, str, str], None], # callback function for latest snapshot 

4759 fn_oldest: Optional[Callable[[int, int, str, str], None]] = None, # callback function for oldest snapshot 

4760 fn_on_finish_dataset: Callable[[str], None] = lambda dataset: None, 

4761 ) -> List[str]: # thread-safe 

4762 """For each dataset in `sorted_datasets`, for each label in `labels`, finds the latest and oldest snapshot, and runs 

4763 the callback functions on them. Ignores the timestamp of the input labels and the timestamp of the snapshot names.""" 

4764 p = self.params 

4765 cmd = p.split_args(f"{p.zfs_program} list -t snapshot -d 1 -Hp -o createtxg,creation,name") # sort dataset,createtxg 

4766 datasets_with_snapshots: Set[str] = set() 

4767 for lines in self.zfs_list_snapshots_in_parallel(remote, cmd, sorted_datasets, ordered=False): 

4768 # streaming group by dataset name (consumes constant memory only) 

4769 for dataset, group in itertools.groupby(lines, key=lambda line: line[line.rindex("\t") + 1 : line.index("@")]): 

4770 snapshots = sorted( # fetch all snapshots of current dataset and sort by createtxg,creation,name 

4771 (int(createtxg), int(creation_unixtime_secs), name[name.index("@") + 1 :]) 

4772 for createtxg, creation_unixtime_secs, name in (line.split("\t", 2) for line in group) 

4773 ) 

4774 assert len(snapshots) > 0 

4775 datasets_with_snapshots.add(dataset) 

4776 snapshot_names = [snapshot[-1] for snapshot in snapshots] 

4777 year_with_4_digits_regex = year_with_four_digits_regex 

4778 fns = ((fn_latest, True),) if fn_oldest is None else ((fn_latest, True), (fn_oldest, False)) 

4779 for i, label in enumerate(labels): 

4780 infix = label.infix 

4781 start = label.prefix + infix 

4782 end = label.suffix 

4783 startlen = len(start) 

4784 endlen = len(end) 

4785 minlen = startlen + endlen if infix else 4 + startlen + endlen # year_with_four_digits_regex 

4786 year_slice = slice(startlen, startlen + 4) # [startlen:startlen+4] # year_with_four_digits_regex 

4787 for fn, is_reverse in fns: 

4788 creation_unixtime_secs: int = 0 # find creation time of latest or oldest snapshot matching the label 

4789 minmax_snapshot = "" 

4790 for j, s in enumerate(reversed(snapshot_names) if is_reverse else snapshot_names): 

4791 if ( 

4792 s.endswith(end) 

4793 and s.startswith(start) 

4794 and len(s) >= minlen 

4795 and (infix or year_with_4_digits_regex.fullmatch(s[year_slice])) 

4796 ): 

4797 k = len(snapshots) - j - 1 if is_reverse else j 

4798 creation_unixtime_secs = snapshots[k][1] 

4799 minmax_snapshot = s 

4800 break 

4801 fn(i, creation_unixtime_secs, dataset, minmax_snapshot) 

4802 fn_on_finish_dataset(dataset) 

4803 

4804 datasets_without_snapshots = [dataset for dataset in sorted_datasets if dataset not in datasets_with_snapshots] 

4805 return datasets_without_snapshots 

4806 

4807 def cache_get_snapshots_changed(self, path: str) -> int: 

4808 return self.cache_get_snapshots_changed2(path)[1] 

4809 

4810 @staticmethod 

4811 def cache_get_snapshots_changed2(path: str) -> Tuple[int, int]: 

4812 """Like zfs_get_snapshots_changed() but reads from local cache.""" 

4813 try: # perf: inode metadata reads and writes are fast - ballpark O(200k) ops/sec. 

4814 s = os_stat(path) 

4815 return round(s.st_atime), round(s.st_mtime) 

4816 except FileNotFoundError: 

4817 return 0, 0 # harmless 

4818 

4819 def last_modified_cache_file(self, remote: Remote, dataset: str, label: Optional[SnapshotLabel] = None) -> str: 

4820 cache_file = "=" if label is None else f"{label.prefix}{label.infix}{label.suffix}" 

4821 userhost_dir = remote.ssh_user_host if remote.ssh_user_host else "-" 

4822 return os_path_join(self.params.log_params.last_modified_cache_dir, userhost_dir, dataset, cache_file) 

4823 

4824 def invalidate_last_modified_cache_dataset(self, dataset: str) -> None: 

4825 """Resets the last_modified timestamp of all cache files of the given dataset to zero.""" 

4826 p = self.params 

4827 cache_file = self.last_modified_cache_file(p.src, dataset) 

4828 if not p.dry_run: 

4829 try: 

4830 zero_times = (0, 0) 

4831 for entry in os.scandir(os.path.dirname(cache_file)): 

4832 os_utime(entry.path, times=zero_times) 

4833 os_utime(cache_file, times=zero_times) 

4834 except FileNotFoundError: 

4835 pass # harmless 

4836 

4837 def update_last_modified_cache(self, datasets_to_snapshot: Dict[SnapshotLabel, List[str]]) -> None: 

4838 """perf: copy lastmodified time of source dataset into local cache to reduce future 'zfs list -t snapshot' calls.""" 

4839 p = self.params 

4840 src = p.src 

4841 if not self.is_caching_snapshots(src): 

4842 return 

4843 src_datasets_set: Set[str] = set() 

4844 dataset_labels: Dict[str, List[SnapshotLabel]] = defaultdict(list) 

4845 for label, datasets in datasets_to_snapshot.items(): 

4846 src_datasets_set.update(datasets) # union 

4847 for dataset in datasets: 

4848 dataset_labels[dataset].append(label) 

4849 

4850 sorted_datasets = sorted(src_datasets_set) 

4851 snapshots_changed_dict = self.zfs_get_snapshots_changed(src, sorted_datasets) 

4852 for src_dataset in sorted_datasets: 

4853 snapshots_changed = snapshots_changed_dict.get(src_dataset, 0) 

4854 self.src_properties[src_dataset][SNAPSHOTS_CHANGED] = snapshots_changed 

4855 if snapshots_changed == 0: 

4856 self.invalidate_last_modified_cache_dataset(src_dataset) 

4857 else: 

4858 cache_file = self.last_modified_cache_file(src, src_dataset) 

4859 cache_dir = os.path.dirname(cache_file) 

4860 if not p.dry_run: 

4861 try: 

4862 os.makedirs(cache_dir, exist_ok=True) 

4863 set_last_modification_time(cache_file, unixtime_in_secs=snapshots_changed, if_more_recent=True) 

4864 for label in dataset_labels[src_dataset]: 

4865 cache_file = self.last_modified_cache_file(src, src_dataset, label) 

4866 set_last_modification_time(cache_file, unixtime_in_secs=snapshots_changed, if_more_recent=True) 

4867 except FileNotFoundError: 

4868 pass # harmless 

4869 

4870 def zfs_get_snapshots_changed(self, remote: Remote, datasets: List[str]) -> Dict[str, int]: 

4871 """Returns the ZFS dataset property "snapshots_changed", which is a UTC Unix time in integer seconds. 

4872 See https://openzfs.github.io/openzfs-docs/man/7/zfsprops.7.html#snapshots_changed""" 

4873 

4874 def try_zfs_list_command(_cmd: List[str], batch: List[str]) -> List[str]: 

4875 try: 

4876 return self.run_ssh_command(remote, print_stderr=False, cmd=_cmd + batch).splitlines() 

4877 except CalledProcessError as e: 

4878 return stderr_to_str(e.stdout).splitlines() 

4879 except UnicodeDecodeError: 

4880 return [] 

4881 

4882 p = self.params 

4883 cmd = p.split_args(f"{p.zfs_program} list -t filesystem,volume -s name -Hp -o snapshots_changed,name") 

4884 results = {} 

4885 for lines in self.itr_ssh_cmd_parallel( 

4886 remote, [(cmd, datasets)], lambda _cmd, batch: try_zfs_list_command(_cmd, batch), ordered=False 

4887 ): 

4888 for line in lines: 

4889 if "\t" not in line: 

4890 break # partial output from failing 'zfs list' command 

4891 snapshots_changed, dataset = line.split("\t", 1) 

4892 if not dataset: 

4893 break # partial output from failing 'zfs list' command 

4894 if snapshots_changed == "-" or not snapshots_changed: 

4895 snapshots_changed = "0" 

4896 results[dataset] = int(snapshots_changed) 

4897 return results 

4898 

4899 @dataclass(order=True, frozen=True) 

4900 class ComparableSnapshot: 

4901 key: Tuple[str, str] # rel_dataset, guid 

4902 cols: List[str] = field(compare=False) 

4903 

4904 def run_compare_snapshot_lists(self, src_datasets: List[str], dst_datasets: List[str]) -> None: 

4905 """Compares source and destination dataset trees recursively wrt. snapshots, for example to check if all recently 

4906 taken snapshots have been successfully replicated by a periodic job. Lists snapshots only contained in source 

4907 (tagged with 'src'), only contained in destination (tagged with 'dst'), and contained in both source and destination 

4908 (tagged with 'all'), in the form of a TSV file, along with other snapshot metadata. Implemented with a time and 

4909 space efficient streaming algorithm; easily scales to millions of datasets and any number of snapshots. 

4910 Assumes that both src_datasets and dst_datasets are sorted.""" 

4911 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

4912 src, dst = p.src, p.dst 

4913 task = src.root_dataset + " vs. " + dst.root_dataset 

4914 tsv_dir = p.log_params.log_file[0 : -len(".log")] + ".cmp" 

4915 os.makedirs(tsv_dir, exist_ok=True) 

4916 tsv_file = os.path.join(tsv_dir, (src.root_dataset + "%" + dst.root_dataset).replace("/", "~") + ".tsv") 

4917 tmp_tsv_file = tsv_file + ".tmp" 

4918 compare_snapshot_lists = set(p.compare_snapshot_lists.split("+")) 

4919 is_src_dst_all = all(choice in compare_snapshot_lists for choice in cmp_choices_items) 

4920 all_src_dst = [loc for loc in ("all", "src", "dst") if loc in compare_snapshot_lists] 

4921 is_first_row = True 

4922 now = None 

4923 

4924 def zfs_list_snapshot_iterator(r: Remote, sorted_datasets: List[str]) -> Generator[str, None, None]: 

4925 """Lists snapshots sorted by dataset name. All snapshots of a given dataset will be adjacent.""" 

4926 assert not self.is_test_mode or sorted_datasets == sorted(sorted_datasets), "List is not sorted" 

4927 written_zfs_prop = "written" # https://openzfs.github.io/openzfs-docs/man/master/7/zfsprops.7.html#written 

4928 if self.is_solaris_zfs(r): # solaris-11.4 zfs does not know the "written" ZFS snapshot property 

4929 written_zfs_prop = "type" # for simplicity, fill in the non-integer dummy constant type="snapshot" 

4930 props = self.creation_prefix + f"creation,guid,createtxg,{written_zfs_prop},name" 

4931 types = "snapshot" 

4932 if p.use_bookmark and r.location == "src" and self.are_bookmarks_enabled(r): 

4933 types = "snapshot,bookmark" # output list ordering: intentionally makes bookmarks appear *after* snapshots 

4934 cmd = p.split_args(f"{p.zfs_program} list -t {types} -d 1 -Hp -o {props}") # sorted by dataset, createtxg 

4935 for lines in self.zfs_list_snapshots_in_parallel(r, cmd, sorted_datasets): 

4936 yield from lines 

4937 

4938 def snapshot_iterator( 

4939 root_dataset: str, sorted_itr: Generator[str, None, None] 

4940 ) -> Generator[Job.ComparableSnapshot, None, None]: 

4941 """Splits/groups snapshot stream into distinct datasets, sorts by GUID within a dataset such that any two 

4942 snapshots with the same GUID will lie adjacent to each other during the upcoming phase that merges 

4943 src snapshots and dst snapshots.""" 

4944 # streaming group by dataset name (consumes constant memory only) 

4945 for dataset, group in itertools.groupby( 

4946 sorted_itr, key=lambda line: line[line.rindex("\t") + 1 : line.replace("#", "@").index("@")] 

4947 ): 

4948 snapshots = list(group) # fetch all snapshots of current dataset, e.g. dataset=tank1/src/foo 

4949 snapshots = self.filter_snapshots(snapshots) # apply include/exclude policy 

4950 snapshots.sort(key=lambda line: line.split("\t", 2)[1]) # stable sort by GUID (2nd remains createtxg) 

4951 rel_dataset = relativize_dataset(dataset, root_dataset) # rel_dataset=/foo, root_dataset=tank1/src 

4952 last_guid = "" 

4953 for line in snapshots: 

4954 cols = line.split("\t") 

4955 creation, guid, createtxg, written, snapshot_name = cols 

4956 if guid == last_guid: 

4957 assert "#" in snapshot_name 

4958 continue # ignore bookmarks whose snapshot still exists. also ignore dupes of bookmarks 

4959 last_guid = guid 

4960 if written == "snapshot": 

4961 written = "-" # sanitize solaris-11.4 work-around (solaris-11.4 also has no bookmark feature) 

4962 cols = [creation, guid, createtxg, written, snapshot_name] 

4963 key = (rel_dataset, guid) # ensures src snapshots and dst snapshots with the same GUID will be adjacent 

4964 yield Job.ComparableSnapshot(key, cols) 

4965 

4966 def print_dataset(rel_dataset: str, entries: Iterable[Tuple[str, Job.ComparableSnapshot]]) -> None: 

4967 entries = sorted( # fetch all snapshots of current dataset and sort em by creation, createtxg, snapshot_tag 

4968 entries, 

4969 key=lambda entry: ( 

4970 int((cols := entry[1].cols)[0]), 

4971 int(cols[2]), 

4972 (snapshot_name := cols[-1])[snapshot_name.replace("#", "@").index("@") + 1 :], 

4973 ), 

4974 ) 

4975 

4976 @dataclass 

4977 class SnapshotStats: 

4978 snapshot_count: int = field(default=0) 

4979 sum_written: int = field(default=0) 

4980 snapshot_count_since: int = field(default=0) 

4981 sum_written_since: int = field(default=0) 

4982 latest_snapshot_idx: Optional[int] = field(default=None) 

4983 latest_snapshot_row_str: Optional[str] = field(default=None) 

4984 latest_snapshot_creation: Optional[str] = field(default=None) 

4985 oldest_snapshot_row_str: Optional[str] = field(default=None) 

4986 oldest_snapshot_creation: Optional[str] = field(default=None) 

4987 

4988 # print metadata of snapshots of current dataset to TSV file; custom stats can later be computed from there 

4989 stats: DefaultDict[str, SnapshotStats] = defaultdict(SnapshotStats) 

4990 header = "location creation_iso createtxg rel_name guid root_dataset rel_dataset name creation written" 

4991 nonlocal is_first_row 

4992 if is_first_row: 

4993 fd.write(header.replace(" ", "\t") + "\n") 

4994 is_first_row = False 

4995 for i, entry in enumerate(entries): 

4996 loc = location = entry[0] 

4997 creation, guid, createtxg, written, name = entry[1].cols 

4998 root_dataset = dst.root_dataset if location == cmp_choices_items[1] else src.root_dataset 

4999 rel_name = relativize_dataset(name, root_dataset) 

5000 creation_iso = isotime_from_unixtime(int(creation)) 

5001 row = loc, creation_iso, createtxg, rel_name, guid, root_dataset, rel_dataset, name, creation, written 

5002 # Example: src 2024-11-06_08:30:05 17435050 /foo@test_2024-11-06_08:30:05_daily 2406491805272097867 tank1/src /foo tank1/src/foo@test_2024-10-06_08:30:04_daily 1730878205 24576 # noqa: E501 

5003 row_str = "\t".join(row) 

5004 if not p.dry_run: 

5005 fd.write(row_str + "\n") 

5006 s = stats[location] 

5007 s.snapshot_count += 1 

5008 s.sum_written += int(written) if written != "-" else 0 

5009 s.latest_snapshot_idx = i 

5010 s.latest_snapshot_row_str = row_str 

5011 s.latest_snapshot_creation = creation 

5012 if not s.oldest_snapshot_row_str: 

5013 s.oldest_snapshot_row_str = row_str 

5014 s.oldest_snapshot_creation = creation 

5015 

5016 # for convenience, directly log basic summary stats of current dataset 

5017 k = stats["all"].latest_snapshot_idx # defaults to None 

5018 k = k if k is not None else -1 

5019 for entry in entries[k + 1 :]: # aggregate basic stats since latest common snapshot 

5020 location = entry[0] 

5021 creation, guid, createtxg, written, name = entry[1].cols 

5022 s = stats[location] 

5023 s.snapshot_count_since += 1 

5024 s.sum_written_since += int(written) if written != "-" else 0 

5025 prefix = f"Comparing {rel_dataset}~" 

5026 msgs = [] 

5027 msgs.append(f"{prefix} of {task}") 

5028 msgs.append( 

5029 f"{prefix} Q: No src snapshots are missing on dst, and no dst snapshots are missing on src, " 

5030 "and there is a common snapshot? A: " 

5031 + ( 

5032 "n/a" 

5033 if not is_src_dst_all 

5034 else str( 

5035 stats["src"].snapshot_count == 0 

5036 and stats["dst"].snapshot_count == 0 

5037 and stats["all"].snapshot_count > 0 

5038 ) 

5039 ) 

5040 ) 

5041 nonlocal now 

5042 now = now or round(time.time()) # uses the same timestamp across the entire dataset tree 

5043 latcom = "latest common snapshot" 

5044 for loc in all_src_dst: 

5045 s = stats[loc] 

5046 msgs.append(f"{prefix} Latest snapshot only in {loc}: {s.latest_snapshot_row_str or 'n/a'}") 

5047 msgs.append(f"{prefix} Oldest snapshot only in {loc}: {s.oldest_snapshot_row_str or 'n/a'}") 

5048 msgs.append(f"{prefix} Snapshots only in {loc}: {s.snapshot_count}") 

5049 msgs.append(f"{prefix} Snapshot data written only in {loc}: {human_readable_bytes(s.sum_written)}") 

5050 if loc != "all": 

5051 na = None if k >= 0 else "n/a" 

5052 msgs.append(f"{prefix} Snapshots only in {loc} since {latcom}: {na or s.snapshot_count_since}") 

5053 msgs.append( 

5054 f"{prefix} Snapshot data written only in {loc} since {latcom}: " 

5055 f"{na or human_readable_bytes(s.sum_written_since)}" 

5056 ) 

5057 all_creation = stats["all"].latest_snapshot_creation 

5058 latest = ("latest", s.latest_snapshot_creation) 

5059 oldest = ("oldest", s.oldest_snapshot_creation) 

5060 for label, s_creation in latest, oldest: 

5061 if loc != "all": 

5062 hd = "n/a" 

5063 if s_creation and k >= 0: 

5064 assert all_creation is not None 

5065 hd = human_readable_duration(int(all_creation) - int(s_creation), unit="s") 

5066 msgs.append(f"{prefix} Time diff between {latcom} and {label} snapshot only in {loc}: {hd}") 

5067 for label, s_creation in latest, oldest: 

5068 hd = "n/a" if not s_creation else human_readable_duration(now - int(s_creation), unit="s") 

5069 msgs.append(f"{prefix} Time diff between now and {label} snapshot only in {loc}: {hd}") 

5070 log.info("%s", "\n".join(msgs)) 

5071 

5072 # setup streaming pipeline 

5073 src_snap_itr = snapshot_iterator(src.root_dataset, zfs_list_snapshot_iterator(src, src_datasets)) 

5074 dst_snap_itr = snapshot_iterator(dst.root_dataset, zfs_list_snapshot_iterator(dst, dst_datasets)) 

5075 merge_itr = self.merge_sorted_iterators(cmp_choices_items, p.compare_snapshot_lists, src_snap_itr, dst_snap_itr) 

5076 

5077 rel_datasets: Dict[str, Set[str]] = defaultdict(set) 

5078 for datasets, remote in (src_datasets, src), (dst_datasets, dst): 

5079 for dataset in datasets: # rel_dataset=/foo, root_dataset=tank1/src 

5080 rel_datasets[remote.location].add(relativize_dataset(dataset, remote.root_dataset)) 

5081 rel_src_or_dst: List[str] = sorted(rel_datasets["src"].union(rel_datasets["dst"])) 

5082 

5083 log.debug("%s", f"Temporary TSV output file comparing {task} is: {tmp_tsv_file}") 

5084 with open_nofollow(tmp_tsv_file, "w", encoding="utf-8", perm=FILE_PERMISSIONS) as fd: 

5085 # streaming group by rel_dataset (consumes constant memory only); entry is a Tuple[str, ComparableSnapshot] 

5086 group = itertools.groupby(merge_itr, key=lambda entry: entry[1].key[0]) 

5087 self.print_datasets(group, lambda rel_ds, entries: print_dataset(rel_ds, entries), rel_src_or_dst) 

5088 os.rename(tmp_tsv_file, tsv_file) 

5089 log.info("%s", f"Final TSV output file comparing {task} is: {tsv_file}") 

5090 

5091 tsv_file = tsv_file[0 : tsv_file.rindex(".")] + ".rel_datasets_tsv" 

5092 tmp_tsv_file = tsv_file + ".tmp" 

5093 with open_nofollow(tmp_tsv_file, "w", encoding="utf-8", perm=FILE_PERMISSIONS) as fd: 

5094 header = "location rel_dataset src_dataset dst_dataset" 

5095 fd.write(header.replace(" ", "\t") + "\n") 

5096 src_only: Set[str] = rel_datasets["src"].difference(rel_datasets["dst"]) 

5097 dst_only: Set[str] = rel_datasets["dst"].difference(rel_datasets["src"]) 

5098 for rel_dataset in rel_src_or_dst: 

5099 loc = "src" if rel_dataset in src_only else "dst" if rel_dataset in dst_only else "all" 

5100 src_dataset = src.root_dataset + rel_dataset if rel_dataset not in dst_only else "" 

5101 dst_dataset = dst.root_dataset + rel_dataset if rel_dataset not in src_only else "" 

5102 row = loc, rel_dataset, src_dataset, dst_dataset # Example: all /foo/bar tank1/src/foo/bar tank2/dst/foo/bar 

5103 if not p.dry_run: 

5104 fd.write("\t".join(row) + "\n") 

5105 os.rename(tmp_tsv_file, tsv_file) 

5106 

5107 @staticmethod 

5108 def print_datasets(group: itertools.groupby, fn: Callable[[str, Iterable], None], rel_datasets: Iterable[str]) -> None: 

5109 rel_datasets = sorted(rel_datasets) 

5110 n = len(rel_datasets) 

5111 i = 0 

5112 for rel_dataset, entries in group: 

5113 while i < n and rel_datasets[i] < rel_dataset: 

5114 fn(rel_datasets[i], []) # Also print summary stats for datasets whose snapshot stream is empty 

5115 i += 1 

5116 assert i >= n or rel_datasets[i] == rel_dataset 

5117 i += 1 

5118 fn(rel_dataset, entries) 

5119 while i < n: 

5120 fn(rel_datasets[i], []) # Also print summary stats for datasets whose snapshot stream is empty 

5121 i += 1 

5122 

5123 def merge_sorted_iterators( 

5124 self, 

5125 choices: Sequence[str], # ["src", "dst", "all"] 

5126 choice: str, # Example: "src+dst+all" 

5127 src_itr: Iterator, 

5128 dst_itr: Iterator, 

5129 ) -> Generator[Tuple[Any, ...], None, None]: 

5130 """This is the typical merge algorithm of a merge sort, slightly adapted to our specific use case.""" 

5131 assert len(choices) == 3 

5132 assert choice 

5133 flags = 0 

5134 for i, item in enumerate(choices): 

5135 if item in choice: 

5136 flags |= 1 << i 

5137 src_next, dst_next = self.run_in_parallel(lambda: next(src_itr, None), lambda: next(dst_itr, None)) 

5138 while not (src_next is None and dst_next is None): 

5139 if src_next == dst_next: 

5140 n = 2 

5141 if (flags & (1 << n)) != 0: 

5142 yield choices[n], src_next, dst_next 

5143 src_next = next(src_itr, None) 

5144 dst_next = next(dst_itr, None) 

5145 elif src_next is None or (dst_next is not None and dst_next < src_next): 

5146 n = 1 

5147 if (flags & (1 << n)) != 0: 

5148 yield choices[n], dst_next 

5149 dst_next = next(dst_itr, None) 

5150 else: 

5151 n = 0 

5152 if (flags & (1 << n)) != 0: 

5153 if isinstance(src_next, Job.ComparableSnapshot): 5153 ↛ 5154line 5153 didn't jump to line 5154 because the condition on line 5153 was never true

5154 name = src_next.cols[-1] 

5155 if "@" in name: 

5156 yield choices[n], src_next # include snapshot 

5157 else: # ignore src bookmarks for which no snapshot exists in dst; those aren't useful 

5158 assert "#" in name 

5159 else: 

5160 yield choices[n], src_next 

5161 src_next = next(src_itr, None) 

5162 

5163 @staticmethod 

5164 def build_dataset_tree(sorted_datasets: List[str]) -> Tree: 

5165 """Takes as input a sorted list of datasets and returns a sorted directory tree containing the same dataset names, 

5166 in the form of nested dicts.""" 

5167 tree: Tree = {} 

5168 for dataset in sorted_datasets: 

5169 current = tree 

5170 for component in dataset.split("/"): 

5171 child = current.get(component) 

5172 if child is None: 

5173 child = {} 

5174 current[component] = child 

5175 current = child 

5176 return tree 

5177 

5178 def process_datasets_in_parallel_and_fault_tolerant( 

5179 self, 

5180 datasets: List[str], 

5181 process_dataset: Callable[[str, str, Retry], bool], # lambda, must be thread-safe 

5182 skip_tree_on_error: Callable[[str], bool], 

5183 max_workers: int = os.cpu_count() or 1, 

5184 interval_nanos: Callable[[str], int] = lambda dataset: 0, 

5185 task_name: str = "Task",
