5186 enable_barriers: Optional[bool] = None, # for testing only; None means 'auto-detect' 

5187 ) -> bool: 

5188 """Runs process_dataset(dataset) for each dataset in datasets, while taking care of error handling and retries and 

5189 parallel execution. Assumes that the input dataset list is sorted and does not contain duplicates. All children of a 

5190 dataset may be processed in parallel. For consistency (even during parallel dataset replication/deletion), processing 

5191 of a dataset only starts after processing of all its ancestor datasets has completed. Further, when a thread is ready 

5192 to start processing another dataset, it chooses the "smallest" dataset wrt. lexicographical sort order from the 

5193 datasets that are currently available for start of processing. Initially, only the roots of the selected dataset 

5194 subtrees are available for start of processing.""" 

5195 assert not self.is_test_mode or datasets == sorted(datasets), "List is not sorted" 

5196 assert not self.is_test_mode or not has_duplicates(datasets), "List contains duplicates" 

5197 assert callable(process_dataset) 

5198 assert callable(skip_tree_on_error) 

5199 assert max_workers > 0 

5200 assert callable(interval_nanos) 

5201 assert "%" not in task_name 

5202 has_barrier = any(BARRIER_CHAR in dataset.split("/") for dataset in datasets) 

5203 assert (enable_barriers is not False) or not has_barrier 

5204 barriers_enabled: bool = bool(has_barrier or enable_barriers) 

5205 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

5206 

5207 def _process_dataset(dataset: str, tid: str) -> bool: 

5208 start_time_nanos = time.monotonic_ns() 

5209 try: 

5210 return self.run_with_retries(p.retry_policy, process_dataset, dataset, tid) 

5211 finally: 

5212 elapsed_nanos = time.monotonic_ns() - start_time_nanos 

5213 log.debug(p.dry(f"{tid} {task_name} done: %s took %s"), dataset, human_readable_duration(elapsed_nanos)) 

5214 

5215 class TreeNodeMutableAttributes: 

5216 __slots__ = ("pending", "barrier") # uses more compact memory layout than __dict__ 

5217 

5218 def __init__(self) -> None: 

5219 self.pending: int = 0 # number of children added to priority queue that haven't completed their work yet 

5220 self.barrier: Optional[TreeNode] = None # zero or one barrier TreeNode waiting for this node to complete 

5221 

5222 class TreeNode(NamedTuple): 

5223 # TreeNodes are ordered by dataset name within a priority queue via __lt__ comparisons. 

5224 dataset: str # Each dataset name is unique, thus attributes other than `dataset` are never used for comparisons 

5225 children: Tree # dataset "directory" tree consists of nested dicts; aka Dict[str, Dict] 

5226 parent: Any # aka TreeNode 

5227 mut: TreeNodeMutableAttributes 

5228 

5229 def __repr__(self) -> str: 

5230 dataset, pending, barrier, nchildren = self.dataset, self.mut.pending, self.mut.barrier, len(self.children) 

5231 return str({"dataset": dataset, "pending": pending, "barrier": barrier is not None, "nchildren": nchildren}) 

5232 

5233 def make_tree_node(dataset: str, children: Tree, parent: Optional[TreeNode] = None) -> TreeNode: 

5234 return TreeNode(dataset, children, parent, TreeNodeMutableAttributes()) 

5235 

5236 def build_dataset_tree_and_find_roots() -> List[TreeNode]: 

5237 """For consistency, processing of a dataset only starts after processing of its ancestors has completed.""" 

5238 tree: Tree = self.build_dataset_tree(datasets) # tree consists of nested dictionaries 

5239 skip_dataset = DONT_SKIP_DATASET 

5240 roots = [] 

5241 for dataset in datasets: 

5242 if is_descendant(dataset, of_root_dataset=skip_dataset): 

5243 continue 

5244 skip_dataset = dataset 

5245 children = tree 

5246 for component in dataset.split("/"): 

5247 children = children[component] 

5248 roots.append(make_tree_node(dataset, children)) 

5249 return roots 

5250 

5251 assert (not self.is_test_mode) or str(make_tree_node("foo", {})) 

5252 immutable_empty_barrier: TreeNode = make_tree_node("immutable_empty_barrier", {}) 

5253 priority_queue: List[TreeNode] = build_dataset_tree_and_find_roots() 

5254 heapq.heapify(priority_queue) # same order as sorted() 

5255 len_datasets: int = len(datasets) 

5256 datasets_set: Set[str] = set(datasets) 

5257 with ThreadPoolExecutor(max_workers=max_workers) as executor: 

5258 todo_futures: Set[Future] = set() 

5259 submitted: int = 0 

5260 next_update_nanos: int = time.monotonic_ns() 

5261 fw_timeout: Optional[float] = None 

5262 

5263 def submit_datasets() -> bool: 

5264 nonlocal fw_timeout 

5265 fw_timeout = None # indicates to use blocking flavor of concurrent.futures.wait() 

5266 while len(priority_queue) > 0 and len(todo_futures) < max_workers: 

5267 # pick "smallest" dataset (wrt. sort order) available for start of processing; submit to thread pool 

5268 nonlocal next_update_nanos 

5269 sleep_nanos = next_update_nanos - time.monotonic_ns() 

5270 if sleep_nanos > 0: 

5271 time.sleep(sleep_nanos / 1_000_000_000) # seconds 

5272 if sleep_nanos > 0 and len(todo_futures) > 0: 

5273 fw_timeout = 0 # indicates to use non-blocking flavor of concurrent.futures.wait() 

5274 # It's possible an even "smaller" dataset (wrt. sort order) has become available while we slept. 

5275 # If so it's preferable to submit to the thread pool the smaller one first. 

5276 break # break out of loop to check if that's the case via non-blocking concurrent.futures.wait() 

5277 node: TreeNode = heapq.heappop(priority_queue) 

5278 next_update_nanos += max(0, interval_nanos(node.dataset)) 

5279 nonlocal submitted 

5280 submitted += 1 

5281 future = executor.submit(_process_dataset, node.dataset, tid=f"{submitted}/{len_datasets}") 

5282 future.node = node # type: ignore[attr-defined] 

5283 todo_futures.add(future) 

5284 return len(todo_futures) > 0 

5285 

5286 # coordination loop; runs in the (single) main thread; submits tasks to worker threads and handles their results 

5287 failed = False 

5288 while submit_datasets(): 

5289 done_futures, todo_futures = concurrent.futures.wait(todo_futures, fw_timeout, return_when=FIRST_COMPLETED) 

5290 for done_future in done_futures: 

5291 dataset = done_future.node.dataset # type: ignore[attr-defined] 

5292 try: 

5293 no_skip: bool = done_future.result() # does not block as processing has already completed 

5294 except (CalledProcessError, subprocess.TimeoutExpired, SystemExit, UnicodeDecodeError) as e: 

5295 failed = True 

5296 if p.skip_on_error == "fail": 

5297 [todo_future.cancel() for todo_future in todo_futures] 

5298 terminate_process_subtree(except_current_process=True) 

5299 raise e 

5300 no_skip = not (p.skip_on_error == "tree" or skip_tree_on_error(dataset)) 

5301 log.error("%s", e) 

5302 self.append_exception(e, task_name, dataset) 

5303 

5304 if not barriers_enabled: 

5305 # This simple algorithm is sufficient for almost all use cases: 

5306 def simple_enqueue_children(node: TreeNode) -> None: 

5307 for child, grandchildren in node.children.items(): # as processing of parent has now completed 

5308 child_node = make_tree_node(f"{node.dataset}/{child}", grandchildren) 

5309 if child_node.dataset in datasets_set: 

5310 heapq.heappush(priority_queue, child_node) # make it available for start of processing 

5311 else: # it's an intermediate node that has no job attached; pass the enqueue operation 

5312 simple_enqueue_children(child_node) # ... recursively down the tree 

5313 

5314 if no_skip: 

5315 simple_enqueue_children(done_future.node) # type: ignore[attr-defined] 

5316 else: 

5317 # The (more complex) algorithm below is for more general job scheduling, as in bzfs_jobrunner. 

5318 # Here, a "dataset" string is treated as an identifier for any kind of job rather than a reference 

5319 # to a concrete ZFS object. Example "dataset" job string: "src_host1/createsnapshot/push/prune". 

5320 # Jobs can depend on another job via a parent/child relationship formed by '/' directory separators 

5321 # within the dataset string, and multiple "datasets" form a job dependency tree by way of common 

5322 # dataset directory prefixes. Jobs that do not depend on each other can be executed in parallel, and 

5323 # jobs can be told to first wait for other jobs to complete successfully. The algorithm is based on 

5324 # a barrier primitive and is typically disabled; it is only required for rare jobrunner configs. For 

5325 # example, a job scheduler can specify that all parallel push replications jobs to multiple 

5326 # destinations must succeed before the jobs of the pruning phase can start. More generally, with 

5327 # this algo, a job scheduler can specify that all jobs within a given job subtree (containing any 

5328 # nested combination of sequential and/or parallel jobs) must successfully complete before a certain 

5329 # other job within the job tree is started. This is specified via the barrier directory named "~". 

5330 # Example: "src_host1/createsnapshot/~/prune". 

5331 # Note that "~" is unambiguous as it is not a valid ZFS dataset name component per the naming rules 

5332 # enforced by the 'zfs create', 'zfs snapshot' and 'zfs bookmark' CLIs. 

5333 def enqueue_children(node: TreeNode) -> int: 

5334 """Returns number of jobs that were added to priority_queue for immediate start of processing.""" 

5335 n = 0 

5336 children = node.children 

5337 for child, grandchildren in children.items(): 

5338 child_node = make_tree_node(f"{node.dataset}/{child}", grandchildren, parent=node) 

5339 if child != BARRIER_CHAR: 

5340 if child_node.dataset in datasets_set: 

5341 # it's not a barrier; make job available for immediate start of processing 

5342 heapq.heappush(priority_queue, child_node) 

5343 k = 1 

5344 else: # it's an intermediate node that has no job attached; pass the enqueue operation 

5345 k = enqueue_children(child_node) # ... recursively down the tree 

5346 elif len(children) == 1: # if the only child is a barrier then pass the enqueue operation 

5347 k = enqueue_children(child_node) # ... recursively down the tree 

5348 else: # park the barrier node within the (still closed) barrier for the time being 

5349 assert node.mut.barrier is None 

5350 node.mut.barrier = child_node 

5351 k = 0 

5352 node.mut.pending += min(1, k) 

5353 n += k 

5354 assert n >= 0 

5355 return n 

5356 

5357 def on_job_completion_with_barriers(node: TreeNode, no_skip: bool) -> None: 

5358 if no_skip: 

5359 enqueue_children(node) # make child datasets available for start of processing 

5360 else: # job completed without success 

5361 tmp = node # ... thus, opening the barrier shall always do nothing in node and its ancestors 

5362 while tmp is not None: 

5363 tmp.mut.barrier = immutable_empty_barrier 

5364 tmp = tmp.parent 

5365 assert node.mut.pending >= 0 

5366 while node.mut.pending == 0: # have all jobs in subtree of current node completed? 

5367 if no_skip: # ... if so open the barrier, if it exists, and enqueue jobs waiting on it 

5368 if not (node.mut.barrier is None or node.mut.barrier is immutable_empty_barrier): 

5369 node.mut.pending += min(1, enqueue_children(node.mut.barrier)) 

5370 node.mut.barrier = immutable_empty_barrier 

5371 if node.mut.pending > 0: # did opening of barrier cause jobs to be enqueued in subtree? 

5372 break # ... if so we aren't quite done yet with this subtree 

5373 if node.parent is None: 

5374 break # we've reached the root node 

5375 node = node.parent # recurse up the tree to propagate completion upward 

5376 node.mut.pending -= 1 # mark subtree as completed 

5377 assert node.mut.pending >= 0 

5378 

5379 assert barriers_enabled 

5380 on_job_completion_with_barriers(done_future.node, no_skip) # type: ignore[attr-defined] 

5381 # endwhile submit_datasets() 

5382 assert len(priority_queue) == 0 

5383 assert len(todo_futures) == 0 

5384 return failed 

5385 

5386 def is_program_available(self, program: str, location: str) -> bool: 

5387 return program in self.params.available_programs.get(location, {}) 

5388 

5389 def detect_available_programs(self) -> None: 

5390 p = params = self.params 

5391 log = p.log 

5392 available_programs = params.available_programs 

5393 if "local" not in available_programs: 5393 ↛ 5394line 5393 didn't jump to line 5394 because the condition on line 5393 was never true

5394 cmd = [p.shell_program_local, "-c", self.find_available_programs()] 

5395 available_programs["local"] = { 

5396 prog: "" 

5397 for prog in subprocess.run(cmd, stdin=DEVNULL, stdout=PIPE, stderr=sys.stderr, text=True).stdout.splitlines() 

5398 } 

5399 cmd = [p.shell_program_local, "-c", "exit"] 

5400 if subprocess.run(cmd, stdin=DEVNULL, stdout=PIPE, stderr=sys.stderr, text=True).returncode != 0: 

5401 self.disable_program("sh", ["local"]) 

5402 

5403 for r in [p.dst, p.src]: 

5404 loc = r.location 

5405 remote_conf_cache_key = r.cache_key() 

5406 cache_item: Optional[RemoteConfCacheItem] = self.remote_conf_cache.get(remote_conf_cache_key) 

5407 if cache_item is not None: 5407 ↛ 5415line 5407 didn't jump to line 5415 because the condition on line 5407 was always true

5408 # startup perf: cache avoids ssh connect setup and feature detection roundtrips on revisits to same site 

5409 p.connection_pools[loc] = cache_item.connection_pools 

5410 if time.monotonic_ns() - cache_item.timestamp_nanos < p.remote_conf_cache_ttl_nanos: 

5411 available_programs[loc] = cache_item.available_programs 

5412 p.zpool_features[loc] = cache_item.zpool_features 

5413 continue # cache hit, skip remote detection 

5414 else: 

5415 p.connection_pools[loc] = ConnectionPools( 

5416 r, {SHARED: r.max_concurrent_ssh_sessions_per_tcp_connection, DEDICATED: 1} 

5417 ) 

5418 self.detect_zpool_features(r) 

5419 self.detect_available_programs_remote(r, available_programs, r.ssh_user_host) 

5420 self.remote_conf_cache[remote_conf_cache_key] = RemoteConfCacheItem( 

5421 p.connection_pools[loc], available_programs[loc], p.zpool_features[loc] 

5422 ) 

5423 if r.use_zfs_delegation and p.zpool_features[loc].get("delegation") == "off": 5423 ↛ 5424line 5423 didn't jump to line 5424 because the condition on line 5423 was never true

5424 die( 

5425 f"Permission denied as ZFS delegation is disabled for {r.location} " 

5426 f"dataset: {r.basis_root_dataset}. Manually enable it via 'sudo zpool set delegation=on {r.pool}'" 

5427 ) 

5428 

5429 locations = ["src", "dst", "local"] 

5430 if params.compression_program == disable_prg: 5430 ↛ 5431line 5430 didn't jump to line 5431 because the condition on line 5430 was never true

5431 self.disable_program("zstd", locations) 

5432 if params.mbuffer_program == disable_prg: 5432 ↛ 5433line 5432 didn't jump to line 5433 because the condition on line 5432 was never true

5433 self.disable_program("mbuffer", locations) 

5434 if params.ps_program == disable_prg: 5434 ↛ 5435line 5434 didn't jump to line 5435 because the condition on line 5434 was never true

5435 self.disable_program("ps", locations) 

5436 if params.pv_program == disable_prg: 5436 ↛ 5437line 5436 didn't jump to line 5437 because the condition on line 5436 was never true

5437 self.disable_program("pv", locations) 

5438 if params.shell_program == disable_prg: 5438 ↛ 5439line 5438 didn't jump to line 5439 because the condition on line 5438 was never true

5439 self.disable_program("sh", locations) 

5440 if params.sudo_program == disable_prg: 5440 ↛ 5441line 5440 didn't jump to line 5441 because the condition on line 5440 was never true

5441 self.disable_program("sudo", locations) 

5442 if params.zpool_program == disable_prg: 5442 ↛ 5443line 5442 didn't jump to line 5443 because the condition on line 5442 was never true

5443 self.disable_program("zpool", locations) 

5444 

5445 for key, programs in available_programs.items(): 

5446 for program in list(programs.keys()): 

5447 if program.startswith("uname-"): 5447 ↛ 5453line 5447 didn't jump to line 5453 because the condition on line 5447 was never true

5448 # uname-Linux foo 5.15.0-69-generic #76-Ubuntu SMP Fri Mar 17 17:19:29 UTC 2023 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux # noqa: E501 

5449 # uname-FreeBSD freebsd 14.1-RELEASE FreeBSD 14.1-RELEASE releng/14.1-n267679-10e31f0946d8 GENERIC amd64 

5450 # uname-SunOS solaris 5.11 11.4.42.111.0 i86pc i386 i86pc # https://blogs.oracle.com/solaris/post/building-open-source-software-on-oracle-solaris-114-cbe-release # noqa: E501 

5451 # uname-SunOS solaris 5.11 11.4.0.15.0 i86pc i386 i86pc 

5452 # uname-Darwin foo 23.6.0 Darwin Kernel Version 23.6.0: Mon Jul 29 21:13:04 PDT 2024; root:xnu-10063.141.2~1/RELEASE_ARM64_T6020 arm64 # noqa: E501 

5453 programs.pop(program) 

5454 uname = program[len("uname-") :] 

5455 programs["uname"] = uname 

5456 log.log(log_trace, f"available_programs[{key}][uname]: %s", uname) 

5457 programs["os"] = uname.split(" ")[0] # Linux|FreeBSD|SunOS|Darwin 

5458 log.log(log_trace, f"available_programs[{key}][os]: %s", programs["os"]) 

5459 elif program.startswith("default_shell-"): 5459 ↛ 5460line 5459 didn't jump to line 5460 because the condition on line 5459 was never true

5460 programs.pop(program) 

5461 default_shell = program[len("default_shell-") :] 

5462 programs["default_shell"] = default_shell 

5463 log.log(log_trace, f"available_programs[{key}][default_shell]: %s", default_shell) 

5464 validate_default_shell(default_shell, r) 

5465 elif program.startswith("getconf_cpu_count-"): 5465 ↛ 5466line 5465 didn't jump to line 5466 because the condition on line 5465 was never true

5466 programs.pop(program) 

5467 getconf_cpu_count = program[len("getconf_cpu_count-") :] 

5468 programs["getconf_cpu_count"] = getconf_cpu_count 

5469 log.log(log_trace, f"available_programs[{key}][getconf_cpu_count]: %s", getconf_cpu_count) 

5470 

5471 for key, programs in available_programs.items(): 

5472 log.debug(f"available_programs[{key}]: %s", list_formatter(programs, separator=", ")) 

5473 

5474 for r in [p.dst, p.src]: 

5475 if r.sudo and not self.is_program_available("sudo", r.location): 5475 ↛ 5476line 5475 didn't jump to line 5476 because the condition on line 5475 was never true

5476 die(f"{p.sudo_program} CLI is not available on {r.location} host: {r.ssh_user_host or 'localhost'}") 

5477 

5478 def disable_program(self, program: str, locations: List[str]) -> None: 

5479 for location in locations: 

5480 self.params.available_programs[location].pop(program, None) 

5481 

5482 def find_available_programs(self) -> str: 

5483 """POSIX shell script that checks for the existence of various programs. It uses `if` statements instead of `&&` plus 

5484 `printf` instead of `echo` to ensure maximum compatibility across shells.""" 

5485 p = self.params 

5486 cmds = [] 

5487 cmds.append("printf 'default_shell-%s\n' \"$SHELL\"") 

5488 cmds.append("if command -v echo > /dev/null; then printf 'echo\n'; fi") 

5489 cmds.append(f"if command -v {p.zpool_program} > /dev/null; then printf 'zpool\n'; fi") 

5490 cmds.append(f"if command -v {p.ssh_program} > /dev/null; then printf 'ssh\n'; fi") 

5491 cmds.append(f"if command -v {p.shell_program} > /dev/null; then printf 'sh\n'; fi") 

5492 cmds.append(f"if command -v {p.sudo_program} > /dev/null; then printf 'sudo\n'; fi") 

5493 cmds.append(f"if command -v {p.compression_program} > /dev/null; then printf 'zstd\n'; fi") 

5494 cmds.append(f"if command -v {p.mbuffer_program} > /dev/null; then printf 'mbuffer\n'; fi") 

5495 cmds.append(f"if command -v {p.pv_program} > /dev/null; then printf 'pv\n'; fi") 

5496 cmds.append(f"if command -v {p.ps_program} > /dev/null; then printf 'ps\n'; fi") 

5497 cmds.append( 

5498 f"if command -v {p.psrinfo_program} > /dev/null; then " 

5499 f"printf 'getconf_cpu_count-'; {p.psrinfo_program} -p; " 

5500 f"elif command -v {p.getconf_program} > /dev/null; then " 

5501 f"printf 'getconf_cpu_count-'; {p.getconf_program} _NPROCESSORS_ONLN; " 

5502 "fi" 

5503 ) 

5504 cmds.append(f"if command -v {p.uname_program} > /dev/null; then printf 'uname-'; {p.uname_program} -a || true; fi") 

5505 return "; ".join(cmds) 

5506 

5507 def detect_available_programs_remote(self, remote: Remote, available_programs: Dict, ssh_user_host: str) -> None: 

5508 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

5509 location = remote.location 

5510 available_programs_minimum = {"zpool": None, "sudo": None} 

5511 available_programs[location] = {} 

5512 lines = None 

5513 try: 

5514 # on Linux, 'zfs --version' returns with zero status and prints the correct info 

5515 # on FreeBSD, 'zfs --version' always prints the same (correct) info as Linux, but nonetheless sometimes 

5516 # returns with non-zero status (sometimes = if the zfs kernel module is not loaded) 

5517 # on Solaris, 'zfs --version' returns with non-zero status without printing useful info as the --version 

5518 # option is not known there 

5519 lines = self.run_ssh_command(remote, log_trace, print_stderr=False, cmd=[p.zfs_program, "--version"]) 

5520 assert lines 

5521 except (FileNotFoundError, PermissionError): # location is local and program file was not found 

5522 die(f"{p.zfs_program} CLI is not available on {location} host: {ssh_user_host or 'localhost'}") 

5523 except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e: 

5524 if "unrecognized command '--version'" in e.stderr and "run: zfs help" in e.stderr: 

5525 available_programs[location]["zfs"] = "notOpenZFS" # solaris-11.4 zfs does not know --version flag 

5526 elif not e.stdout.startswith("zfs"): 

5527 die(f"{p.zfs_program} CLI is not available on {location} host: {ssh_user_host or 'localhost'}") 

5528 else: 

5529 lines = e.stdout # FreeBSD if the zfs kernel module is not loaded 

5530 assert lines 

5531 if lines: 

5532 line = lines.splitlines()[0] 

5533 assert line.startswith("zfs") 

5534 # Example: zfs-2.1.5~rc5-ubuntu3 -> 2.1.5, zfswin-2.2.3rc5 -> 2.2.3 

5535 version = line.split("-")[1].strip() 

5536 match = re.fullmatch(r"(\d+\.\d+\.\d+).*", version) 

5537 assert match, "Unparsable zfs version string: " + version 

5538 version = match.group(1) 

5539 available_programs[location]["zfs"] = version 

5540 if is_version_at_least(version, "2.1.0"): 

5541 available_programs[location][zfs_version_is_at_least_2_1_0] = True 

5542 if is_version_at_least(version, "2.2.0"): 

5543 available_programs[location][zfs_version_is_at_least_2_2_0] = True 

5544 log.log(log_trace, f"available_programs[{location}][zfs]: %s", available_programs[location]["zfs"]) 

5545 

5546 if p.shell_program != disable_prg: 

5547 try: 

5548 cmd = [p.shell_program, "-c", self.find_available_programs()] 

5549 available_programs[location].update( 

5550 dict.fromkeys(self.run_ssh_command(remote, log_trace, cmd=cmd).splitlines()) 

5551 ) 

5552 return 

5553 except (FileNotFoundError, PermissionError) as e: # location is local and shell program file was not found 

5554 if e.filename != p.shell_program: 

5555 raise 

5556 except subprocess.CalledProcessError: 

5557 pass 

5558 log.warning("%s", f"Failed to find {p.shell_program} on {location}. Continuing with minimal assumptions...") 

5559 available_programs[location].update(available_programs_minimum) 

5560 

5561 def is_solaris_zfs(self, remote: Remote) -> bool: 

5562 return self.is_solaris_zfs_location(remote.location) 

5563 

5564 def is_solaris_zfs_location(self, location: str) -> bool: 

5565 if location == "local": 

5566 return platform.system() == "SunOS" 

5567 return self.params.available_programs[location].get("zfs") == "notOpenZFS" 

5568 

5569 @staticmethod 

5570 def is_dummy(r: Remote) -> bool: 

5571 return r.root_dataset == dummy_dataset 

5572 

5573 def detect_zpool_features(self, remote: Remote) -> None: 

5574 p = params = self.params 

5575 r, loc, log = remote, remote.location, p.log 

5576 lines = [] 

5577 features = {} 

5578 params.zpool_features.pop(loc, None) 

5579 if self.is_dummy(r): 

5580 params.zpool_features[loc] = {} 

5581 return 

5582 if params.zpool_program != disable_prg: 

5583 cmd = params.split_args(f"{params.zpool_program} get -Hp -o property,value all", r.pool) 

5584 try: 

5585 lines = self.run_ssh_command(remote, log_trace, check=False, cmd=cmd).splitlines() 

5586 except (FileNotFoundError, PermissionError) as e: 

5587 if e.filename != params.zpool_program: 

5588 raise 

5589 log.warning( 

5590 "%s", f"Failed to detect zpool features on {loc}: {r.pool}. Continuing with minimal assumptions ..." 

5591 ) 

5592 else: 

5593 props = {line.split("\t", 1)[0]: line.split("\t", 1)[1] for line in lines} 

5594 features = {k: v for k, v in props.items() if k.startswith("feature@") or k == "delegation"} 

5595 if len(lines) == 0: 

5596 cmd = p.split_args(f"{p.zfs_program} list -t filesystem -Hp -o name -s name", r.pool) 

5597 if self.try_ssh_command(remote, log_trace, cmd=cmd) is None: 

5598 die(f"Pool does not exist for {loc} dataset: {r.basis_root_dataset}. Manually create the pool first!") 

5599 params.zpool_features[loc] = features 

5600 

5601 def is_zpool_feature_enabled_or_active(self, remote: Remote, feature: str) -> bool: 

5602 return self.params.zpool_features[remote.location].get(feature) in ("active", "enabled") 

5603 

5604 def are_bookmarks_enabled(self, remote: Remote) -> bool: 

5605 return self.is_zpool_feature_enabled_or_active( 

5606 remote, "feature@bookmark_v2" 

5607 ) and self.is_zpool_feature_enabled_or_active(remote, "feature@bookmark_written") 

5608 

5609 def is_caching_snapshots(self, remote: Remote) -> bool: 

5610 return ( 

5611 self.params.is_caching_snapshots 

5612 and self.is_program_available(zfs_version_is_at_least_2_2_0, remote.location) 

5613 and self.is_zpool_feature_enabled_or_active(remote, "feature@extensible_dataset") 

5614 ) 

5615 

5616 def check_zfs_dataset_busy(self, remote: Remote, dataset: str, busy_if_send: bool = True) -> bool: 

5617 """Decline to start a state changing ZFS operation that is, although harmless, likely to collide with other 

5618 currently running processes. Instead, retry the operation later, after some delay. For example, decline to 

5619 start a 'zfs receive' into a destination dataset if another process is already running another 'zfs receive' 

5620 into the same destination dataset, as ZFS would reject any such attempt. However, it's actually fine to run an 

5621 incremental 'zfs receive' into a dataset in parallel with a 'zfs send' out of the very same dataset. This also 

5622 helps daisy chain use cases where A replicates to B, and B replicates to C. 

5623 

5624 check_zfs_dataset_busy() offers no guarantees, it merely proactively avoids likely collisions. In other words, 

5625 even if the process check below passes there is no guarantee that the destination dataset won't be busy by the 

5626 time we actually execute the 'zfs send' operation. In such an event ZFS will reject the operation, we'll detect 

5627 that, and we'll simply retry, after some delay. check_zfs_dataset_busy() can be disabled via --ps-program=-. 

5628 

5629 TLDR: As is common for long-running operations in distributed systems, we use coordination-free optimistic 

5630 concurrency control where the parties simply retry on collision detection (rather than coordinate concurrency 

5631 via a remote lock server).""" 

5632 p, log = self.params, self.params.log 

5633 if not self.is_program_available("ps", remote.location): 

5634 return True 

5635 cmd = p.split_args(f"{p.ps_program} -Ao args") 

5636 procs = (self.try_ssh_command(remote, log_trace, cmd=cmd) or "").splitlines() 

5637 if self.inject_params.get("is_zfs_dataset_busy", False): 

5638 procs += ["sudo -n zfs receive -u -o foo:bar=/baz " + dataset] # for unit testing only 

5639 if not self.is_zfs_dataset_busy(procs, dataset, busy_if_send=busy_if_send): 

5640 return True 

5641 op = "zfs {receive" + ("|send" if busy_if_send else "") + "} operation" 

5642 try: 

5643 die(f"Cannot continue now: Destination is already busy with {op} from another process: {dataset}") 

5644 except SystemExit as e: 

5645 log.warning("%s", e) 

5646 raise RetryableError("dst currently busy with zfs mutation op") from e 

5647 

5648 zfs_dataset_busy_prefix = r"(([^ ]*?/)?(sudo|doas)( +-n)? +)?([^ ]*?/)?zfs (receive|recv" 

5649 zfs_dataset_busy_if_mods = re.compile((zfs_dataset_busy_prefix + ") .*").replace("(", "(?:")) 

5650 zfs_dataset_busy_if_send = re.compile((zfs_dataset_busy_prefix + "|send) .*").replace("(", "(?:")) 

5651 

5652 @staticmethod 

5653 def is_zfs_dataset_busy(procs: List[str], dataset: str, busy_if_send: bool) -> bool: 

5654 regex = Job.zfs_dataset_busy_if_send if busy_if_send else Job.zfs_dataset_busy_if_mods 

5655 suffix = " " + dataset 

5656 infix = " " + dataset + "@" 

5657 return any((proc.endswith(suffix) or infix in proc) and regex.fullmatch(proc) for proc in procs) 

5658 

5659 def run_ssh_cmd_batched( 

5660 self, 

5661 r: Remote, 

5662 cmd: List[str], 

5663 cmd_args: List[str], 

5664 fn: Callable[[List[str]], Any], 

5665 max_batch_items: int = 2**29, 

5666 sep: str = " ", 

5667 ) -> None: 

5668 drain(self.itr_ssh_cmd_batched(r, cmd, cmd_args, fn, max_batch_items=max_batch_items, sep=sep)) 

5669 

5670 def itr_ssh_cmd_batched( 

5671 self, 

5672 r: Remote, 

5673 cmd: List[str], 

5674 cmd_args: List[str], 

5675 fn: Callable[[List[str]], Any], 

5676 max_batch_items: int = 2**29, 

5677 sep: str = " ", 

5678 ) -> Generator[Any, None, None]: 

5679 """Runs fn(cmd_args) in batches w/ cmd, without creating a command line that's too big for the OS to handle.""" 

5680 max_bytes = min(self.get_max_command_line_bytes("local"), self.get_max_command_line_bytes(r.location)) 

5681 assert isinstance(sep, str) 

5682 # Max size of a single argument is 128KB on Linux - https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/bug-bash/2020-09/msg00095.html 

5683 max_bytes = max_bytes if sep == " " else min(max_bytes, 131071) # e.g. 'zfs destroy foo@s1,s2,...,sN' 

5684 fsenc = sys.getfilesystemencoding() 

5685 seplen = len(sep.encode(fsenc)) 

5686 conn_pool: ConnectionPool = self.params.connection_pools[r.location].pool(SHARED) 

5687 conn: Connection = conn_pool.get_connection() 

5688 cmd = conn.ssh_cmd + cmd 

5689 conn_pool.return_connection(conn) 

5690 header_bytes: int = len(" ".join(cmd).encode(fsenc)) 

5691 batch: List[str] = [] 

5692 total_bytes: int = header_bytes 

5693 max_items = max_batch_items 

5694 

5695 def flush() -> Any: 

5696 if len(batch) > 0: 

5697 return fn(batch) 

5698 return None 

5699 

5700 for cmd_arg in cmd_args: 

5701 curr_bytes = seplen + len(cmd_arg.encode(fsenc)) 

5702 if total_bytes + curr_bytes > max_bytes or max_items <= 0: 

5703 results = flush() 

5704 if results is not None: 5704 ↛ 5706line 5704 didn't jump to line 5706 because the condition on line 5704 was always true

5705 yield results 

5706 batch, total_bytes, max_items = [], header_bytes, max_batch_items 

5707 batch.append(cmd_arg) 

5708 total_bytes += curr_bytes 

5709 max_items -= 1 

5710 results = flush() 

5711 if results is not None: 

5712 yield results 

5713 

5714 def run_ssh_cmd_parallel( 

5715 self, 

5716 r: Remote, 

5717 cmd_args_list: List[Tuple[List[str], List[str]]], 

5718 fn: Callable[[List[str], List[str]], Any], 

5719 max_batch_items: int = 2**29, 

5720 ) -> None: 

5721 drain(self.itr_ssh_cmd_parallel(r, cmd_args_list, fn=fn, max_batch_items=max_batch_items, ordered=False)) 

5722 

5723 def itr_ssh_cmd_parallel( 

5724 self, 

5725 r: Remote, 

5726 cmd_args_list: List[Tuple[List[str], List[str]]], 

5727 fn: Callable[[List[str], List[str]], Any], 

5728 max_batch_items: int = 2**29, 

5729 ordered: bool = True, 

5730 ) -> Generator[Any, None, Any]: 

5731 """Returns output datasets in the same order as the input datasets (not in random order) if ordered == True.""" 

5732 max_workers = self.max_workers[r.location] 

5733 with ThreadPoolExecutor(max_workers=max_workers) as executor: 

5734 iterators = [ 

5735 self.itr_ssh_cmd_batched( 

5736 r, cmd, cmd_args, lambda batch, cmd=cmd: executor.submit(fn, cmd, batch), max_batch_items=max_batch_items # type: ignore[misc] 

5737 ) 

5738 for cmd, cmd_args in cmd_args_list 

5739 ] 

5740 iterator = itertools.chain(*iterators) 

5741 iterators.clear() # help gc 

5742 # Materialize the next N futures into a buffer, causing submission + parallel execution of their CLI calls 

5743 fifo_buffer: Deque[Future] = deque(itertools.islice(iterator, max_workers)) 

5744 next_future: Optional[Future] 

5745 

5746 if ordered: 

5747 while fifo_buffer: # submit the next CLI call whenever the current CLI call returns 

5748 curr_future: Future = fifo_buffer.popleft() 

5749 next_future = next(iterator, None) # causes the next CLI call to be submitted 

5750 if next_future is not None: 

5751 fifo_buffer.append(next_future) 

5752 yield curr_future.result() # blocks until CLI returns 

5753 else: 

5754 todo_futures: Set[Future] = set(fifo_buffer) 

5755 fifo_buffer.clear() # help gc 

5756 while todo_futures: 

5757 done_futures, todo_futures = concurrent.futures.wait(todo_futures, return_when=FIRST_COMPLETED) # blocks 

5758 for done_future in done_futures: # submit the next CLI call whenever a CLI call returns 

5759 next_future = next(iterator, None) # causes the next CLI call to be submitted 

5760 if next_future is not None: 

5761 todo_futures.add(next_future) 

5762 yield done_future.result() # does not block as processing has already completed 

5763 assert next(iterator, None) is None 

5764 

5765 def zfs_list_snapshots_in_parallel( 

5766 self, r: Remote, cmd: List[str], datasets: List[str], ordered: bool = True 

5767 ) -> Generator[Any, None, Any]: 

5768 """Runs 'zfs list -t snapshot' on multiple datasets at the same time.""" 

5769 max_workers = self.max_workers[r.location] 

5770 return self.itr_ssh_cmd_parallel( 

5771 r, 

5772 [(cmd, datasets)], 

5773 fn=lambda cmd, batch: (self.try_ssh_command(r, log_trace, cmd=cmd + batch) or "").splitlines(), 

5774 max_batch_items=min( 

5775 self.max_datasets_per_minibatch_on_list_snaps[r.location], 

5776 max( 

5777 len(datasets) // (max_workers if r.ssh_user_host else max_workers * 8), 

5778 max_workers if r.ssh_user_host else 1, 

5779 ), 

5780 ), 

5781 ordered=ordered, 

5782 ) 

5783 

5784 @staticmethod 

5785 def run_in_parallel(fn1: Callable[[], Any], fn2: Callable[[], Any]) -> Tuple[Any, Any]: 

5786 """perf: Runs both I/O functions in parallel/concurrently.""" 

5787 with ThreadPoolExecutor(max_workers=1) as executor: 

5788 future: Future = executor.submit(fn2) # async fn2 

5789 result1 = fn1() # blocks until fn1 call returns 

5790 result2 = future.result() # blocks until fn2 call returns 

5791 return result1, result2 

5792 

5793 def get_max_command_line_bytes(self, location: str, os_name: Optional[str] = None) -> int: 

5794 """Remote flavor of os.sysconf("SC_ARG_MAX") - size(os.environb) - safety margin""" 

5795 os_name = os_name if os_name else self.params.available_programs[location].get("os") 

5796 if os_name == "Linux": 5796 ↛ 5798line 5796 didn't jump to line 5798 because the condition on line 5796 was always true

5797 arg_max = 2 * 1024 * 1024 

5798 elif os_name == "FreeBSD": 

5799 arg_max = 256 * 1024 

5800 elif os_name == "SunOS": 

5801 arg_max = 1 * 1024 * 1024 

5802 elif os_name == "Darwin": 

5803 arg_max = 1 * 1024 * 1024 

5804 elif os_name == "Windows": 

5805 arg_max = 32 * 1024 

5806 else: 

5807 arg_max = 256 * 1024 # unknown 

5808 

5809 environ_size = 4 * 1024 # typically is 1-4 KB 

5810 safety_margin = (8 * 2 * 4 + 4) * 1024 if arg_max >= 1 * 1024 * 1024 else 8 * 1024 

5811 max_bytes = max(4 * 1024, arg_max - environ_size - safety_margin) 

5812 if self.max_command_line_bytes is not None: 5812 ↛ 5813line 5812 didn't jump to line 5813 because the condition on line 5812 was never true

5813 return self.max_command_line_bytes # for testing only 

5814 else: 

5815 return max_bytes 

5816 

5817 

5818############################################################################# 

5819@dataclass(order=True, repr=False) 

5820class Connection: 

5821 """Represents the ability to multiplex N=capacity concurrent SSH sessions over the same TCP connection.""" 

5822 

5823 free: int # sort order evens out the number of concurrent sessions among the TCP connections 

5824 last_modified: int # LIFO: tiebreaker favors latest returned conn as that's most alive and hot 

5825 

5826 def __init__(self, remote: Remote, max_concurrent_ssh_sessions_per_tcp_connection: int, cid: int) -> None: 

5827 assert max_concurrent_ssh_sessions_per_tcp_connection > 0 

5828 self.capacity: int = max_concurrent_ssh_sessions_per_tcp_connection 

5829 self.free: int = max_concurrent_ssh_sessions_per_tcp_connection 

5830 self.last_modified: int = 0 

5831 self.cid: int = cid 

5832 self.ssh_cmd: List[str] = remote.local_ssh_command() 

5833 self.ssh_cmd_quoted: List[str] = [shlex.quote(item) for item in self.ssh_cmd] 

5834 self.lock: threading.Lock = threading.Lock() 

5835 self.last_refresh_time: int = 0 

5836 

5837 def __repr__(self) -> str: 

5838 return str({"free": self.free, "cid": self.cid}) 

5839 

5840 def increment_free(self, value: int) -> None: 

5841 self.free += value 

5842 assert self.free >= 0 

5843 assert self.free <= self.capacity 

5844 

5845 def is_full(self) -> bool: 

5846 return self.free <= 0 

5847 

5848 def update_last_modified(self, last_modified: int) -> None: 

5849 self.last_modified = last_modified 

5850 

5851 def shutdown(self, msg_prefix: str, p: Params) -> None: 

5852 ssh_cmd = self.ssh_cmd 

5853 if ssh_cmd: 

5854 ssh_socket_cmd = ssh_cmd[0:-1] + ["-O", "exit", ssh_cmd[-1]] 

5855 p.log.log(log_trace, f"Executing {msg_prefix}: %s", shlex.join(ssh_socket_cmd)) 

5856 process = subprocess.run(ssh_socket_cmd, stdin=DEVNULL, stderr=PIPE, text=True) 

5857 if process.returncode != 0: 5857 ↛ exitline 5857 didn't return from function 'shutdown' because the condition on line 5857 was always true

5858 p.log.log(log_trace, "%s", process.stderr.rstrip()) 

5859 

5860 

5861############################################################################# 

5862class ConnectionPool: 

5863 """Fetch a TCP connection for use in an SSH session, use it, finally return it back to the pool for future reuse.""" 

5864 

5865 def __init__(self, remote: Remote, max_concurrent_ssh_sessions_per_tcp_connection: int) -> None: 

5866 assert max_concurrent_ssh_sessions_per_tcp_connection > 0 

5867 self.remote: Remote = copy.copy(remote) # shallow copy for immutability (Remote is mutable) 

5868 self.capacity: int = max_concurrent_ssh_sessions_per_tcp_connection 

5869 self.priority_queue: SmallPriorityQueue = SmallPriorityQueue(reverse=True) # sorted by #free slots and last_modified 

5870 self.last_modified: int = 0 # monotonically increasing sequence number 

5871 self.cid: int = 0 # monotonically increasing connection number 

5872 self._lock: threading.Lock = threading.Lock() 

5873 

5874 def get_connection(self) -> Connection: 

5875 """Any Connection object returned on get_connection() also remains intentionally contained in the priority queue, 

5876 and that identical Connection object is later, on return_connection(), temporarily removed from the priority queue, 

5877 updated with an incremented "free" slot count and then immediately reinserted into the priority queue. In effect, 

5878 any Connection object remains intentionally contained in the priority queue at all times.""" 

5879 with self._lock: 

5880 conn = self.priority_queue.pop() if len(self.priority_queue) > 0 else None 

5881 if conn is None or conn.is_full(): 

5882 if conn is not None: 

5883 self.priority_queue.push(conn) 

5884 conn = Connection(self.remote, self.capacity, self.cid) # add a new connection 

5885 self.last_modified += 1 

5886 conn.update_last_modified(self.last_modified) # LIFO tiebreaker favors latest conn as that's most alive 

5887 self.cid += 1 

5888 conn.increment_free(-1) 

5889 self.priority_queue.push(conn) 

5890 return conn 

5891 

5892 def return_connection(self, conn: Connection) -> None: 

5893 assert conn is not None 

5894 with self._lock: 

5895 # update priority = remove conn from queue, increment priority, finally reinsert updated conn into queue 

5896 if self.priority_queue.remove(conn): # conn is not contained only if ConnectionPool.shutdown() was called 

5897 conn.increment_free(1) 

5898 self.last_modified += 1 

5899 conn.update_last_modified(self.last_modified) # LIFO tiebreaker favors latest conn as that's most alive 

5900 self.priority_queue.push(conn) 

5901 

5902 def shutdown(self, msg_prefix: str) -> None: 

5903 with self._lock: 

5904 if self.remote.reuse_ssh_connection: 5904 ↛ 5907line 5904 didn't jump to line 5907 because the condition on line 5904 was always true

5905 for conn in self.priority_queue: 

5906 conn.shutdown(msg_prefix, self.remote.params) 

5907 self.priority_queue.clear() 

5908 

5909 def __repr__(self) -> str: 

5910 with self._lock: 

5911 queue = self.priority_queue 

5912 return str({"capacity": self.capacity, "queue_len": len(queue), "cid": self.cid, "queue": queue}) 

5913 

5914 

5915############################################################################# 

5916class ConnectionPools: 

5917 """A bunch of named connection pools with various multiplexing capacities.""" 

5918 

5919 def __init__(self, remote: Remote, capacities: Dict[str, int]) -> None: 

5920 self.pools = {name: ConnectionPool(remote, capacity) for name, capacity in capacities.items()} 

5921 

5922 def __repr__(self) -> str: 

5923 return str(self.pools) 

5924 

5925 def pool(self, name: str) -> ConnectionPool: 

5926 return self.pools[name] 

5927 

5928 def shutdown(self, msg_prefix: str) -> None: 

5929 for name, pool in self.pools.items(): 

5930 pool.shutdown(msg_prefix + "/" + name) 

5931 

5932 

5933############################################################################# 

5934class ProgressReporter: 

5935 """Periodically prints progress updates to the same console status line, which is helpful if the program runs in an 

5936 interactive Unix terminal session. Tails the 'pv' output log files that are being written to by (parallel) replication, 

5937 and extracts aggregate progress and throughput metrics from them, such as MB, MB/s, ETA, etc. Periodically prints these 

5938 metrics to the console status line (but not to the log file), and in doing so "visually overwrites" the previous status 

5939 line, via appending a \r carriage return control char rather than a \n newline char. Does not print a status line if the 

5940 Unix environment var 'bzfs_isatty' is set to 'false', in order not to confuse programs that scrape redirected stdout. 

5941 Example console status line: 

5942 2025-01-17 01:23:04 [I] zfs sent 41.7 GiB 0:00:46 [963 MiB/s] [907 MiB/s] [==========> ] 80% ETA 0:00:04 ETA 01:23:08""" 

5943 

5944 def __init__( 

5945 self, p: Params, use_select: bool, progress_update_intervals: Optional[Tuple[float, float]], fail: bool = False 

5946 ) -> None: 

5947 # immutable variables: 

5948 self.params: Params = p 

5949 self.use_select: bool = use_select 

5950 self.progress_update_intervals = progress_update_intervals 

5951 self.inject_error: bool = fail # for testing only 

5952 

5953 # mutable variables: 

5954 self.thread: Optional[threading.Thread] = None 

5955 self.exception: Optional[BaseException] = None 

5956 self.lock: threading.Lock = threading.Lock() 

5957 self.sleeper: InterruptibleSleep = InterruptibleSleep(self.lock) # sleeper shares lock with reporter 

5958 self.file_name_queue: Set[str] = set() 

5959 self.file_name_set: Set[str] = set() 

5960 self.is_resetting = True 

5961 self.is_pausing = False 

5962 

5963 def start(self) -> None: 

5964 with self.lock: 

5965 assert self.thread is None 

5966 self.thread = threading.Thread(target=lambda: self._run(), name="progress_reporter", daemon=True) 

5967 self.thread.start() 

5968 

5969 def stop(self) -> None: 

5970 """Blocks until reporter is stopped, then reraises any exception that may have happened during log processing.""" 

5971 self.sleeper.interrupt() 

5972 t = self.thread 

5973 if t is not None: 

5974 t.join() 

5975 e = self.exception 

5976 if e is not None: 

5977 raise e # reraise exception in current thread 

5978 

5979 def pause(self) -> None: 

5980 with self.lock: 

5981 self.is_pausing = True 

5982 

5983 def reset(self) -> None: 

5984 with self.lock: 

5985 self.is_resetting = True 

5986 

5987 def enqueue_pv_log_file(self, pv_log_file: str) -> None: 

5988 """Tells progress reporter thread to also monitor and tail the given pv log file.""" 

5989 with self.lock: 

5990 if pv_log_file not in self.file_name_set: 5990 ↛ exitline 5990 didn't jump to the function exit

5991 self.file_name_queue.add(pv_log_file) 

5992 

5993 def _run(self) -> None: 

5994 log = self.params.log 

5995 try: 

5996 fds: List[IO] = [] 

5997 try: 

5998 selector = selectors.SelectSelector() if self.use_select else selectors.PollSelector() 

5999 try: 

6000 self._run_internal(fds, selector) 

6001 finally: 

6002 selector.close() 

6003 finally: 

6004 for fd in fds: 6004 ↛ 6005line 6004 didn't jump to line 6005 because the loop on line 6004 never started

6005 fd.close() 

6006 except BaseException as e: 

6007 self.exception = e # will be reraised in stop() 

6008 log.exception("%s", "ProgressReporter:") 

6009 

6010 @dataclass 

6011 class TransferStat: 

6012 @dataclass(order=True) 

6013 class ETA: # Estimated time of arrival 

6014 timestamp_nanos: int # sorted by future time at which current zfs send/recv transfer is estimated to complete 

6015 seq_nr: int # tiebreaker wrt. sort order 

6016 line_tail: str = field(compare=False) # trailing pv log line part w/ progress bar, duration ETA, timestamp ETA 

6017 

6018 bytes_in_flight: int 

6019 eta: ETA 

6020 

6021 def _run_internal(self, fds: List[IO], selector: selectors.BaseSelector) -> None: 

6022 

6023 class Sample(NamedTuple): 

6024 sent_bytes: int 

6025 timestamp_nanos: int 

6026 

6027 log = self.params.log 

6028 update_interval_secs, sliding_window_secs = ( 

6029 self.progress_update_intervals if self.progress_update_intervals is not None else self.get_update_intervals() 

6030 ) 

6031 update_interval_nanos: int = round(update_interval_secs * 1_000_000_000) 

6032 sliding_window_nanos: int = round(sliding_window_secs * 1_000_000_000) 

6033 sleep_nanos = round(update_interval_nanos / 2.5) 

6034 etas: List = [] 

6035 while True: 

6036 empty_file_name_queue: Set[str] = set() 

6037 with self.lock: 

6038 if self.sleeper.is_stopping: 

6039 return 

6040 # progress reporter thread picks up pv log files that so far aren't being tailed 

6041 n = len(self.file_name_queue) 

6042 m = len(self.file_name_set) 

6043 self.file_name_set.update(self.file_name_queue) # union 

6044 assert len(self.file_name_set) == n + m # aka assert (previous) file_name_set.isdisjoint(file_name_queue) 

6045 local_file_name_queue = self.file_name_queue 

6046 self.file_name_queue = empty_file_name_queue # exchange buffers 

6047 is_pausing = self.is_pausing 

6048 self.is_pausing = False 

6049 is_resetting = self.is_resetting 

6050 self.is_resetting = False 

6051 if is_pausing: 6051 ↛ 6052line 6051 didn't jump to line 6052 because the condition on line 6051 was never true

6052 next_update_nanos = time.monotonic_ns() + 10 * 365 * 86400 * 1_000_000_000 # infinity 

6053 if is_resetting: 6053 ↛ 6059line 6053 didn't jump to line 6059 because the condition on line 6053 was always true

6054 sent_bytes, last_status_len = 0, 0 

6055 num_lines, num_readables = 0, 0 

6056 start_time_nanos = time.monotonic_ns() 

6057 next_update_nanos = start_time_nanos + update_interval_nanos 

6058 latest_samples: Deque[Sample] = deque([Sample(0, start_time_nanos)]) # sliding window w/ recent measurements 

6059 for pv_log_file in local_file_name_queue: 

6060 try: 

6061 Path(pv_log_file).touch() 

6062 fd = open_nofollow(pv_log_file, mode="r", newline="", encoding="utf-8") 

6063 except FileNotFoundError: # a third party has somehow deleted the log file or directory 

6064 with self.lock: 

6065 self.file_name_set.discard(pv_log_file) # enable re-adding the file later via enqueue_pv_log_file() 

6066 log.warning("ProgressReporter: pv log file disappeared before initial open, skipping: %s", pv_log_file) 

6067 continue # skip to the next file in the queue 

6068 fds.append(fd) 

6069 eta = self.TransferStat.ETA(timestamp_nanos=0, seq_nr=-len(fds), line_tail="") 

6070 selector.register(fd, selectors.EVENT_READ, data=(iter(fd), self.TransferStat(bytes_in_flight=0, eta=eta))) 

6071 etas.append(eta) 

6072 readables = selector.select(timeout=0) # 0 indicates "don't block" 

6073 has_line = False 

6074 curr_time_nanos = time.monotonic_ns() 

6075 selector_key: selectors.SelectorKey 

6076 for selector_key, _ in readables: # for each file that's ready for non-blocking read 6076 ↛ 6077line 6076 didn't jump to line 6077 because the loop on line 6076 never started

6077 num_readables += 1 

6078 iter_fd, s = selector_key.data 

6079 for line in iter_fd: # aka iter(fd) 

6080 sent_bytes += self.update_transfer_stat(line, s, curr_time_nanos) 

6081 num_lines += 1 

6082 has_line = True 

6083 if curr_time_nanos >= next_update_nanos: 6083 ↛ 6084line 6083 didn't jump to line 6084 because the condition on line 6083 was never true

6084 elapsed_nanos = curr_time_nanos - start_time_nanos 

6085 msg0, msg3 = self.format_sent_bytes(sent_bytes, elapsed_nanos) # throughput etc since replication start time 

6086 msg1 = self.format_duration(elapsed_nanos) # duration since replication start time 

6087 oldest: Sample = latest_samples[0] # throughput etc, over sliding window 

6088 _, msg2 = self.format_sent_bytes(sent_bytes - oldest.sent_bytes, curr_time_nanos - oldest.timestamp_nanos) 

6089 msg4 = max(etas).line_tail if len(etas) > 0 else "" # progress bar, ETAs 

6090 timestamp = datetime.now().isoformat(sep=" ", timespec="seconds") # 2024-09-03 12:26:15 

6091 status_line = f"{timestamp} [I] zfs sent {msg0} {msg1} {msg2} {msg3} {msg4}" 

6092 status_line = status_line.ljust(last_status_len) # "overwrite" trailing chars of previous status with spaces 

6093 

6094 # The Unix console skips back to the beginning of the console line when it sees this \r control char: 

6095 sys.stdout.write(f"{status_line}\r") 

6096 sys.stdout.flush() 

6097 

6098 # log.log(log_trace, "\nnum_lines: %s, num_readables: %s", num_lines, num_readables) 

6099 last_status_len = len(status_line.rstrip()) 

6100 next_update_nanos += update_interval_nanos 

6101 latest_samples.append(Sample(sent_bytes, curr_time_nanos)) 

6102 if elapsed_nanos >= sliding_window_nanos: 

6103 latest_samples.popleft() # slide the sliding window containing recent measurements 

6104 elif not has_line: 6104 ↛ 6108line 6104 didn't jump to line 6108 because the condition on line 6104 was always true

6105 # Avoid burning CPU busily spinning on I/O readiness as fds are almost always ready for non-blocking read 

6106 # even if no new pv log line has been written. Yet retain ability to wake up immediately on reporter.stop(). 

6107 self.sleeper.sleep(min(sleep_nanos, next_update_nanos - curr_time_nanos)) 

6108 if self.inject_error: 

6109 raise ValueError("Injected ProgressReporter error") # for testing only 

6110 

6111 def update_transfer_stat(self, line: str, s: TransferStat, curr_time_nanos: int) -> int: 

6112 num_bytes, s.eta.timestamp_nanos, s.eta.line_tail = self.parse_pv_line(line, curr_time_nanos) 

6113 bytes_in_flight = s.bytes_in_flight 

6114 s.bytes_in_flight = num_bytes if line.endswith("\r") else 0 # intermediate vs. final status update of each transfer 

6115 return num_bytes - bytes_in_flight 

6116 

6117 no_rates_regex = re.compile(r".*/s\s*[)\]]?\s*") # matches until end of last pv rate, e.g. "834MiB/s]" or "834MiB/s)" 

6118 # time remaining --eta "ETA 00:00:39" or "ETA 2+0:00:39" or "ETA 2:0:00:39", followed by trailing --fineta timestamp ETA 

6119 time_remaining_eta_regex = re.compile(r".*?ETA\s*((\d+)[+:])?(\d\d?):(\d\d):(\d\d).*(ETA|FIN).*") 

6120 

6121 @staticmethod 

6122 def parse_pv_line(line: str, curr_time_nanos: int) -> Tuple[int, int, str]: 

6123 assert isinstance(line, str) 

6124 if ":" in line: 

6125 line = line.split(":", 1)[1].strip() 

6126 sent_bytes, line = pv_size_to_bytes(line) 

6127 line = ProgressReporter.no_rates_regex.sub("", line.lstrip(), 1) # remove pv --timer, --rate, --average-rate 

6128 if match := ProgressReporter.time_remaining_eta_regex.fullmatch(line): # extract pv --eta duration 

6129 _, days, hours, minutes, secs, _ = match.groups() 

6130 time_remaining_secs = (86400 * int(days) if days else 0) + int(hours) * 3600 + int(minutes) * 60 + int(secs) 

6131 curr_time_nanos += time_remaining_secs * 1_000_000_000 # ETA timestamp = now + time remaining duration 

6132 return sent_bytes, curr_time_nanos, line 

6133 return 0, curr_time_nanos, "" 

6134 

6135 @staticmethod 

6136 def format_sent_bytes(num_bytes: int, duration_nanos: int) -> Tuple[str, str]: 

6137 bytes_per_sec = round(1_000_000_000 * num_bytes / max(1, duration_nanos)) 

6138 return f"{human_readable_bytes(num_bytes, precision=2)}", f"[{human_readable_bytes(bytes_per_sec, precision=2)}/s]" 

6139 

6140 @staticmethod 

6141 def format_duration(duration_nanos: int) -> str: 

6142 total_seconds = round(duration_nanos / 1_000_000_000) 

6143 hours, remainder = divmod(total_seconds, 3600) 

6144 minutes, seconds = divmod(remainder, 60) 

6145 return f"{hours}:{minutes:02d}:{seconds:02d}" 

6146 

6147 def get_update_intervals(self) -> Tuple[float, float]: 

6148 parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(allow_abbrev=False) 

6149 parser.add_argument("--interval", "-i", type=float, default=1) 

6150 parser.add_argument("--average-rate-window", "-m", type=float, default=30) 

6151 args, _ = parser.parse_known_args(args=self.params.pv_program_opts) 

6152 interval = min(60 * 60, max(args.interval, 0.1)) 

6153 return interval, min(60 * 60, max(args.average_rate_window, interval)) 

6154 

6155 

6156############################################################################# 

6157class InterruptibleSleep: 

6158 """Provides a sleep(timeout) function that can be interrupted by another thread.""" 

6159 

6160 def __init__(self, lock: Optional[threading.Lock] = None) -> None: 

6161 self.is_stopping: bool = False 

6162 self._lock = lock if lock is not None else threading.Lock() 

6163 self._condition = threading.Condition(self._lock) 

6164 

6165 def sleep(self, duration_nanos: int) -> None: 

6166 """Delays the current thread by the given number of nanoseconds.""" 

6167 end_time_nanos = time.monotonic_ns() + duration_nanos 

6168 with self._lock: 

6169 while not self.is_stopping: 

6170 diff_nanos = end_time_nanos - time.monotonic_ns() 

6171 if diff_nanos <= 0: 

6172 return 

6173 self._condition.wait(timeout=diff_nanos / 1_000_000_000) # release, then block until notified or timeout 

6174 

6175 def interrupt(self) -> None: 

6176 """Wakes up currently sleeping threads and makes any future sleep()s a noop.""" 

6177 with self._lock: 

6178 if not self.is_stopping: 

6179 self.is_stopping = True 

6180 self._condition.notify_all() 

6181 

6182 

6183############################################################################# 

6184def fix_send_recv_opts( 

6185 opts: List[str], 

6186 exclude_long_opts: Set[str], 

6187 exclude_short_opts: str, 

6188 include_arg_opts: Set[str], 

6189 exclude_arg_opts: FrozenSet[str] = frozenset(), 

6190) -> List[str]: 

6191 """These opts are instead managed via bzfs CLI args --dryrun, etc.""" 

6192 assert "-" not in exclude_short_opts 

6193 results = [] 

6194 i = 0 

6195 n = len(opts) 

6196 while i < n: 

6197 opt = opts[i] 

6198 i += 1 

6199 if opt in exclude_arg_opts: # example: {"-X", "--exclude"} 

6200 i += 1 

6201 continue 

6202 elif opt in include_arg_opts: # example: {"-o", "-x"} 

6203 results.append(opt) 

6204 if i < n: 

6205 results.append(opts[i]) 

6206 i += 1 

6207 elif opt not in exclude_long_opts: # example: {"--dryrun", "--verbose"} 

6208 if opt.startswith("-") and opt != "-" and not opt.startswith("--"): 

6209 for char in exclude_short_opts: # example: "den" 

6210 opt = opt.replace(char, "") 

6211 if opt == "-": 

6212 continue 

6213 results.append(opt) 

6214 return results 

6215 

6216 

6217def fix_solaris_raw_mode(lst: List[str]) -> List[str]: 

6218 lst = ["-w" if opt == "--raw" else opt for opt in lst] 

6219 lst = ["compress" if opt == "--compressed" else opt for opt in lst] 

6220 i = lst.index("-w") if "-w" in lst else -1 

6221 if i >= 0: 

6222 i += 1 

6223 if i == len(lst) or (lst[i] != "none" and lst[i] != "compress" and lst[i] != "crypto"): 

6224 lst.insert(i, "none") 

6225 return lst 

6226 

6227 

6228ssh_master_domain_socket_file_pid_regex = re.compile(r"^[0-9]+") # see socket_name in local_ssh_command() 

6229 

6230 

6231def delete_stale_files( 

6232 root_dir: str, 

6233 prefix: str, 

6234 millis: int = 60 * 60 * 1000, 

6235 dirs: bool = False, 

6236 exclude: Optional[str] = None, 

6237 ssh: bool = False, 

6238) -> None: 

6239 """Cleans up obsolete files. For example caused by abnormal termination, OS crash.""" 

6240 seconds = millis / 1000 

6241 now = time.time() 

6242 for entry in os.scandir(root_dir): 

6243 if entry.name == exclude or not entry.name.startswith(prefix): 

6244 continue 

6245 try: 

6246 if ((dirs and entry.is_dir()) or (not dirs and not entry.is_dir())) and now - entry.stat().st_mtime >= seconds: 

6247 if dirs: 

6248 shutil.rmtree(entry.path, ignore_errors=True) 

6249 elif not (ssh and stat.S_ISSOCK(entry.stat().st_mode)): 

6250 os.remove(entry.path) 

6251 elif match := ssh_master_domain_socket_file_pid_regex.match(entry.name[len(prefix) :]): 6251 ↛ 6242line 6251 didn't jump to line 6242 because the condition on line 6251 was always true

6252 pid = int(match.group(0)) 

6253 if pid_exists(pid) is False or now - entry.stat().st_mtime >= 31 * 24 * 60 * 60: 

6254 os.remove(entry.path) # bzfs process is nomore alive hence its ssh master process isn't alive either 

6255 except FileNotFoundError: 

6256 pass # harmless 

6257 

6258 

6259def die(msg: str, exit_code: int = die_status, parser: Optional[argparse.ArgumentParser] = None) -> NoReturn: 

6260 if parser is None: 

6261 ex = SystemExit(msg) 

6262 ex.code = exit_code 

6263 raise ex 

6264 else: 

6265 parser.error(msg) 

6266 

6267 

6268def filter_lines(input_list: Iterable[str], input_set: Set[str]) -> List[str]: 

6269 """For each line in input_list, includes the line if input_set contains the first column field of that line.""" 

6270 if len(input_set) == 0: 

6271 return [] 

6272 return [line for line in input_list if line[0 : line.index("\t")] in input_set] 

6273 

6274 

6275def filter_lines_except(input_list: List[str], input_set: Set[str]) -> List[str]: 

6276 """For each line in input_list, includes the line if input_set does not contain the first column field of that line.""" 

6277 if len(input_set) == 0: 

6278 return input_list 

6279 return [line for line in input_list if line[0 : line.index("\t")] not in input_set] 

6280 

6281 

6282def has_siblings(sorted_datasets: List[str]) -> bool: 

6283 """Returns whether the (sorted) list of input datasets contains any siblings.""" 

6284 skip_dataset = DONT_SKIP_DATASET 

6285 parents: Set[str] = set() 

6286 for dataset in sorted_datasets: 

6287 assert dataset 

6288 parent = os.path.dirname(dataset) 

6289 if parent in parents: 

6290 return True # I have a sibling if my parent already has another child 

6291 parents.add(parent) 

6292 if is_descendant(dataset, of_root_dataset=skip_dataset): 

6293 continue 

6294 if skip_dataset != DONT_SKIP_DATASET: 

6295 return True # I have a sibling if I am a root dataset and another root dataset already exists 

6296 skip_dataset = dataset 

6297 return False 

6298 

6299 

6300def is_descendant(dataset: str, of_root_dataset: str) -> bool: 

6301 return (dataset + "/").startswith(of_root_dataset + "/") 

6302 

6303 

6304def relativize_dataset(dataset: str, root_dataset: str) -> str: 

6305 """Converts an absolute dataset path to a relative dataset path wrt root_dataset 

6306 Example: root_dataset=tank/foo, dataset=tank/foo/bar/baz --> relative_path=/bar/baz""" 

6307 return dataset[len(root_dataset) :] 

6308 

6309 

6310def replace_prefix(s: str, old_prefix: str, new_prefix: str) -> str: 

6311 """In a string s, replaces a leading old_prefix string with new_prefix. Assumes the leading string is present.""" 

6312 assert s.startswith(old_prefix) 

6313 return new_prefix + s[len(old_prefix) :] 

6314 

6315 

6316def replace_in_lines(lines: List[str], old: str, new: str, count: int = -1) -> None: 

6317 for i in range(len(lines)): 

6318 lines[i] = lines[i].replace(old, new, count) 

6319 

6320 

6321def has_duplicates(sorted_list: List) -> bool: 

6322 """Returns True if any adjacent items within the given sorted sequence are equal.""" 

6323 return any(a == b for a, b in zip(sorted_list, sorted_list[1:])) 

6324 

6325 

6326def is_included(name: str, include_regexes: RegexList, exclude_regexes: RegexList) -> bool: 

6327 """Returns True if the name matches at least one of the include regexes but none of the exclude regexes; else False. 

6328 A regex that starts with a `!` is a negation - the regex matches if the regex without the `!` prefix does not match.""" 

6329 for regex, is_negation in exclude_regexes: 6329 ↛ 6330line 6329 didn't jump to line 6330 because the loop on line 6329 never started

6330 is_match = regex.fullmatch(name) if regex.pattern != ".*" else True 

6331 if is_negation: 

6332 is_match = not is_match 

6333 if is_match: 

6334 return False 

6335 

6336 for regex, is_negation in include_regexes: 6336 ↛ 6337line 6336 didn't jump to line 6337 because the loop on line 6336 never started

6337 is_match = regex.fullmatch(name) if regex.pattern != ".*" else True 

6338 if is_negation: 

6339 is_match = not is_match 

6340 if is_match: 

6341 return True 

6342 

6343 return False 

6344 

6345 

6346def compile_regexes(regexes: List[str], suffix: str = "") -> RegexList: 

6347 assert isinstance(regexes, list) 

6348 compiled_regexes = [] 

6349 for regex in regexes: 

6350 if suffix: # disallow non-trailing end-of-str symbol in dataset regexes to ensure descendants will also match 

6351 if regex.endswith("\\$"): 

6352 pass # trailing literal $ is ok 

6353 elif regex.endswith("$"): 

6354 regex = regex[0:-1] # ok because all users of compile_regexes() call re.fullmatch() 

6355 elif "$" in regex: 

6356 raise re.error("Must not use non-trailing '$' character", regex) 

6357 if is_negation := regex.startswith("!"): 

6358 regex = regex[1:] 

6359 regex = replace_capturing_groups_with_non_capturing_groups(regex) 

6360 if regex != ".*" or not (suffix.startswith("(") and suffix.endswith(")?")): 

6361 regex = f"{regex}{suffix}" 

6362 compiled_regexes.append((re.compile(regex), is_negation)) 

6363 return compiled_regexes 

6364 

6365 

6366def replace_capturing_groups_with_non_capturing_groups(regex: str) -> str: 

6367 """Replaces regex capturing groups with non-capturing groups for better matching performance. 

6368 Example: '(.*/)?tmp(foo|bar)(?!public)\\(' --> '(?:.*/)?tmp(?:foo|bar)(?!public)\\()' 

6369 Aka replaces brace '(' followed by a char other than question mark '?', but not preceded by a backslash 

6370 with the replacement string '(?:' 

6371 Also see https://docs.python.org/3/howto/regex.html#non-capturing-and-named-groups""" 

6372 # pattern = re.compile(r'(?<!\\)\((?!\?)') 

6373 # return pattern.sub('(?:', regex) 

6374 i = len(regex) - 2 

6375 while i >= 0: 

6376 i = regex.rfind("(", 0, i + 1) 

6377 if i >= 0 and regex[i] == "(" and (regex[i + 1] != "?") and (i == 0 or regex[i - 1] != "\\"): 

6378 regex = f"{regex[0:i]}(?:{regex[i + 1:]}" 

6379 i -= 1 

6380 return regex 

6381 

6382 

6383def getenv_any(key: str, default: Optional[str] = None) -> Optional[str]: 

6384 """All shell environment variable names used for configuration start with this prefix.""" 

6385 return os.getenv(env_var_prefix + key, default) 

6386 

6387 

6388def getenv_int(key: str, default: int) -> int: 

6389 return int(cast(str, getenv_any(key, str(default)))) 

6390 

6391 

6392def getenv_bool(key: str, default: bool = False) -> bool: 

6393 return cast(str, getenv_any(key, str(default))).lower().strip().lower() == "true" 

6394 

6395 

6396P = TypeVar("P") 

6397 

6398 

6399def find_match( 

6400 seq: Sequence[P], 

6401 predicate: Callable[[P], bool], 

6402 start: Optional[int] = None, 

6403 end: Optional[int] = None, 

6404 reverse: bool = False, 

6405 raises: Union[bool, str, Callable[[], str]] = False, # raises: bool | str | Callable = False, # python >= 3.10 

6406) -> int: 

6407 """Returns the integer index within seq of the first item (or last item if reverse==True) that matches the given 

6408 predicate condition. If no matching item is found returns -1 or ValueError, depending on the raises parameter, 

6409 which is a bool indicating whether to raise an error, or a string containing the error message, but can also be a 

6410 Callable/lambda in order to support efficient deferred generation of error messages. 

6411 Analog to str.find(), including slicing semantics with parameters start and end. 

6412 For example, seq can be a list, tuple or str. 

6413 

6414 Example usage: 

6415 lst = ["a", "b", "-c", "d"] 

6416 i = find_match(lst, lambda arg: arg.startswith("-"), start=1, end=3, reverse=True) 

6417 if i >= 0: 

6418 ... 

6419 i = find_match(lst, lambda arg: arg.startswith("-"), raises=f"Tag {tag} not found in {file}") 

6420 i = find_match(lst, lambda arg: arg.startswith("-"), raises=lambda: f"Tag {tag} not found in {file}") 

6421 """ 

6422 offset = 0 if start is None else start if start >= 0 else len(seq) + start 

6423 if start is not None or end is not None: 

6424 seq = seq[start:end] 

6425 for i, item in enumerate(reversed(seq) if reverse else seq): 

6426 if predicate(item): 

6427 if reverse: 

6428 return len(seq) - i - 1 + offset 

6429 else: 

6430 return i + offset 

6431 if raises is False or raises is None: 

6432 return -1 

6433 if raises is True: 

6434 raise ValueError("No matching item found in sequence") 

6435 if callable(raises): 

6436 raises = raises() 

6437 raise ValueError(raises) 

6438 

6439 

6440TAPPEND = TypeVar("TAPPEND") 

6441 

6442 

6443def xappend(lst: List[TAPPEND], *items: Union[TAPPEND, Iterable[TAPPEND]]) -> List[TAPPEND]: 

6444 """Appends each of the items to the given list if the item is "truthy", e.g. not None and not an empty string. 

6445 If an item is an iterable does so recursively, flattening the output.""" 

6446 for item in items: 

6447 if isinstance(item, str) or not isinstance(item, collections.abc.Iterable): 

6448 if item: 

6449 lst.append(cast(TAPPEND, item)) 

6450 else: 

6451 xappend(lst, *item) 

6452 return lst 

6453 

6454 

6455def human_readable_bytes(num_bytes: float, separator: str = " ", precision: Optional[int] = None, long: bool = False) -> str: 

6456 sign = "-" if num_bytes < 0 else "" 

6457 s = abs(num_bytes) 

6458 units = ("B", "KiB", "MiB", "GiB", "TiB", "PiB", "EiB", "ZiB", "YiB", "RiB", "QiB") 

6459 n = len(units) - 1 

6460 i = 0 

6461 long_form = f" ({num_bytes} bytes)" if long else "" 

6462 while s >= 1024 and i < n: 

6463 s /= 1024 

6464 i += 1 

6465 formatted_num = human_readable_float(s) if precision is None else f"{s:.{precision}f}" 

6466 return f"{sign}{formatted_num}{separator}{units[i]}{long_form}" 

6467 

6468 

6469def human_readable_duration( 

6470 duration: float, unit: str = "ns", separator: str = "", precision: Optional[int] = None, long: bool = False 

6471) -> str: 

6472 sign = "-" if duration < 0 else "" 

6473 t = abs(duration) 

6474 units = ("ns", "μs", "ms", "s", "m", "h", "d") 

6475 nanos = (1, 1_000, 1_000_000, 1_000_000_000, 60 * 1_000_000_000, 60 * 60 * 1_000_000_000, 60 * 60 * 24 * 1_000_000_000) 

6476 i = units.index(unit) 

6477 long_form = f" ({round(duration * nanos[i] / 1_000_000_000)} seconds)" if long else "" 

6478 if t < 1 and t != 0: 

6479 t *= nanos[i] 

6480 i = 0 

6481 while t >= 1000 and i < 3: 

6482 t /= 1000 

6483 i += 1 

6484 if i >= 3: 

6485 while t >= 60 and i < 5: 

6486 t /= 60 

6487 i += 1 

6488 if i >= 5: 

6489 while t >= 24 and i < len(units) - 1: 

6490 t /= 24 

6491 i += 1 

6492 formatted_num = human_readable_float(t) if precision is None else f"{t:.{precision}f}" 

6493 return f"{sign}{formatted_num}{separator}{units[i]}{long_form}" 

6494 

6495 

6496def human_readable_float(number: float) -> str: 

6497 """If the number has one digit before the decimal point (0 <= abs(number) < 10): 

6498 Round and use two decimals after the decimal point (e.g., 3.14559 --> "3.15"). 

6499 

6500 If the number has two digits before the decimal point (10 <= abs(number) < 100): 

6501 Round and use one decimal after the decimal point (e.g., 12.36 --> "12.4"). 

6502 

6503 If the number has three or more digits before the decimal point (abs(number) >= 100): 

6504 Round and use zero decimals after the decimal point (e.g., 123.556 --> "124"). 

6505 

6506 Ensure no unnecessary trailing zeroes are retained: Example: 1.500 --> "1.5", 1.00 --> "1" 

6507 """ 

6508 abs_number = abs(number) 

6509 precision = 2 if abs_number < 10 else 1 if abs_number < 100 else 0 

6510 if precision == 0: 

6511 return str(round(number)) 

6512 result = f"{number:.{precision}f}" 

6513 assert "." in result 

6514 result = result.rstrip("0").rstrip(".") # Remove trailing zeros and trailing decimal point if empty 

6515 return "0" if result == "-0" else result 

6516 

6517 

6518def percent(number: int, total: int) -> str: 

6519 return f"{number}={'NaN' if total == 0 else human_readable_float(100 * number / total)}%" 

6520 

6521 

6522def parse_duration_to_milliseconds(duration: str, regex_suffix: str = "", context: str = "") -> int: 

6523 unit_milliseconds = { 

6524 "milliseconds": 1, 

6525 "millis": 1, 

6526 "seconds": 1000, 

6527 "secs": 1000, 

6528 "minutes": 60 * 1000, 

6529 "mins": 60 * 1000, 

6530 "hours": 60 * 60 * 1000, 

6531 "days": 86400 * 1000, 

6532 "weeks": 7 * 86400 * 1000, 

6533 "months": round(30.5 * 86400 * 1000), 

6534 "years": 365 * 86400 * 1000, 

6535 } 

6536 match = re.fullmatch( 

6537 r"(\d+)\s*(milliseconds|millis|seconds|secs|minutes|mins|hours|days|weeks|months|years)" + regex_suffix, duration 

6538 ) 

6539 if not match: 

6540 if context: 

6541 die(f"Invalid duration format: {duration} within {context}") 

6542 else: 

6543 raise ValueError(f"Invalid duration format: {duration}") 

6544 assert match 

6545 quantity = int(match.group(1)) 

6546 unit = match.group(2) 

6547 return quantity * unit_milliseconds[unit] 

6548 

6549 

6550def get_home_directory() -> str: 

6551 """Reliably detects home dir without using HOME env var.""" 

6552 # thread-safe version of: os.environ.pop('HOME', None); os.path.expanduser('~') 

6553 return pwd.getpwuid(os.getuid()).pw_dir 

6554 

6555 

6556def create_symlink(src: str, dst_dir: str, dst: str) -> None: 

6557 rel_path = os.path.relpath(src, start=dst_dir) 

6558 os.symlink(rel_path, os.path.join(dst_dir, dst)) 

6559 

6560 

6561def is_version_at_least(version_str: str, min_version_str: str) -> bool: 

6562 """Checks if the version string is at least the minimum version string.""" 

6563 return tuple(map(int, version_str.split("."))) >= tuple(map(int, min_version_str.split("."))) 

6564 

6565 

6566def tail(file: str, n: int, errors: Optional[str] = None) -> Sequence[str]: 

6567 if not os.path.isfile(file): 

6568 return [] 

6569 with open_nofollow(file, "r", encoding="utf-8", errors=errors) as fd: 

6570 return deque(fd, maxlen=n) 

6571 

6572 

6573def append_if_absent(lst: List[TAPPEND], *items: TAPPEND) -> List[TAPPEND]: 

6574 for item in items: 

6575 if item not in lst: 

6576 lst.append(item) 

6577 return lst 

6578 

6579 

6580def stderr_to_str(stderr: Any) -> str: 

6581 """Workaround for https://github.com/python/cpython/issues/87597""" 

6582 return str(stderr) if not isinstance(stderr, bytes) else stderr.decode("utf-8") 

6583 

6584 

6585def xprint(log: Logger, value: Any, run: bool = True, end: str = "\n", file: Optional[TextIO] = None) -> None: 

6586 if run and value: 

6587 value = value if end else str(value).rstrip() 

6588 level = log_stdout if file is sys.stdout else log_stderr 

6589 log.log(level, "%s", value) 

6590 

6591 

6592def set_last_modification_time_safe( 

6593 path: str, 

6594 unixtime_in_secs: Union[int, Tuple[int, int]], 

6595 if_more_recent: bool = False, 

6596) -> None: 

6597 try: 

6598 os.makedirs(os.path.dirname(path), exist_ok=True) 

6599 set_last_modification_time(path, unixtime_in_secs=unixtime_in_secs, if_more_recent=if_more_recent) 

6600 except FileNotFoundError: 

6601 pass # harmless 

6602 

6603 

6604def set_last_modification_time( 

6605 path: str, 

6606 unixtime_in_secs: Union[int, Tuple[int, int]], 

6607 if_more_recent: bool = False, 

6608) -> None: 

6609 """if_more_recent=True is a concurrency control mechanism that prevents us from overwriting a newer (monotonically 

6610 increasing) snapshots_changed value (which is a UTC Unix time in integer seconds) that might have been written to the 

6611 cache file by a different, more up-to-date bzfs process.""" 

6612 unixtime_in_secs = (unixtime_in_secs, unixtime_in_secs) if isinstance(unixtime_in_secs, int) else unixtime_in_secs 

6613 if not os_path_exists(path): 

6614 with open(path, "a"): 

6615 pass 

6616 elif if_more_recent and unixtime_in_secs[1] <= round(os_stat(path).st_mtime): 

6617 return 

6618 os_utime(path, times=unixtime_in_secs) 

6619 

6620 

6621def drain(iterable: Iterable) -> None: 

6622 """Consumes all items in the iterable, effectively draining it.""" 

6623 deque(iterable, maxlen=0) 

6624 

6625 

6626def nprefix(s: str) -> str: 

6627 return sys.intern(s + "_") 

6628 

6629 

6630def ninfix(s: str) -> str: 

6631 return sys.intern(s + "_") if s else "" 

6632 

6633 

6634def nsuffix(s: str) -> str: 

6635 return sys.intern("_" + s) if s else "" 

6636 

6637 

6638def format_dict(dictionary: Dict[Any, Any]) -> str: 

6639 return f'"{dictionary}"' 

6640 

6641 

6642def unixtime_fromisoformat(datetime_str: str) -> int: 

6643 """Converts an ISO 8601 datetime string into a UTC Unix time in integer seconds. If the datetime string does not 

6644 contain time zone info then it is assumed to be in the local time zone.""" 

6645 return int(datetime.fromisoformat(datetime_str).timestamp()) 

6646 

6647 

6648def isotime_from_unixtime(unixtime_in_seconds: int) -> str: 

6649 """Converts a UTC Unix time in integer seconds into an ISO 8601 datetime string in the local time zone. 

6650 Example: 2024-09-03_12:26:15""" 

6651 tz: tzinfo = timezone.utc # outputs time in UTC 

6652 # tz = None # outputs time in local time zone 

6653 dt = datetime.fromtimestamp(unixtime_in_seconds, tz=tz) 

6654 return dt.isoformat(sep="_", timespec="seconds") 

6655 

6656 

6657def current_datetime( 

6658 tz_spec: Optional[str] = None, 

6659 now_fn: Optional[Callable[[Optional[tzinfo]], datetime]] = None, 

6660) -> datetime: 

6661 """Returns a datetime that is the current time in the given timezone, or in the local timezone if tz_spec is absent.""" 

6662 if now_fn is None: 

6663 now_fn = datetime.now 

6664 return now_fn(get_timezone(tz_spec)) 

6665 

6666 

6667def get_timezone(tz_spec: Optional[str] = None) -> Optional[tzinfo]: 

6668 """Returns the given timezone, or the local timezone if the timezone spec is absent. The optional timezone spec is of 

6669 the form "UTC" or "+HH:MM" or "-HH:MM" for fixed UTC offsets.""" 

6670 if tz_spec is None: 

6671 tz = None # i.e. local timezone 

6672 elif tz_spec == "UTC": 

6673 tz = timezone.utc 

6674 else: 

6675 if match := re.fullmatch(r"([+-])(\d\d):?(\d\d)", tz_spec): 

6676 sign, hours, minutes = match.groups() 

6677 offset = int(hours) * 60 + int(minutes) 

6678 offset = -offset if sign == "-" else offset 

6679 tz = timezone(timedelta(minutes=offset)) 

6680 elif "/" in tz_spec and sys.version_info >= (3, 9): 

6681 from zoneinfo import ZoneInfo # requires python >= 3.9 

6682 

6683 tz = ZoneInfo(tz_spec) # Standard IANA timezone. Example: "Europe/Vienna" 

6684 else: 

6685 raise ValueError(f"Invalid timezone specification: {tz_spec}") 

6686 return tz 

6687 

6688 

6689metadata_month = {"min": 1, "max": 12, "help": "The month within a year"} 

6690metadata_weekday = {"min": 0, "max": 6, "help": "The weekday within a week: 0=Sunday, 1=Monday, ..., 6=Saturday"} 

6691metadata_day = {"min": 1, "max": 31, "help": "The day within a month"} 

6692metadata_hour = {"min": 0, "max": 23, "help": "The hour within a day"} 

6693metadata_minute = {"min": 0, "max": 59, "help": "The minute within an hour"} 

6694metadata_second = {"min": 0, "max": 59, "help": "The second within a minute"} 

6695metadata_millisecond = {"min": 0, "max": 999, "help": "The millisecond within a second"} 

6696metadata_microsecond = {"min": 0, "max": 999, "help": "The microsecond within a millisecond"} 

6697 

6698 

6699@dataclass(frozen=True) 

6700class PeriodAnchors: 

6701 # The anchors for a given duration unit are computed as follows: 

6702 # yearly: Anchor(dt) = latest T where T <= dt and T == Start of January 1 of dt + anchor.yearly_* vars 

6703 yearly_year: int = field(default=2025, metadata={"min": 1, "max": 9999, "help": "The anchor year of multi-year periods"}) 

6704 yearly_month: int = field(default=1, metadata=metadata_month) # 1 <= x <= 12 

6705 yearly_monthday: int = field(default=1, metadata=metadata_day) # 1 <= x <= 31 

6706 yearly_hour: int = field(default=0, metadata=metadata_hour) # 0 <= x <= 23 

6707 yearly_minute: int = field(default=0, metadata=metadata_minute) # 0 <= x <= 59 

6708 yearly_second: int = field(default=0, metadata=metadata_second) # 0 <= x <= 59 

6709 

6710 # monthly: Anchor(dt) = latest T where T <= dt && T == Start of first day of month of dt + anchor.monthly_* vars 

6711 monthly_month: int = field(default=1, metadata={"min": 1, "max": 12, "help": "The anchor month of multi-month periods"}) 

6712 monthly_monthday: int = field(default=1, metadata=metadata_day) # 1 <= x <= 31 

6713 monthly_hour: int = field(default=0, metadata=metadata_hour) # 0 <= x <= 23 

6714 monthly_minute: int = field(default=0, metadata=metadata_minute) # 0 <= x <= 59 

6715 monthly_second: int = field(default=0, metadata=metadata_second) # 0 <= x <= 59 

6716 

6717 # weekly: Anchor(dt) = latest T where T <= dt && T == Latest midnight from Sunday to Monday of dt + anchor.weekly_* vars 

6718 weekly_weekday: int = field(default=0, metadata=metadata_weekday) # 0 <= x <= 7 

6719 weekly_hour: int = field(default=0, metadata=metadata_hour) # 0 <= x <= 23 

6720 weekly_minute: int = field(default=0, metadata=metadata_minute) # 0 <= x <= 59 

6721 weekly_second: int = field(default=0, metadata=metadata_second) # 0 <= x <= 59 

6722 

6723 # daily: Anchor(dt) = latest T where T <= dt && T == Latest midnight of dt + anchor.daily_* vars 

6724 daily_hour: int = field(default=0, metadata=metadata_hour) # 0 <= x <= 23 

6725 daily_minute: int = field(default=0, metadata=metadata_minute) # 0 <= x <= 59 

6726 daily_second: int = field(default=0, metadata=metadata_second) # 0 <= x <= 59 

6727 

6728 # hourly: Anchor(dt) = latest T where T <= dt && T == Latest midnight of dt + anchor.hourly_* vars
