6729 hourly_minute: int = field(default=0, metadata=metadata_minute) # 0 <= x <= 59 

6730 hourly_second: int = field(default=0, metadata=metadata_second) # 0 <= x <= 59 

6731 

6732 # minutely: Anchor(dt) = latest T where T <= dt && T == Latest midnight of dt + anchor.minutely_* vars 

6733 minutely_second: int = field(default=0, metadata=metadata_second) # 0 <= x <= 59 

6734 

6735 # secondly: Anchor(dt) = latest T where T <= dt && T == Latest midnight of dt + anchor.secondly_* vars 

6736 secondly_millisecond: int = field(default=0, metadata=metadata_millisecond) # 0 <= x <= 999 

6737 

6738 # secondly: Anchor(dt) = latest T where T <= dt && T == Latest midnight of dt + anchor.millisecondly_* vars 

6739 millisecondly_microsecond: int = field(default=0, metadata=metadata_microsecond) # 0 <= x <= 999 

6740 

6741 @staticmethod 

6742 def parse(args: argparse.Namespace) -> "PeriodAnchors": 

6743 kwargs = {f.name: getattr(args, f.name) for f in dataclasses.fields(PeriodAnchors)} 

6744 return PeriodAnchors(**kwargs) 

6745 

6746 

6747def round_datetime_up_to_duration_multiple( 

6748 dt: datetime, duration_amount: int, duration_unit: str, anchors: PeriodAnchors 

6749) -> datetime: 

6750 """Given a timezone-aware datetime and a duration, returns a datetime (in the same timezone) that is greater than or 

6751 equal to dt, and rounded up (ceiled) and snapped to an anchor plus a multiple of the duration. The snapping is done 

6752 relative to the anchors object and the rules defined therein. 

6753 Supported units: "millisecondly", "secondly", "minutely", "hourly", "daily", "weekly", "monthly", "yearly". 

6754 If dt is already exactly on a boundary (i.e. exactly on a multiple), it is returned unchanged. 

6755 Examples: 

6756 Default hourly anchor is midnight 

6757 14:00:00, 1 hours --> 14:00:00 

6758 14:05:01, 1 hours --> 15:00:00 

6759 15:05:01, 1 hours --> 16:00:00 

6760 16:05:01, 1 hours --> 17:00:00 

6761 23:55:01, 1 hours --> 00:00:00 on the next day 

6762 14:05:01, 2 hours --> 16:00:00 

6763 15:00:00, 2 hours --> 16:00:00 

6764 15:05:01, 2 hours --> 16:00:00 

6765 16:00:00, 2 hours --> 16:00:00 

6766 16:05:01, 2 hours --> 18:00:00 

6767 23:55:01, 2 hours --> 00:00:00 on the next day 

6768 """ 

6769 

6770 def add_months(dt: datetime, months: int) -> datetime: 

6771 total_month = dt.month - 1 + months 

6772 new_year = dt.year + total_month // 12 

6773 new_month = total_month % 12 + 1 

6774 last_day = calendar.monthrange(new_year, new_month)[1] # last valid day of the current month 

6775 return dt.replace(year=new_year, month=new_month, day=min(dt.day, last_day)) 

6776 

6777 def add_years(dt: datetime, years: int) -> datetime: 

6778 new_year = dt.year + years 

6779 last_day = calendar.monthrange(new_year, dt.month)[1] # last valid day of the current month 

6780 return dt.replace(year=new_year, day=min(dt.day, last_day)) 

6781 

6782 if duration_amount == 0: 

6783 return dt 

6784 

6785 period = None 

6786 if duration_unit == "millisecondly": 

6787 anchor = dt.replace(hour=0, minute=0, second=0, microsecond=anchors.millisecondly_microsecond) 

6788 anchor = anchor if anchor <= dt else anchor - timedelta(milliseconds=1) 

6789 period = timedelta(milliseconds=duration_amount) 

6790 

6791 elif duration_unit == "secondly": 

6792 anchor = dt.replace(hour=0, minute=0, second=0, microsecond=anchors.secondly_millisecond * 1000) 

6793 anchor = anchor if anchor <= dt else anchor - timedelta(seconds=1) 

6794 period = timedelta(seconds=duration_amount) 

6795 

6796 elif duration_unit == "minutely": 

6797 anchor = dt.replace(second=anchors.minutely_second, microsecond=0) 

6798 anchor = anchor if anchor <= dt else anchor - timedelta(minutes=1) 

6799 period = timedelta(minutes=duration_amount) 

6800 

6801 elif duration_unit == "hourly": 

6802 daily_base = dt.replace(hour=0, minute=0, second=0, microsecond=0) 

6803 anchor = daily_base + timedelta(minutes=anchors.hourly_minute, seconds=anchors.hourly_second) 

6804 anchor = anchor if anchor <= dt else anchor - timedelta(days=1) 

6805 period = timedelta(hours=duration_amount) 

6806 

6807 elif duration_unit == "daily": 

6808 daily_base = dt.replace(hour=0, minute=0, second=0, microsecond=0) 

6809 anchor = daily_base + timedelta(hours=anchors.daily_hour, minutes=anchors.daily_minute, seconds=anchors.daily_second) 

6810 anchor = anchor if anchor <= dt else anchor - timedelta(days=1) 

6811 period = timedelta(days=duration_amount) 

6812 

6813 elif duration_unit == "weekly": 

6814 daily_base = dt.replace(hour=0, minute=0, second=0, microsecond=0) 

6815 anchor = daily_base + timedelta( 

6816 hours=anchors.weekly_hour, minutes=anchors.weekly_minute, seconds=anchors.weekly_second 

6817 ) 

6818 # Convert cron weekday (0=Sunday, 1=Monday, ..., 6=Saturday) to Python's weekday (0=Monday, ..., 6=Sunday) 

6819 target_py_weekday = (anchors.weekly_weekday - 1) % 7 

6820 diff_days = (anchor.weekday() - target_py_weekday) % 7 

6821 anchor = anchor - timedelta(days=diff_days) 

6822 anchor = anchor if anchor <= dt else anchor - timedelta(weeks=1) 

6823 period = timedelta(weeks=duration_amount) 

6824 

6825 if period is not None: # "millisecondly", "secondly", "minutely", "hourly", "daily", "weekly" 

6826 delta = dt - anchor 

6827 period_micros = (period.days * 86400 + period.seconds) * 1_000_000 + period.microseconds 

6828 delta_micros = (delta.days * 86400 + delta.seconds) * 1_000_000 + delta.microseconds 

6829 remainder = delta_micros % period_micros 

6830 if remainder == 0: 

6831 return dt 

6832 return dt + timedelta(microseconds=period_micros - remainder) 

6833 

6834 elif duration_unit == "monthly": 

6835 last_day = calendar.monthrange(dt.year, dt.month)[1] # last valid day of the current month 

6836 anchor = dt.replace( # Compute the base anchor for the month ensuring the day is valid 

6837 month=anchors.monthly_month, 

6838 day=min(anchors.monthly_monthday, last_day), 

6839 hour=anchors.monthly_hour, 

6840 minute=anchors.monthly_minute, 

6841 second=anchors.monthly_second, 

6842 microsecond=0, 

6843 ) 

6844 if anchor > dt: 

6845 anchor = add_months(anchor, -duration_amount) 

6846 diff_months = (dt.year - anchor.year) * 12 + (dt.month - anchor.month) 

6847 anchor_boundary = add_months(anchor, duration_amount * (diff_months // duration_amount)) 

6848 if anchor_boundary < dt: 

6849 anchor_boundary = add_months(anchor_boundary, duration_amount) 

6850 return anchor_boundary 

6851 

6852 elif duration_unit == "yearly": 

6853 # Calculate the start of the cycle period that `dt` falls into. 

6854 year_offset = (dt.year - anchors.yearly_year) % duration_amount 

6855 period_start_year = dt.year - year_offset 

6856 last_day = calendar.monthrange(period_start_year, anchors.yearly_month)[1] # last valid day of the month 

6857 anchor = dt.replace( 

6858 year=period_start_year, 

6859 month=anchors.yearly_month, 

6860 day=min(anchors.yearly_monthday, last_day), 

6861 hour=anchors.yearly_hour, 

6862 minute=anchors.yearly_minute, 

6863 second=anchors.yearly_second, 

6864 microsecond=0, 

6865 ) 

6866 if anchor < dt: 

6867 return add_years(anchor, duration_amount) 

6868 return anchor 

6869 

6870 else: 

6871 raise ValueError(f"Unsupported duration unit: {duration_unit}") 

6872 

6873 

6874def subprocess_run(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any) -> subprocess.CompletedProcess: 

6875 """Drop-in replacement for subprocess.run() that mimics its behavior except it enhances cleanup on TimeoutExpired.""" 

6876 input_value = kwargs.pop("input", None) 

6877 timeout = kwargs.pop("timeout", None) 

6878 check = kwargs.pop("check", False) 

6879 if input_value is not None: 

6880 if kwargs.get("stdin") is not None: 

6881 raise ValueError("input and stdin are mutually exclusive") 

6882 kwargs["stdin"] = subprocess.PIPE 

6883 

6884 with subprocess.Popen(*args, **kwargs) as proc: 

6885 try: 

6886 stdout, stderr = proc.communicate(input_value, timeout=timeout) 

6887 except BaseException as e: 

6888 try: 

6889 if isinstance(e, subprocess.TimeoutExpired): 

6890 terminate_process_subtree(root_pid=proc.pid) # send SIGTERM to child process and its descendants 

6891 finally: 

6892 proc.kill() 

6893 raise e 

6894 else: 

6895 exitcode: Optional[int] = proc.poll() 

6896 assert exitcode is not None 

6897 if check and exitcode: 

6898 raise subprocess.CalledProcessError(exitcode, proc.args, output=stdout, stderr=stderr) 

6899 return subprocess.CompletedProcess(proc.args, exitcode, stdout, stderr) 

6900 

6901 

6902def terminate_process_subtree( 

6903 except_current_process: bool = False, 

6904 root_pid: Optional[int] = None, 

6905 sig: signal.Signals = signal.SIGTERM, 

6906) -> None: 

6907 """Sends signal also to descendant processes to also terminate processes started via subprocess.run()""" 

6908 current_pid = os.getpid() 

6909 root_pid = current_pid if root_pid is None else root_pid 

6910 pids = get_descendant_processes(root_pid) 

6911 if root_pid == current_pid: 

6912 pids += [] if except_current_process else [current_pid] 

6913 else: 

6914 pids.insert(0, root_pid) 

6915 for pid in pids: 

6916 with contextlib.suppress(OSError): 

6917 os.kill(pid, sig) 

6918 

6919 

6920def get_descendant_processes(root_pid: int) -> List[int]: 

6921 """Returns the list of all descendant process IDs for the given root PID, on Unix systems.""" 

6922 procs = defaultdict(list) 

6923 cmd = ["ps", "-Ao", "pid,ppid"] 

6924 lines = subprocess.run(cmd, stdin=DEVNULL, stdout=PIPE, text=True, check=True).stdout.splitlines() 

6925 for line in lines[1:]: # all lines except the header line 

6926 splits = line.split() 

6927 assert len(splits) == 2 

6928 pid = int(splits[0]) 

6929 ppid = int(splits[1]) 

6930 procs[ppid].append(pid) 

6931 descendants: List[int] = [] 

6932 

6933 def recursive_append(ppid: int) -> None: 

6934 for child_pid in procs[ppid]: 

6935 descendants.append(child_pid) 

6936 recursive_append(child_pid) 

6937 

6938 recursive_append(root_pid) 

6939 return descendants 

6940 

6941 

6942def pid_exists(pid: int) -> Optional[bool]: 

6943 if pid <= 0: 

6944 return False 

6945 try: # with signal=0, no signal is actually sent, but error checking is still performed 

6946 os.kill(pid, 0) # ... which can be used to check for process existence on POSIX systems 

6947 except OSError as err: 

6948 if err.errno == errno.ESRCH: # No such process 

6949 return False 

6950 if err.errno == errno.EPERM: # Operation not permitted 6950 ↛ 6951line 6950 didn't jump to line 6951 because the condition on line 6950 was never true

6951 return True 

6952 return None 

6953 return True 

6954 

6955 

6956arabic_decimal_separator = "\u066b" # "٫" 

6957pv_size_to_bytes_regex = re.compile(rf"(\d+[.,{arabic_decimal_separator}]?\d*)\s*([KMGTPEZYRQ]?)(i?)([Bb])(.*)") 

6958 

6959 

6960def pv_size_to_bytes(size: str) -> Tuple[int, str]: # example inputs: "800B", "4.12 KiB", "510 MiB", "510 MB", "4Gb", "2TiB" 

6961 if match := pv_size_to_bytes_regex.fullmatch(size): 

6962 number = float(match.group(1).replace(",", ".").replace(arabic_decimal_separator, ".")) 

6963 i = "KMGTPEZYRQ".index(match.group(2)) if match.group(2) else -1 

6964 m = 1024 if match.group(3) == "i" else 1000 

6965 b = 1 if match.group(4) == "B" else 8 

6966 line_tail = match.group(5) 

6967 if line_tail and line_tail.startswith("/s"): 

6968 raise ValueError("Invalid pv_size: " + size) # stems from 'pv --rate' or 'pv --average-rate' 

6969 size_in_bytes = round(number * (m ** (i + 1)) / b) 

6970 return size_in_bytes, line_tail 

6971 else: 

6972 return 0, "" # skip partial or bad 'pv' log file line (pv process killed while writing?) 

6973 

6974 

6975def count_num_bytes_transferred_by_zfs_send(basis_pv_log_file: str) -> int: 

6976 """Scrapes the .pv log file(s) and sums up the 'pv --bytes' column.""" 

6977 

6978 def parse_pv_line(line: str) -> int: 

6979 if ":" in line: 

6980 col = line.split(":", 1)[1].strip() 

6981 num_bytes, _ = pv_size_to_bytes(col) 

6982 return num_bytes 

6983 return 0 

6984 

6985 total_bytes = 0 

6986 files = [basis_pv_log_file] + glob.glob(basis_pv_log_file + pv_file_thread_separator + "[0-9]*") 

6987 for file in files: 

6988 if os.path.isfile(file): 

6989 try: 

6990 with open_nofollow(file, mode="r", newline="", encoding="utf-8") as fd: 

6991 line = None 

6992 for line in fd: 

6993 if line.endswith("\r"): 

6994 continue # skip all but the most recent status update of each transfer 

6995 total_bytes += parse_pv_line(line) 

6996 line = None 

6997 if line is not None: 

6998 total_bytes += parse_pv_line(line) # consume last line of file w/ intermediate status update, if any 

6999 except FileNotFoundError: 

7000 pass # harmless 

7001 return total_bytes 

7002 

7003 

7004def parse_dataset_locator( 

7005 input_text: str, 

7006 validate: bool = True, 

7007 user: Optional[str] = None, 

7008 host: Optional[str] = None, 

7009 port: Optional[int] = None, 

7010) -> Tuple[str, str, str, str, str]: 

7011 def convert_ipv6(hostname: str) -> str: # support IPv6 without getting confused by host:dataset colon separator ... 

7012 return hostname.replace("|", ":") # ... and any colons that may be part of a (valid) ZFS dataset name 

7013 

7014 user_undefined = user is None 

7015 if user is None: 7015 ↛ 7017line 7015 didn't jump to line 7017 because the condition on line 7015 was always true

7016 user = "" 

7017 host_undefined = host is None 

7018 if host is None: 7018 ↛ 7020line 7018 didn't jump to line 7020 because the condition on line 7018 was always true

7019 host = "" 

7020 host = convert_ipv6(host) 

7021 user_host, dataset, pool = "", "", "" 

7022 

7023 # Input format is [[user@]host:]dataset 

7024 # 1234 5 6 

7025 if match := re.fullmatch(r"(((([^@]*)@)?([^:]+)):)?(.*)", input_text, re.DOTALL): 7025 ↛ 7042line 7025 didn't jump to line 7042 because the condition on line 7025 was always true

7026 if user_undefined: 7026 ↛ 7028line 7026 didn't jump to line 7028 because the condition on line 7026 was always true

7027 user = match.group(4) or "" 

7028 if host_undefined: 7028 ↛ 7031line 7028 didn't jump to line 7031 because the condition on line 7028 was always true

7029 host = match.group(5) or "" 

7030 host = convert_ipv6(host) 

7031 if host == "-": 

7032 host = "" 

7033 dataset = match.group(6) or "" 

7034 i = dataset.find("/") 

7035 pool = dataset[0:i] if i >= 0 else dataset 

7036 

7037 if user and host: 

7038 user_host = f"{user}@{host}" 

7039 elif host: 

7040 user_host = host 

7041 

7042 if validate: 

7043 validate_user_name(user, input_text) 

7044 validate_host_name(host, input_text) 

7045 if port is not None: 7045 ↛ 7046line 7045 didn't jump to line 7046 because the condition on line 7045 was never true

7046 validate_port(port, f"Invalid port number: '{port}' for: '{input_text}' - ") 

7047 validate_dataset_name(dataset, input_text) 

7048 

7049 return user, host, user_host, pool, dataset 

7050 

7051 

7052def validate_dataset_name(dataset: str, input_text: str) -> None: 

7053 """'zfs create' CLI does not accept dataset names that are empty or start or end in a slash, etc.""" 

7054 # Also see https://github.com/openzfs/zfs/issues/439#issuecomment-2784424 

7055 # and https://github.com/openzfs/zfs/issues/8798 

7056 # and (by now nomore accurate): https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E26505_01/html/E37384/gbcpt.html 

7057 if ( 

7058 dataset in ("", ".", "..") 

7059 or any(dataset.startswith(prefix) for prefix in ("/", "./", "../")) 

7060 or any(dataset.endswith(suffix) for suffix in ("/", "/.", "/..")) 

7061 or any(substring in dataset for substring in ("//", "/./", "/../")) 

7062 or any(char in SHELL_CHARS or (char.isspace() and char != " ") for char in dataset) 

7063 or not dataset[0].isalpha() 

7064 ): 

7065 die(f"Invalid ZFS dataset name: '{dataset}' for: '{input_text}'") 

7066 

7067 

7068def validate_user_name(user: str, input_text: str) -> None: 

7069 invalid_chars = SHELL_CHARS + "/" 

7070 if user and (".." in user or any(c.isspace() or c in invalid_chars for c in user)): 

7071 die(f"Invalid user name: '{user}' for: '{input_text}'") 

7072 

7073 

7074def validate_host_name(host: str, input_text: str, extra_invalid_chars: str = "") -> None: 

7075 invalid_chars = SHELL_CHARS + "/" + extra_invalid_chars 

7076 if host and (".." in host or any(c.isspace() or c in invalid_chars for c in host)): 

7077 die(f"Invalid host name: '{host}' for: '{input_text}'") 

7078 

7079 

7080def validate_port(port: Union[str, int], message: str) -> None: 

7081 if isinstance(port, int): 

7082 port = str(port) 

7083 if port and not port.isdigit(): 

7084 die(message + f"must be empty or a positive integer: '{port}'") 

7085 

7086 

7087def validate_default_shell(path_to_default_shell: str, r: Remote) -> None: 

7088 if path_to_default_shell.endswith("/csh") or path_to_default_shell.endswith("/tcsh"): 

7089 # On some old FreeBSD systems the default shell is still csh. Also see https://www.grymoire.com/unix/CshTop10.txt 

7090 die( 

7091 f"Cowardly refusing to proceed because {prog_name} is not compatible with csh-style quoting of special " 

7092 f"characters. The safe workaround is to first manually set 'sh' instead of '{path_to_default_shell}' as " 

7093 f"the default shell of the Unix user on {r.location} host: {r.ssh_user_host or 'localhost'}, like so: " 

7094 "chsh -s /bin/sh YOURUSERNAME" 

7095 ) 

7096 

7097 

7098def validate_no_argument_file( 

7099 path: str, namespace: argparse.Namespace, err_prefix: str, parser: Optional[argparse.ArgumentParser] = None 

7100) -> None: 

7101 if getattr(namespace, "no_argument_file", False): 

7102 die(f"{err_prefix}Argument file inclusion is disabled: {path}", parser=parser) 

7103 

7104 

7105def list_formatter(iterable: Iterable, separator: str = " ", lstrip: bool = False) -> Any: 

7106 # For lazy/noop evaluation in disabled log levels 

7107 class CustomListFormatter: 

7108 def __str__(self) -> str: 

7109 s = separator.join(map(str, iterable)) 

7110 return s.lstrip() if lstrip else s 

7111 

7112 return CustomListFormatter() 

7113 

7114 

7115def pretty_print_formatter(obj_to_format: Any) -> Any: # For lazy/noop evaluation in disabled log levels 

7116 class PrettyPrintFormatter: 

7117 def __str__(self) -> str: 

7118 import pprint 

7119 

7120 return pprint.pformat(vars(obj_to_format)) 

7121 

7122 return PrettyPrintFormatter() 

7123 

7124 

7125def reset_logger() -> None: 

7126 """Remove and close logging handlers (and close their files) and reset loggers to default state.""" 

7127 for log in [logging.getLogger(__name__), logging.getLogger(get_logger_subname())]: 

7128 for handler in log.handlers.copy(): 

7129 log.removeHandler(handler) 

7130 handler.flush() 

7131 handler.close() 

7132 for _filter in log.filters.copy(): 

7133 log.removeFilter(_filter) 

7134 log.setLevel(logging.NOTSET) 

7135 log.propagate = True 

7136 

7137 

7138def get_logger_subname() -> str: 

7139 return __name__ + ".sub" # the logger name for use by --log-config-file 

7140 

7141 

7142def get_logger(log_params: LogParams, args: argparse.Namespace, log: Optional[Logger] = None) -> Logger: 

7143 add_trace_loglevel() 

7144 logging.addLevelName(log_stderr, "STDERR") 

7145 logging.addLevelName(log_stdout, "STDOUT") 

7146 

7147 if log is not None: 

7148 assert isinstance(log, Logger) 

7149 return log # use third party provided logger object 

7150 elif args.log_config_file: 7150 ↛ 7151line 7150 didn't jump to line 7151 because the condition on line 7150 was never true

7151 clog = get_dict_config_logger(log_params, args) # use logger defined in config file, and afterwards ... 

7152 # ... add our own handlers unless matching handlers are already present 

7153 default_log = get_default_logger(log_params, args) 

7154 return clog if args.log_config_file else default_log 

7155 

7156 

7157def get_default_logger(log_params: LogParams, args: argparse.Namespace) -> Logger: 

7158 sublog = logging.getLogger(get_logger_subname()) 

7159 log = logging.getLogger(__name__) 

7160 log.setLevel(log_params.log_level) 

7161 log.propagate = False # don't propagate log messages up to the root logger to avoid emitting duplicate messages 

7162 

7163 if not any(isinstance(h, logging.StreamHandler) and h.stream in [sys.stdout, sys.stderr] for h in sublog.handlers): 7163 ↛ 7169line 7163 didn't jump to line 7169 because the condition on line 7163 was always true

7164 handler: logging.Handler = logging.StreamHandler(stream=sys.stdout) 

7165 handler.setFormatter(get_default_log_formatter(log_params=log_params)) 

7166 handler.setLevel(log_params.log_level) 

7167 log.addHandler(handler) 

7168 

7169 abs_log_file = os.path.abspath(log_params.log_file) 

7170 if not any(isinstance(h, logging.FileHandler) and h.baseFilename == abs_log_file for h in sublog.handlers): 7170 ↛ 7176line 7170 didn't jump to line 7176 because the condition on line 7170 was always true

7171 handler = logging.FileHandler(log_params.log_file, encoding="utf-8") 

7172 handler.setFormatter(get_default_log_formatter()) 

7173 handler.setLevel(log_params.log_level) 

7174 log.addHandler(handler) 

7175 

7176 address = args.log_syslog_address 

7177 if address: # optionally, also log to local or remote syslog 7177 ↛ 7178line 7177 didn't jump to line 7178 because the condition on line 7177 was never true

7178 address, socktype = get_syslog_address(address, args.log_syslog_socktype) 

7179 log_syslog_prefix = str(args.log_syslog_prefix).strip().replace("%", "") # sanitize 

7180 handler = logging.handlers.SysLogHandler(address=address, facility=args.log_syslog_facility, socktype=socktype) 

7181 handler.setFormatter(get_default_log_formatter(prefix=log_syslog_prefix + " ")) 

7182 handler.setLevel(args.log_syslog_level) 

7183 log.addHandler(handler) 

7184 if handler.level < sublog.getEffectiveLevel(): 

7185 log_level_name = logging.getLevelName(sublog.getEffectiveLevel()) 

7186 log.warning( 

7187 "%s", 

7188 f"No messages with priority lower than {log_level_name} will be sent to syslog because syslog " 

7189 f"log level {args.log_syslog_level} is lower than overall log level {log_level_name}.", 

7190 ) 

7191 

7192 # perf: tell logging framework not to gather unnecessary expensive info for each log record 

7193 logging.logProcesses = False 

7194 logging.logThreads = False 

7195 logging.logMultiprocessing = False 

7196 return log 

7197 

7198 

7199log_level_prefixes = { 

7200 logging.CRITICAL: "[C] CRITICAL:", 

7201 logging.ERROR: "[E] ERROR:", 

7202 logging.WARNING: "[W]", 

7203 logging.INFO: "[I]", 

7204 logging.DEBUG: "[D]", 

7205 log_trace: "[T]", 

7206} 

7207 

7208 

7209def get_default_log_formatter(prefix: str = "", log_params: Optional[LogParams] = None) -> logging.Formatter: 

7210 _level_prefixes = log_level_prefixes 

7211 _log_stderr = log_stderr 

7212 _log_stdout = log_stdout 

7213 terminal_cols = [0 if log_params is None else None] # 'None' indicates "configure value later" 

7214 

7215 class DefaultLogFormatter(logging.Formatter): 

7216 def format(self, record: logging.LogRecord) -> str: 

7217 levelno = record.levelno 

7218 if levelno != _log_stderr and levelno != _log_stdout: # emit stdout and stderr "as-is" (no formatting) 

7219 timestamp = datetime.now().isoformat(sep=" ", timespec="seconds") # 2024-09-03 12:26:15 

7220 ts_level = f"{timestamp} {_level_prefixes.get(levelno, '')} " 

7221 msg = record.msg 

7222 i = msg.find("%s") 

7223 msg = ts_level + msg 

7224 if i >= 1: 

7225 i += len(ts_level) 

7226 msg = msg[0:i].ljust(54) + msg[i:] # right-pad msg if record.msg contains "%s" unless at start 

7227 if record.exc_info or record.exc_text or record.stack_info: 

7228 record.msg = msg 

7229 msg = super().format(record) 

7230 elif record.args: 

7231 msg = msg % record.args 

7232 else: 

7233 msg = super().format(record) 

7234 

7235 msg = prefix + msg 

7236 cols = terminal_cols[0] 

7237 if cols is None: 

7238 cols = self.ljust_cols() 

7239 msg = msg.ljust(cols) # w/ progress line, "overwrite" trailing chars of previous msg with spaces 

7240 return msg 

7241 

7242 @staticmethod 

7243 def ljust_cols() -> int: 

7244 # lock-free yet thread-safe late configuration-based init for prettier ProgressReporter output 

7245 # log_params.params and available_programs are not fully initialized yet before detect_available_programs() ends 

7246 cols = 0 

7247 assert log_params is not None 

7248 p = log_params.params 

7249 if p is not None and "local" in p.available_programs: 7249 ↛ 7250line 7249 didn't jump to line 7250 because the condition on line 7249 was never true

7250 if "pv" in p.available_programs["local"]: 

7251 cols = p.terminal_columns 

7252 assert cols is not None 

7253 terminal_cols[0] = cols # finally, resolve to use this specific value henceforth 

7254 return cols 

7255 

7256 return DefaultLogFormatter() 

7257 

7258 

7259def get_simple_logger(program: str) -> Logger: 

7260 class LevelFormatter(logging.Formatter): 

7261 def format(self, record: logging.LogRecord) -> str: 

7262 record.level_prefix = log_level_prefixes.get(record.levelno, "") 

7263 record.program = program 

7264 return super().format(record) 

7265 

7266 add_trace_loglevel() 

7267 log = logging.getLogger(program) 

7268 log.setLevel(logging.INFO) 

7269 log.propagate = False 

7270 if not any(isinstance(h, logging.StreamHandler) for h in log.handlers): 

7271 handler = logging.StreamHandler() 

7272 handler.setFormatter( 

7273 LevelFormatter(fmt="%(asctime)s %(level_prefix)s [%(program)s] %(message)s", datefmt="%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S") 

7274 ) 

7275 log.addHandler(handler) 

7276 return log 

7277 

7278 

7279def add_trace_loglevel() -> None: 

7280 logging.addLevelName(log_trace, "TRACE") 

7281 

7282 

7283def get_syslog_address( 

7284 address: str, log_syslog_socktype: str 

7285) -> Tuple[Union[str, Tuple[str, int]], Optional[socket.SocketKind]]: 

7286 address = address.strip() 

7287 socktype: Optional[socket.SocketKind] = None 

7288 if ":" in address: 

7289 host, port_str = address.rsplit(":", 1) 

7290 addr = (host.strip(), int(port_str.strip())) 

7291 socktype = socket.SOCK_DGRAM if log_syslog_socktype == "UDP" else socket.SOCK_STREAM # for TCP 

7292 return addr, socktype 

7293 return address, socktype 

7294 

7295 

7296def get_dict_config_logger(log_params: LogParams, args: argparse.Namespace) -> Logger: 

7297 import json 

7298 

7299 prefix = prog_name + "." 

7300 log_config_vars = { 

7301 prefix + "sub.logger": get_logger_subname(), 

7302 prefix + "get_default_log_formatter": __name__ + ".get_default_log_formatter", 

7303 prefix + "log_level": log_params.log_level, 

7304 prefix + "log_dir": log_params.log_dir, 

7305 prefix + "log_file": os.path.basename(log_params.log_file), 

7306 prefix + "timestamp": log_params.timestamp, 

7307 prefix + "dryrun": "dryrun" if args.dryrun else "", 

7308 } 

7309 log_config_vars.update(log_params.log_config_vars) # merge variables passed into CLI with convenience variables 

7310 

7311 log_config_file_str = log_params.log_config_file 

7312 if log_config_file_str.startswith("+"): 7312 ↛ 7320line 7312 didn't jump to line 7320 because the condition on line 7312 was always true

7313 path = log_config_file_str[1:] 

7314 basename_stem = Path(path).stem # stem is basename without file extension ("bzfs_log_config") 

7315 if not ("bzfs_log_config" in basename_stem and os.path.basename(path).endswith(".json")): 7315 ↛ 7317line 7315 didn't jump to line 7317 because the condition on line 7315 was always true

7316 die(f"--log-config-file: basename must contain 'bzfs_log_config' and end with '.json': {path}") 

7317 with open_nofollow(path, "r", encoding="utf-8") as fd: 

7318 log_config_file_str = fd.read() 

7319 

7320 def remove_json_comments(config_str: str) -> str: # not standard but practical 

7321 lines = [] 

7322 for line in config_str.splitlines(): 

7323 stripped = line.strip() 

7324 if stripped.startswith("#"): 

7325 line = "" # replace comment line with empty line to preserve line numbering 

7326 elif stripped.endswith("#"): 

7327 i = line.rfind("#", 0, line.rindex("#")) 

7328 if i >= 0: 

7329 line = line[0:i] # strip line-ending comment 

7330 lines.append(line) 

7331 return "\n".join(lines) 

7332 

7333 def substitute_log_config_vars(config_str: str, log_config_variables: Dict[str, str]) -> str: 

7334 """Substitute ${name[:default]} placeholders within JSON with values from log_config_variables""" 

7335 

7336 def substitute_fn(match: re.Match) -> str: 

7337 varname = match.group(1) 

7338 error_msg = validate_log_config_variable_name(varname) 

7339 if error_msg: 

7340 raise ValueError(error_msg) 

7341 replacement = log_config_variables.get(varname) 

7342 if not replacement: 

7343 default = match.group(3) 

7344 if default is None: 

7345 raise ValueError("Missing default value in JSON for empty log config variable: ${" + varname + "}") 

7346 replacement = default 

7347 replacement = json.dumps(replacement) # JSON escape special chars such as newlines, quotes, etc 

7348 assert len(replacement) >= 2 

7349 assert replacement.startswith('"') 

7350 assert replacement.endswith('"') 

7351 return replacement[1:-1] # strip surrounding quotes added by dumps() 

7352 

7353 pattern = re.compile(r"\$\{([^}:]*?)(:([^}]*))?}") # Any char except } and :, followed by optional default part 

7354 return pattern.sub(substitute_fn, config_str) 

7355 

7356 log_config_file_str = remove_json_comments(log_config_file_str) 

7357 if not log_config_file_str.strip().startswith("{"): 

7358 log_config_file_str = "{\n" + log_config_file_str # lenient JSON parsing 

7359 if not log_config_file_str.strip().endswith("}"): 

7360 log_config_file_str = log_config_file_str + "\n}" # lenient JSON parsing 

7361 log_config_file_str = substitute_log_config_vars(log_config_file_str, log_config_vars) 

7362 # if args is not None and args.verbose >= 2: 

7363 # print("[T] Substituted log_config_file_str:\n" + log_config_file_str, flush=True) 

7364 log_config_dict = json.loads(log_config_file_str) 

7365 logging.config.dictConfig(log_config_dict) 

7366 return logging.getLogger(get_logger_subname()) 

7367 

7368 

7369def validate_log_config_variable(var: str) -> Optional[str]: 

7370 if not var.strip(): 

7371 return "Invalid log config NAME:VALUE variable. Variable must not be empty: " + var 

7372 if ":" not in var: 

7373 return "Invalid log config NAME:VALUE variable. Variable is missing a colon character: " + var 

7374 return validate_log_config_variable_name(var[0 : var.index(":")]) 

7375 

7376 

7377def validate_log_config_variable_name(name: str) -> Optional[str]: 

7378 if not name: 

7379 return "Invalid log config variable name. Name must not be empty: " + name 

7380 bad_chars = "${} " + '"' + "'" 

7381 if any(char in bad_chars for char in name): 

7382 return f"Invalid log config variable name. Name must not contain forbidden {bad_chars} characters: " + name 

7383 if any(char.isspace() for char in name): 

7384 return "Invalid log config variable name. Name must not contain whitespace: " + name 

7385 return None 

7386 

7387 

7388############################################################################# 

7389class RetryableError(Exception): 

7390 """Indicates that the task that caused the underlying exception can be retried and might eventually succeed.""" 

7391 

7392 def __init__(self, message: str, no_sleep: bool = False) -> None: 

7393 super().__init__(message) 

7394 self.no_sleep: bool = no_sleep 

7395 

7396 

7397############################################################################# 

7398class Tee: 

7399 def __init__(self, *files: IO) -> None: 

7400 self.files = files 

7401 

7402 def write(self, obj: str) -> None: 

7403 for file in self.files: 

7404 file.write(obj) 

7405 file.flush() # Ensure each write is flushed immediately 

7406 

7407 def flush(self) -> None: 

7408 for file in self.files: 

7409 file.flush() 

7410 

7411 def fileno(self) -> int: 

7412 return self.files[0].fileno() 

7413 

7414 

7415############################################################################# 

7416class NonEmptyStringAction(argparse.Action): 

7417 def __call__( 

7418 self, 

7419 parser: argparse.ArgumentParser, 

7420 namespace: argparse.Namespace, 

7421 values: Any, 

7422 option_string: Optional[str] = None, 

7423 ) -> None: 

7424 values = values.strip() 

7425 if values == "": 

7426 parser.error(f"{option_string}: Empty string is not valid") 

7427 setattr(namespace, self.dest, values) 

7428 

7429 

7430############################################################################# 

7431class DatasetPairsAction(argparse.Action): 

7432 def __call__( 

7433 self, 

7434 parser: argparse.ArgumentParser, 

7435 namespace: argparse.Namespace, 

7436 values: Any, 

7437 option_string: Optional[str] = None, 

7438 ) -> None: 

7439 datasets = [] 

7440 err_prefix = f"{option_string or self.dest}: " 

7441 for value in values: 

7442 if not value.startswith("+"): 

7443 datasets.append(value) 

7444 else: 

7445 path = value[1:] 

7446 validate_no_argument_file(path, namespace, err_prefix=err_prefix, parser=parser) 

7447 if "bzfs_argument_file" not in os.path.basename(path): 

7448 parser.error(f"{err_prefix}basename must contain substring 'bzfs_argument_file': {path}") 

7449 try: 

7450 with open_nofollow(path, "r", encoding="utf-8") as fd: 

7451 for i, line in enumerate(fd.read().splitlines()): 

7452 if line.startswith("#") or not line.strip(): 

7453 continue # skip comment lines and empty lines 

7454 splits = line.split("\t", 1) 

7455 if len(splits) <= 1: 

7456 parser.error(f"{err_prefix}Line must contain tab-separated SRC_DATASET and DST_DATASET: {i}") 

7457 src_root_dataset, dst_root_dataset = splits 

7458 if not src_root_dataset.strip() or not dst_root_dataset.strip(): 

7459 parser.error( 

7460 f"{err_prefix}SRC_DATASET and DST_DATASET must not be empty or whitespace-only: {i}" 

7461 ) 

7462 datasets.append(src_root_dataset) 

7463 datasets.append(dst_root_dataset) 

7464 except OSError as e: 

7465 parser.error(f"{err_prefix}{e}") 

7466 

7467 if len(datasets) % 2 != 0: 

7468 parser.error(f"{err_prefix}Each SRC_DATASET must have a corresponding DST_DATASET: {datasets}") 

7469 root_dataset_pairs = [(datasets[i], datasets[i + 1]) for i in range(0, len(datasets), 2)] 

7470 setattr(namespace, self.dest, root_dataset_pairs) 

7471 

7472 

7473############################################################################# 

7474class SSHConfigFileNameAction(argparse.Action): 

7475 def __call__( 

7476 self, 

7477 parser: argparse.ArgumentParser, 

7478 namespace: argparse.Namespace, 

7479 values: Any, 

7480 option_string: Optional[str] = None, 

7481 ) -> None: 

7482 values = values.strip() 

7483 if values == "": 

7484 parser.error(f"{option_string}: Empty string is not valid") 

7485 if any(char in SHELL_CHARS or char.isspace() for char in values): 

7486 parser.error(f"{option_string}: Invalid file name '{values}': must not contain whitespace or special chars.") 

7487 setattr(namespace, self.dest, values) 

7488 

7489 

7490############################################################################# 

7491class SafeFileNameAction(argparse.Action): 

7492 def __call__( 

7493 self, 

7494 parser: argparse.ArgumentParser, 

7495 namespace: argparse.Namespace, 

7496 values: Any, 

7497 option_string: Optional[str] = None, 

7498 ) -> None: 

7499 if ".." in values or "/" in values or "\\" in values: 

7500 parser.error(f"{option_string}: Invalid file name '{values}': must not contain '..' or '/' or '\\'.") 

7501 if any(char.isspace() and char != " " for char in values): 

7502 parser.error(f"{option_string}: Invalid file name '{values}': must not contain whitespace other than space.") 

7503 setattr(namespace, self.dest, values) 

7504 

7505 

7506############################################################################# 

7507class SafeDirectoryNameAction(argparse.Action): 

7508 def __call__( 

7509 self, 

7510 parser: argparse.ArgumentParser, 

7511 namespace: argparse.Namespace, 

7512 values: Any, 

7513 option_string: Optional[str] = None, 

7514 ) -> None: 

7515 values = values.strip() 

7516 if values == "": 

7517 parser.error(f"{option_string}: Empty string is not valid") 

7518 if any(char.isspace() and char != " " for char in values): 

7519 parser.error(f"{option_string}: Invalid dir name '{values}': must not contain whitespace other than space.") 

7520 setattr(namespace, self.dest, values) 

7521 

7522 

7523############################################################################# 

7524class NewSnapshotFilterGroupAction(argparse.Action): 

7525 def __call__( 

7526 self, 

7527 parser: argparse.ArgumentParser, 

7528 args: argparse.Namespace, 

7529 values: Any, 

7530 option_string: Optional[str] = None, 

7531 ) -> None: 

7532 if not hasattr(args, snapshot_filters_var): 

7533 args.snapshot_filters_var = [[]] 

7534 elif len(args.snapshot_filters_var[-1]) > 0: 7534 ↛ 7535line 7534 didn't jump to line 7535 because the condition on line 7534 was never true

7535 args.snapshot_filters_var.append([]) 

7536 

7537 

7538############################################################################# 

7539class FileOrLiteralAction(argparse.Action): 

7540 def __call__( 

7541 self, 

7542 parser: argparse.ArgumentParser, 

7543 namespace: argparse.Namespace, 

7544 values: Any, 

7545 option_string: Optional[str] = None, 

7546 ) -> None: 

7547 current_values = getattr(namespace, self.dest, None) 

7548 if current_values is None: 

7549 current_values = [] 

7550 extra_values = [] 

7551 err_prefix = f"{option_string or self.dest}: " 

7552 for value in values: 

7553 if not value.startswith("+"): 

7554 extra_values.append(value) 

7555 else: 

7556 path = value[1:] 

7557 validate_no_argument_file(path, namespace, err_prefix=err_prefix, parser=parser) 

7558 if "bzfs_argument_file" not in os.path.basename(path): 

7559 parser.error(f"{err_prefix}basename must contain substring 'bzfs_argument_file': {path}") 

7560 try: 

7561 with open_nofollow(path, "r", encoding="utf-8") as fd: 

7562 for line in fd.read().splitlines(): 

7563 if line.startswith("#") or not line.strip(): 

7564 continue # skip comment lines and empty lines 

7565 extra_values.append(line) 

7566 except OSError as e: 

7567 parser.error(f"{err_prefix}{e}") 

7568 current_values += extra_values 

7569 setattr(namespace, self.dest, current_values) 

7570 if self.dest in snapshot_regex_filter_names: 

7571 add_snapshot_filter(namespace, SnapshotFilter(self.dest, None, extra_values)) 

7572 

7573 

7574############################################################################# 

7575class IncludeSnapshotPlanAction(argparse.Action): 

7576 def __call__( 

7577 self, 

7578 parser: argparse.ArgumentParser, 

7579 namespace: argparse.Namespace, 

7580 values: Any, 

7581 option_string: Optional[str] = None, 

7582 ) -> None: 

7583 opts = getattr(namespace, self.dest, None) 

7584 opts = [] if opts is None else opts 

7585 # The bzfs_include_snapshot_plan_excludes_outdated_snapshots env var flag is a work-around for (rare) replication 

7586 # situations where a common snapshot cannot otherwise be found because bookmarks are disabled and a common 

7587 # snapshot is actually available but not included by the --include-snapshot-plan policy chosen by the user, and the 

7588 # user cannot change the content of the --include-snapshot-plan for some reason. The flag makes replication work even 

7589 # in this scenario, at the expense of including (and thus replicating) old snapshots that will immediately be deleted 

7590 # on the destination by the next pruning action. In a proper production setup, it should never be necessary to set 

7591 # the flag to 'False'. 

7592 include_snapshot_times_and_ranks = getenv_bool("include_snapshot_plan_excludes_outdated_snapshots", True) 

7593 if not self._add_opts(opts, include_snapshot_times_and_ranks, parser, values, option_string=option_string): 

7594 opts += ["--new-snapshot-filter-group", "--include-snapshot-regex=!.*"] 

7595 setattr(namespace, self.dest, opts) 

7596 

7597 def _add_opts( 

7598 self, 

7599 opts: List[str], 

7600 include_snapshot_times_and_ranks: bool, 

7601 parser: argparse.ArgumentParser, 

7602 values: str, 

7603 option_string: Optional[str] = None, 

7604 ) -> bool: 

7605 """Generates extra options to be parsed later during second parse_args() pass, within run_main()""" 

7606 xperiods = SnapshotPeriods() 

7607 has_at_least_one_filter_clause = False 

7608 for org, target_periods in ast.literal_eval(values).items(): 

7609 prefix = re.escape(nprefix(org)) 

7610 for target, periods in target_periods.items(): 

7611 infix = re.escape(ninfix(target)) if target else year_with_four_digits_regex.pattern # disambiguate 

7612 for period_unit, period_amount in periods.items(): # e.g. period_unit can be "10minutely" or "minutely" 

7613 if not isinstance(period_amount, int) or period_amount < 0: 

7614 parser.error(f"{option_string}: Period amount must be a non-negative integer: {period_amount}") 

7615 suffix = re.escape(nsuffix(period_unit)) 

7616 regex = f"{prefix}{infix}.*{suffix}" 

7617 opts += ["--new-snapshot-filter-group", f"--include-snapshot-regex={regex}"] 

7618 if include_snapshot_times_and_ranks: 

7619 duration_amount, duration_unit = xperiods.suffix_to_duration0(period_unit) # --> 10, "minutely" 

7620 duration_unit_label = xperiods.period_labels.get(duration_unit) # duration_unit_label = "minutes" 

7621 opts += [ 

7622 "--include-snapshot-times-and-ranks", 

7623 ( 

7624 "notime" 

7625 if duration_unit_label is None or duration_amount * period_amount == 0 

7626 else f"{duration_amount * period_amount}{duration_unit_label}ago..anytime" 

7627 ), 

7628 f"latest{period_amount}", 

7629 ] 

7630 has_at_least_one_filter_clause = True 

7631 return has_at_least_one_filter_clause 

7632 

7633 

7634############################################################################# 

7635class DeleteDstSnapshotsExceptPlanAction(IncludeSnapshotPlanAction): 

7636 def __call__( 

7637 self, 

7638 parser: argparse.ArgumentParser, 

7639 namespace: argparse.Namespace, 

7640 values: Any, 

7641 option_string: Optional[str] = None, 

7642 ) -> None: 

7643 opts = getattr(namespace, self.dest, None) 

7644 opts = [] if opts is None else opts 

7645 opts += ["--delete-dst-snapshots-except"] 

7646 if not self._add_opts(opts, True, parser, values, option_string=option_string): 

7647 parser.error( 

7648 f"{option_string}: Cowardly refusing to delete all snapshots on " 

7649 f"--delete-dst-snapshots-except-plan='{values}' (which means 'retain no snapshots' aka " 

7650 "'delete all snapshots'). Assuming this is an unintended pilot error rather than intended carnage. " 

7651 "Aborting. If this is really what is intended, use `--delete-dst-snapshots --include-snapshot-regex=.*` " 

7652 "instead to force the deletion." 

7653 ) 

7654 setattr(namespace, self.dest, opts) 

7655 

7656 

7657############################################################################# 

7658class TimeRangeAndRankRangeAction(argparse.Action): 

7659 def __call__( 

7660 self, 

7661 parser: argparse.ArgumentParser, 

7662 namespace: argparse.Namespace, 

7663 values: Any, 

7664 option_string: Optional[str] = None, 

7665 ) -> None: 

7666 def parse_time(time_spec: str) -> Optional[Union[int, timedelta]]: 

7667 time_spec = time_spec.strip() 

7668 if time_spec == "*" or time_spec == "anytime": 

7669 return None 

7670 if time_spec.isdigit(): 

7671 return int(time_spec) # Input is a Unix time in integer seconds 

7672 try: 

7673 return timedelta(milliseconds=parse_duration_to_milliseconds(time_spec, regex_suffix=r"\s*ago")) 

7674 except ValueError: 

7675 try: # If it's not a duration, try parsing as an ISO 8601 datetime 

7676 return unixtime_fromisoformat(time_spec) 

7677 except ValueError: 

7678 parser.error(f"{option_string}: Invalid duration, Unix time, or ISO 8601 datetime: {time_spec}") 

7679 

7680 assert isinstance(values, list) 

7681 assert len(values) > 0 

7682 value = values[0].strip() 

7683 if value == "notime": 

7684 value = "0..0" 

7685 if ".." not in value: 

7686 parser.error(f"{option_string}: Invalid time range: Missing '..' separator: {value}") 

7687 timerange_specs = [parse_time(time_spec) for time_spec in value.split("..", 1)] 

7688 rankranges = self.parse_rankranges(parser, values[1:], option_string=option_string) 

7689 setattr(namespace, self.dest, [timerange_specs] + rankranges) # for testing only 

7690 timerange = self.get_include_snapshot_times(timerange_specs) 

7691 add_time_and_rank_snapshot_filter(namespace, self.dest, timerange, rankranges) 

7692 

7693 @staticmethod 

7694 def get_include_snapshot_times(times: List[Union[timedelta, int, None]]) -> UnixTimeRange: 

7695 def utc_unix_time_in_seconds(time_spec: Union[timedelta, int, None], default: int) -> Union[timedelta, int]: 

7696 if isinstance(time_spec, timedelta): 

7697 return time_spec 

7698 if isinstance(time_spec, int): 

7699 return int(time_spec) 

7700 return default 

7701 

7702 lo, hi = times 

7703 if lo is None and hi is None: 

7704 return None 

7705 lo = utc_unix_time_in_seconds(lo, default=0) 

7706 hi = utc_unix_time_in_seconds(hi, default=unixtime_infinity_secs) 

7707 if isinstance(lo, int) and isinstance(hi, int): 

7708 return (lo, hi) if lo <= hi else (hi, lo) 

7709 return lo, hi 

7710 

7711 @staticmethod 

7712 def parse_rankranges( 

7713 parser: argparse.ArgumentParser, 

7714 values: Any, 

7715 option_string: Optional[str] = None, 

7716 ) -> List[RankRange]: 

7717 def parse_rank(spec: str) -> Tuple[bool, str, int, bool]: 

7718 spec = spec.strip() 

7719 if not (match := re.fullmatch(r"(all\s*except\s*)?(oldest|latest)\s*(\d+)%?", spec)): 

7720 parser.error(f"{option_string}: Invalid rank format: {spec}") 

7721 assert match 

7722 is_except = bool(match.group(1)) 

7723 kind = match.group(2) 

7724 num = int(match.group(3)) 

7725 is_percent = spec.endswith("%") 

7726 if is_percent and num > 100: 

7727 parser.error(f"{option_string}: Invalid rank: Percent must not be greater than 100: {spec}") 

7728 return is_except, kind, num, is_percent 

7729 

7730 rankranges = [] 

7731 for value in values: 

7732 value = value.strip() 

7733 if ".." in value: 

7734 lo_split, hi_split = value.split("..", 1) 

7735 lo = parse_rank(lo_split) 

7736 hi = parse_rank(hi_split) 

7737 if lo[0] or hi[0]: 

7738 # Example: 'all except latest 90..except latest 95' or 'all except latest 90..latest 95' 

7739 parser.error(f"{option_string}: Invalid rank range: {value}") 

7740 if lo[1] != hi[1]: 

7741 # Example: 'latest10..oldest10' and 'oldest10..latest10' may be somewhat unambigous if there are 40 

7742 # input snapshots, but they are tricky/not well-defined if there are less than 20 input snapshots. 

7743 parser.error(f"{option_string}: Ambiguous rank range: Must not compare oldest with latest: {value}") 

7744 else: 

7745 hi = parse_rank(value) 

7746 is_except, kind, num, is_percent = hi 

7747 if is_except: 

7748 if is_percent: 

7749 # 'all except latest 10%' aka 'oldest 90%' aka 'oldest 0..oldest 90%' 

7750 # 'all except oldest 10%' aka 'latest 90%' aka 'latest 0..oldest 90%' 

7751 negated_kind = "oldest" if kind == "latest" else "latest" 

7752 lo = parse_rank(f"{negated_kind}0") 

7753 hi = parse_rank(f"{negated_kind}{100-num}%") 

7754 else: 

7755 # 'all except latest 90' aka 'latest 90..latest 100%' 

7756 # 'all except oldest 90' aka 'oldest 90..oldest 100%' 

7757 lo = parse_rank(f"{kind}{num}") 

7758 hi = parse_rank(f"{kind}100%") 

7759 else: 

7760 # 'latest 90' aka 'latest 0..latest 90' 

7761 lo = parse_rank(f"{kind}0") 

7762 rankranges.append((lo[1:], hi[1:])) 

7763 return rankranges 

7764 

7765 

7766############################################################################# 

7767@dataclass(order=True) 

7768class SnapshotFilter: 

7769 name: str 

7770 timerange: UnixTimeRange 

7771 options: Any = field(compare=False, default=None) 

7772 

7773 

7774def add_snapshot_filter(args: argparse.Namespace, _filter: SnapshotFilter) -> None: 

7775 if not hasattr(args, snapshot_filters_var): 

7776 args.snapshot_filters_var = [[]] 

7777 args.snapshot_filters_var[-1].append(_filter) 

7778 

7779 

7780def add_time_and_rank_snapshot_filter( 

7781 args: argparse.Namespace, dst: str, timerange: UnixTimeRange, rankranges: List[RankRange] 

7782) -> None: 

7783 if timerange is None or len(rankranges) == 0 or any(rankrange[0] == rankrange[1] for rankrange in rankranges): 

7784 add_snapshot_filter(args, SnapshotFilter("include_snapshot_times", timerange, None)) 

7785 else: 

7786 assert timerange is not None 

7787 add_snapshot_filter(args, SnapshotFilter(dst, timerange, rankranges)) 

7788 

7789 

7790def has_timerange_filter(snapshot_filters: List[List[SnapshotFilter]]) -> bool: 

7791 """Interacts with add_time_and_rank_snapshot_filter() and optimize_snapshot_filters()""" 

7792 return any(f.timerange is not None for snapshot_filter in snapshot_filters for f in snapshot_filter) 

7793 

7794 

7795def optimize_snapshot_filters(snapshot_filters: List[SnapshotFilter]) -> List[SnapshotFilter]: 

7796 """Not intended to be a full query execution plan optimizer, but we still apply some basic plan optimizations.""" 

7797 merge_adjacent_snapshot_filters(snapshot_filters) 

7798 merge_adjacent_snapshot_regexes(snapshot_filters) 

7799 snapshot_filters = [f for f in snapshot_filters if f.timerange or f.options] # drop noop --include-snapshot-times 

7800 reorder_snapshot_time_filters(snapshot_filters) 

7801 return snapshot_filters 

7802 

7803 

7804def merge_adjacent_snapshot_filters(snapshot_filters: List[SnapshotFilter]) -> None: 

7805 """Merges filter operators of the same kind if they are next to each other and carry an option list, for example 

7806 --include-snapshot-ranks and --include-snapshot-regex and --exclude-snapshot-regex. This improves execution perf 

7807 and makes handling easier in later stages. 

7808 Example: merges --include-snapshot-times-and-ranks 0..9 oldest10% --include-snapshot-times-and-ranks 0..9 latest20% 

7809 into --include-snapshot-times-and-ranks 0..9 oldest10% latest20%""" 

7810 i = len(snapshot_filters) - 1 

7811 while i >= 0: 

7812 filter_i = snapshot_filters[i] 

7813 if isinstance(filter_i.options, list): 

7814 j = i - 1 

7815 if j >= 0 and snapshot_filters[j] == filter_i: 

7816 lst = snapshot_filters[j].options 

7817 assert isinstance(lst, list) 

7818 lst += filter_i.options 

7819 snapshot_filters.pop(i) 

7820 i -= 1 

7821 

7822 

7823def merge_adjacent_snapshot_regexes(snapshot_filters: List[SnapshotFilter]) -> None: 

7824 # Merge regex filter operators of the same kind as long as they are within the same group, aka as long as they 

7825 # are not separated by a non-regex filter. This improves execution perf and makes handling easier in later stages. 

7826 # Example: --include-snapshot-regex .*daily --exclude-snapshot-regex .*weekly --include-snapshot-regex .*hourly 

7827 # --exclude-snapshot-regex .*monthly 

7828 # gets merged into the following: 

7829 # --include-snapshot-regex .*daily .*hourly --exclude-snapshot-regex .*weekly .*monthly 

7830 i = len(snapshot_filters) - 1 

7831 while i >= 0: 

7832 filter_i = snapshot_filters[i] 

7833 if filter_i.name in snapshot_regex_filter_names: 

7834 assert isinstance(filter_i.options, list) 

7835 j = i - 1 

7836 while j >= 0 and snapshot_filters[j].name in snapshot_regex_filter_names: 

7837 if snapshot_filters[j].name == filter_i.name: 

7838 lst = snapshot_filters[j].options 

7839 assert isinstance(lst, list) 

7840 lst += filter_i.options 

7841 snapshot_filters.pop(i) 

7842 break 

7843 j -= 1 

7844 i -= 1 

7845 

7846 # Merge --include-snapshot-regex and --exclude-snapshot-regex filters that are part of the same group (i.e. next 

7847 # to each other) into a single combined filter operator that contains the info of both, and hence all info for the 

7848 # group, which makes handling easier in later stages. 

7849 # Example: --include-snapshot-regex .*daily .*hourly --exclude-snapshot-regex .*weekly .*monthly 

7850 # gets merged into the following: --snapshot-regex(excludes=[.*weekly, .*monthly], includes=[.*daily, .*hourly]) 

7851 i = len(snapshot_filters) - 1 

7852 while i >= 0: 

7853 filter_i = snapshot_filters[i] 

7854 name = filter_i.name 

7855 if name in snapshot_regex_filter_names: 

7856 j = i - 1 

7857 if j >= 0 and snapshot_filters[j].name in snapshot_regex_filter_names: 

7858 filter_j = snapshot_filters[j] 

7859 assert filter_j.name != name 

7860 snapshot_filters.pop(i) 

7861 i -= 1 

7862 else: 

7863 name_j = next(iter(snapshot_regex_filter_names.difference({name}))) 

7864 filter_j = SnapshotFilter(name_j, None, []) 

7865 sorted_filters = sorted([filter_i, filter_j]) 

7866 exclude_regexes, include_regexes = sorted_filters[0].options, sorted_filters[1].options 

7867 snapshot_filters[i] = SnapshotFilter(snapshot_regex_filter_name, None, (exclude_regexes, include_regexes)) 

7868 i -= 1 

7869 

7870 

7871def reorder_snapshot_time_filters(snapshot_filters: List[SnapshotFilter]) -> None: 

7872 """In an execution plan that contains filter operators based on sort order (the --include-snapshot-times-and-ranks 

7873 operator with non-empty ranks), filters cannot freely be reordered without violating correctness, but they can 

7874 still be partially reordered for better execution performance. The filter list is partitioned into sections such 

7875 that sections are separated by --include-snapshot-times-and-ranks operators with non-empty ranks. Within each 

7876 section, we move include_snapshot_times operators aka --include-snapshot-times-and-ranks operators with empty ranks 

7877 before --include/exclude-snapshot-regex operators because the former involves fast integer comparisons and the 

7878 latter involves more expensive regex matching. 

7879 Example: reorders --include-snapshot-regex .*daily --include-snapshot-times-and-ranks 2024-01-01..2024-04-01 into 

7880 --include-snapshot-times-and-ranks 2024-01-01..2024-04-01 --include-snapshot-regex .*daily""" 

7881 

7882 def reorder_time_filters_within_section(i: int, j: int) -> None: 

7883 while j > i: 

7884 filter_j = snapshot_filters[j] 

7885 if filter_j.name == "include_snapshot_times": 

7886 snapshot_filters.pop(j) 

7887 snapshot_filters.insert(i + 1, filter_j) 

7888 j -= 1 

7889 

7890 i = len(snapshot_filters) - 1 

7891 j = i 

7892 while i >= 0: 

7893 name = snapshot_filters[i].name 

7894 if name == "include_snapshot_times_and_ranks": 

7895 reorder_time_filters_within_section(i, j) 

7896 j = i - 1 

7897 i -= 1 

7898 reorder_time_filters_within_section(i, j) 

7899 

7900 

7901############################################################################# 

7902class LogConfigVariablesAction(argparse.Action): 

7903 def __call__( 

7904 self, 

7905 parser: argparse.ArgumentParser, 

7906 namespace: argparse.Namespace, 

7907 values: Any, 

7908 option_string: Optional[str] = None, 

7909 ) -> None: 

7910 current_values = getattr(namespace, self.dest, None) 

7911 if current_values is None: 7911 ↛ 7913line 7911 didn't jump to line 7913 because the condition on line 7911 was always true

7912 current_values = [] 

7913 for variable in values: 

7914 error_msg = validate_log_config_variable(variable) 

7915 if error_msg: 

7916 parser.error(error_msg) 

7917 current_values.append(variable) 

7918 setattr(namespace, self.dest, current_values) 

7919 

7920 

7921############################################################################# 

7922# class CheckRange is copied from https://gist.github.com/dmitriykovalev/2ab1aa33a8099ef2d514925d84aa89e7/30961300d3f8192f775709c06ff9a5b777475adf 

7923# Written by Dmitriy Kovalev 

7924# 

7925# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); 

7926# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. 

7927# You may obtain a copy of the License at 

7928# 

7929# http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 

7930# 

7931# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software 

7932# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, 

7933# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. 

7934# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and 

7935# limitations under the License. 

7936# 

7937# Allows you to validate open, closed, and half-open intervals on int as well as float arguments. 

7938# Each endpoint can be either a number or positive or negative infinity: 

7939# [a, b] --> min=a, max=b 

7940# [a, b) --> min=a, sup=b 

7941# (a, b] --> inf=a, max=b 

7942# (a, b) --> inf=a, sup=b 

7943# [a, +infinity) --> min=a 

7944# (a, +infinity) --> inf=a 

7945# (-infinity, b] --> max=b 

7946# (-infinity, b) --> sup=b 

7947# fmt: off 

7948class CheckRange(argparse.Action): 

7949 ops = {'inf': operator.gt, 

7950 'min': operator.ge, 

7951 'sup': operator.lt, 

7952 'max': operator.le} 

7953 

7954 def __init__(self, *args: Any, **kwargs: Any) -> None: 

7955 if 'min' in kwargs and 'inf' in kwargs: 

7956 raise ValueError('either min or inf, but not both') 

7957 if 'max' in kwargs and 'sup' in kwargs: 

7958 raise ValueError('either max or sup, but not both') 

7959 

7960 for name in self.ops: 

7961 if name in kwargs: 

7962 setattr(self, name, kwargs.pop(name)) 

7963 

7964 super().__init__(*args, **kwargs) 

7965 

7966 def interval(self) -> str: 

7967 if hasattr(self, 'min'): 

7968 lo = f'[{self.min}' 

7969 elif hasattr(self, 'inf'): 

7970 lo = f'({self.inf}' 

7971 else: 

7972 lo = '(-infinity' 

7973 

7974 if hasattr(self, 'max'): 

7975 up = f'{self.max}]' 

7976 elif hasattr(self, 'sup'): 

7977 up = f'{self.sup})' 

7978 else: 

7979 up = '+infinity)' 

7980 

7981 return f'valid range: {lo}, {up}' 

7982 

7983 def __call__( 

7984 self, 

7985 parser: argparse.ArgumentParser, 

7986 namespace: argparse.Namespace, 

7987 values: Any, 

7988 option_string: Optional[str] = None, 

7989 ) -> None: 

7990 for name, op in self.ops.items(): 

7991 if hasattr(self, name) and not op(values, getattr(self, name)): 

7992 raise argparse.ArgumentError(self, self.interval()) 

7993 setattr(namespace, self.dest, values) 

7994# fmt: on 

7995 

7996 

7997############################################################################# 

7998class CheckPercentRange(CheckRange): 

7999 

8000 def __call__( 

8001 self, 

8002 parser: argparse.ArgumentParser, 

8003 namespace: argparse.Namespace, 

8004 values: Any, 

8005 option_string: Optional[str] = None, 

8006 ) -> None: 

8007 assert isinstance(values, str) 

8008 original = values 

8009 values = values.strip() 

8010 is_percent = values.endswith("%") 

8011 if is_percent: 

8012 values = values[0:-1] 

8013 try: 

8014 values = float(values) 

8015 except ValueError: 

8016 parser.error(f"{option_string}: Invalid percentage or number: {original}") 

8017 super().__call__(parser, namespace, values, option_string=option_string) 

8018 setattr(namespace, self.dest, (getattr(namespace, self.dest), is_percent)) 

8019 

8020 

8021############################################################################# 

8022class Comparable(Protocol): 

8023 def __lt__(self, other: Any) -> bool: # pragma: no cover - behavior defined by implementor 

8024 ... 

8025 

8026 

8027T = TypeVar("T", bound=Comparable) # Generic type variable for elements stored in a SmallPriorityQueue 

8028 

8029 

8030class SmallPriorityQueue(Generic[T]): 

8031 """A priority queue that can handle updates to the priority of any element that is already contained in the queue, and 

8032 does so very efficiently if there are a small number of elements in the queue (no more than thousands), as is the case 

8033 for us. Could be implemented using a SortedList via https://github.com/grantjenks/python-sortedcontainers or using an 

8034 indexed priority queue via https://github.com/nvictus/pqdict but, to avoid an external dependency, is actually 

8035 implemented using a simple yet effective binary search-based sorted list that can handle updates to the priority of 

8036 elements that are already contained in the queue, via removal of the element, followed by update of the element, followed 

8037 by (re)insertion. Duplicate elements (if any) are maintained in their order of insertion relative to other duplicates.""" 

8038 

8039 def __init__(self, reverse: bool = False) -> None: 

8040 self._lst: List[T] = [] 

8041 self._reverse: bool = reverse 

8042 

8043 def clear(self) -> None: 

8044 self._lst.clear() 

8045 

8046 def push(self, element: T) -> None: 

8047 bisect.insort(self._lst, element) 

8048 

8049 def pop(self) -> T: 

8050 """Removes and return the smallest (or largest if reverse == True) element from the queue.""" 

8051 return self._lst.pop() if self._reverse else self._lst.pop(0) 

8052 

8053 def peek(self) -> T: 

8054 """Returns the smallest (or largest if reverse == True) element without removing it.""" 

8055 return self._lst[-1] if self._reverse else self._lst[0] 

8056 

8057 def remove(self, element: T) -> bool: 

8058 """Removes the first occurrence of the specified element from the queue; returns True if the element was contained""" 

8059 lst = self._lst 

8060 i = bisect.bisect_left(lst, element) 

8061 is_contained = i < len(lst) and lst[i] == element 

8062 if is_contained: 

8063 del lst[i] # is an optimized memmove() 

8064 return is_contained 

8065 

8066 def __len__(self) -> int: 

8067 return len(self._lst) 

8068 

8069 def __contains__(self, element: T) -> bool: 

8070 lst = self._lst 

8071 i = bisect.bisect_left(lst, element) 

8072 return i < len(lst) and lst[i] == element 

8073 

8074 def __iter__(self) -> Iterator[T]: 

8075 return reversed(self._lst) if self._reverse else iter(self._lst) 

8076 

8077 def __repr__(self) -> str: 

8078 return repr(list(reversed(self._lst))) if self._reverse else repr(self._lst) 

8079 

8080 

8081############################################################################# 

8082class SynchronizedBool: 

8083 """Thread-safe bool.""" 

8084 

8085 def __init__(self, val: bool) -> None: 

8086 assert isinstance(val, bool) 

8087 self._lock: threading.Lock = threading.Lock() 

8088 self._value: bool = val 

8089 

8090 @property 

8091 def value(self) -> bool: 

8092 with self._lock: 

8093 return self._value 

8094 

8095 @value.setter 

8096 def value(self, new_value: bool) -> None: 

8097 with self._lock: 

8098 self._value = new_value 

8099 

8100 def get_and_set(self, new_value: bool) -> bool: 

8101 with self._lock: 

8102 old_value = self._value 

8103 self._value = new_value 

8104 return old_value 

8105 

8106 def compare_and_set(self, expected_value: bool, new_value: bool) -> bool: 

8107 with self._lock: 

8108 eq = self._value == expected_value 

8109 if eq: 

8110 self._value = new_value 

8111 return eq 

8112 

8113 def __bool__(self) -> bool: 

8114 return self.value 

8115 

8116 def __repr__(self) -> str: 

8117 return repr(self.value) 

8118 

8119 def __str__(self) -> str: 

8120 return str(self.value) 

8121 

8122 

8123############################################################################# 

8124K = TypeVar("K") 

8125V = TypeVar("V") 

8126 

8127 

8128class SynchronizedDict(Generic[K, V]): 

8129 """Thread-safe dict.""" 

8130 

8131 def __init__(self, val: Dict[K, V]) -> None: 

8132 assert isinstance(val, dict) 

8133 self._lock: threading.Lock = threading.Lock() 

8134 self._dict: Dict[K, V] = val 

8135 

8136 def __getitem__(self, key: K) -> V: 

8137 with self._lock: 

8138 return self._dict[key] 

8139 

8140 def __setitem__(self, key: K, value: V) -> None: 

8141 with self._lock: 

8142 self._dict[key] = value 

8143 

8144 def __delitem__(self, key: K) -> None: 

8145 with self._lock: 

8146 self._dict.pop(key) 

8147 

8148 def __contains__(self, key: K) -> bool: 

8149 with self._lock: 

8150 return key in self._dict 

8151 

8152 def __len__(self) -> int: 

8153 with self._lock: 

8154 return len(self._dict) 

8155 

8156 def __repr__(self) -> str: 

8157 with self._lock: 

8158 return repr(self._dict) 

8159 

8160 def __str__(self) -> str: 

8161 with self._lock: 

8162 return str(self._dict) 

8163 

8164 def get(self, key: K, default: Optional[V] = None) -> Optional[V]: 

8165 with self._lock: 

8166 return self._dict.get(key, default) 

8167 

8168 def pop(self, key: K, default: Optional[V] = None) -> Optional[V]: 

8169 with self._lock: 

8170 return self._dict.pop(key, default) 

8171 

8172 def clear(self) -> None: 

8173 with self._lock: 

8174 self._dict.clear() 

8175 

8176 def items(self) -> ItemsView[K, V]: 

8177 with self._lock: 

8178 return self._dict.copy().items() 

8179 

8180 

8181############################################################################# 

8182class _XFinally(contextlib.AbstractContextManager): 

8183 def __init__(self, cleanup: Callable[[], None]) -> None: 

8184 self._cleanup = cleanup # Zero‑argument callable executed after the `with` block exits. 

8185 

8186 def __exit__( # type: ignore # need to ignore on python <= 3.8 

8187 self, exc_type: Optional[Type[BaseException]], exc: Optional[BaseException], tb: Optional[types.TracebackType] 

8188 ) -> bool: 

8189 try: 

8190 self._cleanup() 

8191 except BaseException as cleanup_exc: 

8192 if exc is None: 

8193 raise # No main error --> propagate cleanup error normally 

8194 # Both failed 

8195 # if sys.version_info >= (3, 11): 

8196 # raise ExceptionGroup("main error and cleanup error", [exc, cleanup_exc]) from None 

8197 # <= 3.10: attach so it shows up in traceback but doesn't mask 

8198 exc.__context__ = cleanup_exc 

8199 return False # reraise original exception 

8200 return False # propagate main exception if any 

8201 

8202 

8203def xfinally(cleanup: Callable[[], None]) -> _XFinally: 

8204 """Usage: with xfinally(lambda: cleanup()): ... 

8205 Returns a context manager that guarantees that cleanup() runs on exit and guarantees any error in cleanup() will never 

8206 mask an exception raised earlier inside the body of the `with` block, while still surfacing both problems when possible. 

8207 

8208 Problem it solves 

8209 ----------------- 

8210 A naive ``try ... finally`` may lose the original exception: 

8211 

8212 try: 

8213 work() 

8214 finally: 

8215 cleanup() # <-- if this raises an exception, it replaces the real error! 

8216 

8217 `_XFinally` preserves exception priority: 

8218 

8219 * Body raises, cleanup succeeds --> original body exception is re‑raised. 

8220 * Body raises, cleanup also raises --> re‑raises body exception; cleanup exception is linked via ``__context__``. 

8221 * Body succeeds, cleanup raises --> cleanup exception propagates normally. 

8222 

8223 Example: 

8224 ------- 

8225 >>> with xfinally(reset_logger): # doctest: +SKIP 

8226 ... run_tasks() 

8227 

8228 The single *with* line replaces verbose ``try/except/finally`` boilerplate while preserving full error information. 

8229 """ 

8230 return _XFinally(cleanup) 

8231 

8232 

8233############################################################################# 

8234if __name__ == "__main__": 8234 ↛ 8235line 8234 didn't jump to line 8235 because the condition on line 8234 was never true

8235 main() 

« prev     ^ index     » next       coverage.py v7.8.2, created at 2025-06-21 02:39 +0000
